CHAPTER XLV

THE BLUE CASTLE

CHAPTER [I]0-i

If it had not rained on a certain May morning [Valancy Stirling]107-valancy ’s whole life would have been entirely different . [She]107-valancy would have gone , with [the rest of [[her]107-valancy clan]331-her clan]330-the rest of her clan , to [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington ’s engagement picnic and [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent would have gone to [Montreal]4-montreal . But it did rain and [you]322-you shall hear what happened to [her]107-valancy because of it .

[Valancy]107-valancy wakened early , in the lifeless , hopeless hour just preceding dawn . [She]107-valancy had not slept very well . [One]332-one does not sleep well , sometimes , when [one]332-one is twenty - nine on the morrow , and unmarried , in a community and connection where [the unmarried]334-the unmarried are simply those who have failed to get [a man]335-a man .

[Deerwood]5-deerwood and [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings had long since relegated [Valancy]107-valancy to hopeless old maidenhood . But [Valancy]107-valancy [herself]107-valancy had never quite relinquished a certain pitiful , shamed , little hope that [Romance]94-romance would come [her]107-valancy way yet — never , until this wet , horrible morning , when [she]107-valancy wakened to the fact that [she]107-valancy was twenty - nine and unsought by [any man]336-any man .

Ay , there lay the sting . [Valancy]107-valancy did not mind so much being [an old maid]337-an old maid . After all , [she]107-valancy thought , being [an old maid]337-an old maid could n’t possibly be as dreadful as being married to [an Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington or [an Uncle Benjamin]339-an uncle benjamin , or even [an Uncle Herbert]340-an uncle herbert . What hurt [her]107-valancy was that [she]107-valancy had never had a chance to be anything but [an old maid]337-an old maid . [No man]342-no man had ever desired [her]107-valancy .

The tears came into [her]107-valancy eyes as [she]107-valancy lay there alone in the faintly greying darkness . [She]107-valancy dared not let [herself]107-valancy cry as hard as [she]107-valancy wanted to , for two reasons . [She]107-valancy was afraid that crying might bring on another attack of that pain around the heart . [She]107-valancy had had a spell of it after [she]107-valancy had got into bed — rather worse than any [she]107-valancy had had yet . And [she]107-valancy was afraid [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother would notice [her]107-valancy red eyes at breakfast and keep at [her]107-valancy with minute , persistent , mosquito - like questions regarding the cause thereof .

“ Suppose , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy with a ghastly grin , “ [I]107-valancy answered with the plain truth , ‘ [I]107-valancy am crying because [I]107-valancy can not get married . ’ How horrified [Mother]96-mother would be — though [she]343-her mother is ashamed every day of [her]343-her mother life of [[her]343-her mother old maid daughter]2184-her old maid daughter . ”[107-valancy]

But of course appearances should be kept up . “ It is not , ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy could hear [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother ’s prim , dictatorial voice asserting , “ it is not maidenly to think about [men]2185-men . ”[343-her mother]

The thought of [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother ’s expression made [Valancy]107-valancy laugh — for [she]107-valancy had a sense of humour [nobody in [[her]107-valancy clan]331-her clan]346-nobody in her clan suspected . For that matter , there were a good many things about [Valancy]107-valancy that [nobody]348-nobody suspected . But [her]107-valancy laughter was very superficial and presently [she]107-valancy lay there , [a huddled , futile little figure]349-a huddled , futile little figure , listening to the rain pouring down outside and watching , with a sick distaste , the chill , merciless light creeping into [[her]107-valancy ugly , sordid room]350-her ugly , sordid room .

[She]107-valancy knew the ugliness of [that room]351-that room by heart — knew it and hated it . The yellow - painted floor , with one hideous , “ hooked ”[107-valancy] rug by the bed , with a grotesque , “ hooked ”[107-valancy] dog on it , always grinning at [her]107-valancy when [she]107-valancy awoke ; the faded , dark - red paper ; the ceiling discoloured by old leaks and crossed by cracks ; the narrow , pinched little washstand ; the brown - paper lambrequin with purple roses on it ; the spotted old looking - glass with the crack across it , propped up on the inadequate dressing - table ; the jar of ancient potpourri made by [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother in [[her]343-her mother mythical honeymoon]353-her mythical honeymoon ; the shell - covered box , with one burst corner , which [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles had made in [her]97-cousin stickles equally mythical girlhood ; the beaded pincushion with half its bead fringe gone ; the one stiff , yellow chair ; the faded old motto , “ Gone but not forgotten , ”[107-valancy] worked in coloured yarns about [Great - grand - mother]354-great - grand - mother [Stirling]107-valancy ’s grim old face ; the old photographs of [ancient relatives]355-ancient relatives long banished from [the rooms below]356-the rooms below . There were only two pictures that were not of [relatives]357-relatives . One , an old chromo of a puppy sitting on [a rainy doorstep]358-a rainy doorstep . That picture always made [Valancy]107-valancy unhappy . That forlorn little dog crouched on the doorstep in the driving rain ! Why did n’t [some one]359-some one open the door and let [him]360-him in ? The other picture was a faded , passe - partouted engraving of [Queen Louise]98-queen louise coming down [a stairway]361-a stairway , which [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington had lavishly given [her]107-valancy on [her]107-valancy tenth birthday . For nineteen years [she]107-valancy had looked at it and hated it , beautiful , smug , self - satisfied [Queen Louise]98-queen louise . But [she]107-valancy never dared destroy it or remove it . [Mother]362-mother and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles would have been aghast , or , as [Valancy]107-valancy irreverently expressed it in [her]107-valancy thoughts , would have had a fit .

[Every room in [the house]364-the house]363-every room in the house was ugly , of course . But [downstairs]365-downstairs appearances were kept up somewhat . There was no money for [rooms]366-rooms [nobody]348-nobody ever saw . [Valancy]107-valancy sometimes felt that [she]107-valancy could have done something for [[her]107-valancy room [herself]107-valancy]368-her room herself , even without money , if [she]107-valancy were permitted . But [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother had negatived every timid suggestion and [Valancy]107-valancy did not persist . [Valancy]107-valancy never persisted . [She]107-valancy was afraid to . [[Her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother could not brook opposition . [Mrs. Stirling]99-mrs. frederick would sulk for days if offended , with the airs of [an insulted duchess]371-an insulted duchess .

The only thing [Valancy]107-valancy liked about [[her]107-valancy room]372-her room was that [she]107-valancy could be alone there at night to cry if [she]107-valancy wanted to .

But , after all , what did it matter if [a room]373-a room , which [you]374-you used for nothing except sleeping and dressing in , were ugly ? [Valancy]107-valancy was never permitted to stay alone in [[her]107-valancy room]372-her room for any other purpose . [People who wanted to be alone]376-people who wanted to be alone , so [Mrs. Frederick Stirling]99-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles believed , could only want to be alone for some sinister purpose . But [[her]107-valancy room in [the Blue Castle]2-the blue castle]377-her room in the blue castle was everything [a room]373-a room should be .

[Valancy]107-valancy , so cowed and subdued and overridden and snubbed in real life , was wo nt to let [herself]107-valancy go rather splendidly in [her]107-valancy day - dreams . [Nobody in the Stirling clan]379-nobody in the stirling clan , or its ramifications , suspected this , least of all [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles . [They]381-they never knew that [Valancy]107-valancy had [two homes]382-two homes — [the ugly red brick box of [a home]384-a home]383-the ugly red brick box of a home , on [Elm Street]7-elm street , and [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle in [Spain]8-spain . [Valancy]107-valancy had lived spiritually in [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle ever since [she]107-valancy could remember . [She]107-valancy had been [a very tiny child]387-a very tiny child when [she]107-valancy found [herself]107-valancy possessed of [it]319-the blue castle . Always , when [she]107-valancy shut [her]107-valancy eyes , [she]107-valancy could see [it]319-the blue castle plainly , with [its]319-the blue castle turrets and banners on the pine - clad mountain height , wrapped in its faint , blue loveliness , against the sunset skies of [a fair and unknown land]388-a fair and unknown land . Everything wonderful and beautiful was in [that castle]389-that castle . Jewels that [queens]390-queens might have worn ; robes of moonlight and fire ; couches of roses and gold ; long flights of shallow marble steps , with great , white urns , and with [slender , mist - clad maidens]391-slender , mist - clad maidens going up and down [them]392-them ; [courts]393-courts , marble - pillared , where [shimmering fountains fell and nightingales sang among the myrtles]394-shimmering fountains fell and nightingales sang among the myrtles ; [halls of mirrors]395-halls of mirrors that reflected only [handsome knights]396-handsome knights and [lovely women]397-lovely women — [herself]107-valancy the loveliest of all , for whose glance [men]2185-men died . All that supported [her]107-valancy through the boredom of [her]107-valancy days was the hope of going on a dream spree at night . Most , if not all , of [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings would have died of horror if [they]399-they had known half the things [Valancy]107-valancy did in [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle .

For one thing [she]107-valancy had [quite a few lovers]401-quite a few lovers in it . Oh , only one at a time . [One who wooed [her]107-valancy with all the romantic ardour of the age of chivalry and won [her]107-valancy after long devotion and many deeds of derring - do]402-one who wooed her with all the romantic ardour of the age of chivalry and won her after long devotion and many deeds of derring - do , and was wedded to [her]107-valancy with pomp and circumstance in [the great , banner - hung chapel of [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle]403-the great , banner - hung chapel of the blue castle .

At twelve , [this lover]405-this lover was [a fair lad with golden curls and heavenly blue eyes]406-a fair lad with golden curls and heavenly blue eyes . At fifteen , [he]405-this lover was tall and dark and pale , but still necessarily handsome . At twenty , [he]405-this lover was ascetic , dreamy , spiritual . At twenty - five , [he]405-this lover had a clean - cut jaw , slightly grim , and a face strong and rugged rather than handsome . [Valancy]107-valancy never grew older than twenty - five in [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle , but recently — very recently — [[her]107-valancy hero]408-her hero had had reddish , tawny hair , a twisted smile and a mysterious past .

[I]0-i do n’t say [Valancy]107-valancy deliberately murdered [these lovers]409-these lovers as [she]107-valancy outgrew [them]409-these lovers . [One]332-one simply faded away as another came . Things are very convenient in this respect in [Blue Castles]9-blue castles .

But , on this morning of [her]107-valancy day of fate , [Valancy]107-valancy could not find the key of [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle . [Reality]100-reality pressed on [her]107-valancy too hardly , barking at [her]107-valancy heels like a maddening little dog . [She]107-valancy was twenty - nine , lonely , undesired , ill - favoured — [the only homely girl in [a handsome clan]413-a handsome clan]412-the only homely girl in a handsome clan , with no past and no future . As far as [she]107-valancy could look back , life was drab and colourless , with not one single crimson or purple spot anywhere . As far as [she]107-valancy could look forward it seemed certain to be just the same until [she]107-valancy was nothing but a solitary , little withered leaf clinging to a wintry bough . The moment when [a woman]414-a woman realises that [she]414-a woman has nothing to live for — neither love , duty , purpose nor hope — holds for [her]414-a woman the bitterness of death .

“ And [I]107-valancy just have to go on living because [I]107-valancy ca n’t stop . [I]107-valancy may have to live eighty years , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy , in a kind of panic . “ [We]2186-we ’re all horribly long - lived . It sickens [me]107-valancy to think of it . ”[107-valancy]

[She]107-valancy was glad it was raining — or rather , [she]107-valancy was drearily satisfied that it was raining . There would be no picnic that day . This annual picnic , whereby [Aunt]415-aunt and [Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington — one always thought of [them]416-them in that succession — inevitably celebrated [their]416-them engagement at a picnic thirty years before , had been , of late years , a veritable nightmare to [Valancy]107-valancy . By an impish coincidence it was the same day as [her]107-valancy birthday and , after [she]107-valancy had passed twenty - five , [nobody]348-nobody let [her]107-valancy forget it .

Much as [she]107-valancy hated going to the picnic , it would never have occurred to [her]107-valancy to rebel against it . There seemed to be nothing of the revolutionary in [her]107-valancy nature . And [she]107-valancy knew exactly what [every one]418-every one would say to [her]107-valancy at the picnic . [Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington , whom [she]107-valancy disliked and despised even though [he]95-uncle wellington had fulfilled the highest Stirling aspiration , “ marrying money , ”[95-uncle wellington] would say to [her]107-valancy in a pig ’s whisper , “ Not thinking of getting married yet , [[my]95-uncle wellington dear]2187-my dear ? ”[95-uncle wellington] and then go off into the bellow of laughter with which [he]95-uncle wellington invariably concluded [his]95-uncle wellington dull remarks . [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington , of whom [Valancy]107-valancy stood in abject awe , would tell [her]107-valancy about [Olive]101-olive ’s new chiffon dress and [Cecil]102-cecil ’s last devoted letter . [Valancy]107-valancy would have to look as pleased and interested as if the dress and letter had been [hers]107-valancy or else [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington would be offended . [And Valancy]107-valancy had long ago decided that [she]107-valancy would rather offend [God]103-god than [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington , because [God]103-god might forgive [her]107-valancy but [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington never would .

[Aunt Alberta]104-aunt alberta , enormously fat , with an amiable habit of always referring to [[her]104-aunt alberta husband]419-her husband as “ [he]419-her husband , ”[419-her husband] as if [he]419-her husband were [the only male creature in [the world]321-the world , who could never forget that [she]104-aunt alberta had been a great beauty in [her]104-aunt alberta youth]420-the only male creature in the world , who could never forget that she had been a great beauty in her youth , would condole with [Valancy]107-valancy on [her]104-aunt alberta sallow skin —

“ [I]107-valancy do n’t know why all [the girls of today]2188-the girls of today are so sunburned . When [I]107-valancy was [a girl]2189-a girl [my]107-valancy skin was roses and cream . [I]107-valancy was counted [the prettiest girl in [Canada]10-canada]2190-the prettiest girl in canada , [[my]107-valancy dear]2187-my dear . ”[107-valancy]

Perhaps [Uncle Herbert]105-uncle herbert would n’t say anything — or perhaps [he]105-uncle herbert would remark jocularly , “ How fat [you]2187-my dear ’re getting , Doss ! ”[105-uncle herbert] And then [everybody]422-everybody would laugh over the excessively humorous idea of poor , scrawny little [Doss]106-doss getting fat .

Handsome , [solemn Uncle James , whom [Valancy]107-valancy disliked but respected because [he]105-uncle herbert was reputed to be very clever and was therefore [the clan oracle]423-the clan oracle — brains being none too plentiful in the [Stirling]107-valancy connection]107-valancy — would probably remark with the owl - like sarcasm that had won [him]105-uncle herbert [his]105-uncle herbert reputation , “ [I]108-uncle benjamin suppose [you]2187-my dear ’re busy with [your]2187-my dear hope - chest these days ? ”[108-uncle benjamin]

And [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin would ask some of [his]108-uncle benjamin abominable conundrums , between wheezy chuckles , and answer [them]424-them [himself]108-uncle benjamin .

“ What is the difference between [Doss]106-doss and a mouse ?[108-uncle benjamin]

“ The mouse wishes to harm the cheese and [Doss]106-doss wishes to charm the [he]108-uncle benjamin ’s . ”[107-valancy]

[Valancy]107-valancy had heard [him]108-uncle benjamin ask that riddle fifty times and every time [she]107-valancy wanted to throw something at [him]108-uncle benjamin . But [she]107-valancy never did . In the first place , [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings simply did not throw things ; in the second place , [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin was [a wealthy and childless old widower]425-a wealthy and childless old widower and [Valancy]107-valancy had been brought up in the fear and admonition of [his]108-uncle benjamin money . If [she]107-valancy offended [him]108-uncle benjamin [he]108-uncle benjamin would cut [her]107-valancy out of [his]108-uncle benjamin will — supposing [she]107-valancy were in it . [Valancy]107-valancy did not want to be cut out of [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin ’s will . [She]107-valancy had been poor all [her]107-valancy life and knew the galling bitterness of it . So [she]107-valancy endured [his]108-uncle benjamin riddles and even smiled tortured little smiles over them .

[Aunt Isabel]109-aunt isabel , downright and disagreeable as [an east wind]426-an east wind , would criticise [her]107-valancy in some way — [Valancy]107-valancy could not predict just how , for [Aunt Isabel]109-aunt isabel never repeated a criticism — [she]109-aunt isabel found something new with which to jab [you]427-you every time . [Aunt Isabel]109-aunt isabel prided [herself]109-aunt isabel on saying what [she]109-aunt isabel thought , but did n’t like it so well when [other people]428-other people said what [they]428-other people thought to [her]109-aunt isabel . [Valancy]107-valancy never said what [she]107-valancy thought .

[Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana — named after [[her]110-cousin georgiana great - great - grand - mother]429-her great - great - grand - mother , who had been named after [George the Fourth]111-george the fourth — would recount dolorously the names of [all relatives]430-all relatives and [friends who had died since the last picnic]431-friends who had died since the last picnic and wonder “ which of [us]2192-us will be the first to go next . ”[112-aunt mildred]

Oppressively competent , [Aunt Mildred]112-aunt mildred would talk endlessly of [[her]112-aunt mildred husband]419-her husband and [her]112-aunt mildred odious prodigies of [babies]433-babies to [Valancy]107-valancy , because [Valancy]107-valancy would be the only one [she]112-aunt mildred could find to put up with it . For the same reason , [Cousin Gladys]92-dr. trent — really [First Cousin Gladys]113-first cousin gladys once removed , according to the strict way in which [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings tabulated relationship — [a tall , thin lady who admitted [she]434-a tall , thin lady who admitted she had a sensitive disposition , would describe minutely the tortures of her neuritis had a sensitive disposition , would describe minutely the tortures of [her]434-a tall , thin lady who admitted she had a sensitive disposition , would describe minutely the tortures of her neuritis neuritis]434-a tall , thin lady who admitted she had a sensitive disposition , would describe minutely the tortures of her neuritis . And [Olive]101-olive , [the wonder girl of [the whole Stirling clan]436-the whole stirling clan]435-the wonder girl of the whole stirling clan , who had everything [Valancy]107-valancy had not — beauty , popularity , love,—would show off [her]101-olive beauty and presume on [her]101-olive popularity and flaunt [her]101-olive diamond insignia of love in [Valancy]107-valancy ’s dazzled , envious eyes .

There would be none of all this today . And there would be no packing up of teaspoons . The packing up was always left for [Valancy]107-valancy and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles . And once , six years ago , a silver teaspoon from [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington ’s wedding set had been lost . [Valancy]107-valancy never heard the last of that silver teaspoon . [Its]437-its ghost appeared Banquo - like at every subsequent family feast .

Oh , yes , [Valancy]107-valancy knew exactly what the picnic would be like and [she]107-valancy blessed the rain that had saved [her]107-valancy from it . There would be no picnic this year . If [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington could not celebrate on the sacred day itself [she]91-aunt wellington would have no celebration at all . Thank whatever gods there were for that .

Since there would be no picnic , [Valancy]107-valancy made up [her]107-valancy mind that , if the rain held up in the afternoon , [she]107-valancy would go up to [the library]438-the library and get another of [John Foster]114-john foster ’s books . [Valancy]107-valancy was never allowed to read novels , but [John Foster]114-john foster ’s books were not novels . They were “ nature books”—so[439-the librarian] [the librarian]439-the librarian told [Mrs. Frederick Stirling—“all]115-mrs. frederick stirling—“all about [the woods]2193-the woods and birds and bugs and things like that , [you]440-your know . ”[439-the librarian] So [Valancy]107-valancy was allowed to read them — under protest , for it was only too evident that [she]107-valancy enjoyed them too much . It was permissible , even laudable , to read to improve [your]440-your mind and [your]440-your religion , but a book that was enjoyable was dangerous . [Valancy]107-valancy did not know whether [her]107-valancy mind was being improved or not ; but [she]107-valancy felt vaguely that if [she]107-valancy had come across [John Foster]114-john foster ’s books years ago life might have been a different thing for [her]107-valancy . They seemed to [her]107-valancy to yield glimpses of a world into which [she]107-valancy might once have entered , though the door was forever barred to [her]107-valancy now . It was only within the last year that [John Foster]114-john foster ’s books had been in [the Deerwood library]441-the deerwood library , though [the librarian]439-the librarian told [Valancy]107-valancy that [he]114-john foster had been [a well - known writer]443-a well - known writer for several years .

“ Where does [he]114-john foster live ? ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy had asked .

“ [Nobody]348-nobody knows . From [his]114-john foster books [he]114-john foster must be [a Canadian]2195-a canadian , but no more information can be had . [[His]114-john foster publishers]2196-his publishers wo n’t say a word . Quite likely [John Foster]114-john foster is a nom de plume . [His]114-john foster books are so popular [we]2197-we ca n’t keep them in at all , though [I]439-the librarian really ca n’t see what [people]2198-people find in them to rave over . ”[439-the librarian]

“ [I]107-valancy think they ’re wonderful , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , timidly .

“ Oh — well — ”[116-miss clarkson] [Miss Clarkson]116-miss clarkson smiled in a patronising fashion that relegated [Valancy]107-valancy ’s opinions to limbo , “ [I]116-miss clarkson ca n’t say [I]116-miss clarkson care much for bugs [myself]116-miss clarkson . But certainly [Foster]114-john foster seems to know all there is to know about them . ”[116-miss clarkson]

[Valancy]107-valancy did n’t know whether [she]107-valancy cared much for bugs either . It was not [John Foster]114-john foster ’s uncanny knowledge of wild creatures and insect life that enthralled [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy could hardly say what it was — some tantalising lure of a mystery never revealed — some hint of a great secret just a little further on — some faint , elusive echo of lovely , forgotten things — [John Foster]114-john foster ’s magic was indefinable .

Yes , [she]107-valancy would get a new Foster book . It was a month since [she]107-valancy had [Thistle Harvest]12-thistle harvest , so surely [Mother]96-mother could not object . [Valancy]107-valancy had read it four times — [she]107-valancy knew whole passages off by heart .

And — [she]107-valancy almost thought [she]107-valancy would go and see [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent about that queer pain around the heart . It had come rather often lately , and the palpitations were becoming annoying , not to speak of an occasional dizzy moment and a queer shortness of breath . But could [she]107-valancy go to see [him]92-dr. trent without telling [any one]444-any one ? It was a most daring thought . [None of [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings]445-none of the stirlings ever consulted [a doctor]446-a doctor without holding [a family council]447-a family council and getting [Uncle James]107-valancy ’ approval . Then , [they]445-none of the stirlings went to [[Dr. Ambrose]117-dr. marsh Marsh of [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence]13-dr. ambrose marsh of port lawrence , who had married Second Cousin [Adelaide Stirling]118-adelaide stirling .

But [Valancy]107-valancy disliked [Dr. Ambrose Marsh]117-dr. marsh . And , besides , [she]107-valancy could not get to [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence , fifteen miles away , without being taken [there]448-there . [She]107-valancy did not want [any one]444-any one to know about [her]107-valancy heart . There would be such a fuss made and [every member of [the family]451-the family]450-every member of the family would come down and talk it over and advise [her]107-valancy and caution [her]107-valancy and warn [her]107-valancy and tell [her]107-valancy horrible tales of [great - aunts]452-great - aunts and [cousins forty times removed who had been “ just like that ”[109-aunt isabel] and “ dropped dead without a moment]2199-cousins forty times removed who had been “ just like that ” and “ dropped dead without a moment ’s warning , [[my]109-aunt isabel dear]2187-my dear . ”[109-aunt isabel]

[Aunt Isabel]109-aunt isabel would remember that [she]109-aunt isabel had always said [Doss]106-doss looked like [a girl who would have heart trouble—“so pinched and peaked always ”]2201-a girl who would have heart trouble—“so pinched and peaked always ”[109-aunt isabel] ; and [Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington would take it as a personal insult , when “ [no Stirling]107-valancy ever had heart disease before ”[95-uncle wellington] ; and [Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana would forebode in perfectly audible asides that “ [poor , dear little Doss]2202-poor , dear little doss is n’t long for [this world]2203-this world , [I]110-cousin georgiana ’m afraid ”[110-cousin georgiana] ; and [Cousin Gladys]92-dr. trent would say , “ Why , [my]92-dr. trent heart has been like that for years , ”[92-dr. trent] in a tone that implied [no one else]453-no one else had any business even to have a heart ; and [Olive]101-olive — [Olive]101-olive would merely look beautiful and superior and disgustingly healthy , as if to say , “ Why all this fuss over a faded superfluity like Doss when [you]2204-you have [me]101-olive ? ”[101-olive]

[Valancy]107-valancy felt that [she]107-valancy could n’t tell [anybody]454-anybody unless [she]107-valancy had to . [She]107-valancy felt quite sure there was nothing at all seriously wrong with [her]107-valancy heart and no need of all the pother that would ensue if [she]107-valancy mentioned it . [She]107-valancy would just slip up quietly and see [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent that very day . As for [his]92-dr. trent bill , [she]107-valancy had the two hundred dollars that [[her]107-valancy father]455-her father had put in the bank for [her]107-valancy the day [she]107-valancy was born . [She]107-valancy was never allowed to use even the interest of this , but [she]107-valancy would secretly take out enough to pay [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent .

[Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent was [a gruff , outspoken , absent - minded old fellow]456-a gruff , outspoken , absent - minded old fellow , but [he]92-dr. trent was a recognised authority on heart disease , even if [he]92-dr. trent were only [a general practitioner]457-a general practitioner in [out - of - [the - world]459-the - world [Deerwood]5-deerwood]458-out - of - the - world deerwood . [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent was over seventy and there had been rumours that [he]92-dr. trent meant to retire soon . [None of [the Stirling clan]461-the stirling clan]460-none of the stirling clan had ever gone to [him]92-dr. trent since [he]92-dr. trent had told [Cousin Gladys]92-dr. trent , ten years before , that [her]462-her neuritis was all imaginary and that [she]462-her enjoyed it . [You]463-you could n’t patronise [a doctor who insulted [[your]463-you first - cousin]465-your first - cousin - once - removed like that — not to mention that [he]92-dr. trent was [a Presbyterian]466-a presbyterian when all [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings went to [the Anglican church]467-the anglican church]464-a doctor who insulted your first - cousin - once - removed like that — not to mention that he was a presbyterian when all the stirlings went to the anglican church . But [Valancy]107-valancy , between the devil of disloyalty to [clan and the deep sea of fuss and clatter and advice]468-clan and the deep sea of fuss and clatter and advice , thought [she]107-valancy would take a chance with [the devil]469-the devil .

CHAPTER II

When [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles knocked at [her]107-valancy door , [Valancy]107-valancy knew it was half - past seven and [she]107-valancy must get up . As long as [she]107-valancy could remember , [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles had knocked at [her]107-valancy door at half - past seven . [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles and [Mrs. Frederick Stirling]99-mrs. frederick had been up since seven , but [Valancy]107-valancy was allowed to lie abed half an hour longer because of a family tradition that [she]107-valancy was delicate . [Valancy]107-valancy got up , though [she]107-valancy hated getting up more this morning than ever [she]107-valancy had before . What was there to get up for ? Another dreary day like all the days that had preceded it , full of meaningless little tasks , joyless and unimportant , that benefited [nobody]348-nobody . But if [she]107-valancy did not get up at once [she]107-valancy would not be ready for breakfast at eight o’clock . Hard and fast times for meals were the rule in [[Mrs. Stirling]99-mrs. frederick ’s household]471-mrs. stirling ’s household . Breakfast at eight , dinner at one , supper at six , year in and year out . No excuses for being late were ever tolerated . So up [Valancy]107-valancy got , shivering .

[The room]472-the room was bitterly cold with the raw , penetrating chill of a wet May morning . [The house]364-the house would be cold all day . It was one of [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick ’s rules that no fires were necessary after the twenty - fourth of May . Meals were cooked on the little oil - stove in [the back porch]474-the back porch . And though May might be icy and October frost - bitten , no fires were lighted until the twenty - first of October by the calendar . On the twenty - first of October [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick began cooking over the [kitchen range]475-kitchen range and lighted a fire in the sitting - room stove in the evenings . It was whispered about in the connection that [the late Frederick Stirling]99-mrs. frederick had caught the cold which resulted in [his]476-his death during [Valancy]107-valancy ’s first year of life because [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick would not have a fire on the twentieth of October . [She]99-mrs. frederick lighted it the next day — but that was a day too late for [Frederick Stirling]99-mrs. frederick .

[Valancy]107-valancy took off and hung up in [the closet]477-the closet [her]107-valancy nightdress of coarse , unbleached cotton , with high neck and long , tight sleeves . [She]107-valancy put on undergarments of a similar nature , a dress of brown gingham , thick , black stockings and rubber - heeled boots . Of late years [she]107-valancy had fallen into the habit of doing [her]107-valancy hair with the shade of the window by the looking - glass pulled down . The lines on [her]107-valancy face did not show so plainly then . But this morning [she]107-valancy jerked the shade to the very top and looked at [herself]107-valancy in the leprous mirror with a passionate determination to see [herself]107-valancy as [the world]321-the world saw [her]107-valancy .

The result was rather dreadful . Even [a beauty]479-a beauty would have found that harsh , unsoftened side - light trying . [Valancy]107-valancy saw straight black hair , short and thin , always lustreless despite the fact that [she]107-valancy gave it one hundred strokes of the brush , neither more nor less , every night of [her]107-valancy life and faithfully rubbed [Redfern]119-dr. redfern ’s Hair Vigor into the roots , more lustreless than ever in its morning roughness ; fine , straight , black brows ; a nose [she]107-valancy had always felt was much too small even for [her]107-valancy small , three - cornered , white face ; a small , pale mouth that always fell open a trifle over little , pointed white teeth ; a figure thin and flat - breasted , rather below the average height . [She]107-valancy had somehow escaped the family high cheek - bones , and [her]107-valancy dark - brown eyes , too soft and shadowy to be black , had a slant that was almost Oriental . Apart from [her]107-valancy eyes [she]107-valancy was neither pretty nor ugly — just insignificant - looking , [she]107-valancy concluded bitterly . How plain the lines around [her]107-valancy eyes and mouth were in that merciless light ! And never had [her]107-valancy narrow , white face looked so narrow and so white .

[She]107-valancy did [her]107-valancy hair in a pompadour . [Pompadours]480-pompadours had long gone out of fashion , but they had been in when [Valancy]107-valancy first put [her]107-valancy hair up and [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington had decided that [she]107-valancy must always wear [her]107-valancy hair so .

“ It is the only way that becomes [you]2205-you . [Your]2205-you face is so small that [you]2205-you must add height to it by a pompadour effect , ”[91-aunt wellington] said [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington , who always enunciated commonplaces as if uttering profound and important truths .

[Valancy]107-valancy had hankered to do [her]107-valancy hair pulled low on [her]107-valancy forehead , with puffs above the ears , as [Olive]101-olive was wearing [hers]101-olive . But [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington ’s dictum had such an effect on [her]107-valancy that [she]107-valancy never dared change [her]107-valancy style of hairdressing again . But then , there were so many things [Valancy]107-valancy never dared do .

All [her]107-valancy life [she]107-valancy had been afraid of something , [she]107-valancy thought bitterly . From the very dawn of recollection , when [she]107-valancy had been so horribly afraid of the big black bear that lived , so [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles told [her]107-valancy , in [the closet under the stairs]481-the closet under the stairs .

“ And [I]97-cousin stickles always will be — [I]97-cousin stickles know it — [I]97-cousin stickles ca n’t help it . [I]97-cousin stickles do n’t know what it would be like not to be afraid of something . ”[97-cousin stickles]

Afraid of [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother ’s sulky fits — afraid of offending [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin — afraid of becoming a target for [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington ’s contempt — afraid of [Aunt Isabel]109-aunt isabel ’s biting comments — afraid of [Uncle James]107-valancy ’ disapproval — afraid of offending [the whole clan]483-the whole clan ’s opinions and prejudices — afraid of not keeping up appearances — afraid to say what [she]107-valancy really thought of anything — afraid of poverty in [her]107-valancy old age . Fear — fear — fear — [she]107-valancy could never escape from it . It bound [her]107-valancy and enmeshed [her]107-valancy like a spider ’s web of steel . Only in [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle could [she]107-valancy find temporary release . And this morning [Valancy]107-valancy could not believe [she]107-valancy had [a Blue Castle]485-a blue castle . [She]107-valancy would never be able to find it again . Twenty - nine , unmarried , undesired — what had [she]107-valancy to do with [the fairy - like chatelaine of [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle]486-the fairy - like chatelaine of the blue castle ? [She]107-valancy would cut such childish nonsense out of [her]107-valancy life forever and face reality unflinchingly .

[She]107-valancy turned from [her]107-valancy unfriendly mirror and looked out . The ugliness of the view always struck [her]107-valancy like a blow ; the ragged fence , [the tumble - down old carriage - shop in [the next lot]489-the next lot]488-the tumble - down old carriage - shop in the next lot , plastered with crude , violently coloured advertisements ; [the grimy railway station]490-the grimy railway station beyond , with the awful derelicts that were always hanging around [it]490-the grimy railway station even at this early hour . In the pouring rain everything looked worse than usual , especially the beastly advertisement , “ Keep that schoolgirl complexion . ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy had kept [her]107-valancy schoolgirl complexion . That was just the trouble . There was not a gleam of beauty anywhere—“exactly like [my]107-valancy life , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy drearily . [Her]107-valancy brief bitterness had passed . [She]107-valancy accepted facts as resignedly as [she]107-valancy had always accepted them . [She]107-valancy was one of [the people whom life always passes by]491-the people whom life always passes by . There was no altering that fact .

In this mood [Valancy]107-valancy went down to breakfast .

CHAPTER III

Breakfast was always the same . Oatmeal porridge , which [Valancy]107-valancy loathed , toast and tea , and one teaspoonful of marmalade . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick thought two teaspoonfuls extravagant — but that did not matter to [Valancy]107-valancy , who hated marmalade , too . [The chilly , gloomy little dining - room]492-the chilly , gloomy little dining - room was chillier and gloomier than usual ; the rain streamed down outside the window ; [departed Stirlings]93-the stirlings , in atrocious , gilt frames , wider than the pictures , glowered down from the walls . And yet [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles wished [Valancy]107-valancy many happy returns of the day !

“ Sit up straight , [Doss]106-doss , ”[343-her mother] was all [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother said .

[Valancy]107-valancy sat up straight . [She]107-valancy talked to [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles of the things [they]495-they always talked of . [She]107-valancy never wondered what would happen if [she]107-valancy tried to talk of something else . [She]107-valancy knew . Therefore [she]107-valancy never did it .

[Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick was offended with [Providence]120-providence for sending a rainy day when [she]99-mrs. frederick wanted to go to a picnic , so [she]99-mrs. frederick ate [her]99-mrs. frederick breakfast in a sulky silence for which [Valancy]107-valancy was rather grateful . But [Christine Stickles]121-christine stickles whined endlessly on as usual , complaining about everything — the weather , the leak in [the pantry]496-the pantry , the price of oatmeal and butter — [Valancy]107-valancy felt at once [she]107-valancy had buttered [her]107-valancy toast too lavishly — the epidemic of mumps in [Deerwood]5-deerwood .

“ [Doss]106-doss will be sure to ketch [them]498-them , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy foreboded .

“ [Doss]106-doss must not go where [she]106-doss is likely to catch mumps , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick shortly .

[Valancy]107-valancy had never had mumps — or whooping cough — or chicken - pox — or measles — or anything [she]107-valancy should have had — nothing but horrible colds every winter . [Doss]106-doss ’ winter colds were a sort of tradition in [the family]451-the family . Nothing , it seemed , could prevent [her]107-valancy from catching [them]498-them . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles did [their]499-their heroic best . One winter [they]499-their kept [Valancy]107-valancy housed up from November to May , in [the warm sitting - room]500-the warm sitting - room . [She]107-valancy was not even allowed to go to [church]501-church . And [Valancy]107-valancy took cold after cold and ended up with bronchitis in June .

“ [None of [[my]99-mrs. frederick family]2207-my family]2206-none of my family were ever like that , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick , implying that it must be a [Stirling]107-valancy tendency .

“ [The Stirlings]93-the stirlings seldom take colds , ”[97-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles resentfully . [She]107-valancy had been [a Stirling]502-a stirling .

“ [I]99-mrs. frederick think , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick , “ that if [a person]2208-a person makes up [her]2208-a person mind not to have colds [she]2208-a person will not have colds . ”[99-mrs. frederick]

So that was the trouble . It was all [Valancy]107-valancy ’s own fault .

But on this particular morning [Valancy]107-valancy ’s unbearable grievance was that [she]107-valancy was called [Doss]106-doss . [She]107-valancy had endured it for twenty - nine years , and all at once [she]107-valancy felt [she]107-valancy could not endure it any longer . [Her]107-valancy full name was [Valancy Jane]107-valancy . [Valancy Jane]107-valancy was rather terrible , but [she]107-valancy liked [Valancy]107-valancy , with its odd , out - land tang . It was always a wonder to [Valancy]107-valancy that [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings had allowed [her]107-valancy to be so christened . [She]107-valancy had been told that [[her]107-valancy maternal grandfather]503-her maternal grandfather , [old Amos Wansbarra]123-old amos wansbarra , had chosen the name for [her]107-valancy . [[Her]107-valancy father]455-her father had tacked on [the Jane]107-valancy by way of civilising it , and the whole connection got out of the difficulty by nicknaming [her]107-valancy Doss . [She]107-valancy never got [Valancy]107-valancy from [any one but outsiders]505-any one but outsiders .

“ [Mother]96-mother , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy said timidly , “ would [you]96-mother mind calling [me]107-valancy [Valancy]107-valancy after this ? [Doss]106-doss seems so — so — [I]107-valancy do n’t like it . ”[107-valancy]

[Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick looked at [[her]99-mrs. frederick daughter]506-her daughter in astonishment . [She]107-valancy wore glasses with enormously strong lenses that gave [her]107-valancy eyes a peculiarly disagreeable appearance .

“ What is the matter with [Doss]106-doss ? ”[107-valancy]

“ It — seems so childish , ”[107-valancy] faltered [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ Oh ! ”[99-mrs. frederick] [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick had been [a Wansbarra]123-old amos wansbarra and [the Wansbarra]123-old amos wansbarra smile was not an asset . “ [I]123-old amos wansbarra see . Well , it should suit [you]507-the dear child then . [You]507-the dear child are childish enough in all conscience , [[my]123-old amos wansbarra dear child]2209-my dear child . ”[123-old amos wansbarra]

“ [I]507-the dear child am twenty - nine , ”[507-the dear child] said [the dear child]507-the dear child desperately .

“ [I]99-mrs. frederick would n’t proclaim it from [the house - tops]2210-the house - tops if [I]99-mrs. frederick were [you]507-the dear child , [dear]2211-dear , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick . “ Twenty - nine ! [I]99-mrs. frederick had been married nine years when [I]99-mrs. frederick was twenty - nine . ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ [I]97-cousin stickles was married at seventeen , ”[97-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles proudly .

[Valancy]107-valancy looked at [them]508-them furtively . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick , except for those terrible glasses and the hooked nose that made [her]99-mrs. frederick look more like a parrot than a parrot itself could look , was not ill - looking . At twenty [she]99-mrs. frederick might have been quite pretty . But [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles ! And yet [Christine Stickles]121-christine stickles had once been desirable in [some man]509-some man ’s eyes . [Valancy]107-valancy felt that [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles , with [her]97-cousin stickles broad , flat , wrinkled face , a mole right on the end of [her]97-cousin stickles dumpy nose , bristling hairs on [her]97-cousin stickles chin , wrinkled yellow neck , pale , protruding eyes , and thin , puckered mouth , had yet this advantage over [her]97-cousin stickles — this right to look down on [her]97-cousin stickles . And even yet [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles was necessary to [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick . [Valancy]107-valancy wondered pitifully what it would be like to be wanted by [some one]359-some one — needed by [some one]359-some one . [No one in [the whole world]513-the whole world]512-no one in the whole world needed [her]107-valancy , or would miss anything from life if [she]107-valancy dropped suddenly out of it . [She]107-valancy was a disappointment to [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother . [No one]515-no one loved [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy had never so much as had [a girl friend]516-a girl friend .

“ [I]107-valancy have n’t even a gift for friendship , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy had once admitted to [herself]107-valancy pitifully .

“ Doss , [you]107-valancy have n’t eaten [your]107-valancy crusts , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick rebukingly .

It rained all the forenoon without cessation . [Valancy]107-valancy pieced a quilt . [Valancy]107-valancy hated piecing quilts . And there was no need of it . [The house]364-the house was full of quilts . There were three big chests , packed with quilts , in [the attic]518-the attic . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick had begun storing away quilts when [Valancy]107-valancy was seventeen and [she]99-mrs. frederick kept on storing them , though it did not seem likely that [Valancy]107-valancy would ever need them . But [Valancy]107-valancy must be at work and fancy work materials were too expensive . Idleness was a cardinal sin in [the Stirling household]519-the stirling household . When [Valancy]107-valancy had been [a child]520-a child [she]107-valancy had been made to write down every night , in a small , hated , black notebook , all the minutes [she]107-valancy had spent in idleness that day . On Sundays [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother made [her]107-valancy tot [them]522-them up and pray over [them]522-them .

On this particular forenoon of this day of destiny [Valancy]107-valancy spent only ten minutes in idleness . At least , [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles would have called it idleness . [She]107-valancy went to [[her]107-valancy room]372-her room to get a better thimble and [she]107-valancy opened [Thistle Harvest]12-thistle harvest guiltily at random .

“ [The woods]2193-the woods are so human , ”[114-john foster] wrote [John Foster]114-john foster , “ that to know [them]2193-the woods one must live with [them]2193-the woods . An occasional saunter through [them]2193-the woods , keeping to the well - trodden paths , will never admit [us]2213-we to [their]2193-the woods intimacy . If [we]2213-we wish to be [friends]2214-friends [we]2213-we must seek [them]2193-the woods out and win [them]2193-the woods by frequent , reverent visits at all hours ; by morning , by noon , and by night ; and at all seasons , in spring , in summer , in autumn , in winter . Otherwise [we]2213-we can never really know [them]2193-the woods and any pretence [we]2213-we may make to the contrary will never impose on [them]2193-the woods . [They]2193-the woods have [their]2193-the woods own effective way of keeping [aliens]2215-aliens at a distance and shutting [their]2193-the woods hearts to [mere casual sightseers]2216-mere casual sightseers . It is of no use to seek [the woods]2193-the woods from any motive except sheer love of [them]2193-the woods ; [they]2193-the woods will find [us]2213-we out at once and hide all [their]2193-the woods sweet , old - world secrets from [us]2213-we . But if [they]2193-the woods know [we]2213-we come to [them]2193-the woods because [we]2213-we love [them]2193-the woods [they]2193-the woods will be very kind to [us]2213-we and give [us]2213-we such treasures of beauty and delight as are not bought or sold in any market - place . For [the woods]2193-the woods , when [they]2193-the woods give at all , give unstintedly and hold nothing back from [[their]2193-the woods true worshippers]2219-their true worshippers . [We]2213-we must go to [them]2193-the woods lovingly , humbly , patiently , watchfully , and [we]2213-we shall learn what poignant loveliness lurks in [the wild places]2220-the wild places and silent intervals , lying under starshine and sunset , what cadences of unearthly music are harped on aged pine boughs or crooned in copses of fir , what delicate savours exhale from mosses and ferns in sunny corners or on [damp brooklands]2221-damp brooklands , what dreams and myths and legends of an older time haunt [them]2193-the woods . Then the immortal heart of [the woods]2193-the woods will beat against [ours]2213-we and its subtle life will steal into [our]2213-we veins and make [us]2213-we its own forever , so that no matter where [we]2213-we go or how widely [we]2213-we wander [we]2213-we shall yet be drawn back to [the forest]2223-the forest to find [our]2213-we most enduring kinship . ”[114-john foster]

“ [Doss]106-doss , ”[343-her mother] called [[her]524-her mother]343-her mother from [the hall below]526-the hall below , “ what are [you]107-valancy doing all by [yourself]107-valancy in [that room]351-that room ? ”[343-her mother]

[Valancy]107-valancy dropped [Thistle Harvest]12-thistle harvest like a hot coal and fled [downstairs]365-downstairs to [[her]107-valancy patches]528-her patches ; but [she]107-valancy felt the strange exhilaration of spirit that always came momentarily to [her]107-valancy when [she]107-valancy dipped into one of [John Foster]114-john foster ’s books . [Valancy]107-valancy did not know much about woods — except the haunted groves of oak and pine around [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle . But [she]107-valancy had always secretly hankered after [them]530-them and a Foster book about woods was the next best thing to [the woods]2193-the woods [themselves]2193-the woods .

At noon it stopped raining , but the sun did not come out until three . Then [Valancy]107-valancy timidly said [she]107-valancy thought [she]107-valancy would go [uptown]532-uptown .

“ What do [you]107-valancy want to go [uptown]532-uptown for ? ”[343-her mother] demanded [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother .

“ [I]107-valancy want to get a book from [the library]438-the library . ”[107-valancy]

“ [You]107-valancy got a book from [the library]438-the library only last week . ”[107-valancy]

“ No , it was four weeks . ”[107-valancy]

“ Four weeks . Nonsense ! ”[107-valancy]

“ Really it was , [Mother]96-mother . ”[107-valancy]

“ [You]107-valancy are mistaken . It can not possibly have been more than two weeks . [I]107-valancy dislike contradiction . And [I]107-valancy do not see what [you]107-valancy want to get a book for , anyhow . [You]107-valancy waste too much time reading . ”[107-valancy]

“ Of what value is [my]107-valancy time ? ”[107-valancy] asked [Valancy]107-valancy bitterly .

“ Doss ! Do n’t speak in that tone to [me]107-valancy . ”[107-valancy]

“ [We]534-we need some tea , ”[97-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles . “ [She]107-valancy might go and get that if [she]107-valancy wants a walk — though this damp weather is bad for colds . ”[97-cousin stickles]

[They]534-we argued the matter for ten minutes longer and finally [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick agreed rather grudgingly that [Valancy]107-valancy might go .

CHAPTER IV

“ Got [your]107-valancy rubbers on ? ”[97-cousin stickles] called [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles , as [Valancy]107-valancy left [the house]364-the house .

[Christine Stickles]121-christine stickles had never once forgotten to ask that question when [Valancy]107-valancy went out on a damp day .

“ Yes . ”[121-christine stickles]

“ Have [you]107-valancy got [your]107-valancy flannel petticoat on ? ”[99-mrs. frederick] asked [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick .

“ No . ”[121-christine stickles]

“ [Doss]106-doss , [I]99-mrs. frederick really do not understand [you]107-valancy . Do [you]107-valancy want to catch [your]107-valancy death of cold again ? ”[99-mrs. frederick] [Her]99-mrs. frederick voice implied that [Valancy]107-valancy had died of a cold several times already . “ Go [upstairs]2228-upstairs this minute and put it on ! ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ [Mother]96-mother , [I]121-christine stickles do n’t need a flannel petticoat . [My]121-christine stickles sateen one is warm enough . ”[121-christine stickles]

“ [Doss]106-doss , remember [you]107-valancy had bronchitis two years ago . Go and do as [you]107-valancy are told ! ”[99-mrs. frederick]

[Valancy]107-valancy went , though [nobody]348-nobody will ever know just how near [she]107-valancy came to hurling the rubber - plant into [the street]537-the street before [she]107-valancy went . [She]107-valancy hated that grey flannel petticoat more than any other garment [she]107-valancy owned . [Olive]101-olive never had to wear flannel petticoats . [Olive]101-olive wore ruffled silk and sheer lawn and filmy laced flounces . But [[Olive]101-olive ’s father]538-olive ’s father had “ married money ”[101-olive] and [Olive]101-olive never had bronchitis . So there [you]539-you were .

“ Are [you]107-valancy sure [you]107-valancy did n’t leave the soap in the water ? ”[99-mrs. frederick] demanded [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick . But [Valancy]107-valancy was gone . [She]107-valancy turned at the corner and looked back down [the ugly , prim , respectable street]540-the ugly , prim , respectable street where [she]107-valancy lived . [The Stirling house]541-the stirling house was the ugliest on [it]540-the ugly , prim , respectable street — more like a red brick box than anything else . Too high for [its]541-the stirling house breadth , and made still higher by a bulbous glass cupola on top . About [it]541-the stirling house was the desolate , barren peace of [an old house whose life is lived]542-an old house whose life is lived .

There was [a very pretty little house]543-a very pretty little house , with leaded casements and dubbed gables , just around the corner — [a new house]544-a new house , one of [those houses [you]539-you love the minute [you]539-you see [them]544-a new house]545-those houses you love the minute you see them . [Clayton Markley]125-clayton markley had built [it]544-a new house for [[his]125-clayton markley bride]546-his bride . [He]125-clayton markley was to be married to [Jennie Lloyd]126-jennie lloyd in [June]15-june . [The little house]547-the little house , it was said , was furnished from [attic]548-attic to [cellar]549-cellar , in complete readiness for [[its]547-the little house mistress]550-its mistress .

“ [I]107-valancy do n’t envy [Jennie]126-jennie lloyd [the man]2229-the man , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy sincerely — [Clayton Markley]125-clayton markley was not one of [her]107-valancy many ideals—“but [I]107-valancy do envy [her]126-jennie lloyd [the house]364-the house . It ’s such [a nice young house]2231-a nice young house . Oh , if [I]107-valancy could only have [a house of [my]107-valancy own]2232-a house of my own — ever so poor , so tiny — but [my]107-valancy own ! But then , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy added bitterly , “ there is no use in yowling for the moon when [you]2233-you ca n’t even get a tallow candle . ”[107-valancy]

In [dreamland]551-dreamland nothing would do [Valancy]107-valancy but [a castle of pale sapphire]552-a castle of pale sapphire . In real life [she]107-valancy would have been fully satisfied with [a little house of [her]107-valancy own]553-a little house of her own . [She]107-valancy envied [Jennie Lloyd]126-jennie lloyd more fiercely than ever today . [Jennie]126-jennie lloyd was not so much better looking than [she]126-jennie lloyd was , and not so very much younger . Yet [she]107-valancy was to have [this delightful house]554-this delightful house . And the nicest little Wedgwood teacups — [Valancy]107-valancy had seen them ; an open fireplace , and monogrammed linen ; hemstitched tablecloths , and china - closets . Why did everything come to [some girls]555-some girls and nothing to [others]556-others ? It was n’t fair .

[Valancy]107-valancy was once more seething with rebellion as [she]107-valancy walked along , [a prim , dowdy little figure in [her]107-valancy shabby raincoat and three - year - old hat , splashed occasionally by the mud of [a passing motor]558-a passing motor with its insulting shrieks]557-a prim , dowdy little figure in her shabby raincoat and three - year - old hat , splashed occasionally by the mud of a passing motor with its insulting shrieks . Motors were still rather a novelty in [Deerwood]5-deerwood , though they were common in [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence , and [most of [the summer residents up at [Muskoka]16-muskoka]560-the summer residents up at muskoka]559-most of the summer residents up at muskoka had [them]561-them . In [Deerwood]5-deerwood only some of [the smart set]562-the smart set had them ; for even [Deerwood]5-deerwood was divided into sets . There was the smart set — the intellectual set — the old - family set — of which [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings were [members]563-members — [the common run]564-the common run , and [a few pariahs]565-a few pariahs . [Not one of [the Stirling clan]461-the stirling clan]566-not one of the stirling clan had as yet condescended to a motor , though [Olive]101-olive was teasing [[her]101-olive father]455-her father to have one . [Valancy]107-valancy had never even been in [a motorcar]569-a motorcar . But [she]107-valancy did not hanker after this . In truth , [she]107-valancy felt rather afraid of [motorcars]570-motorcars , especially at night . [They]570-motorcars seemed to be too much like big purring beasts that might turn and crush [you]571-you — or make some terrible savage leap somewhere . On the steep mountain trails around [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle only gaily caparisoned steeds might proudly pace ; in real life [Valancy]107-valancy would have been quite contented to drive in a buggy behind a nice horse . [She]107-valancy got a buggy drive only when [some uncle or cousin]573-some uncle or cousin remembered to fling [her]107-valancy “ a chance , ”[108-uncle benjamin] like a bone to a dog .

CHAPTER V

Of course [she]107-valancy must buy the tea in [[Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin ’s grocery - store]574-uncle benjamin ’s grocery - store . To buy it anywhere else was unthinkable . [Yet Valancy]107-valancy hated to go to [[Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin ’s store]575-uncle benjamin ’s store on [her]107-valancy twenty - ninth birthday . There was no hope that [he]108-uncle benjamin would not remember it .

“ Why , ”[108-uncle benjamin] demanded [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin , leeringly , as [he]108-uncle benjamin tied up [her]107-valancy tea , “ are [young ladies]2234-young ladies like [bad grammarians]2235-bad grammarians ? ”[108-uncle benjamin]

[Valancy]107-valancy , with [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin ’s will in the background of [her]107-valancy mind , said meekly , “ [I]107-valancy do n’t know . Why ? ”[107-valancy]

“ Because , ”[108-uncle benjamin] chuckled [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin , “ [they]2234-young ladies ca n’t decline matrimony . ”[108-uncle benjamin]

[The two clerks]576-the two clerks , [Joe Hammond]127-joe and [Claude Bertram]128-claude bertram , chuckled also , and [Valancy]107-valancy disliked [them]576-the two clerks a little more than ever . On the first day [Claude Bertram]128-claude bertram had seen [her]107-valancy in [the store]577-the store [she]107-valancy had heard [him]128-claude bertram whisper to [Joe]127-joe , “ Who is that ? ”[128-claude bertram] And [Joe]127-joe had said , “ [Valancy Stirling]107-valancy — [one of [the Deerwood old maids]2237-the deerwood old maids]2236-one of the deerwood old maids . ”[127-joe] “ Curable or incurable ? ”[128-claude bertram] [Claude]128-claude bertram had asked with a snicker , evidently thinking the question very clever . [Valancy]107-valancy smarted anew with the sting of that old recollection .

“ Twenty - nine , ”[108-uncle benjamin] [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin was saying . “ Dear [me]108-uncle benjamin , [Doss]106-doss , [you]106-doss ’re dangerously near the second corner and not even thinking of getting married yet . Twenty - nine . It seems impossible . ”[108-uncle benjamin]

Then [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin said an original thing . [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin said , “ How time does fly ! ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ [I]107-valancy think it crawls , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy passionately . [Passion]129-passion was so alien to [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin ’s conception of [Valancy]107-valancy that [he]108-uncle benjamin did n’t know what to make of [her]107-valancy . To cover [his]108-uncle benjamin confusion , [he]108-uncle benjamin asked another conundrum as [he]108-uncle benjamin tied up [her]107-valancy beans — [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles had remembered at the last moment that they must have beans . Beans were cheap and filling .

“ What two ages are apt to prove illusory ? ”[108-uncle benjamin] asked [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin ; and , not waiting for [Valancy]107-valancy to “ give it up , ”[108-uncle benjamin] [he]108-uncle benjamin added , “ [Mir]130-mir - age and marriage . ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ M - i - r - a - g - e is pronounced mirazh , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy shortly , picking up [her]107-valancy tea and [her]107-valancy beans . For the moment [she]107-valancy did not care whether [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin cut [her]107-valancy out of [his]108-uncle benjamin will or not . [She]107-valancy walked out of [the store]577-the store while [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin stared after [her]107-valancy with [his]108-uncle benjamin mouth open . Then [he]108-uncle benjamin shook [his]108-uncle benjamin head .

“ [Poor Doss]106-doss is taking it hard , ”[108-uncle benjamin] [he]108-uncle benjamin said .

[Valancy]107-valancy was sorry by the time [she]107-valancy reached the next crossing . Why had [she]107-valancy lost [her]107-valancy patience like that ? [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin would be annoyed and would likely tell [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother that [Doss]106-doss had been impertinent—“to me!”—and[343-her mother] [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother would lecture [her]107-valancy for a week .

“ [I]107-valancy ’ve held [my]107-valancy tongue for twenty years , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy . “ Why could n’t [I]107-valancy have held it once more ? ”[107-valancy]

Yes , it was just twenty , [Valancy]107-valancy reflected , since [she]107-valancy had first been twitted with [her]107-valancy loverless condition . [She]107-valancy remembered the bitter moment perfectly . [She]107-valancy was just nine years old and [she]107-valancy was standing alone on [the school playground]581-the school playground while [the other little girls of [her]107-valancy class]582-the other little girls of her class were playing a game in which [you]583-you must be chosen by [a boy]584-a boy as [[his]584-a boy partner]585-his partner before [you]583-you could play . [Nobody]348-nobody had chosen [Valancy]107-valancy — little , pale , black - haired [Valancy]107-valancy , with [her]107-valancy prim , long - sleeved apron and odd , slanted eyes .

“ Oh , ”[587-a pretty little girl] said [a pretty little girl]587-a pretty little girl to [her]107-valancy , “ [I]587-a pretty little girl ’m so sorry for [you]107-valancy . [You]107-valancy have n’t got [a beau]2238-a beau . ”[587-a pretty little girl]

[Valancy]107-valancy had said defiantly , as [she]107-valancy continued to say for twenty years , “ [I]107-valancy do n’t want [a beau]2238-a beau . ”[107-valancy] But this afternoon [Valancy]107-valancy once and for all stopped saying that .

“ [I]107-valancy ’m going to be honest with [myself]107-valancy anyhow , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy thought savagely . “ [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin ’s riddles hurt [me]107-valancy because they are true . [I]107-valancy do want to be married . [I]107-valancy want [a house of [my]107-valancy own]2232-a house of my own — [I]107-valancy want [a husband]2241-a husband of [my]107-valancy own — [I]107-valancy want [sweet , little fat babies]2242-sweet , little fat babies of [my]107-valancy own — ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy stopped suddenly aghast at [her]107-valancy own recklessness . [She]107-valancy felt sure that [Rev. Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling , who passed [her]107-valancy at this moment , read [her]107-valancy thoughts and disapproved of them thoroughly . [Valancy]107-valancy was afraid of [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling — had been afraid of [him]131-dr. stalling ever since the Sunday , twenty - three years before , when [he]131-dr. stalling had first come to [St. Albans ’]17-st. albans ’ . [Valancy]107-valancy had been too late for Sunday School that day and [she]107-valancy had gone into [the church]588-the church timidly and sat in [[their]589-their pew]590-their pew . [No one else]453-no one else was in [the church]588-the church — [nobody]348-nobody except [the new rector]594-the new rector , [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling . [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling stood up in front of the choir door , beckoned to [her]107-valancy , and said sternly , “ [Little boy]2243-little boy , come up here . ”[131-dr. stalling]

[Valancy]107-valancy had stared around [her]107-valancy . There was [no little boy]595-no little boy — there was [no one]515-no one in all [the huge church]597-the huge church but [herself]107-valancy . [This strange man with the blue glasses]598-this strange man with the blue glasses could n’t mean [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy was not [a boy]584-a boy .

“ [Little boy]2243-little boy , ”[131-dr. stalling] repeated [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling , more sternly still , shaking [his]131-dr. stalling forefinger fiercely at [her]107-valancy , “ come up here at once ! ”[131-dr. stalling]

[Valancy]107-valancy arose as if hypnotised and walked up [the aisle]600-the aisle . [She]107-valancy was too terrified to do anything else . What dreadful thing was going to happen to [her]107-valancy ? What had happened to [her]107-valancy ? Had [she]107-valancy actually turned into [a boy]584-a boy ? [She]107-valancy came to a stop in front of [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling . [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling shook [his]131-dr. stalling forefinger — such a long , knuckly forefinger — at [her]107-valancy and said :

“ [Little boy]2243-little boy , take off [your]2243-little boy hat . ”[131-dr. stalling]

[Valancy]107-valancy took off [her]107-valancy hat . [She]107-valancy had a scrawny little pigtail hanging down [her]107-valancy back , but [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling was short - sighted and did not perceive it .

“ [Little boy]2243-little boy , go back to [your]2243-little boy seat and always take off [your]2243-little boy hat in [church]501-church . Remember ! ”[131-dr. stalling]

[Valancy]107-valancy went back to [her]107-valancy seat carrying [her]107-valancy hat like [an automaton]602-an automaton . Presently [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother came in .

“ Doss , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Stirling]99-mrs. frederick , “ what do [you]2243-little boy mean by taking off [your]2243-little boy hat ? Put it on instantly ! ”[99-mrs. frederick]

[Valancy]107-valancy put it on instantly . [She]107-valancy was cold with fear lest [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling should immediately summon [her]107-valancy up front again . [She]107-valancy would have to go , of course — it never occurred to [her]107-valancy that [one]332-one could disobey [the rector]605-the rector — and [the church]588-the church was full of [people]2198-people now . Oh , what would [she]107-valancy do if that horrible , stabbing forefinger were shaken at [her]107-valancy again before [all those people]608-all those people ? [Valancy]107-valancy sat through the whole service in an agony of dread and was sick for a week afterwards . [Nobody]348-nobody knew why — [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick again bemoaned [herself]99-mrs. frederick of [[her]99-mrs. frederick delicate child]610-her delicate child .

[Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling found out [his]131-dr. stalling mistake and laughed over it to [Valancy]107-valancy — who did not laugh . [She]107-valancy never got over [her]107-valancy dread of [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling . And now to be caught by [him]131-dr. stalling on [the street corner]611-the street corner , thinking such things !

[Valancy]107-valancy got [her]107-valancy John Foster book — Magic of Wings . “ [His]92-dr. trent latest — all about birds , ”[116-miss clarkson] said [Miss Clarkson]116-miss clarkson . [She]116-miss clarkson had almost decided that [she]116-miss clarkson would go [home]612-home , instead of going to see [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent . [Her]116-miss clarkson courage had failed [her]116-miss clarkson . [She]116-miss clarkson was afraid of offending [Uncle James]107-valancy — afraid of angering [[her]116-miss clarkson mother]343-her mother — afraid of facing [gruff , shaggy - browed old [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent , who would probably tell [her]116-miss clarkson , as [he]92-dr. trent had told [Cousin Gladys]92-dr. trent , that [her]116-miss clarkson trouble was entirely imaginary and that [she]116-miss clarkson only had it because [she]116-miss clarkson liked to have it]92-dr. trent . No , [she]116-miss clarkson would not go ; [she]116-miss clarkson would get a bottle of Redfern ’s Purple Pills instead . Redfern ’s Purple Pills were the standard medicine of [the Stirling clan]461-the stirling clan . Had [they]615-they not cured [Second Cousin Geraldine]132-second cousin geraldine when [five doctors]616-five doctors had given [her]132-second cousin geraldine up ? [Valancy]107-valancy always felt very sceptical concerning the virtues of the Purple Pills ; but there might be something in them ; and it was easier to take them than to face [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent alone . [She]107-valancy would glance over the magazines in [the reading - room]617-the reading - room a few minutes and then go [home]612-home .

[Valancy]107-valancy tried to read a story , but it made [her]116-miss clarkson furious . On every page was a picture of [the heroine]619-the heroine surrounded by [adoring men]620-adoring men . And here was [she]116-miss clarkson , [Valancy Stirling]107-valancy , who could not get a solitary beau ! [Valancy]107-valancy slammed the magazine shut ; [she]116-miss clarkson opened Magic of Wings . [Her]116-miss clarkson eyes fell on the paragraph that changed [her]116-miss clarkson life .

“ Fear is the original sin , ”[114-john foster] wrote [John Foster]114-john foster . “ Almost all the evil in [the world]321-the world has its origin in the fact that [some one]359-some one is afraid of something . It is a cold , slimy serpent coiling about [you]2250-you . It is horrible to live with fear ; and it is of all things degrading . ”[114-john foster]

[Valancy]107-valancy shut Magic of Wings and stood up . [She]107-valancy would go and see [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent .

CHAPTER VI

The ordeal was not so dreadful , after all . [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent was as gruff and abrupt as usual , but [he]92-dr. trent did not tell [her]107-valancy ailment was imaginary . After [he]92-dr. trent had listened to [her]107-valancy symptoms and asked a few questions and made a quick examination , [he]92-dr. trent sat for a moment looking at [her]107-valancy quite intently . [Valancy]107-valancy thought [he]92-dr. trent looked as if [he]92-dr. trent were sorry for [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy caught [her]107-valancy breath for a moment . Was the trouble serious ? Oh , it could n’t be , surely — it really had n’t bothered [her]107-valancy much — only lately it had got a little worse .

[Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent opened [his]92-dr. trent mouth — but before [he]92-dr. trent could speak the telephone at [his]92-dr. trent elbow rang sharply . [He]92-dr. trent picked up the receiver . [Valancy]107-valancy , watching [him]92-dr. trent , saw [his]92-dr. trent face change suddenly as [he]92-dr. trent listened , “ ‘ [Lo]133-lo — yes — yes — what?—yes — yes”—a[92-dr. trent] brief interval—“My God ! ”[92-dr. trent]

[Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent dropped the receiver , dashed out of [the room]472-the room and [upstairs]2228-upstairs without even a glance at [Valancy]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy heard [him]92-dr. trent rushing madly about overhead , barking out a few remarks to [somebody]623-somebody — presumably [[his]92-dr. trent housekeeper]624-his housekeeper . Then [he]92-dr. trent came tearing [downstairs]365-downstairs with a club bag in [his]92-dr. trent hand , snatched [his]92-dr. trent hat and coat from the rack , jerked open the street door and rushed down [the street]537-the street in the direction of [the station]627-the station .

[Valancy]107-valancy sat alone in [the little office]628-the little office , feeling more absolutely foolish than [she]107-valancy had ever felt before in [her]107-valancy life . Foolish — and humiliated . So this was all that had come of [her]107-valancy heroic determination to live up to [John Foster]114-john foster and cast fear aside . Not only was [she]107-valancy a failure as [a relative]629-a relative and non - existent as [a sweetheart]630-a sweetheart or [friend]631-friend , but [she]107-valancy was not even of any importance as [a patient]632-a patient . [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent had forgotten [her]107-valancy very presence in [his]92-dr. trent excitement over whatever message had come by the telephone . [She]107-valancy had gained nothing by ignoring [Uncle James]107-valancy and flying in the face of family tradition .

For a moment [she]107-valancy was afraid [she]107-valancy was going to cry . It was all so — ridiculous . Then [she]107-valancy heard [[Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s housekeeper]633-dr. trent ’s housekeeper coming down the stairs . [Valancy]107-valancy rose and went to [the office]634-the office door .

“ [The doctor]2251-the doctor forgot all about [me]107-valancy , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy said with a twisted smile .

“ Well , that ’s too bad , ”[134-mrs. patterson] said [Mrs. Patterson]134-mrs. patterson sympathetically . “ But it was n’t much wonder , [poor man]2252-poor man . That was a telegram [they]2253-they ’ phoned over from [the Port]2254-the port . [[His]92-dr. trent son]2255-his son has been terribly injured in an auto accident in [Montreal]4-montreal . [The doctor]2251-the doctor had just ten minutes to catch [the train]2257-the train . [I]134-mrs. patterson do n’t know what [he]2251-the doctor ’ll do if anything happens to [Ned]135-edward beck — [he]2251-the doctor ’s just bound up in [the boy]2258-the boy . [You]107-valancy ’ll have to come again , [Miss Stirling]107-valancy . [I]134-mrs. patterson hope it ’s nothing serious . ”[134-mrs. patterson]

“ Oh , no , nothing serious , ”[107-valancy] agreed [Valancy]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy felt a little less humiliated . It was no wonder poor [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent had forgotten [her]107-valancy at such a moment . Nevertheless , [she]107-valancy felt very flat and discouraged as [she]107-valancy went down [the street]537-the street .

[Valancy]107-valancy went [home]612-home by [the short - cut of [Lover ’s Lane]18-lover ’s lane]637-the short - cut of lover ’s lane . [She]107-valancy did not often go through [Lover ’s Lane]18-lover ’s lane — but it was getting near supper - time and it would never do to be late . [Lover ’s Lane]18-lover ’s lane wound back of [the village]638-the village , under [great elms and maples]639-great elms and maples , and deserved [its]18-lover ’s lane name . It was hard to go [there]448-there at any time and not find [some canoodling couple]641-some canoodling couple — or [young girls in pairs]642-young girls in pairs , arms intertwined , earnestly talking over [their]642-young girls in pairs little secrets . [Valancy]107-valancy did n’t know which made [her]107-valancy feel more self - conscious and uncomfortable .

This evening [she]107-valancy encountered both . [She]107-valancy met [Connie Hale]136-connie hale and [Kate Bayley]137-kate bayley , in new pink organdy dresses with flowers stuck coquettishly in [their]642-young girls in pairs glossy , bare hair . [Valancy]107-valancy had never had a pink dress or worn flowers in [her]107-valancy hair . Then [she]107-valancy passed [a young couple [she]107-valancy did n’t know , dandering along , oblivious to everything but [themselves]643-a young couple she did n’t know , dandering along , oblivious to everything but themselves]643-a young couple she did n’t know , dandering along , oblivious to everything but themselves . [The young man]644-the young man ’s arm was around [the girl]645-the girl ’s waist quite shamelessly . [Valancy]107-valancy had never walked with [a man]335-a man ’s arm about [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy felt that [she]107-valancy ought to be shocked — [they]643-a young couple she did n’t know , dandering along , oblivious to everything but themselves might leave that sort of thing for the screening twilight , at least — but [she]107-valancy was n’t shocked . In another flash of desperate , stark honesty [she]107-valancy owned to [herself]107-valancy that [she]107-valancy was merely envious .
