When [she]107-valancy passed [them]643-a young couple she did n’t know , dandering along , oblivious to everything but themselves [she]107-valancy felt quite sure [they]643-a young couple she did n’t know , dandering along , oblivious to everything but themselves were laughing at [her]107-valancy — pitying [her—“there]107-valancy ’s [that queer little old maid , [Valancy Stirling]107-valancy]2259-that queer little old maid , valancy stirling . [They]643-a young couple she did n’t know , dandering along , oblivious to everything but themselves say [she]107-valancy never had a beau in [her]107-valancy whole life”—Valancy[643-a young couple she did n’t know , dandering along , oblivious to everything but themselves] fairly ran to get out of [Lover ’s Lane]18-lover ’s lane . Never had [she]107-valancy felt so utterly colourless and skinny and insignificant .

Just where [Lover ’s Lane]18-lover ’s lane debouched on [the street]537-the street , [an old car]648-an old car was parked . [Valancy]107-valancy knew [that car]649-that car well — by sound , at least — and [everybody in [Deerwood]5-deerwood]650-everybody in deerwood knew it . This was before the phrase “ tin [Lizzie]138-betty ”[650-everybody in deerwood] had come into circulation — in [Deerwood]5-deerwood , at least ; but if it had been known , [this car]651-this car was the tinniest of [Lizzies]139-lizzies — though it was not [a Ford]19-a ford but an old Grey Slosson . Nothing more battered and disreputable could be imagined .

It was [[Barney Snaith]140-barney ’s car]652-barney snaith ’s car and [Barney]140-barney [himself]140-barney was just scrambling up from under [it]652-barney snaith ’s car , in overalls plastered with mud . [Valancy]107-valancy gave [him]653-he a swift , furtive look as [she]107-valancy hurried by . This was only the second time [she]107-valancy had ever seen the notorious [Barney Snaith]140-barney , though [she]107-valancy had heard enough about [him]653-he in the five years that [he]653-he had been living “ up back ”[653-he] in [Muskoka]16-muskoka . The first time had been nearly a year ago , on [the Muskoka road]654-the muskoka road . [He]653-he had been crawling out from under [[his]653-he car]655-his car then , too , and [he]653-he had given [her]107-valancy a cheerful grin as [she]107-valancy went by — a little , whimsical grin that gave [him]653-he the look of [an amused gnome]656-an amused gnome . [He]653-he did n’t look bad — [she]107-valancy did n’t believe [he]653-he was bad , in spite of the wild yarns that were always being told of [him]653-he . Of course [he]653-he went tearing in [that terrible old [Grey Slosson]210-lady jane through [Deerwood]5-deerwood]657-that terrible old grey slosson through deerwood at hours when [all decent people]658-all decent people were in bed — often with [old “ Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel , ”[141-roaring abel] who made the night hideous with [his]653-he howls—“both of [them]658-all decent people dead drunk , [[my]141-roaring abel dear]2187-my dear . ”[141-roaring abel] And [every one]418-every one knew that [he]653-he was [an escaped convict]660-an escaped convict and [a defaulting bank clerk]661-a defaulting bank clerk and [a murderer in hiding]662-a murderer in hiding and [an infidel]663-an infidel and [an illegitimate son of [old Roaring Abel Gay]141-roaring abel]664-an illegitimate son of old roaring abel gay and [the father of [[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s illegitimate grandchild]666-roaring abel ’s illegitimate grandchild]665-the father of roaring abel ’s illegitimate grandchild and [a counterfeiter]667-a counterfeiter and [a forger]668-a forger and a few other awful things . But still [Valancy]107-valancy did n’t believe [he]653-he was bad . Nobody with a smile like that could be bad , no matter what [he]653-he had done .

It was that night [the Prince of [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle]669-the prince of the blue castle changed from [a being of grim jaw and hair with a dash of premature grey]671-a being of grim jaw and hair with a dash of premature grey to [a rakish individual with overlong , tawny hair , dashed with red , dark - brown eyes]672-a rakish individual with overlong , tawny hair , dashed with red , dark - brown eyes , and ears that stuck out just enough to give [him]653-he an alert look but not enough to be called flying jibs . But [he]653-he still retained something a little grim about the jaw .

[Barney Snaith]140-barney looked even more disreputable than usual just now . It was very evident that [he]653-he had n’t shaved for days , and [his]653-he hands and arms , bare to the shoulders , were black with grease . But [he]653-he was whistling gleefully to [himself]653-he and [he]653-he seemed so happy that [Valancy]107-valancy envied [him]653-he . [She]107-valancy envied [him]653-he [his]653-he light - heartedness and [his]653-he irresponsibility and [[his]653-he mysterious little cabin up on [an island in [Lake Mistawis]21-lake mistawis]674-an island in lake mistawis]673-his mysterious little cabin up on an island in lake mistawis — even [[his]653-he rackety old Grey [Slosson]22-slosson]675-his rackety old grey slosson . Neither [he]653-he nor [[his]653-he car]655-his car had to be respectable and live up to traditions . When [he]653-he rattled past [her]107-valancy a few minutes later , bareheaded , leaning back in [his]653-he Lizzie at a raffish angle , [his]653-he longish hair blowing in the wind , a villainous - looking old black pipe in [his]653-he mouth , [she]107-valancy envied [him]653-he again . [Men]2185-men had the best of it , no doubt about that . [This outlaw]678-this outlaw was happy , whatever [he]653-he was or was n’t . [She]107-valancy , [Valancy Stirling]107-valancy , respectable , well - behaved to the last degree , was unhappy and had always been unhappy . So there [you]679-you were .

[Valancy]107-valancy was just in time for supper . The sun had clouded over , and a dismal , drizzling rain was falling again . [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles had the neuralgia . [Valancy]107-valancy had to do the family darning and there was no time for [Magic of Wings]142-magic of wings .

“ Ca n’t the darning wait till tomorrow ? ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy pleaded .

“ Tomorrow will bring [its]2261-its own duties , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick inexorably .

[Valancy]107-valancy darned all the evening and listened to [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles talking the eternal , niggling gossip of [the clan]680-the clan , as [they]681-they knitted drearily at interminable black stockings . [They]681-they discussed [Second Cousin Lilian]143-second cousin lilian ’s approaching wedding in all its bearings . On the whole , [they]681-they approved . [Second Cousin Lilian]143-second cousin lilian was doing well for [herself]143-second cousin lilian .

“ Though [she]143-second cousin lilian has n’t hurried , ”[97-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles . “ [She]143-second cousin lilian must be twenty - five . ”[97-cousin stickles]

“ There have not — fortunately — been [many old maids in [our]2263-our connection]2262-many old maids in our connection , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick bitterly .

[Valancy]107-valancy flinched . [She]107-valancy had run the darning needle into [her]107-valancy finger .

[Third Cousin Aaron Gray]144-third cousin aaron gray had been scratched by a cat and had blood - poisoning in [his]144-third cousin aaron gray finger . “ [Cats]145-cats are most dangerous animals , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick . “ [I]99-mrs. frederick would never have a cat about [the house]364-the house . ”[99-mrs. frederick]

[She]99-mrs. frederick glared significantly at [Valancy]107-valancy through [her]99-mrs. frederick terrible glasses . Once , five years ago , [Valancy]107-valancy had asked if [she]107-valancy might have a cat . [She]107-valancy had never referred to it since , but [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick still suspected [her]107-valancy of harbouring the unlawful desire in [her]107-valancy heart of hearts .

Once [Valancy]107-valancy sneezed . Now , in the Stirling code , it was very bad form to sneeze in public .

“ [You]2265-your can always repress a sneeze by pressing [your]2265-your finger on [your]2265-your upper lip , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick rebukingly .

Half - past nine o’clock and so , as [Mr. Pepys]146-mr. pepys would say , to bed . But First [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles ’ neuralgic back must be rubbed with [Redfern]140-barney ’s Liniment . [Valancy]107-valancy did that . [Valancy]107-valancy always had to do it . [She]107-valancy hated the smell of [Redfern]140-barney ’s Liniment — [she]107-valancy hated the smug , beaming , portly , be - whiskered , be - spectacled picture of [Dr. Redfern]119-dr. redfern on the bottle . [Her]107-valancy fingers smelled of the horrible stuff after [she]107-valancy got into bed , in spite of all the scrubbing [she]107-valancy gave [them]682-them .

[Valancy]107-valancy ’s day of destiny had come and gone . [She]107-valancy ended it as [she]107-valancy had begun it , in tears .

CHAPTER VII

There was a rosebush on [the little Stirling lawn]683-the little stirling lawn , growing beside the gate . It was called “ [Doss ’s rosebush]2266-doss ’s rosebush . ”[110-cousin georgiana] [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana had given it to [Valancy]107-valancy five years ago and [Valancy]107-valancy had planted it joyfully . [She]107-valancy loved roses . But — of course — the rosebush never bloomed . That was [her]107-valancy luck . [Valancy]107-valancy did everything [she]107-valancy could think of and took the advice of [everybody in the clan]684-everybody in the clan , but still the rosebush would not bloom . [It]685-it throve and grew luxuriantly , with great leafy branches untouched of rust or spider ; but not even a bud had ever appeared on it . [Valancy]107-valancy , looking at it two days after [her]107-valancy birthday , was filled with a sudden , overwhelming hatred for it . The thing would n’t bloom : very well , then , [she]107-valancy would cut it down . [She]107-valancy marched to [the tool - room in [the barn]687-the barn]686-the tool - room in the barn for [her]107-valancy garden knife and [she]107-valancy went at the rosebush viciously . A few minutes later [horrified Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick came out to [the verandah]688-the verandah and beheld [[her]99-mrs. frederick daughter]506-her daughter slashing insanely among the rosebush boughs . Half of them were already strewn on the walk . The bush looked sadly dismantled .

“ [Doss]106-doss , what on earth are [you]106-doss doing ? Have [you]106-doss gone crazy ? ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ No , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy meant to say it defiantly , but habit was too strong for [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy said it deprecatingly . “ [I]107-valancy — [I]107-valancy just made up [my]107-valancy mind to cut this bush down . It is no good . It never blooms — never will bloom . ”[107-valancy]

“ That is no reason for destroying it , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick sternly . “ It was a beautiful bush and quite ornamental . [You]107-valancy have made a sorry - looking thing of it . ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ Rose trees should bloom , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy a little obstinately .

“ Do n’t argue with [me]99-mrs. frederick , [Doss]106-doss . Clear up that mess and leave the bush alone . [I]99-mrs. frederick do n’t know what [Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana will say when [she]110-cousin georgiana sees how [you]106-doss have hacked it to pieces . Really , [I]99-mrs. frederick ’m surprised at [you]106-doss . And to do it without consulting [me]99-mrs. frederick ! ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ The bush is mine , ”[107-valancy] muttered [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ What ’s that ? What did [you]106-doss say , [Doss]106-doss ? ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ [I]107-valancy only said the bush was mine , ”[107-valancy] repeated [Valancy]107-valancy humbly .

[Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick turned without a word and marched back into [the house]364-the house . The mischief was done now . [Valancy]107-valancy knew [she]107-valancy had offended [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother deeply and would not be spoken to or noticed in any way for two or three days . [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles would see to [Valancy]107-valancy ’s bringing - up but [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick would preserve the stony silence of outraged majesty .

[Valancy]107-valancy sighed and put away [her]107-valancy garden knife , hanging it precisely on its precise nail in the [tool - shop]692-tool - shop . [She]107-valancy cleared away the severed branches and swept up the leaves . [Her]107-valancy lips twitched as [she]107-valancy looked at the straggling bush . [It]693-it had an odd resemblance to [its]693-it shaken , scrawny donor , [little Cousin Georgiana [herself]694-little cousin georgiana herself]694-little cousin georgiana herself .

“ [I]107-valancy certainly have made an awful - looking thing of it , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy .

But [she]107-valancy did not feel repentant — only sorry [she]107-valancy had offended [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother . Things would be so uncomfortable until [she]107-valancy was forgiven . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick was [one of [those women who can make [their]697-those women who can make their anger felt all over a house anger felt all over [a house]698-a house]697-those women who can make their anger felt all over a house]696-one of those women who can make their anger felt all over a house . Walls and doors are no protection from it .

“ [You]107-valancy ’d better go [uptown]532-uptown and git the mail , ”[97-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles , when [Valancy]107-valancy went in . “ [I]97-cousin stickles ca n’t go — [I]97-cousin stickles feel all sorter peaky and piny this spring . [I]97-cousin stickles want [you]107-valancy to stop at [the drugstore]2268-the drugstore and git [me]97-cousin stickles a bottle of Redfern ’s Blood Bitters . There ’s nothing like [Redfern ’s Bitters]23-redfern ’s bitters for building a body up . [Cousin James]147-cousin james says [the Purple Pills]162-purple pills are the best , but [I]97-cousin stickles know better . [[My]97-cousin stickles poor dear husband]2269-my poor dear husband took [Redfern]119-dr. redfern ’s Bitters right up to the day [he]2269-my poor dear husband died . Do n’t let [them]162-purple pills charge [you]107-valancy more’n ninety cents . [I]97-cousin stickles kin git it for that at [the Port]2254-the port . And what have [you]107-valancy been saying to [[your]107-valancy poor mother]2271-your poor mother ? Do [you]107-valancy ever stop to think , [Doss]106-doss , that [you]107-valancy kin only have [one mother]2272-one mother ? ”[97-cousin stickles]

“ One is enough for [me]107-valancy , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy undutifully , as [she]107-valancy went [uptown]532-uptown .

[She]107-valancy got [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles ’ bottle of bitters and then [she]107-valancy went to [the post - office]700-the post - office and asked for [her]107-valancy mail at the General Delivery . [[Her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother did not have a box . [They]702-they got too little mail to bother with it . [Valancy]107-valancy did not expect any mail , except the Christian Times , which was the only paper [they]702-they took . [They]702-they hardly ever got any letters . But [Valancy]107-valancy rather liked to stand in [the office]634-the office and watch [Mr. Carewe]148-mr. carewe , [the grey - bearded , Santa - Clausy old clerk]704-the grey - bearded , santa - clausy old clerk , handing out letters to [the lucky people who did get them]705-the lucky people who did get them . [He]148-mr. carewe did it with such a detached , impersonal , Jove - like air , as if it did not matter in the least to [him]148-mr. carewe what supernal joys or shattering horrors might be in those letters for [the people to whom [they]702-they were addressed]706-the people to whom they were addressed . Letters had a fascination for [Valancy]107-valancy , perhaps because [she]107-valancy so seldom got any . In [her]107-valancy Blue Castle exciting epistles , bound with silk and sealed with crimson , were always being brought to [her]107-valancy by pages in livery of gold and blue , but in real life [her]107-valancy only letters were occasional perfunctory notes from [relatives]357-relatives or an advertising circular .

Consequently [she]107-valancy was immensely surprised when [Mr. Carewe]148-mr. carewe , looking even more [Jovian]149-jovian than usual , poked a letter out to [her]107-valancy . Yes , it was addressed to [her]107-valancy plainly , in a fierce , black hand : “ [Miss Valancy Stirling]107-valancy , [Elm Street]7-elm street , [Deerwood”—and]25-deerwood”—and[148-mr. carewe] the postmark was [Montreal]4-montreal . [Valancy]107-valancy picked it up with a little quickening of [her]107-valancy breath . [Montreal]4-montreal ! It must be from [Doctor Trent]150-doctor trent . [He]150-doctor trent had remembered [her]107-valancy , after all .

[Valancy]107-valancy met [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin coming in as [she]107-valancy was going out and was glad the letter was safely in [her]107-valancy bag .

“ What , ”[108-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin , “ is the difference between a donkey and a postage - stamp ? ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ [I]107-valancy do n’t know . What ? ”[107-valancy] answered [Valancy]107-valancy dutifully .

“ [One]332-one [you]107-valancy lick with a stick and the other [you]107-valancy stick with a lick . Ha , ha ! ”[108-uncle benjamin]

[Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin passed in , tremendously pleased with [himself]108-uncle benjamin .

[Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles pounced on the Times when [Valancy]107-valancy got [home]612-home , but it did not occur to [her]107-valancy to ask if there were any letters . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick would have asked it , but [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick ’s lips at present were sealed . [Valancy]107-valancy was glad of this . If [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother had asked if there were any letters [Valancy]107-valancy would have had to admit there was . Then [she]107-valancy would have had to let [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles read the letter and all would be discovered .

[Her]107-valancy heart acted strangely on the way [upstairs]2228-upstairs , and [she]107-valancy sat down by [her]107-valancy window for a few minutes before opening [her]107-valancy letter . [She]107-valancy felt very guilty and deceitful . [She]107-valancy had never before kept a letter secret from [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother . Every letter [she]107-valancy had ever written or received had been read by [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick . That had never mattered . [Valancy]107-valancy had never had anything to hide . But this did matter . [She]107-valancy could not have [any one]444-any one see this letter . But [her]107-valancy fingers trembled with a consciousness of wickedness and unfilial conduct as [she]107-valancy opened it — trembled a little , too , perhaps , with apprehension . [She]107-valancy felt quite sure there was nothing seriously wrong with [her]107-valancy heart but — [one]332-one never knew .

[Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s letter was like [himself]92-dr. trent — blunt , abrupt , concise , wasting no words . [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent never beat about the bush . “ [Dear Miss Sterling”—and]151-dear miss sterling”—and[92-dr. trent] then a page of black , positive writing . [Valancy]107-valancy seemed to read it at a glance ; [she]107-valancy dropped it on [her]107-valancy lap , [her]107-valancy face ghost - white .

[Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent told [her]107-valancy that [she]107-valancy had a very dangerous and fatal form of heart disease — angina pectoris — evidently complicated with an aneurism — whatever that was — and in the last stages . [He]92-dr. trent said , without mincing matters , that nothing could be done for [her]107-valancy . If [she]107-valancy took great care of [herself]107-valancy [she]107-valancy might live a year — but [she]107-valancy might also die at any moment — [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent never troubled [himself]92-dr. trent about euphemisms . [She]107-valancy must be careful to avoid all excitement and all severe muscular efforts . [She]107-valancy must eat and drink moderately , [she]107-valancy must never run , [she]107-valancy must go [upstairs]2228-upstairs and uphill with great care . Any sudden jolt or shock might be fatal . [She]107-valancy was to get the prescription [he]92-dr. trent enclosed filled and carry it with [her]107-valancy always , taking a dose whenever [her]107-valancy attacks came on . And [he]92-dr. trent was [hers]107-valancy truly , [H. B. Trent]152-h. b. trent .

[Valancy]107-valancy sat for a long while by [her]107-valancy window . Outside was a world drowned in the light of a spring afternoon — skies entrancingly blue , winds perfumed and free , lovely , soft , blue hazes at the end of [every street]716-every street . Over at [the railway station]717-the railway station [a group of young girls]718-a group of young girls was waiting for [a train]719-a train ; [she]107-valancy heard [their]718-a group of young girls gay laughter as [they]718-a group of young girls chattered and joked . [The train]2257-the train roared in and roared out again . But none of these things had any reality . Nothing had any reality except the fact that [she]107-valancy had only another year to live .

When [she]107-valancy was tired of sitting at the window [she]107-valancy went over and lay down on [her]107-valancy bed , staring at the cracked , discoloured ceiling . The curious numbness that follows on a staggering blow possessed [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy did not feel anything except a boundless surprise and incredulity — behind which was the conviction that [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent knew [his]92-dr. trent business and that [she]107-valancy , [Valancy Stirling]107-valancy , who had never lived , was about to die .

When the gong rang for supper [Valancy]107-valancy got up and went [downstairs]365-downstairs mechanically , from force of habit . [She]107-valancy wondered that [she]107-valancy had been let alone so long . But of course [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother would not pay any attention to [her]107-valancy just now . [Valancy]107-valancy was thankful for this . [She]107-valancy thought the quarrel over the rosebush had been really , as [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick [herself]99-mrs. frederick might have said , Providential . [She]107-valancy could not eat anything , but both [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles thought this was because [she]107-valancy was deservedly unhappy over [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother ’s attitude , and [her]107-valancy lack of appetite was not commented on . [Valancy]107-valancy forced [herself]107-valancy to swallow a cup of tea and then sat and watched [the others]724-the others eat , with an odd feeling that years had passed since [she]107-valancy had sat with [them]724-the others at the dinner - table . [She]107-valancy found [herself]107-valancy smiling inwardly to think what a commotion [she]107-valancy could make if [she]107-valancy chose . Let [her]107-valancy merely tell [them]724-the others what was in [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s letter and there would be as much fuss made as if — [Valancy]107-valancy thought bitterly — [they]724-the others really cared two straws about [her]107-valancy .

“ [[Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s housekeeper]633-dr. trent ’s housekeeper got word from [him]92-dr. trent today , ”[97-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles , so suddenly that [Valancy]107-valancy jumped guiltily . Was there anything in thought waves ? “ [Mrs. Judd]153-mrs. judd was talking to [[her]153-mrs. judd uptown]2275-her uptown . [They]2275-her uptown think [[his]92-dr. trent son]2255-his son will recover , but [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent wrote that if [he]92-dr. trent did [he]92-dr. trent was going to take [him]2255-his son abroad as soon as [he]92-dr. trent was able to travel and would n’t be back [here]2277-here for a year at least . ”[97-cousin stickles]

“ That will not matter much to [us]2278-us , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick majestically . “ [He]92-dr. trent is not [[our]2278-us doctor]2279-our doctor . [I]725-i would not”—here[725-i] [she]725-i looked or seemed to look accusingly right through Valancy—“have [him]92-dr. trent to doctor a sick cat . ”[97-cousin stickles]

“ May [I]107-valancy go [upstairs]2228-upstairs and lie down ? ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy faintly . “ [I]107-valancy — [I]107-valancy have a headache . ”[107-valancy]

“ What has given [you]107-valancy a headache ? ”[97-cousin stickles] asked [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles , since [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick would not . The question had to be asked . [Valancy]107-valancy could not be allowed to have headaches without interference .

“ [You]107-valancy ai n’t in the habit of having headaches . [I]97-cousin stickles hope [you]107-valancy ’re not taking [the mumps]2281-the mumps . Here , try a spoonful of vinegar . ”[97-cousin stickles]

“ Piffle ! ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy rudely , getting up from the table . [She]107-valancy did not care just then if [she]107-valancy were rude . [She]107-valancy had had to be so polite all [her]107-valancy life .

If it had been possible for [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles to turn pale [she]107-valancy would have . As it was not , [she]107-valancy turned yellower .

“ Are [you]107-valancy sure [you]107-valancy ai n’t feverish , Doss ? [You]107-valancy sound like it . [You]107-valancy go and get right into bed , ”[97-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles , thoroughly alarmed , “ and [I]97-cousin stickles ’ll come up and rub [your]107-valancy forehead and the back of [your]107-valancy neck with Redfern ’s Liniment . ”[97-cousin stickles]

[Valancy]107-valancy had reached the door , but [she]107-valancy turned . “ [I]107-valancy wo n’t be rubbed with Redfern ’s Liniment ! ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy said .

[Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles stared and gasped . “ What — what do [you]107-valancy mean ? ”[97-cousin stickles]

“ [I]107-valancy said [I]107-valancy would n’t be rubbed with Redfern ’s Liniment , ”[107-valancy] repeated [Valancy]107-valancy . “ Horrid , sticky stuff ! And it has the vilest smell of any liniment [I]107-valancy ever saw . It ’s no good . [I]107-valancy want to be left alone , that ’s all . ”[107-valancy]

[Valancy]107-valancy went out , leaving [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles aghast .

“ [She]2282-she ’s feverish — [she]2282-she must be feverish , ”[97-cousin stickles] ejaculated [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles .

[Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick went on eating [her]99-mrs. frederick supper . It did not matter whether [Valancy]107-valancy was or was not feverish . [Valancy]107-valancy had been guilty of impertinence to [her]107-valancy .

[CHAPTER VIII

Valancy]154-chapter viii valancy did not sleep that night . [She]107-valancy lay awake all through the long dark hours — thinking — thinking . [She]107-valancy made a discovery that surprised [her]107-valancy : [she]107-valancy , who had been afraid of almost everything in life , was not afraid of death . It did not seem in the least terrible to [her]107-valancy . And [she]107-valancy need not now be afraid of anything else . Why had [she]107-valancy been afraid of things ? Because of life . Afraid of [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin because of the menace of poverty in old age . But now [she]107-valancy would never be old — neglected — tolerated . Afraid of being [an old maid]337-an old maid all [her]107-valancy life . But now [she]107-valancy would not be [an old maid]337-an old maid very long . Afraid of offending [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother and [[her]343-her mother clan]331-her clan because [she]107-valancy had to live with and among [them]331-her clan and could n’t live peaceably if [she]107-valancy did n’t give in to [them]331-her clan . But now [she]107-valancy had n’t . [Valancy]107-valancy felt a curious freedom .

But [she]107-valancy was still horribly afraid of one thing — the fuss [the whole jamfry of [them]331-her clan]730-the whole jamfry of them would make when [she]107-valancy told [them]331-her clan . [Valancy]107-valancy shuddered at the thought of it . [She]107-valancy could n’t endure it . Oh , [she]107-valancy knew so well how it would be . First there would be indignation — yes , indignation on the part of [Uncle James]107-valancy because [she]107-valancy had gone to [a doctor]446-a doctor — [any doctor]732-any doctor — without consulting [HIM]446-a doctor . Indignation on the part of [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother for being so sly and deceitful—“to [[your]2283-your own mother]2284-your own mother , [Doss]106-doss . ”[343-her mother] Indignation on the part of [the whole clan]483-the whole clan because [she]107-valancy had not gone to [Dr. Marsh]117-dr. marsh .

Then would come the solicitude . [She]107-valancy would be taken to [Dr. Marsh]117-dr. marsh , and when [Dr. Marsh]117-dr. marsh confirmed [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s diagnosis [she]107-valancy would be taken to [specialists in [Toronto]26-toronto and [Montreal]4-montreal]735-specialists in toronto and montreal . [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin would foot the bill with a splendid gesture of munificence in thus assisting [the widow]736-the widow and [orphan]737-orphan , and talk forever after of the shocking fees [specialists]738-specialists charged for looking wise and saying [they]738-specialists could n’t do anything . And when [the specialists]739-the specialists could do nothing for [her]107-valancy [Uncle James]107-valancy would insist on [her]107-valancy taking Purple Pills—“I’ve known [them]738-specialists to effect a cure when [all the doctors]2285-all the doctors had given up”—and[107-valancy] [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother would insist on [Redfern]119-dr. redfern ’s Blood Bitters , and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles would insist on rubbing [her]107-valancy over the heart every night with [Redfern]119-dr. redfern ’s Liniment on the grounds that it might do good and could n’t do harm ; and [everybody else]741-everybody else would have some pet dope for [her]107-valancy to take . [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling would come to [her]107-valancy and say solemnly , “ [You]107-valancy are very ill . Are [you]107-valancy prepared for what may be before [you?”—almost]2286-you?”—almost[131-dr. stalling] as if [he]131-dr. stalling were going to shake [his]131-dr. stalling forefinger at [her]107-valancy , the forefinger that had not grown any shorter or less knobbly with age . And [she]107-valancy would be watched and checked like [a baby]742-a baby and never let do anything or go anywhere alone . Perhaps [she]107-valancy would not even be allowed to sleep alone lest [she]107-valancy die in [her]107-valancy sleep . [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles or [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother would insist on sharing [[her]107-valancy room]372-her room and bed . Yes , undoubtedly [they]745-they would .

It was this last thought that really decided [Valancy]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy could not put up with it and [she]107-valancy would n’t . As the clock in [the hall below]526-the hall below struck twelve [Valancy]107-valancy suddenly and definitely made up [her]107-valancy mind that [she]107-valancy would not tell [anybody]454-anybody . [She]107-valancy had always been told , ever since [she]107-valancy could remember , that [she]107-valancy must hide [her]107-valancy feelings . “ It is not ladylike to have feelings , ”[107-valancy] [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles had once told [her]107-valancy disapprovingly . Well , [she]107-valancy would hide them with a vengeance .

But though [she]107-valancy was not afraid of death [she]107-valancy was not indifferent to it . [She]107-valancy found that [she]107-valancy resented it ; it was not fair that [she]107-valancy should have to die when [she]107-valancy had never lived . Rebellion flamed up in [her]107-valancy soul as the dark hours passed by — not because [she]107-valancy had no future but because [she]107-valancy had no past .

“ [I]107-valancy ’m poor — [I’m]107-valancy ugly — [I’m]107-valancy a failure — and [I]107-valancy ’m near death , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy thought . [She]107-valancy could see [her]107-valancy own obituary notice in the Deerwood Weekly Times , copied into the Port Lawrence Journal . “ A deep gloom was cast over [Deerwood]5-deerwood , etc . , etc . ”—“leaves[107-valancy] a large circle of [friends to mourn , etc . , etc .]748-friends to mourn , etc . , etc . , etc . ”—lies , all lies . Gloom , forsooth ! [Nobody]348-nobody would miss [her]107-valancy . [Her]107-valancy death would not matter a straw to [anybody]454-anybody . Not even [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother loved [her]107-valancy — [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother who had been so disappointed that [she]107-valancy was not [a boy]584-a boy — or at least , [a pretty girl]2292-a pretty girl .[107-valancy]

[Valancy]107-valancy reviewed [her]107-valancy whole life between midnight and the early spring dawn . It was a very drab existence , but here and there an incident loomed out with a significance out of all proportion to its real importance . These incidents were all unpleasant in one way or another . Nothing really pleasant had ever happened to [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ [I]107-valancy ’ve never had one wholly happy hour in [my]107-valancy life — not one , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy thought . “ [I]107-valancy ’ve just been a colourless nonentity . [I]107-valancy remember reading somewhere once that there is an hour in which [a woman]414-a woman might be happy all [her]414-a woman life if [she]414-a woman could but find it . [I]107-valancy ’ve never found [my]107-valancy hour — never , never . And [I]107-valancy never will now . If [I]107-valancy could only have had that hour [I]107-valancy ’d be willing to die . ”[107-valancy]

Those significant incidents kept bobbing up in [her]107-valancy mind like unbidden ghosts , without any sequence of time or place . For instance , that time when , at sixteen , [she]107-valancy had blued a tubful of clothes too deeply . And the time when , at eight , [she]107-valancy had “ stolen ”[108-uncle benjamin] some raspberry jam from [[Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington ’s pantry]749-aunt wellington ’s pantry . [Valancy]107-valancy never heard the last of those two misdemeanours . At almost every clan gathering [they]750-they were raked up against [her]107-valancy as jokes . [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin hardly ever missed re - telling the raspberry jam incident — [he]108-uncle benjamin had been the one to catch [her]107-valancy , [her]107-valancy face all stained and streaked .

“ [I]107-valancy have really done so few bad things that [they]750-they have to keep harping on [the old ones]2294-the old ones , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy . “ Why , [I]107-valancy ’ve never even had a quarrel with [any one]444-any one . [I]107-valancy have n’t [an enemy]2296-an enemy . What a spineless thing [I]107-valancy must be not to have [even one enemy]2297-even one enemy ! ”[107-valancy]

There was that incident of the dust - pile at [school]751-school when [she]107-valancy was seven . [Valancy]107-valancy always recalled it when [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling referred to the text , “ To [him]2298-him that hath shall be given and from [him]2298-him that [hath]2299-hath not shall be taken even that which [he]2298-him hath . ”[131-dr. stalling] [Other people]428-other people might puzzle over that text but it never puzzled [Valancy]107-valancy . The whole relationship between [herself]107-valancy and [Olive]101-olive , dating from the day of the dust - pile , was a commentary on it .

[She]107-valancy had been going to [school]751-school a year , but [Olive]101-olive , who was a year younger , had just begun and had about [her]101-olive all the glamour of “ [a new girl ”]2300-a new girl ”[101-olive] and [an exceedingly pretty girl]754-an exceedingly pretty girl at that . It was at recess and [all the girls , big and little]755-all the girls , big and little , were out on [the road]756-the road in front of [the school]757-the school making dust - piles . The aim of [each girl]758-each girl was to have the biggest pile . [Valancy]107-valancy was good at making dust - piles — there was an art in it — and [she]107-valancy had secret hopes of leading . But [Olive]101-olive , working off by [herself]101-olive , was suddenly discovered to have a larger dust - pile than [anybody]454-anybody . [Valancy]107-valancy felt no jealousy . [Her]101-olive dust - pile was quite big enough to please [her]101-olive . Then [one of [the older girls]761-the older girls]760-one of the older girls had an inspiration .

“ Let ’s put all [our]762-the girls dust on [Olive]101-olive ’s pile and make a tremendous one , ”[760-one of the older girls] [she]760-one of the older girls exclaimed .

A frenzy seemed to seize [the girls]762-the girls . [They]762-the girls swooped down on the dust - piles with pails and shovels and in a few seconds [Olive]101-olive ’s pile was a veritable pyramid . In vain [Valancy]107-valancy , with scrawny , outstretched little arms , tried to protect [hers]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy was ruthlessly swept aside , [her]107-valancy dust - pile scooped up and poured on [Olive]101-olive ’s . [Valancy]107-valancy turned away resolutely and began building another dust - pile . Again [a bigger girl]763-a bigger girl pounced on it . [Valancy]107-valancy stood before it , flushed , indignant , arms outspread .

“ Do n’t take it , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy pleaded . “ Please do n’t take it . ”[107-valancy]

“ But why ? ”[764-the older girl] demanded [the older girl]764-the older girl . “ Why wo n’t [you]107-valancy help to build [Olive]101-olive ’s bigger ? ”[764-the older girl]

“ [I]107-valancy want [my]107-valancy own little dust - pile , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy piteously .

[Her]107-valancy plea went unheeded . While [she]107-valancy argued with [one girl]765-one girl [another]766-another scraped up [her]107-valancy dust - pile . [Valancy]107-valancy turned away , [her]107-valancy heart swelling , [her]107-valancy eyes full of tears .

“ Jealous — [you’re]762-the girls jealous ! ”[762-the girls] said [the girls]762-the girls mockingly .

“ [You]107-valancy were very selfish , ”[343-her mother] said [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother coldly , when [Valancy]107-valancy told [her]343-her mother about it at night . That was the first and last time [Valancy]107-valancy had ever taken any of [her]107-valancy troubles to [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother .

[Valancy]107-valancy was neither jealous nor selfish . It was only that [she]107-valancy wanted a dust - pile of [her]107-valancy own — small or big mattered not . A team of horses came down [the street]537-the street — [Olive]101-olive ’s dust pile was scattered over [the roadway]771-the roadway — the bell rang — [the girls]762-the girls trooped into [school]751-school and had forgotten the whole affair before [they]762-the girls reached [their]762-the girls seats . [Valancy]107-valancy never forgot it . To this day [she]107-valancy resented it in [her]107-valancy secret soul . But was it not symbolical of [her]107-valancy life ?

“ [I]107-valancy ’ve never been able to have [my]107-valancy own dust - pile , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy .

The enormous red moon [she]107-valancy had seen rising right at the end of [the street]537-the street one autumn evening of [her]107-valancy sixth year . [She]107-valancy had been sick and cold with the awful , uncanny horror of it . So near to [her]107-valancy . So big . [She]107-valancy had run in trembling to [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother and [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother had laughed at [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy had gone to bed and hidden [her]107-valancy face under the clothes in terror lest [she]107-valancy might look at the window and see that horrible moon glaring in at [her]107-valancy through it .

[The boy who had tried to kiss [her]107-valancy at a party when [she]107-valancy was fifteen]777-the boy who had tried to kiss her at a party when she was fifteen . [She]107-valancy had not let [him]777-the boy who had tried to kiss her at a party when she was fifteen — [she]107-valancy had evaded [him]777-the boy who had tried to kiss her at a party when she was fifteen and run . [He]777-the boy who had tried to kiss her at a party when she was fifteen was [the only boy who had ever tried to kiss [her]107-valancy]778-the only boy who had ever tried to kiss her . Now , fourteen years later , [Valancy]107-valancy found [herself]107-valancy wishing that [she]107-valancy had let [him]777-the boy who had tried to kiss her at a party when she was fifteen .

The time [she]107-valancy had been made to apologise to [Olive]101-olive for something [she]101-olive had n’t done . [Olive]101-olive had said that [Valancy]107-valancy had pushed [her]101-olive into the mud and spoiled [her]101-olive new shoes on purpose . [Valancy]107-valancy knew [she]107-valancy had n’t . It had been an accident — and even that was n’t [her]107-valancy fault — but [nobody]348-nobody would believe [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy had to apologise — and kiss [Olive]101-olive to “ make up . ”[107-valancy] The injustice of it burned in [her]107-valancy soul tonight .

That summer when [Olive]101-olive had the most beautiful hat , trimmed with creamy yellow net , with a wreath of red roses and little ribbon bows under the chin . [Valancy]107-valancy had wanted a hat like that more than [she]107-valancy had ever wanted anything . [She]107-valancy pleaded for one and had been laughed at — all summer [she]101-olive had to wear [a horrid little brown sailor with elastic that cut behind [her]101-olive ears]780-a horrid little brown sailor with elastic that cut behind her ears . [None of [the girls]762-the girls]781-none of the girls would go around with [her]101-olive because [she]101-olive was so shabby — [nobody]348-nobody but [Olive]101-olive . [People]2198-people had thought [Olive]101-olive so sweet and unselfish .

“ [I]107-valancy was an excellent foil for [her]101-olive , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy . “ Even then [she]101-olive knew that . ”[107-valancy]

[Valancy]107-valancy had tried to win a prize for attendance in [Sunday School]785-sunday school once . But [Olive]101-olive won it . There were so many Sundays [Valancy]107-valancy had to stay [home]612-home because [she]107-valancy had colds . [She]107-valancy had once tried to “ say a piece ”[107-valancy] in [school]751-school one Friday afternoon and had broken down in it . [Olive]101-olive was [a good reciter]788-a good reciter and never got stuck .

The night [she]101-olive had spent in [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence with [Aunt Isabel]109-aunt isabel when [she]101-olive was ten . [Byron Stirling]155-byron was [there]448-there ; from [Montreal]4-montreal , [twelve years old , conceited , clever]790-twelve years old , conceited , clever . At family prayers in the morning [Byron]155-byron had reached across and given [Valancy]107-valancy ’s thin arm such a savage pinch that [she]107-valancy screamed out with pain . After prayers were over [she]107-valancy was summoned to [[Aunt Isabel]109-aunt isabel ’s bar of judgment]791-aunt isabel ’s bar of judgment . But when [she]107-valancy said [Byron]155-byron had pinched [her]107-valancy [Byron]155-byron denied it . [He]155-byron said [she]107-valancy cried out because the kitten scratched [her]107-valancy . [He]155-byron said [she]107-valancy had put the kitten up on [her]107-valancy chair and was playing with it when [she]107-valancy should have been listening to [Uncle David]156-uncle david ’s prayer . [He]155-byron was believed . In the Stirling clan [the boys]792-the boys were always believed before [the girls]762-the girls . [Valancy]107-valancy was sent [home]612-home in disgrace because of [her]107-valancy exceedingly bad behavior during family prayers and [she]107-valancy was not asked to [Aunt Isabel]109-aunt isabel ’s again for many moons .

The time [Cousin Betty Stirling]138-betty was married . Somehow [Valancy]107-valancy got wind of the fact that [Betty]138-betty was going to ask [her]107-valancy to be [one of [[her]138-betty bridesmaids]796-her bridesmaids]795-one of her bridesmaids . [Valancy]107-valancy was secretly uplifted . It would be a delightful thing to be [a bridesmaid]797-a bridesmaid . And of course [she]107-valancy would have to have a new dress for it — a pretty new dress — a pink dress . [Betty]138-betty wanted [[her]138-betty bridesmaids]796-her bridesmaids to dress in pink .

But [Betty]138-betty had never asked [her]107-valancy , after all . [Valancy]107-valancy could n’t guess why , but long after [her]107-valancy secret tears of disappointment had been dried [Olive]101-olive told [her]107-valancy . [Betty]138-betty , after much consultation and reflection , had decided that [Valancy]107-valancy was too insignificant — [she]138-betty would “ spoil the effect . ”[138-betty] That was nine years ago . But tonight [Valancy]107-valancy caught [her]107-valancy breath with the old pain and sting of it .

That day in [her]107-valancy eleventh year when [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother had badgered [her]107-valancy into confessing something [she]107-valancy had never done . [Valancy]107-valancy had denied it for a long time but eventually for peace ’ sake [she]107-valancy had given in and pleaded guilty . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick was always making [people]2198-people lie by pushing [them]2198-people into situations where [they]2198-people had to lie . Then [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother had made [her]107-valancy kneel down on [the parlour floor]802-the parlour floor , between [herself]107-valancy and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles , and say , “ O God , please forgive [me]107-valancy for not speaking the truth . ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy had said it , but as [she]107-valancy rose from [her]107-valancy knees [she]107-valancy muttered . “ But , [O God]103-god , [you]103-god know [I]107-valancy did speak the truth . ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy had not then heard of [Galileo]157-galileo but [her]107-valancy fate was similar to [his]157-galileo . [She]107-valancy was punished just as severely as if [she]107-valancy had n’t confessed and prayed .

The winter [she]107-valancy went to dancing - school . [Uncle James]107-valancy had decreed [she]107-valancy should go and had paid for [her]107-valancy lessons . How [she]107-valancy had looked forward to it ! And how [she]107-valancy had hated it ! [She]107-valancy had never had [a voluntary partner]803-a voluntary partner . [The teacher]804-the teacher always had to tell [some boy]805-some boy to dance with [her]107-valancy , and generally [he]805-some boy had been sulky about it . Yet [Valancy]107-valancy was [a good dancer]806-a good dancer , as light on [her]107-valancy feet as thistledown . [Olive]101-olive , who never lacked [eager partners]807-eager partners , was heavy .

The affair of the button - string , when [she]101-olive was ten . [All the girls in school]808-all the girls in school had button - strings . [Olive]101-olive had a very long one with a great many beautiful buttons . [Valancy]107-valancy had one . Most of the buttons on it were very commonplace , but [she]107-valancy had six beauties that had come off [Grandmother Stirling]158-grandmother stirling ’s wedding - gown — sparkling buttons of gold and glass , much more beautiful than any [Olive]101-olive had . [Their]809-their possession conferred a certain distinction on [Valancy]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy knew [every little girl in school]810-every little girl in school envied [her]107-valancy the exclusive possession of those beautiful buttons . When [Olive]101-olive saw them on the button - string [she]101-olive had looked at them narrowly but said nothing — then . The next day [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington had come to [Elm Street]7-elm street and told [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick that [she]91-aunt wellington thought [Olive]101-olive should have some of those buttons — [Grandmother Stirling]158-grandmother stirling was just as much [[Wellington]91-aunt wellington ’s mother]811-wellington ’s mother as [[Frederick]99-mrs. frederick ’s]812-frederick ’s . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick had agreed amiably . [She]99-mrs. frederick could not afford to fall out with [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington . Moreover , the matter was of no importance whatever . [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington carried off four of the buttons , generously leaving two for [Valancy]107-valancy . [Valancy]107-valancy had torn these from [her]107-valancy string and flung them on the floor — [she]107-valancy had not yet learned that it was unladylike to have feelings — and had been sent supperless to bed for the exhibition .

The night of [Margaret Blunt]159-margaret blunt ’s party . [She]107-valancy had made such pathetic efforts to be pretty that night . [Rob Walker]160-rob was to be [there]448-there ; and two nights before , on the moonlit verandah of [[Uncle Herbert]105-uncle herbert ’s cottage at [Mistawis]27-mistawis]814-uncle herbert ’s cottage at mistawis , [Rob]160-rob had really seemed attracted to [her]107-valancy . At [Margaret]159-margaret blunt ’s party [Rob]160-rob never even asked [her]107-valancy to dance — did not notice [her]107-valancy at all . [She]107-valancy was [a wallflower]815-a wallflower , as usual . That , of course , was years ago . [People in [Deerwood]5-deerwood]816-people in deerwood had long since given up inviting [Valancy]107-valancy to dances . But to [Valancy]107-valancy its humiliation and disappointment were of the other day . [Her]107-valancy face burned in the darkness as [she]107-valancy recalled [herself]107-valancy , sitting there with [her]107-valancy pitifully crimped , thin hair and the cheeks [she]107-valancy had pinched for an hour before coming , in an effort to make them red . All that came of it was a wild story that [Valancy Stirling]107-valancy was rouged at [Margaret Blunt]159-margaret blunt ’s party . In those days in [Deerwood]5-deerwood that was enough to wreck [your]817-your character forever . [It]818-it did not wreck [Valancy]107-valancy ’s , or even damage it . [People]2198-people knew [she]107-valancy could n’t be fast if [she]107-valancy tried . [They]2198-people only laughed at [her]107-valancy .

“ [I]107-valancy ’ve had nothing but a second - hand existence , ”[107-valancy] decided [Valancy]107-valancy . “ All the great emotions of life have passed [me]107-valancy by . [I]107-valancy ’ve never even had a grief . And have [I]107-valancy ever really loved [anybody]454-anybody ? Do [I]107-valancy really love [Mother]96-mother ? No , [I]107-valancy do n’t . That ’s the truth , whether it is disgraceful or not . [I]107-valancy do n’t love [her]96-mother — [I’ve]107-valancy never loved [her]96-mother . What ’s worse , [I]107-valancy do n’t even like [her]96-mother . So [I]107-valancy do n’t know anything about any kind of love . [My]107-valancy life has been empty — empty . Nothing is worse than emptiness . Nothing ! ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy ejaculated the last “ nothing ”[2198-people] aloud passionately . Then [she]107-valancy moaned and stopped thinking about anything for a while . One of [her]107-valancy attacks of pain had come on .

When it was over something had happened to [Valancy]107-valancy — perhaps the culmination of the process that had been going on in [her]107-valancy mind ever since [she]107-valancy had read [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s letter . It was three o’clock in the morning — the wisest and most accursed hour of the clock . But sometimes it sets [us]820-us free .

“ [I]107-valancy ’ve been trying to please [other people]428-other people all [my]107-valancy life and failed , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy said . “ After this [I]107-valancy shall please [myself]107-valancy . [I]107-valancy shall never pretend anything again . [I]107-valancy ’ve breathed an atmosphere of fibs and pretences and evasions all [my]107-valancy life . What a luxury it will be to tell the truth ! [I]107-valancy may not be able to do much that [I]107-valancy want to do but [I]107-valancy wo n’t do another thing that [I]107-valancy do n’t want to do . [Mother]362-mother can pout for weeks — [I]107-valancy sha n’t worry over it . ‘ [Despair]161-despair is [a free man]2304-a free man — hope is [a slave]2305-a slave . ’ ”[107-valancy]

[Valancy]107-valancy got up and dressed , with a deepening of that curious sense of freedom . When [she]107-valancy had finished with [her]107-valancy hair [she]107-valancy opened the window and hurled the jar of potpourri over into [the next lot]489-the next lot . It smashed gloriously against [the schoolgirl]822-the schoolgirl complexion on [the old carriage - shop]823-the old carriage - shop .

“ [I]107-valancy ’m sick of the fragrance of dead things , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

CHAPTER IX

[Uncle Herbert]105-uncle herbert and [Aunt Alberta]104-aunt alberta ’s silver wedding was delicately referred to among [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings during the following weeks as “ the time [we]2306-we first noticed [poor Valancy]107-valancy was — a little — [you]2307-you understand ? ”[104-aunt alberta]

Not for worlds would [any of [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings]824-any of the stirlings have said out and out at first that [Valancy]107-valancy had gone mildly insane or even that [her]107-valancy mind was slightly deranged . [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin was considered to have gone entirely too far when [he]108-uncle benjamin had ejaculated , “ [She]107-valancy ’s dippy — [I]108-uncle benjamin tell [you]2307-you , [she]107-valancy ’s dippy , ”[108-uncle benjamin] and was only excused because of the outrageousness of [Valancy]107-valancy ’s conduct at the aforesaid wedding dinner .

But [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles had noticed a few things that made [them]825-them uneasy before the dinner . It had begun with the rosebush , of course ; and [Valancy]107-valancy never was really “ quite right ”[107-valancy] again . [She]107-valancy did not seem to worry in the least over the fact that [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother was not speaking to [her]107-valancy . [You]827-you would never suppose [she]107-valancy noticed it at all . [She]107-valancy had flatly refused to take either [Purple Pills]162-purple pills or [Redfern]119-dr. redfern ’s Bitters . [She]107-valancy had announced coolly that [she]107-valancy did not intend to answer to the name of “ Doss ”[107-valancy] any longer . [She]107-valancy had told [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles that [she]107-valancy wished [she]107-valancy would give up wearing that brooch with [Cousin Artemas Stickles]97-cousin stickles ’ hair in it . [She]107-valancy had moved [her]107-valancy bed in [[her]107-valancy room]372-her room to the opposite corner . [She]107-valancy had read [Magic of Wings]142-magic of wings Sunday afternoon . When [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles had rebuked [her]107-valancy [Valancy]107-valancy had said indifferently , “ Oh , [I]107-valancy forgot it was [Sunday”—and]163-sunday”—and[107-valancy] had gone on reading it .

[Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles had seen a terrible thing — [she]97-cousin stickles had caught [Valancy]107-valancy sliding down [the bannister]829-the bannister . [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles did not tell [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick this — [poor Amelia]164-amelia was worried enough as it was . But it was [Valancy]107-valancy ’s announcement on Saturday night that [she]107-valancy was not going to go to [the Anglican church]467-the anglican church any more that broke through [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick ’s stony silence .

“ Not going to [church]501-church any more ! Doss , have [you]99-mrs. frederick absolutely taken leave — — ”[107-valancy]

“ Oh , [I]107-valancy ’m going to [church]501-church , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy airily . “ [I]107-valancy ’m going to [the Presbyterian church]2310-the presbyterian church . But to [the Anglican church]467-the anglican church [I]107-valancy will not go . ”[107-valancy]

This was even worse . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick had recourse to tears , having found [outraged majesty]831-outraged majesty had ceased to be effective .

“ What have [you]99-mrs. frederick got against [the Anglican church]467-the anglican church ? ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy sobbed .

“ Nothing — only just that [you]99-mrs. frederick ’ve always made [me]107-valancy go [there]448-there . If [you]99-mrs. frederick ’d made [me]107-valancy go to [the Presbyterian church]2310-the presbyterian church [I]107-valancy ’d want to go to the Anglican . ”[107-valancy]

“ Is that a nice thing to say to [[your]107-valancy mother]2315-your mother ? Oh , how true it is that it is sharper than a serpent ’s tooth to have [a thankless child]2316-a thankless child . ”[107-valancy]

“ Is that a nice thing to say to [[your]99-mrs. frederick daughter]2317-your daughter ? ”[107-valancy] said unrepentant [Valancy]107-valancy .

So [Valancy]107-valancy ’s behaviour at the silver wedding was not quite the surprise to [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick and [Christine Stickles]121-christine stickles that it was to the rest . [They]832-they were doubtful about the wisdom of taking [her]107-valancy , but concluded it would “ make talk ”[832-they] if [they]832-they did n’t . Perhaps [she]107-valancy would behave [herself]107-valancy , and so far [no outsider]833-no outsider suspected there was anything queer about [her]107-valancy . By a special mercy of [Providence]120-providence it had poured torrents Sunday morning , so [Valancy]107-valancy had not carried out [her]107-valancy hideous threat of going to [the Presbyterian church]2310-the presbyterian church .

[Valancy]107-valancy would not have cared in the least if [they]832-they had left [her]107-valancy at [home]612-home . [These family]836-these family celebrations were all hopelessly dull . But [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings always celebrated everything . It was a long - established custom . [Even Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick gave a dinner party on [her]99-mrs. frederick wedding anniversary and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles had [friends]2214-friends in to supper on [her]97-cousin stickles birthday . [Valancy]107-valancy hated these entertainments because [they]832-they had to pinch and save and contrive for weeks afterwards to pay for them . But [she]107-valancy wanted to go to the silver wedding . It would hurt [Uncle Herbert]105-uncle herbert ’s feelings if [she]107-valancy stayed away , and [she]107-valancy rather liked [Uncle Herbert]105-uncle herbert . Besides , [she]107-valancy wanted to look over all [[her]107-valancy relatives]838-her relatives from [her]107-valancy new angle . It would be an excellent place to make public [her]107-valancy declaration of independence if occasion offered .

“ Put on [your]107-valancy brown silk dress , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Stirling]99-mrs. frederick .

As if there were anything else to put on ! [Valancy]107-valancy had only the one festive dress — that snuffy - brown silk [Aunt Isabel]109-aunt isabel had given [her]107-valancy . [Aunt Isabel]109-aunt isabel had decreed that [Valancy]107-valancy should never wear colours . [They]839-they did not become [her]107-valancy . When [she]107-valancy was young [they]839-they allowed [her]107-valancy to wear white , but that had been tacitly dropped for some years . [Valancy]107-valancy put on the brown silk . It had a high collar and long sleeves . [She]107-valancy had never had a dress with low neck and elbow sleeves , although they had been worn , even in [Deerwood]5-deerwood , for over a year . But [she]107-valancy did not do [her]107-valancy hair pompadour . [She]107-valancy knotted it on [her]107-valancy neck and pulled it out over [her]107-valancy ears . [She]107-valancy thought it became [her]107-valancy — only the little knot was so absurdly small . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick resented the hair but decided it was wisest to say nothing on the eve of the party . It was so important that [Valancy]107-valancy should be kept in good humour , if possible , until it was over . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick did not reflect that this was the first time in [her]99-mrs. frederick life that [she]99-mrs. frederick had thought it necessary to consider [Valancy]107-valancy ’s humours . But then [Valancy]107-valancy had never been “ queer ”[107-valancy] before .

On [their]840-they way to [Uncle Herbert’s]165-uncle herbert’s — [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles walking in front , [Valancy]107-valancy trotting meekly along behind — [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel drove past [them]840-they . Drunk as usual but not in the roaring stage . Just drunk enough to be excessively polite . [He]141-roaring abel raised [his]141-roaring abel disreputable old tartan cap with the air of [a monarch saluting [[his]141-roaring abel subjects]842-his subjects]841-a monarch saluting his subjects and swept [them]842-his subjects a grand bow . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles dared not cut [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel altogether . [He]141-roaring abel was [the only person in [Deerwood]5-deerwood]843-the only person in deerwood who could be got to do odd jobs of carpentering and repairing when [they]840-they needed to be done , so it would not do to offend [him]141-roaring abel . But [they]840-they responded with only the stiffest , slightest of bows . [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel must be kept in [his]141-roaring abel place .

[Valancy]107-valancy , behind [them]840-they , did a thing [they]840-they were fortunately spared seeing . [She]107-valancy smiled gaily and waved [her]107-valancy hand to [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel . Why not ? [She]107-valancy had always liked [the old sinner]844-the old sinner . [He]141-roaring abel was such [a jolly , picturesque , unashamed reprobate]845-a jolly , picturesque , unashamed reprobate and stood out against the drab respectability of [Deerwood]5-deerwood and [its]5-deerwood customs like a flame - red flag of revolt and protest . Only a few nights ago [Abel]141-roaring abel had gone through [Deerwood]5-deerwood in [the wee sma ’s]846-the wee sma ’s , shouting oaths at the top of [his]141-roaring abel stentorian voice which could be heard for miles , and lashing [his]141-roaring abel horse into a furious gallop as [he]141-roaring abel tore along prim , proper [Elm Street]7-elm street .

“ Yelling and blaspheming like [a fiend]2318-a fiend , ”[97-cousin stickles] shuddered [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles at the breakfast - table .

“ [I]99-mrs. frederick can not understand why the judgment of [the Lord]2319-the lord has not fallen upon [that man]2320-that man long ere this , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick petulantly , as if [she]99-mrs. frederick thought [Providence]120-providence was very dilatory and ought to have a gentle reminder .

“ [He]2320-that man ’ll be picked up dead some morning — [he’ll]2320-that man fall under [his]2320-that man horse ’s hoofs and be trampled to death , ”[97-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles reassuringly .

[Valancy]107-valancy had said nothing , of course ; but [she]107-valancy wondered to [herself]107-valancy if [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s periodical sprees were not [his]141-roaring abel futile protest against the poverty and drudgery and monotony of [his]141-roaring abel existence . [She]107-valancy went on dream sprees in [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle . [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel , having no imagination , could not do that . [His]141-roaring abel escapes from reality had to be concrete . So [she]107-valancy waved at [him]141-roaring abel today with a sudden fellow feeling , and [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel , not too drunk to be astonished , nearly fell off [his]141-roaring abel seat in [his]141-roaring abel amazement .

By this time [they]848-they had reached [Maple Avenue]28-maple avenue and [[Uncle Herbert]105-uncle herbert ’s house]849-uncle herbert ’s house , [a large , pretentious structure peppered with meaningless bay windows and excrescent porches]850-a large , pretentious structure peppered with meaningless bay windows and excrescent porches . [A house that always looked like [a stupid , prosperous , self - satisfied man with warts on [his]141-roaring abel face]852-a stupid , prosperous , self - satisfied man with warts on his face]851-a house that always looked like a stupid , prosperous , self - satisfied man with warts on his face .

“ [A house like that]2321-a house like that , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy solemnly , “ is a blasphemy . ”[107-valancy]

[Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick was shaken to [her]99-mrs. frederick soul . What had [Valancy]107-valancy said ? Was it profane ? Or only just queer ? [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick took off [her]99-mrs. frederick hat in [[Aunt Alberta]104-aunt alberta ’s spare - room]853-aunt alberta ’s spare - room with trembling hands . [She]99-mrs. frederick made one more feeble attempt to avert disaster . [She]99-mrs. frederick held [Valancy]107-valancy back on [the landing]854-the landing as [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles went [downstairs]365-downstairs .

“ Wo n’t [you]107-valancy try to remember [you]107-valancy ’re [a lady]2322-a lady ? ”[99-mrs. frederick] [she]99-mrs. frederick pleaded .

“ Oh , if there were only any hope of being able to forget it ! ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy wearily .

[Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick felt that [she]99-mrs. frederick had not deserved this from [Providence]120-providence .

CHAPTER X

“ Bless this food to [our]2323-our use and consecrate [our]2323-our lives to [Thy]2324-thy service , ”[105-uncle herbert] said [Uncle Herbert]105-uncle herbert briskly .

[Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington frowned . [She]91-aunt wellington always considered [Herbert]105-uncle herbert ’s graces entirely too short and “ flippant . ”[91-aunt wellington] A grace , to be a grace in [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington ’s eyes , had to be at least three minutes long and uttered in an unearthly tone , between a groan and a chant . As a protest [she]91-aunt wellington kept [her]91-aunt wellington head bent a perceptible time after all the rest had been lifted . When [she]91-aunt wellington permitted [herself]91-aunt wellington to sit upright [she]91-aunt wellington found [Valancy]107-valancy looking at [her]91-aunt wellington . Ever afterwards [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington averred that [she]91-aunt wellington had known from that moment that there was something wrong with [Valancy]107-valancy . In those queer , slanted eyes of [hers—“we]91-aunt wellington should always have known [she]91-aunt wellington was not entirely right with eyes like that”—there[91-aunt wellington] was an odd gleam of mockery and amusement — as if [Valancy]107-valancy were laughing at [her]91-aunt wellington . Such a thing was unthinkable , of course . [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington at once ceased to think it .

[Valancy]107-valancy was enjoying [herself]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy had never enjoyed [herself]107-valancy at a “ family reunion ”[107-valancy] before . In social function , as in childish games , [she]107-valancy had only “ filled in . ”[107-valancy] [[Her]107-valancy clan]331-her clan had always considered [her]107-valancy very dull . [She]107-valancy had no parlour tricks . And [she]107-valancy had been in the habit of taking refuge from the boredom of family parties in [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle , which resulted in an absent - mindedness that increased [her]107-valancy reputation for dulness and vacuity .

“ [She]107-valancy has no social presence whatever , ”[91-aunt wellington] [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington had decreed once and for all . [Nobody]348-nobody dreamed that [Valancy]107-valancy was dumb in [their]859-them presence merely because [she]107-valancy was afraid of [them]859-them . Now [she]107-valancy was no longer afraid of [them]859-them . The shackles had been stricken off [her]107-valancy soul . [She]107-valancy was quite prepared to talk if occasion offered . Meanwhile [she]107-valancy was giving [herself]107-valancy such freedom of thought as [she]107-valancy had never dared to take before . [She]107-valancy let [herself]107-valancy go with a wild , inner exultation , as [Uncle Herbert]105-uncle herbert carved the turkey . [Uncle Herbert]105-uncle herbert gave [Valancy]107-valancy a second look that day . Being [a man]335-a man , [he]105-uncle herbert did n’t know what [she]107-valancy had done to [her]107-valancy hair , but [he]105-uncle herbert thought surprisedly that [Doss]106-doss was not such [a bad - looking girl]861-a bad - looking girl , after all ; and [he]105-uncle herbert put an extra piece of white meat on [her]107-valancy plate .

“ What herb is most injurious to [a young lady]2325-a young lady ’s beauty ? ”[108-uncle benjamin] propounded [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin by way of starting conversation—“loosening things up a bit , ”[108-uncle benjamin] as [he]108-uncle benjamin would have said .

[Valancy]107-valancy , whose duty it was to say , “ What ? ”[107-valancy] did not say it . [He]108-uncle benjamin looked resentfully at [Valancy]107-valancy , who had never failed [him]108-uncle benjamin before , but [Valancy]107-valancy did not seem even to be aware of [him]108-uncle benjamin . [She]107-valancy was gazing around the table , examining relentlessly every one in [this depressing assembly of [sensible people]864-sensible people]863-this depressing assembly of sensible people and watching [their]864-sensible people little squirms with a detached , amused smile .

So these were [the people [she]107-valancy had always held in reverence and fear]865-the people she had always held in reverence and fear . [She]107-valancy seemed to see [them]865-the people she had always held in reverence and fear with new eyes .

Big , capable , patronising , voluble [Aunt Mildred]112-aunt mildred , who thought [herself]112-aunt mildred [the cleverest woman in [the clan]680-the clan]866-the cleverest woman in the clan , [[her]112-aunt mildred husband]419-her husband a little lower than [the angels]869-the angels and [[her]112-aunt mildred children]870-her children wonders . And could [she]107-valancy not tell [you]872-you the best way to do everything , from cooking mushrooms to picking up a snake ? What a bore [she]107-valancy was ! What ugly moles [she]107-valancy had on [her]107-valancy face !

[[Cousin Gladys]92-dr. trent , who was always praising [[her]873-cousin gladys , who was always praising her son , who had died young , and always fighting with her living one son]871-her son , who had died young , and always fighting with [her]873-cousin gladys , who was always praising her son , who had died young , and always fighting with her living one living one]873-cousin gladys , who was always praising her son , who had died young , and always fighting with her living one . [She]873-cousin gladys , who was always praising her son , who had died young , and always fighting with her living one had neuritis — or what [she]873-cousin gladys , who was always praising her son , who had died young , and always fighting with her living one called neuritis . [You]872-you ca n’t think with neuritis in [your]872-you head , [[my]0-i dear]2187-my dear .

“ What [an old humbug]2326-an old humbug [you]109-aunt isabel are ! ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy impiously .

“ [I]107-valancy wonder what would happen to [your]109-aunt isabel face if [you]109-aunt isabel ever smiled , ”[107-valancy] speculated [Valancy]107-valancy , unblushingly .

[Second Cousin [Sarah Taylor]167-cousin sarah , with [her]881-her great , pale , expressionless eyes , who was noted for the variety of [her]881-her pickle recipes and for nothing else . [Little Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana . [Not such a bad little soul]882-not such a bad little soul . But dreary — very . [Uncle James]107-valancy . Handsome , black , with [his]884-he sarcastic , trap - like mouth and iron - grey side - burns , whose favourite amusement was to write controversial letters to the Christian Times , attacking [Modernism]168-modernism . [Valancy]107-valancy always wondered if [he]884-he looked as solemn when [he]884-he was asleep as [he]884-he did when awake . No wonder [[his]884-he wife]885-his wife had died young . [Valancy]107-valancy remembered [her]885-his wife . [A pretty , sensitive thing]886-a pretty , sensitive thing . [Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington . [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington . Named [Mary]169-mary but called by [[her]91-aunt wellington husband]419-her husband ’s name to distinguish [her]91-aunt wellington from [Great - aunt Mary]889-great - aunt mary . [A massive , dignified , permanent lady]890-a massive , dignified , permanent lady . Splendidly arranged , iron - grey hair . Rich , fashionable beaded dress . Had [her]91-aunt wellington moles removed by electrolysis — which [Aunt Mildred]112-aunt mildred thought was a wicked evasion of the purposes of [God]103-god .

[Uncle Herbert]105-uncle herbert , with [his]105-uncle herbert spiky grey hair . [Aunt Alberta]104-aunt alberta , who twisted [her]104-aunt alberta mouth so unpleasantly in talking and had a great reputation for unselfishness because [she]104-aunt alberta was always giving up a lot of things [she]104-aunt alberta did n’t want . [Valancy]107-valancy let them off easily in [her]107-valancy judgment because [she]107-valancy liked them , even if they were in [Milton]170-milton ’s expressive phrase , “ stupidly good . ”[107-valancy] But [she]107-valancy wondered for what inscrutable reason [Aunt Alberta]104-aunt alberta had seen fit to tie a black velvet ribbon around each of [her]104-aunt alberta chubby arms above the elbow .

Then [she]107-valancy looked across the table at [Olive]101-olive . [Olive]101-olive , who had been held up to [her]107-valancy as [a paragon of beauty , behaviour and success]891-a paragon of beauty , behaviour and success as long as [she]107-valancy could remember . “ Why ca n’t [you]892-you hold [yourself]892-you like [Olive]101-olive , Doss ?
