[Valancy]107-valancy ’s elfin eyes lost their mocking glitter and became pensive and sorrowful . [You]892-you could not ignore or disdain [Olive]101-olive . It was quite impossible to deny that [she]101-olive was beautiful and effective and sometimes [she]101-olive was a little intelligent . [Her]101-olive mouth might be a trifle heavy — [she]101-olive might show [her]101-olive fine , white , regular teeth rather too lavishly when [she]101-olive smiled . But when all was said and done , [Olive]101-olive justified [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin ’s summing [up—“a stunning girl]2328-up—“a stunning girl . ”[108-uncle benjamin] Yes , [Valancy]107-valancy agreed in [her]107-valancy heart , [Olive]101-olive was stunning .

Rich , golden - brown hair , elaborately dressed , with a sparkling bandeau holding its glossy puffs in place ; large , brilliant blue eyes and thick silken lashes ; face of rose and bare neck of snow , rising above [her]101-olive gown ; great pearl bubbles in [her]101-olive ears ; the blue - white diamond flame on [her]101-olive long , smooth , waxen finger with its rosy , pointed nail . Arms of marble , gleaming through green chiffon and shadow lace . [Valancy]107-valancy felt suddenly thankful that [her]107-valancy own scrawny arms were decently swathed in brown silk . Then [she]107-valancy resumed [her]107-valancy tabulation of [Olive]101-olive ’s charms .

Tall . Queenly . [Confident]171-confident . Everything that [Valancy]107-valancy was not . [Dimples]172-dimples , too , in cheeks and chin . “ [A woman with dimples]2329-a woman with dimples always gets [her]2329-a woman with dimples own way , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy , in a recurring spasm of bitterness at the fate which had denied [her]107-valancy even one dimple .

[Olive]101-olive was only a year younger than [Valancy]107-valancy , though [a stranger]893-a stranger would have thought that there was at least ten years between [them]894-them . But [nobody]348-nobody ever dreaded old maidenhood for [her]101-olive . [Olive]101-olive had been surrounded by [a crowd of eager beaus]896-a crowd of eager beaus since [her]101-olive early teens , just as [her]101-olive mirror was always surrounded by a fringe of cards , photographs , programmes and invitations . At eighteen , when [she]101-olive had graduated from [Havergal College]29-havergal college , [Olive]101-olive had been engaged to [Will Desmond]173-will desmond , lawyer in [embryo]30-embryo . [Will Desmond]173-will desmond had died and [Olive]101-olive had mourned for [him]173-will desmond properly for two years . When [she]101-olive was twenty - three [she]101-olive had a hectic affair with [Donald Jackson]174-donald jackson . But [Aunt]897-aunt and [Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington disapproved of that and in the end [Olive]101-olive dutifully gave [him]173-will desmond up . [Nobody in the Stirling clan]379-nobody in the stirling clan — whatever [outsiders]899-outsiders might say — hinted that [she]101-olive did so because [Donald]174-donald jackson [himself]174-donald jackson was cooling off . However that might be , [Olive]101-olive ’s third venture met with [everybody]422-everybody ’s approval . [Cecil Price]102-cecil was clever and handsome and “ one of the Port Lawrence Prices . ”[102-cecil] [Olive]101-olive had been engaged to [him]102-cecil for three years . [He]102-cecil had just graduated in civil engineering and [they]901-they were to be married as soon as [he]102-cecil landed a contract . [Olive]101-olive ’s hope chest was full to overflowing with exquisite things and [Olive]101-olive had already confided to [Valancy]107-valancy what [her]101-olive wedding - dress was to be . Ivory silk draped with lace , white satin court train , lined with pale green georgette , heirloom veil of Brussels lace . [Valancy]107-valancy knew also — though [Olive]101-olive had not told [her]107-valancy — that [the bridesmaids]902-the bridesmaids were selected and that [she]101-olive was not among [them]902-the bridesmaids .

[Valancy]107-valancy had , after a fashion , always been [[Olive]101-olive ’s confidante]903-olive ’s confidante — perhaps because [she]107-valancy was [the only girl in the connection]904-the only girl in the connection who could not bore [Olive]101-olive with return confidences . [Olive]101-olive always told [Valancy]107-valancy all the details of [her]101-olive love affairs , from the days when [the little boys in school]905-the little boys in school used to “ persecute ”[101-olive] [her]101-olive with love letters . [Valancy]107-valancy could not comfort [herself]107-valancy by thinking these affairs mythical . [Olive]101-olive really had them . [Many men]906-many men had gone mad over [her]101-olive besides [the three fortunate ones]907-the three fortunate ones .

“ [I]101-olive do n’t know what [the poor idiots]2330-the poor idiots see in [me]101-olive , that drives [them]2330-the poor idiots to make [such double idiots of [themselves]2330-the poor idiots]2331-such double idiots of themselves , ”[101-olive] [Olive]101-olive was wo nt to say . [Olive Stirling]175-olive was one of [the girls about whom [men]2185-men do go mad just as indubitably as [she]175-olive , [Valancy]107-valancy]908-the girls about whom men do go mad just as indubitably as she , valancy , was one of [the girls at whom [no man]342-no man]910-the girls at whom no man ever looked twice .

“ And yet , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy , summing [her]175-olive up with a new and merciless conclusiveness , “ [she]175-olive ’s like a dewless morning . There ’s something lacking . ”[107-valancy]

CHAPTER XI

Meanwhile the dinner in its earlier stages was dragging its slow length along true to [Stirling]107-valancy form . [The room]472-the room was chilly , in spite of the calendar , and [Aunt Alberta]104-aunt alberta had the gas - logs lighted . [Everybody in [the clan]680-the clan]684-everybody in the clan envied [her]104-aunt alberta those gas - logs except [Valancy]107-valancy . Glorious open fires blazed in [every room of [her]104-aunt alberta Blue Castle]915-every room of her blue castle when autumnal nights were cool , but [she]104-aunt alberta would have frozen to death in [it]915-every room of her blue castle before [she]104-aunt alberta would have committed the sacrilege of a gas - log . [Uncle Herbert]105-uncle herbert made [his]105-uncle herbert hardy perennial joke when [he]105-uncle herbert helped [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington to the cold meat—“Mary , will [you]91-aunt wellington have a little lamb ? ”[105-uncle herbert] [Aunt Mildred]112-aunt mildred told the same old story of once finding a lost ring in a turkey ’s crop . [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin told [his]108-uncle benjamin favourite prosy tale of how [he]108-uncle benjamin had once chased and punished [a now famous man]916-a now famous man for stealing apples . [Second Cousin Jane]176-second cousin jane described all [her]176-second cousin jane sufferings with an ulcerating tooth . [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington admired the pattern of [Aunt Alberta]104-aunt alberta ’s silver teaspoons and lamented the fact that one of [her]91-aunt wellington own had been lost .

“ It spoiled the set . [I]91-aunt wellington could never get it matched . And it was [my]91-aunt wellington wedding - present from dear [old Aunt Matilda]177-old aunt matilda . ”[91-aunt wellington]

[Aunt Isabel]109-aunt isabel thought the seasons were changing and could n’t imagine what had become of [[our]917-our good , old - fashioned springs]918-our good , old - fashioned springs . [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana , as usual , discussed the last funeral and wondered , audibly , “ which of [us]917-our will be the next to pass away . ”[110-cousin georgiana] [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana could never say anything as blunt as “ die . ”[110-cousin georgiana] [Valancy]107-valancy thought [she]107-valancy could tell [her]110-cousin georgiana , but did n’t . [Cousin Gladys]92-dr. trent , likewise as usual , had a grievance . “ [Boys]2333-boys will be [boys]2333-boys , ”[105-uncle herbert] reminded [Uncle Herbert]105-uncle herbert tolerantly .

[Uncle James]107-valancy thought the conversation was sagging to a rather low plane of personal gossip . [Everybody]422-everybody stared . [Nobody]348-nobody felt it safe to say anything . Was [Valancy]107-valancy trying to be funny ? It was incredible . “ But [I]107-valancy ’m not [a young girl]2342-a young girl , ”[107-valancy] retorted [Valancy]107-valancy , uncrushed . “ Are n’t [you]106-doss always rubbing that into [me]107-valancy ? [CHAPTER XII

Valancy]107-valancy hurried [home]612-home through the faint blue twilight — hurried too fast perhaps . The attack [she]107-valancy had when [she]107-valancy thankfully reached the shelter of [[her]107-valancy own room]976-her own room was the worst yet . It was really very bad . [She]107-valancy might die in one of those spells . It would be dreadful to die in such pain . Perhaps — perhaps this was death . [Valancy]107-valancy felt pitifully alone . When [she]107-valancy could think at all [she]107-valancy wondered what it would be like to have some one with [her]107-valancy who could sympathise — [some one who really cared — just to hold [her]107-valancy hand tight , if nothing else — [some one]359-some one just to say , “ Yes , [I]359-some one know]2415-some one who really cared — just to hold her hand tight , if nothing else — some one just to say , “ yes , i know . It ’s dreadful — be brave — [you’ll]2416-you’ll soon be better ; ”[359-some one] not [some one merely fussy and alarmed]978-some one merely fussy and alarmed . Not [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother or [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles . Why did the thought of [Barney Snaith]140-barney come into [her]107-valancy mind ? Why did [she]107-valancy suddenly feel , in the midst of this hideous loneliness of pain , that [he]980-he would be sympathetic — sorry for [any one that was suffering]981-any one that was suffering ? Why did [he]980-he seem to [her]107-valancy like [an old , well - known friend]982-an old , well - known friend ? Was it because [she]107-valancy had been defending [him]980-he — standing up to [[her]107-valancy family]983-her family for [him]980-he ?

[She]107-valancy was so bad at first that [she]107-valancy could not even get [herself]107-valancy a dose of [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s prescription . But eventually [she]107-valancy managed it , and soon after relief came . The pain left [her]107-valancy and [she]107-valancy lay on [her]107-valancy bed , spent , exhausted , in a cold perspiration . Oh , that had been horrible ! [She]107-valancy could not endure many more attacks like that . [One]332-one did n’t mind dying if death could be instant and painless . But to be hurt so in dying !

Suddenly [she]107-valancy found [herself]107-valancy laughing . That dinner had been fun . And it had all been so simple . [She]107-valancy had merely said the things [she]107-valancy had always thought . [Their]985-their faces — oh , [their]985-their faces ! [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin — poor , flabbergasted [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin ! [Valancy]107-valancy felt quite sure [he]108-uncle benjamin would make a new will that very night . [Olive]175-olive would get [Valancy]107-valancy ’s share of [his]108-uncle benjamin fat hoard . [Olive]175-olive had always got [Valancy]107-valancy ’s share of everything . Remember the dust - pile .

To laugh at [her]107-valancy clan as [she]107-valancy had always wanted to laugh was all the satisfaction [she]107-valancy could get out of life now . But [she]107-valancy thought it was rather pitiful that it should be so . Might [she]107-valancy not pity [herself]107-valancy a little when [nobody else]862-nobody else did ?

[Valancy]107-valancy got up and went to [her]107-valancy window . The moist , beautiful wind blowing across groves of young - leafed wild trees touched [her]107-valancy face with the caress of [a wise , tender , old friend]987-a wise , tender , old friend . The lombardies in [[Mrs. Tredgold]191-mrs. tredgold ’s lawn]988-mrs. tredgold ’s lawn , off to the left — [Valancy]107-valancy could just see [them]989-them between [the stable]990-the stable and [the old carriage - shop]823-the old carriage - shop — were in dark purple silhouette against a clear sky and there was a milk - white , pulsating star just over one of them , like a living pearl on [a silver - green lake]992-a silver - green lake . Far beyond [the station]627-the station were [the shadowy , purple - hooded woods around [Lake Mistawis]21-lake mistawis]994-the shadowy , purple - hooded woods around lake mistawis . [Valancy]107-valancy looked at it over [her]107-valancy thin left shoulder .

“ [I]107-valancy wish , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy said whimsically , “ that [I]107-valancy may have one little dust - pile before [I]107-valancy die . ”[107-valancy]

CHAPTER XIII

[Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin found [he]108-uncle benjamin had reckoned without [[his]108-uncle benjamin host]995-his host when [he]108-uncle benjamin promised so airily to take [Valancy]107-valancy to [a doctor]446-a doctor . [Valancy]107-valancy would not go . [Valancy]107-valancy laughed in [his]108-uncle benjamin face .

“ Why on earth should [I]107-valancy go to [Dr. Marsh]117-dr. marsh ? There ’s nothing the matter with [my]107-valancy mind . Though [you]2417-you all think [I]107-valancy ’ve suddenly gone crazy . What indeed ! It was not seemly — or even possible — to hale [Valancy]107-valancy doctorwards by physical force . And in no other way could it be done , seemingly . [[Her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother ’s tears and imploring entreaties availed not .

“ Do n’t worry , [Mother]362-mother , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , lightly but quite respectfully . “ It is n’t likely [I]107-valancy ’ll do anything very terrible . But [I]107-valancy mean to have a little fun . ”[107-valancy]

“ More as if [she]107-valancy were talking to [herself]107-valancy than to [me]107-valancy . “ [I]91-aunt wellington ’m sure [I]91-aunt wellington ca n’t imagine , ”[91-aunt wellington] groaned [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington , prepared for anything .

“ [Her]107-valancy mind is affected , [Olive]175-olive , ”[91-aunt wellington] said [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington solemnly . “ [You]91-aunt wellington must not hold [her]107-valancy responsible for what [she]107-valancy says . ”[91-aunt wellington]

When [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington told [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick what [Valancy]107-valancy had said to [Olive]175-olive , [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick wanted [Valancy]107-valancy to apologise .

“ [You]91-aunt wellington made [me]107-valancy apologise to [Olive]175-olive fifteen years ago for something [I]107-valancy did n’t do , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . “ [That old apology]2428-that old apology will do for now . ”[107-valancy]

[Another solemn family]1001-another solemn family conclave was held . [They]1002-they were all there except [Cousin Gladys]92-dr. trent , who had been suffering such tortures of neuritis in [her]1003-her head “ ever since [poor Doss]106-doss went queer ”[1001-another solemn family] that [she]1003-her could n’t undertake any responsibility . [They]1002-they decided — that is , [they]1002-they accepted a fact that was thrust in [their]1002-they faces — that the wisest thing was to leave [Valancy]107-valancy alone for a while—“give [her]107-valancy [her]107-valancy head ”[108-uncle benjamin] as [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin expressed it—“keep a careful eye on [her]107-valancy but let [her]107-valancy pretty much alone . ”[108-uncle benjamin] The term of “ watchful waiting ”[108-uncle benjamin] had not been invented then , but that was practically the policy [[Valancy]107-valancy ’s distracted relatives]1004-valancy ’s distracted relatives decided to follow .

“ [We]1002-they must be guided by developments , ”[108-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin . “ It is”—solemnly—“easier[108-uncle benjamin] to scramble eggs than unscramble them . Of course — if [she]107-valancy becomes violent — — ”[107-valancy]

[Uncle James]107-valancy consulted [Dr. Ambrose Marsh]117-dr. marsh . [Dr. Ambrose Marsh]117-dr. marsh approved [their]1002-they decision . [He]117-dr. marsh pointed out to irate [Uncle James]107-valancy — who would have liked to lock [Valancy]107-valancy up somewhere , out of hand — that [Valancy]107-valancy had not , as yet , really done or said anything that could be construed as proof of lunacy — and without proof [you]1005-you can not lock [people]2198-people up in this degenerate age . Nothing that [Uncle James]107-valancy had reported seemed very alarming to [Dr. Marsh]117-dr. marsh , who put up [his]117-dr. marsh hand to conceal a smile several times . But then [he]117-dr. marsh [himself]117-dr. marsh was not [a Stirling]107-valancy . And [he]117-dr. marsh knew very little about [the old Valancy]107-valancy . [Uncle James]107-valancy stalked out and drove back to [Deerwood]5-deerwood , thinking that [Ambrose Marsh]117-dr. marsh was n’t much of [a doctor]446-a doctor , after all , and that [Adelaide Stirling]118-adelaide stirling might have done better for [herself]118-adelaide stirling .

CHAPTER XIV

Life can not stop because tragedy enters it . Meals must be made ready though [a son]1008-a son dies and [porches]1009-porches must be repaired even if [[your]1005-you only daughter]1010-your only daughter is going out of [her]1010-your only daughter mind . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick , in [her]99-mrs. frederick systematic way , had long ago appointed the second week in June for the repairing of the [front porch]1011-front porch , the roof of which was sagging dangerously . [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel had been engaged to do it many moons before and [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel promptly appeared on the morning of the first day of the second week , and fell to work . Of course [he]141-roaring abel was drunk . [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel was never anything but drunk . But [he]141-roaring abel was only in the first stage , which made [him]141-roaring abel talkative and genial . The odour of whisky on [his]141-roaring abel breath nearly drove [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles wild at dinner . [Even Valancy]107-valancy , with all [her]107-valancy emancipation , did not like it . But [she]107-valancy liked [Abel]141-roaring abel and [she]107-valancy liked [his]141-roaring abel vivid , eloquent talk , and after [she]107-valancy washed the dinner dishes [she]107-valancy went out and sat on the steps and talked to [him]141-roaring abel .

[Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles thought it a terrible proceeding , but what could [they]1012-they do ? [Valancy]107-valancy only smiled mockingly at [them]1012-they when [they]1012-they called [her]107-valancy in , and did not go . It was so easy to defy once [you]1013-you got started . The first step was the only one that really counted . [They]1012-they were both afraid to say anything more to [her]107-valancy lest [she]107-valancy might make a scene before [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel , who would spread it all over [the country]2368-the country with [his]141-roaring abel own characteristic comments and exaggerations . It was too cold a day , in spite of the June sunshine , for [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick to sit at the dining - room window and listen to what was said . [She]99-mrs. frederick had to shut the window and [Valancy]107-valancy and [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel had [their]1012-they talk to [themselves]1012-they . But if [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick had known what the outcome of that talk was to be [she]99-mrs. frederick would have prevented it , if [the porch]1015-the porch was never repaired .

[Valancy]107-valancy sat on the steps , defiant of the chill breeze of this cold June which had made [Aunt Isabel]109-aunt isabel aver the seasons were changing . [She]107-valancy did not care whether [she]107-valancy caught a cold or not . It was delightful to sit there in [that cold , beautiful , fragrant world]1016-that cold , beautiful , fragrant world and feel free . [She]107-valancy filled [her]107-valancy lungs with the clean , lovely wind and held out [her]107-valancy arms to it and let it tear [her]107-valancy hair to pieces while [she]107-valancy listened to [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel , who told [her]107-valancy [his]141-roaring abel troubles between intervals of hammering gaily in time to [his]141-roaring abel Scotch songs . [Valancy]107-valancy liked to hear [him]141-roaring abel . Every stroke of [his]141-roaring abel hammer fell true to the note .

[Old Abel Gay]193-abel , in spite of [his]193-abel seventy years , was handsome still , in a stately , patriarchal manner . [His]193-abel tremendous beard , falling down over [his]193-abel blue flannel shirt , was still a flaming , untouched red , though [his]193-abel shock of hair was white as snow , and [his]193-abel eyes were a fiery , youthful blue . [His]193-abel enormous , reddish - white eyebrows were more like moustaches than eyebrows . Perhaps this was why [he]193-abel always kept [his]193-abel upper lip scrupulously shaved . [His]193-abel cheeks were red and [his]193-abel nose ought to have been , but was n’t . It was a fine , upstanding , aquiline nose , such as [the noblest Roman of [them]1018-them]1017-the noblest roman of them all might have rejoiced in . [Abel]193-abel was six feet two in [his]193-abel stockings , broad - shouldered , lean - hipped . In [his]193-abel youth [he]193-abel had been [a famous lover]1019-a famous lover , finding [all women]1020-all women too charming to bind [himself]193-abel to one . [His]193-abel years had been a wild , colourful panorama of follies and adventures , gallantries , fortunes and misfortunes . [He]193-abel had been forty - five before [he]193-abel married — [a pretty slip of [a girl whom [his]193-abel goings - on killed in a few years]1022-a girl whom his goings - on killed in a few years]1021-a pretty slip of a girl whom his goings - on killed in a few years . [Abel]193-abel was piously drunk at [her]1022-a girl whom his goings - on killed in a few years funeral and insisted on repeating the fifty - fifth chapter of [Isaiah]194-isaiah — [Abel]193-abel knew most of the Bible and all the Psalms by heart — while [the minister]1023-the minister , whom [he]193-abel disliked , prayed or tried to pray . Thereafter [[his]193-abel house]1024-his house was run by [an untidy old cousin who cooked [his]193-abel meals and kept things going after a fashion]1025-an untidy old cousin who cooked his meals and kept things going after a fashion . In this unpromising environment [little Cecilia Gay]182-cissy had grown up .

[Valancy]107-valancy had known “ [Cissy Gay]182-cissy ”[107-valancy] fairly well in the democracy of [the public school]1026-the public school , though [Cissy]182-cissy had been three years younger than [she]182-cissy . After [they]1027-they left [school]751-school [their]1027-they paths diverged and [she]182-cissy had seen nothing of [her]182-cissy . [Old Abel]193-abel was [a Presbyterian]466-a presbyterian . That is , [he]193-abel got [a Presbyterian preacher]1030-a presbyterian preacher to marry [him]193-abel , baptise [[his]193-abel child]1031-his child and bury [[his]193-abel wife]885-his wife ; and [he]193-abel knew more about Presbyterian theology than [most ministers]1033-most ministers , which made [him]193-abel a terror to [them]1033-most ministers in arguments . But [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel never went to [church]501-church . [[Every Presbyterian minister]1035-every presbyterian minister who had been in [Deerwood]5-deerwood]1036-every presbyterian minister who had been in deerwood had tried [his]1036-every presbyterian minister who had been in deerwood hand — once — at reforming [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel . But [he]1036-every presbyterian minister who had been in deerwood had not been pestered of late . [Rev. Mr. Bently]195-rev. mr. bently had been in [Deerwood]5-deerwood for eight years , but [he]195-rev. mr. bently had not sought out [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel since the first three months of [his]195-rev. mr. bently pastorate . [He]195-rev. mr. bently had called on [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel then and found [him]141-roaring abel in the theological stage of drunkenness — which always followed [the sentimental maudlin one]1037-the sentimental maudlin one , and preceded [the roaring , blasphemous one]1038-the roaring , blasphemous one . The eloquently prayerful one , in which [he]141-roaring abel realised [himself]141-roaring abel temporarily and intensely as [a sinner in the hands of [an angry God]1040-an angry god]1039-a sinner in the hands of an angry god , was the final one . [Abel]141-roaring abel never went beyond it . [He]141-roaring abel generally fell asleep on [his]141-roaring abel knees and awakened sober , but [he]141-roaring abel had never been “ dead drunk ”[141-roaring abel] in [his]141-roaring abel life . [He]141-roaring abel told [Mr. Bently]196-mr. bently that [he]141-roaring abel was [a sound Presbyterian and sure of]1041-a sound presbyterian and sure of [his]141-roaring abel election . [He]141-roaring abel had no sins — that [he]141-roaring abel knew of — to repent of .

“ Have [you]141-roaring abel never done anything in [your]141-roaring abel life that [you]141-roaring abel are sorry for ? ”[196-mr. bently] asked [Mr. Bently]196-mr. bently .

[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel scratched [his]141-roaring abel bushy white head and pretended to reflect . “ Well , yes , ”[141-roaring abel] [he]141-roaring abel said finally . “ There were [some women]2429-some women [I]141-roaring abel might have kissed and did n’t . [I]141-roaring abel ’ve always been sorry for that . ”[141-roaring abel]

[Mr. Bently]1042-mr. bently went out and went [home]612-home .

[Abel]141-roaring abel had seen that [Cissy]182-cissy was properly baptised — jovially drunk at the same time [himself]141-roaring abel . [He]141-roaring abel made [her]182-cissy go to [church]501-church and [Sunday School]785-sunday school regularly . [The church people]1046-the church people took [her]182-cissy up and [she]182-cissy was in turn [a member of [the Mission Band]1048-the mission band , [[the Girls]197-the girls ’ Guild]1049-the girls ’ guild and [the Young Women ’s Missionary Society]1050-the young women ’s missionary society]1047-a member of the mission band , the girls ’ guild and the young women ’s missionary society . [She]182-cissy was [a faithful , unobtrusive , sincere , little worker]1051-a faithful , unobtrusive , sincere , little worker . [Everybody]422-everybody liked [Cissy Gay]182-cissy and was sorry for [her]182-cissy . [She]182-cissy was so modest and sensitive and pretty in that delicate , elusive fashion of beauty which fades so quickly if life is not kept in it by love and tenderness . But then liking and pity did not prevent [them]1046-the church people from tearing [her]182-cissy in pieces like hungry cats when the catastrophe came . Four years previously [Cissy Gay]182-cissy had gone up to [a Muskoka hotel]1053-a muskoka hotel as [a summer waitress]1054-a summer waitress . And when [she]182-cissy had come back in the fall [she]182-cissy was [a changed creature]1055-a changed creature . [She]182-cissy hid [herself]182-cissy away and went nowhere . The reason soon leaked out and scandal raged . That winter [[Cissy]182-cissy ’s baby]1056-cissy ’s baby was born . [Nobody]348-nobody ever knew who [the father]1058-the father was . [Cecily]182-cissy kept [her]182-cissy poor pale lips tightly locked on [her]182-cissy sorry secret . [Nobody]348-nobody dared ask [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel any questions about it . Rumour and surmise laid the guilt at [Barney Snaith]140-barney ’s door because diligent inquiry among [the other maids at [the hotel]1061-the hotel]1060-the other maids at the hotel revealed the fact that [nobody there]1062-nobody there had ever seen [Cissy Gay]182-cissy “ with [a fellow]2430-a fellow . ”[182-cissy] [She]182-cissy had “ kept [herself]182-cissy to [herself]182-cissy ”[1063-they] [they]1063-they said , rather resentfully . “ Too good for [our]1063-they dances . And now look ! ”[1063-they]

[The baby]1064-the baby had lived for a year . After [its]1064-the baby death [Cissy]182-cissy faded away . Two years ago [Dr. Marsh]117-dr. marsh had given [her]182-cissy only six months to live — [her]182-cissy lungs were hopelessly diseased . But [she]182-cissy was still alive . [Nobody]348-nobody went to see [her]182-cissy . [Women]2354-women would not go to [[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s house]1067-roaring abel ’s house . [Mr. Bently]1068-mr. bently had gone once , when [he]1068-mr. bently knew [Abel]141-roaring abel was away , but [the dreadful old creature who was scrubbing the kitchen floor]1069-the dreadful old creature who was scrubbing the kitchen floor told [him]1068-mr. bently [Cissy]182-cissy would n’t see [any one]444-any one . [The old cousin]1071-the old cousin had died and [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel had had [two or three disreputable housekeepers]1072-two or three disreputable housekeepers — the only kind who could be prevailed on to go to [a house where [a girl]2189-a girl was dying of consumption]1073-a house where a girl was dying of consumption . But [the last one]1075-the last one had left and [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel had now [no one to wait on [Cissy]182-cissy and “ do ”[141-roaring abel] for [him]141-roaring abel]1076-no one to wait on cissy and “ do ” for him . This was the burden of [his]141-roaring abel plaint to [Valancy]107-valancy and [he]141-roaring abel condemned [the “ hypocrites ”[141-roaring abel] of [Deerwood]5-deerwood and [its surrounding communities]1078-its surrounding communities]1077-the “ hypocrites ” of deerwood and its surrounding communities with some rich , meaty oaths that happened to reach [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles ’ ears as [she]97-cousin stickles passed through [the hall]1079-the hall and nearly finished [the poor lady]1080-the poor lady . Was [Valancy]107-valancy listening to that ?

[Valancy]107-valancy hardly noticed the profanity . [Her]107-valancy attention was focussed on the horrible thought of [poor , unhappy , disgraced [little Cissy Gay]182-cissy , ill and helpless in [that forlorn old house out on [the Mistawis road]1083-the mistawis road]1082-that forlorn old house out on the mistawis road , without a soul to help or comfort [her]182-cissy]1081-poor , unhappy , disgraced little cissy gay , ill and helpless in that forlorn old house out on the mistawis road , without a soul to help or comfort her . And this in [a nominally Christian community in the year of grace nineteen]1084-a nominally christian community in the year of grace nineteen and some odd !

“ Do [you]107-valancy mean to say that [Cissy]182-cissy is all alone [there]448-there now , with [nobody]348-nobody to do anything for [her]182-cissy — [nobody]348-nobody ? ”[107-valancy]

“ Oh , [she]182-cissy can move about a bit and get a bite and sup when [she]182-cissy wants it . But [she]182-cissy ca n’t work . It ’s [d]2434-d —— d hard for [a man]335-a man to work hard all day and go [home]612-home at night tired and hungry and cook [his]335-a man own meals . Sometimes [I]141-roaring abel ’m sorry [I]141-roaring abel kicked [old Rachel Edwards]198-old rachel edwards out . ”[141-roaring abel] [Abel]141-roaring abel described [Rachel]198-old rachel edwards picturesquely .

“ [Her]198-old rachel edwards face looked as if it had wore out a hundred bodies . And [she]198-old rachel edwards moped . Talk about temper ! Temper ’s nothing to moping . [She]198-old rachel edwards was too slow to catch worms , and dirty — d —— d dirty . [I]107-valancy ai n’t unreasonable — [I]107-valancy know [a man]335-a man has to eat [his]335-a man peck before [he]335-a man dies — but [she]198-old rachel edwards went over the limit . What d’ye sp’ose [I]107-valancy saw [that lady]2438-that lady do ? [She]2438-that lady ’d made some punkin jam — had it on the table in glass jars with the tops off . [The dawg]2439-the dawg got up on the table and stuck [his]2439-the dawg paw into one of them . What did [she]2438-that lady do ? [She]2438-that lady jest took holt of the dawg and wrung the syrup off [his]2439-the dawg paw back into the jar ! Then screwed the top on and set it in the pantry . [I]107-valancy sets open the door and says to [her]2438-that lady , ‘ Go ! ’ [The dame]2440-the dame went , and [I]107-valancy fired the jars of punkin after [her]2438-that lady , two at a time . Thought [I]107-valancy ’d die laughing to see [old Rachel]198-old rachel edwards run — with [them]2441-them punkin jars raining after [her]2438-that lady . [She]2438-that lady ’s told everywhere [I]107-valancy ’m crazy , so [nobody’ll]2442-nobody’ll come for love or money . ”[107-valancy]

“ But [Cissy]182-cissy must have some one to look after [her]182-cissy , ”[107-valancy] insisted [Valancy]107-valancy , whose mind was centred on this aspect of the case . [She]107-valancy did not care whether [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel had any one to cook for [him]141-roaring abel or not . But [her]107-valancy heart was wrung for [Cecilia Gay]182-cissy .

“ Oh , [she]2438-that lady gits on . [Barney Snaith]140-barney always drops in when [he]141-roaring abel ’s passing and does anything [she]2438-that lady wants done . Brings [her]2438-that lady oranges and flowers and things . There ’s [a Christian]2443-a christian for [you]2444-you . Yet [that sanctimonious , snivelling parcel of [St. [Andrew]199-andrew ’s people]2446-st. andrew ’s people]2445-that sanctimonious , snivelling parcel of st. andrew ’s people would n’t be seen on the same side of [the road]756-the road with [him]141-roaring abel . [Their]2446-st. andrew ’s people dogs’ll go to [heaven]2448-heaven before [they]2446-st. andrew ’s people do . And [[their]2446-st. andrew ’s people minister]2449-their minister — slick as if the cat had licked [him]141-roaring abel ! ”[107-valancy]

“ There are plenty of [good people]2450-good people , both in [St. Andrew ’s]35-st. andrew ’s and [St. George]200-st. george ’s , who would be kind to [Cissy]182-cissy if [you]2444-you would behave [yourself]2444-you , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy severely . “ [They]2446-st. andrew ’s people ’re afraid to go near [[your]2444-you place]2451-your place . ”[107-valancy]

“ Because [I]107-valancy ’m such [a sad old dog]2452-a sad old dog ? But [I]107-valancy do n’t bite — never bit any one in [my]107-valancy life . A few loose words spilled around do n’t hurt [any one]444-any one . And [I]107-valancy ’m not asking [people]2198-people to come . Do n’t want ’em poking and prying about . What [I]107-valancy want is [a housekeeper]2455-a housekeeper . If [I]107-valancy shaved every Sunday and went to [church]501-church [I]107-valancy ’d get all the housekeepers [I]107-valancy ’d want . [I]107-valancy ’d be respectable then . But what ’s the use of going to [church]501-church when it ’s all settled by predestination ? Tell [me]107-valancy that , [Miss.]201-miss. ”[107-valancy]

“ Is it ? ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ Yes . Ca n’t git around it nohow . Wish [I]107-valancy could . [I]107-valancy do n’t want either [heaven]2448-heaven or hell for steady . Wish [a man]335-a man could have ’em mixed in equal proportions . ”[107-valancy]

“ Is n’t that the way it is in [this world]2203-this world ? ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy thoughtfully — but rather as if [her]107-valancy thought was concerned with something else than theology .

“ No , no , ”[141-roaring abel] boomed [Abel]141-roaring abel , striking a tremendous blow on a stubborn nail . “ There ’s too much hell here — entirely too much hell . That ’s why [I]141-roaring abel get drunk so often . It sets [you]2461-you free for a little while — free from [yourself]2461-you — yes , by [God]103-god , free from predestination . Ever try it ? ”[141-roaring abel]

“ No , [I]107-valancy ’ve another way of getting free , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy absently . “ But about [Cissy]182-cissy now . [She]182-cissy must have [some one]359-some one to look after [her]182-cissy — — ”[107-valancy]

“ What are [you]141-roaring abel harping on [Sis]202-sis for ? Seems to [me]141-roaring abel [you]141-roaring abel ai n’t bothered much about [her]182-cissy up to now . [You]141-roaring abel never even come to see [her]182-cissy . And [she]182-cissy used to like [you]141-roaring abel so well . ”[141-roaring abel]

“ [I]107-valancy should have , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . “ But never mind . [You]141-roaring abel could n’t understand . The point is — [you]141-roaring abel must have [a housekeeper]2455-a housekeeper . ”[107-valancy]

“ Where am [I]141-roaring abel to get one ? [I]141-roaring abel can pay decent wages if [I]141-roaring abel could get [a decent woman]2464-a decent woman . [D’ye]2465-d’ye think [I]141-roaring abel like [old hags]2466-old hags ? ”[141-roaring abel]

“ Will [I]107-valancy do ? ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

[CHAPTER XV]203-chapter xv

“ Let [us]2467-us be calm , ”[108-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin . “ Let [us]2467-us be perfectly calm . ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ Calm ! ”[99-mrs. frederick] [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick wrung [her]99-mrs. frederick hands . “ How can [I]99-mrs. frederick be calm — how could [anybody]454-anybody be calm under such a disgrace as this ? ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ Why in [the world]321-the world did [you]107-valancy let [her]2470-her go ? ”[107-valancy] asked [Uncle James]107-valancy .

“ Let [her]2470-her ! How could [I]108-uncle benjamin stop [her]2470-her , [James]107-valancy ? It seems [she]2470-her packed the big valise and sent it away with [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel when [he]141-roaring abel went [home]612-home after supper , while [Christine]121-christine stickles and [I]108-uncle benjamin were out in [the kitchen]2472-the kitchen . Then [Doss]106-doss [herself]106-doss came down with [her]106-doss little satchel , dressed in [her]106-doss green serge suit . [I]108-uncle benjamin felt a terrible premonition . [I]108-uncle benjamin ca n’t tell [you]107-valancy how it was , but [I]108-uncle benjamin seemed to know that [Doss]106-doss was going to do something dreadful . ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ It ’s a pity [you]107-valancy could n’t have had [your]107-valancy premonition a little sooner , ”[108-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin drily .

“ [I]108-uncle benjamin said , ‘ [Doss]106-doss , where are [you]106-doss going ? ’ and [she]106-doss said , ‘ [I]108-uncle benjamin am going to look for [[my]108-uncle benjamin Blue Castle]2473-my blue castle . ’ ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ Would n’t [you]107-valancy think that would convince [Marsh]117-dr. marsh that [her]106-doss mind is affected ? ”[107-valancy] interjected [Uncle James]107-valancy .

“ And [I]108-uncle benjamin said , ‘ [Valancy]107-valancy , what do [you]106-doss mean ? ’ And [she]106-doss said , ‘ [I]108-uncle benjamin am going to keep [house]2474-house for [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel and [nurse Cissy]182-cissy . [He]141-roaring abel will pay [me]108-uncle benjamin thirty dollars a month . ’ [I]108-uncle benjamin wonder [I]108-uncle benjamin did n’t drop dead on the spot . ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ [You]107-valancy should n’t have let [her]106-doss go — [you]107-valancy should n’t have let [her]106-doss out of [the house]364-the house , ”[107-valancy] said [Uncle James]107-valancy . “ [You]107-valancy should have locked the door — anything — — ”[107-valancy]

“ [She]106-doss was between [me]108-uncle benjamin and the front door . And [you]107-valancy ca n’t realise how determined [she]106-doss was . [She]106-doss was like a rock . That ’s the strangest thing of all about [her]106-doss . [She]106-doss used to be so good and obedient , and now [she]106-doss ’s neither to hold nor bind . But [I]108-uncle benjamin said everything [I]108-uncle benjamin could think of to bring [her]106-doss to [her]106-doss senses . [I]108-uncle benjamin asked [her]106-doss if [she]106-doss had no regard for [her]106-doss reputation . [I]108-uncle benjamin said to [her]106-doss solemnly , ‘ [Doss]106-doss , when [a woman]414-a woman ’s reputation is once smirched nothing can ever make it spotless again . [Your]106-doss character will be gone for ever if [you]106-doss go to [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s to wait on [a bad girl like [Sis Gay]202-sis]2477-a bad girl like sis gay . ’ And [she]106-doss said , ‘ [I]108-uncle benjamin do n’t believe [Cissy]182-cissy was [a bad girl]2478-a bad girl , but [I]108-uncle benjamin do n’t care if [she]182-cissy was . ’ Those were [her]106-doss very words , ‘ [I]108-uncle benjamin do n’t care if [she]182-cissy was . ’ ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ [She]182-cissy has lost all sense of decency , ”[108-uncle benjamin] exploded [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin .

“ ‘ [Cissy Gay]182-cissy is dying , ’ [she]106-doss said , ‘ and it ’s a shame and disgrace that [she]182-cissy is dying in [a Christian community with [no one]515-no one to do anything for [her]182-cissy]2479-a christian community with no one to do anything for her . Whatever [she]182-cissy ’s been or done , [she]182-cissy ’s [a human being]2481-a human being . ’ ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ Well , [you]108-uncle benjamin know , when it comes to that , [I]107-valancy suppose [she]182-cissy is , ”[107-valancy] said [Uncle James]107-valancy with the air of one making a splendid concession .

“ [I]108-uncle benjamin asked [Doss]106-doss if [she]182-cissy had no regard for appearances . [She]182-cissy said , ‘ [I]108-uncle benjamin ’ve been keeping up appearances all [my]108-uncle benjamin life . Now [I]108-uncle benjamin ’m going in for realities . Appearances can go hang ! ’ Go hang ! ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ An outrageous thing ! ”[108-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin violently . “ An outrageous thing ! ”[108-uncle benjamin]

Which relieved [his]108-uncle benjamin feelings , but did n’t help [any one else]1085-any one else .

[Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick wept . [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles took up the refrain between [her]97-cousin stickles moans of despair .

“ [I]99-mrs. frederick told [her]182-cissy — [we]2482-we both told [her]182-cissy — that [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel had certainly killed [[his]141-roaring abel wife]885-his wife in one of [his]141-roaring abel drunken rages and would kill [her]182-cissy . [She]182-cissy laughed and said , ‘ [I]99-mrs. frederick ’m not afraid of [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel . [He]141-roaring abel wo n’t kill [me]99-mrs. frederick , and [he]141-roaring abel ’s too old for [me]99-mrs. frederick to be afraid of [his]141-roaring abel gallantries . ’ What did [she]182-cissy mean ? What are [gallantries]2484-gallantries ? ”[99-mrs. frederick]

[Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick saw that [she]99-mrs. frederick must stop crying if [she]99-mrs. frederick wanted to regain control of the conversation .

“ [I]99-mrs. frederick said to [her]182-cissy , ‘ [Valancy]107-valancy , if [you]182-cissy have no regard for [your]182-cissy own reputation and [[your]182-cissy family]2485-your family ’s standing , have [you]182-cissy none for [my]99-mrs. frederick feelings ? ’ [She]182-cissy said , ‘ None . ’ Just like that , ‘ None ! ’ ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ [Insane people]2486-insane people never do have any regard for [other people]428-other people ’s feelings , ”[108-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin . “ That ’s one of the symptoms . ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ [I]99-mrs. frederick broke out into tears then , and [she]182-cissy said , ‘ Come now , [Mother]96-mother , be a good sport . [I]99-mrs. frederick ’m going to do an act of Christian charity , and as for the damage it will do [my]99-mrs. frederick reputation , why , [you]96-mother know [I]99-mrs. frederick have n’t any matrimonial chances anyhow , so what does it matter ? ’ And with that [she]182-cissy turned and went out . ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ The last words [I]97-cousin stickles said to [her]182-cissy , ”[97-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles pathetically , “ were , ‘ Who will rub [my]97-cousin stickles back at nights now ? ’ And [she]182-cissy said — [she]182-cissy said — but no , [I]97-cousin stickles can not repeat it . ”[97-cousin stickles]

“ Nonsense , ”[108-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin . “ Out with it . This is no time to be squeamish . ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ [She]182-cissy said”—Cousin[97-cousin stickles] [Stickles]97-cousin stickles ’ voice was little more than a whisper—“she said—‘Oh , darn ! ’ ”[97-cousin stickles]

“ To think [I]99-mrs. frederick should have lived to hear [[my]99-mrs. frederick daughter]2488-my daughter swearing ! ”[99-mrs. frederick] sobbed [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick .

“ [It]2489-it — it was only imitation swearing , ”[97-cousin stickles] faltered [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles , desirous of smoothing things over now that the worst was out . But [she]97-cousin stickles had never told about [the bannister]829-the bannister .

“ It will be only a step from that to real swearing , ”[107-valancy] said [Uncle James]107-valancy sternly .

“ The worst of this”—Mrs[99-mrs. frederick] . [Frederick]99-mrs. frederick hunted for a dry spot on [her]97-cousin stickles handkerchief—“is that [every one]418-every one will know now that [she]97-cousin stickles is deranged . [We]2491-we ca n’t keep it a secret any longer . Oh , [I]99-mrs. frederick can not bear it ! ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ [You]108-uncle benjamin should have been stricter with [her]97-cousin stickles when [she]97-cousin stickles was young , ”[108-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin .

“ [I]99-mrs. frederick do n’t see how [I]99-mrs. frederick could have been , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick — truthfully enough .

“ The worst feature of the case is that [Snaith scoundrel]140-barney is always hanging around [Roaring Abel ’s]141-roaring abel , ”[107-valancy] said [Uncle James]107-valancy . “ [I]107-valancy shall be thankful if nothing worse comes of [this mad freak]2492-this mad freak than a few weeks at [Roaring Abel ’s]141-roaring abel . [Cissy Gay]182-cissy ca n’t live much longer . ”[107-valancy]

“ And [she]97-cousin stickles did n’t even take [her]97-cousin stickles flannel petticoat ! ”[97-cousin stickles] lamented [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles .

“ [I]108-uncle benjamin ’ll see [Ambrose Marsh]117-dr. marsh again about this , ”[108-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin — meaning [Valancy]107-valancy , not the flannel petticoat .

“ [I]107-valancy ’ll see [Lawyer Ferguson]204-lawyer ferguson , ”[107-valancy] said [Uncle James]107-valancy .

“ Meanwhile , ”[108-uncle benjamin] added [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin , “ let [us]2493-us be calm . ”[108-uncle benjamin]

[CHAPTER XVI

Valancy]107-valancy had walked out to [[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s house]1067-roaring abel ’s house on [the Mistawis road]1083-the mistawis road under a sky of purple and amber , with a queer exhilaration and expectancy in [her]107-valancy heart . Back there , behind [her]107-valancy , [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles were crying — over [themselves]1090-themselves , not over [her]107-valancy . But here the wind was in [her]107-valancy face , soft , dew - wet , cool , blowing along [the grassy roads]1091-the grassy roads . Oh , [she]107-valancy loved the wind ! The robins were whistling sleepily in the firs along the way and the moist air was fragrant with the tang of balsam . [Big cars]1092-big cars went purring past in the violet dusk — the stream of summer tourists to [Muskoka]16-muskoka had already begun — but [Valancy]107-valancy did not envy [any of [[their]1092-big cars occupants]1094-their occupants]1093-any of their occupants . [[Muskoka]16-muskoka cottages]1095-muskoka cottages might be charming , but beyond , in the sunset skies , among the spires of the firs , [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle towered . [She]107-valancy brushed the old years and habits and inhibitions away from [her]107-valancy like dead leaves . [She]107-valancy would not be littered with them .

[[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house]1097-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house was situated about three miles from [the village]638-the village , on the very edge of “ up back , ”[107-valancy] as [the sparsely settled , hilly , wooded country around [Mistawis]27-mistawis]1099-the sparsely settled , hilly , wooded country around mistawis was called vernacularly . [It]1097-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house did not , it must be confessed , look much like [a Blue Castle]485-a blue castle .

[It]1097-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house had once been [a snug place]1101-a snug place enough in the days when [Abel Gay]141-roaring abel had been young and prosperous , and the punning , arched sign over the gate—“A. Gay , [Carpenter]2494-carpenter , ”[141-roaring abel] had been fine and freshly painted . Now [it]1097-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house was [a faded , dreary old place]1102-a faded , dreary old place , with a leprous , patched roof and shutters hanging askew . [Abel]141-roaring abel never seemed to do any carpenter jobs about [[his]141-roaring abel own house]1103-his own house . [It]1097-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house had a listless air , as if tired of life . There was a dwindling grove of ragged , crone - like old spruces behind [it]1097-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house . [The garden]1104-the garden , which [Cissy]182-cissy used to keep neat and pretty , had run wild . On two sides of [the house]364-the house were fields full of nothing but mulleins . Behind [the house]364-the house was a long stretch of useless barrens , full of scrub pines and spruces , with here and there a blossoming bit of wild cherry , running back to a belt of timber on [the shores of [Lake Mistawis]21-lake mistawis]1107-the shores of lake mistawis , two miles away . [A rough , rocky , boulder - strewn lane]1108-a rough , rocky , boulder - strewn lane ran through [it]1097-roaring abel ’s rambling , tumble - down old house to [the woods]2193-the woods — [a lane white with pestiferous , beautiful daisies]1110-a lane white with pestiferous , beautiful daisies .

[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel met [Valancy]107-valancy at the door .

“ So [you]107-valancy ’ve come , ”[141-roaring abel] [he]141-roaring abel said incredulously . “ [I]141-roaring abel never s’posed that ruck of [Stirlings]93-the stirlings would let [you]107-valancy . ”[141-roaring abel]

[Valancy]107-valancy showed all [her]107-valancy pointed teeth in a grin .

“ [They]2495-they could n’t stop [me]107-valancy . ”[107-valancy]

“ [I]141-roaring abel did n’t think [you]107-valancy ’d so much spunk , ”[141-roaring abel] said [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel admiringly . “ And look at the nice ankles of [her]107-valancy , ”[141-roaring abel] [he]141-roaring abel added , as [he]141-roaring abel stepped aside to let [her]107-valancy in .

If [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles had heard this [she]97-cousin stickles would have been certain that [Valancy]107-valancy ’s doom , earthly and unearthly , was sealed . But [Abel]141-roaring abel ’s superannuated gallantry did not worry [Valancy]107-valancy . Besides , this was the first compliment [she]107-valancy had ever received in [her]107-valancy life and [she]107-valancy found [herself]107-valancy liking it . [She]107-valancy sometimes suspected [she]107-valancy had nice ankles , but [nobody]348-nobody had ever mentioned it before . In [the Stirling clan]461-the stirling clan ankles were among the unmentionables .

[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel took [her]107-valancy into [the kitchen]2472-the kitchen , where [Cissy Gay]182-cissy was lying on the sofa , breathing quickly , with little scarlet spots on [her]182-cissy hollow cheeks . [Valancy]107-valancy had not seen [Cecilia Gay]182-cissy for years . Then [she]182-cissy had been such [a pretty creature]1114-a pretty creature , [a slight , blossom - like girl , with soft , golden hair , clear - cut , almost waxen features , and large , beautiful blue eyes]1115-a slight , blossom - like girl , with soft , golden hair , clear - cut , almost waxen features , and large , beautiful blue eyes . [She]107-valancy was shocked at the change in [her]182-cissy . Could this be sweet [Cissy]182-cissy — this pitiful little thing that looked like a tired , broken flower ? [She]182-cissy had wept all the beauty out of [her]182-cissy eyes ; they looked too big — enormous — in [her]182-cissy wasted face . The last time [Valancy]107-valancy had seen [Cecilia Gay]182-cissy those faded , piteous eyes had been limpid , shadowy blue pools aglow with mirth . The contrast was so terrible that [Valancy]107-valancy ’s own eyes filled with tears . [She]107-valancy knelt down by [Cissy]182-cissy and put [her]107-valancy arms about [her]182-cissy .

“ [Cissy]182-cissy dear , [I]107-valancy ’ve come to look after [you]182-cissy . [I]107-valancy ’ll stay with [you]182-cissy till — till — as long as [you]182-cissy want [me]107-valancy . ”[107-valancy]

“ Oh ! ”[182-cissy] [Cissy]182-cissy put [her]182-cissy thin arms about [Valancy]107-valancy ’s neck . “ Oh — will [you]107-valancy ? It ’s been so — lonely . [I]182-cissy can wait on [myself]182-cissy — but it ’s been so lonely . [It]2496-it — would just be like — heaven — to have [some one]359-some one here — like [you]182-cissy . [You]182-cissy were always — so sweet to [me]182-cissy — long ago . ”[182-cissy]

[Valancy]107-valancy held [Cissy]182-cissy close . [She]107-valancy was suddenly happy . Here was [some one who needed [her]107-valancy]1116-some one who needed her — [some one [she]107-valancy could help]1117-some one she could help . [She]107-valancy was no longer a superfluity . Old things had passed away ; everything had become new .

“ Most things are predestinated , but some are just darn sheer luck , ”[141-roaring abel] said [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel , complacently smoking [his]141-roaring abel pipe in the corner .

CHAPTER XVII

When [Valancy]107-valancy had lived for a week at [[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s]1118-roaring abel ’s [she]107-valancy felt as if years had separated [her]107-valancy from [her]107-valancy old life and [all the people [she]107-valancy had known in it]1119-all the people she had known in it . [They]1120-they were beginning to seem remote — dream - like — far - away — and as the days went on they seemed still more so , until they ceased to matter altogether .

[She]107-valancy was happy . [Nobody]348-nobody ever bothered [her]107-valancy with conundrums or insisted on giving [her]107-valancy Purple Pills . [Nobody]348-nobody called [her]107-valancy Doss or worried [her]107-valancy about catching cold . There were no quilts to piece , no abominable rubber - plant to water , no ice - cold maternal tantrums to endure . [She]107-valancy could be alone whenever [she]107-valancy liked , go to bed when [she]107-valancy liked , sneeze when [she]107-valancy liked . In the long , wondrous , northern twilights , when [Cissy]182-cissy was asleep and [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel away , [she]107-valancy could sit for hours on [the shaky back verandah steps]1123-the shaky back verandah steps , looking out over [the barrens]1124-the barrens to [the hills beyond]1125-the hills beyond , covered with their fine , purple bloom , listening to the friendly wind singing wild , sweet melodies in the little spruces , and drinking in the aroma of the sunned grasses , until darkness flowed over [the landscape]1126-the landscape like a cool , welcome wave .

Sometimes of an afternoon , when [Cissy]182-cissy was strong enough , [the two girls]1127-the two girls went into [the barrens]1124-the barrens and looked at the wood - flowers . But [they]1127-the two girls did not pick any . [Valancy]107-valancy had read to [Cissy]182-cissy the gospel thereof according to [John Foster]114-john foster : “ It is a pity to gather wood - flowers . [They]1127-the two girls lose half [their]1127-the two girls witchery away from [the green and the flicker]2498-the green and the flicker . The way to enjoy wood - flowers is to track [them]1127-the two girls down to [[their]1127-the two girls remote haunts]2499-their remote haunts — gloat over [them]1127-the two girls — and then leave [them]1127-the two girls with backward glances , taking with [us]2500-us only the beguiling memory of [their]1127-the two girls grace and fragrance . ”[114-john foster]

[Valancy]107-valancy was in the midst of realities after a lifetime of unrealities . And busy — very busy . [The house]364-the house had to be cleaned . Not for nothing had [Valancy]107-valancy been brought up in the Stirling habits of neatness and cleanliness . If [she]107-valancy found satisfaction in cleaning [dirty rooms]1130-dirty rooms [she]107-valancy got [her]107-valancy fill of it [there]448-there . [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel thought [she]107-valancy was foolish to bother doing so much more than [she]107-valancy was asked to do , but [he]141-roaring abel did not interfere with [her]107-valancy . [He]141-roaring abel was very well satisfied with [his]141-roaring abel bargain . [Valancy]107-valancy was [a good cook]1132-a good cook . [Abel]141-roaring abel said [she]107-valancy got a flavour into things . The only fault [he]141-roaring abel found with [her]107-valancy was that [she]107-valancy did not sing at [her]107-valancy work .

“ [Folks]2501-folks should always sing at [their]2501-folks work , ”[141-roaring abel] [he]141-roaring abel insisted . “ Sounds cheerful - like . ”[141-roaring abel]

“ Not always , ”[107-valancy] retorted [Valancy]107-valancy . “ Fancy [a butcher]2502-a butcher singing at [his]2502-a butcher work . Or [an undertaker]2503-an undertaker . ”[107-valancy]

[Abel]141-roaring abel burst into [his]141-roaring abel great broad laugh .

“ There ’s no getting the better of [you]107-valancy . [You]107-valancy ’ve got an answer every time . [I]141-roaring abel should think [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings would be glad to be rid of [you]107-valancy . [They]1135-they do n’t like being sassed back . ”[141-roaring abel]

During the day [Abel]141-roaring abel was generally away from [home]612-home — if not working , then shooting or fishing with [Barney Snaith]140-barney . [He]141-roaring abel generally came [home]612-home at nights — always very late and often very drunk . The first night [they]1135-they heard [him]141-roaring abel come howling into [the yard]1136-the yard , [Cissy]182-cissy had told [Valancy]107-valancy not to be afraid .

“ [Father]206-father never does anything — [he]206-father just makes a noise . ”[182-cissy]

[Valancy]107-valancy , lying on the sofa in [[Cissy]182-cissy ’s room]1137-cissy ’s room , where [she]182-cissy had elected to sleep , lest [Cissy]182-cissy should need attention in the night — [Cissy]182-cissy would never have called [her]107-valancy — was not at all afraid , and said so . By the time [Abel]141-roaring abel had got [his]141-roaring abel horses put away , the roaring stage had passed and [he]141-roaring abel was in [[his]141-roaring abel room]1138-his room at the end of [the hall]1079-the hall crying and praying . [Valancy]107-valancy could still hear [his]141-roaring abel dismal moans when [she]182-cissy went calmly to sleep . For the most part , [Abel]141-roaring abel was a good - natured creature , but occasionally [he]141-roaring abel had a temper . [Once Valancy]107-valancy asked [him]141-roaring abel coolly :

“ What is the use of getting in a rage ? ”[107-valancy]

“ It ’s such a d —— d relief , ”[141-roaring abel] said [Abel]141-roaring abel .

[They]1140-they both burst out laughing together .

“ [You]107-valancy ’re [a great little sport]2504-a great little sport , ”[141-roaring abel] said [Abel]141-roaring abel admiringly . “ Do n’t mind [my]141-roaring abel bad French . [I]141-roaring abel do n’t mean a thing by it . Jest habit . Say , [I]141-roaring abel like [a woman that ai n’t afraid to speak up to [me]141-roaring abel]2505-a woman that ai n’t afraid to speak up to me . [Sis]202-sis there was always too meek — too meek . That ’s why [she]202-sis got adrift . [I]141-roaring abel like [you]107-valancy . ”[141-roaring abel]

“ All the same , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy determinedly , “ there is no use in sending things to hell as [you]107-valancy ’re always doing . And [I]107-valancy ’m not going to have [you]107-valancy tracking mud all over a floor [I]107-valancy ’ve just scrubbed . [You]107-valancy must use the scraper whether [you]107-valancy consign it to perdition or not . ”[107-valancy]

[Cissy]182-cissy loved the cleanness and neatness . [She]182-cissy had kept it so , too , until [her]182-cissy strength failed . [She]182-cissy was very pitifully happy because [she]182-cissy had [Valancy]107-valancy with [her]182-cissy . It had been so terrible — the long , lonely days and nights with no companionship save [those dreadful old women who came to work]1141-those dreadful old women who came to work . [Cissy]182-cissy had hated and feared [them]1141-those dreadful old women who came to work . [She]182-cissy clung to [Valancy]107-valancy like [a child]520-a child .

There was no doubt that [Cissy]182-cissy was dying . Yet at no time did [she]182-cissy seem alarmingly ill . [She]182-cissy did not even cough a great deal . Most days [she]182-cissy was able to get up and dress — sometimes even to work about in [the garden]1104-the garden or [the barrens]1124-the barrens for an hour or two . For a few weeks after [Valancy]107-valancy ’s coming [she]182-cissy seemed so much better that [Valancy]107-valancy began to hope [she]182-cissy might get well . But [Cissy]182-cissy shook [her]182-cissy head .

“ No , [I]182-cissy ca n’t get well . [My]182-cissy lungs are almost gone . And [I]182-cissy — don’t want to . [I]182-cissy ’m so tired , [Valancy]107-valancy . Only dying can rest [me]182-cissy . But it ’s lovely to have [you]107-valancy here — [you’ll]107-valancy never know how much it means to [me]182-cissy . But [Valancy]107-valancy — [you]107-valancy work too hard . [You]107-valancy do n’t need to — [Father]206-father only wants [his]206-father meals cooked . [I]182-cissy do n’t think [you]107-valancy are strong [yourself]107-valancy . [You]107-valancy turn so pale sometimes . And those drops [you]107-valancy take . Are [you]107-valancy well , [dear]2211-dear ? ”[182-cissy]

“ [I]107-valancy ’m all right , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy lightly . [She]107-valancy would not have [Cissy]182-cissy worried . “ And [I]107-valancy ’m not working hard . [I]107-valancy ’m glad to have some work to do — something that really wants to be done . ”[107-valancy]

“ [Then”—Cissy]207-then”—cissy[107-valancy] slipped [her]107-valancy hand wistfully into [Valancy’s—“don’t]208-valancy’s—“don’t let ’s talk any more about [my]107-valancy being sick . Let ’s just forget it . Let ’s pretend [I]107-valancy ’m [a little girl]2507-a little girl again — and [you]107-valancy have come here to play with [me]107-valancy . [I]107-valancy used to wish that long ago — wish that [you]107-valancy could come . [I]107-valancy knew [you]107-valancy could n’t , of course . But how [I]107-valancy did wish it ! [You]107-valancy always seemed so different from [the other girls]2508-the other girls — so kind and sweet — and as if [you]107-valancy had something in [yourself]107-valancy [nobody]348-nobody knew about — some dear , pretty secret . Had [you]107-valancy , [Valancy]107-valancy ? ”[107-valancy]

“ [I]107-valancy had [[my]107-valancy Blue Castle]2473-my blue castle , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , laughing a little . [She]107-valancy was pleased that [Cissy]182-cissy had thought of [her]107-valancy like this . [She]107-valancy had never suspected that [anybody]454-anybody liked or admired or wondered about [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy told [Cissy]182-cissy all about [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle . [She]107-valancy had never told [any one]444-any one about it before .

“ [Every one]418-every one has [a Blue Castle]485-a blue castle , [I]182-cissy think , ”[182-cissy] said [Cissy]182-cissy softly . “ Only [every one]418-every one has a different name for [it]485-a blue castle . [I]182-cissy had [mine]182-cissy — once . ”[182-cissy]

[She]107-valancy put [her]107-valancy two thin little hands over [her]107-valancy face . [She]107-valancy did not tell [Valancy]107-valancy — then — who had destroyed [[her]107-valancy [Blue Castle]2-the blue castle]400-her blue castle . But [Valancy]107-valancy knew that , whoever it was , it was not [Barney Snaith]140-barney .

[CHAPTER XVIII

Valancy]107-valancy was acquainted with [Barney]140-barney by now — well acquainted , it seemed , though [she]107-valancy had spoken to [him]1149-his only a few times . But then [she]107-valancy had felt just as well acquainted with [him]1149-his the first time [they]1150-they had met . [She]107-valancy had been in [the garden]1104-the garden at twilight , hunting for a few stalks of white narcissus for [[Cissy]182-cissy ’s room]1137-cissy ’s room when [she]107-valancy heard that terrible old Grey Slosson coming down through [the woods]2193-the woods from [Mistawis]27-mistawis — [one]332-one could hear it miles away . [Valancy]107-valancy did not look up as it drew near , thumping over the rocks in [that crazy lane]1155-that crazy lane . [She]107-valancy had never looked up , though [Barney]140-barney had gone racketting past every evening since [she]107-valancy had been at [Roaring Abel ’s]141-roaring abel . This time [he]1149-his did not racket past . [The old Grey Slosson]210-lady jane stopped with even more terrible noises than it made going . [Valancy]107-valancy was conscious that [Barney]140-barney had sprung from it and was leaning over the ramshackle gate . [She]107-valancy suddenly straightened up and looked into [his]1149-his face . [Their]1156-their eyes met — [Valancy]107-valancy was suddenly conscious of a delicious weakness . Was one of [her]107-valancy heart attacks coming on?—But this was a new symptom .

[His]1149-his eyes , which [she]107-valancy had always thought brown , now seen close , were deep violet — translucent and intense . Neither of [his]1149-his eyebrows looked like the other . [He]1149-his was thin — too thin — [she]107-valancy wished [she]107-valancy could feed [him]1149-his up a bit — [she]107-valancy wished [she]107-valancy could sew the buttons on [his]1149-his coat — and make [him]1149-his cut [his]1149-his hair — and shave every day . There was something in [his]1149-his face — [one]332-one hardly knew what it was . Tiredness ? Sadness ? Disillusionment ? [He]1149-his had dimples in [his]1149-his thin cheeks when [he]1149-his smiled . All these thoughts flashed through [Valancy]107-valancy ’s mind in that one moment while [his]1149-his eyes looked into [hers]107-valancy .

“ Good - evening , [Miss Stirling]175-olive . ”[1149-his]

Nothing could be more commonplace and conventional . [Any one]444-any one might have said it . But [Barney Snaith]140-barney had a way of saying things that gave [them]1159-them poignancy . When [he]1149-his said good - evening [you]1160-you felt that it was a good evening and that it was partly [his]1149-his doing that it was . Also , [you]1160-you felt that some of the credit was [yours]1160-you . [Valancy]107-valancy felt all this vaguely , but [she]107-valancy could n’t imagine why [she]107-valancy was trembling from head to foot — it must be [her]107-valancy heart . If only [he]1149-his did n’t notice it !

“ [I]140-barney ’m going over to [the Port]2254-the port , ”[140-barney] [Barney]140-barney was saying . “ Can [I]140-barney acquire merit by getting or doing anything there for [you]140-barney or [Cissy]182-cissy ? ”[140-barney]

“ Will [you]1149-his get some salt codfish for [us]2515-us ? ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . It was the only thing [she]107-valancy could think of . [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel had expressed a desire that day for a dinner of boiled salt codfish . When [[her]107-valancy knights]1161-her knights came riding to [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle , [Valancy]107-valancy had sent [them]1161-her knights on many a quest , but [she]107-valancy had never asked any of [them]1161-her knights to get [her]107-valancy salt codfish .

“ Certainly . [You]1149-his ’re sure there ’s nothing else ? [Lots of room in [Lady Jane Grey Slosson]210-lady jane]2516-lots of room in lady jane grey slosson . And [she]210-lady jane always gets back some time , does [Lady Jane]210-lady jane . ”[107-valancy]

“ [I]107-valancy do n’t think there ’s anything more , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy knew [he]1163-i would bring oranges for [Cissy]182-cissy anyhow — [he]1163-i always did .

[Barney]140-barney did not turn away at once . [He]1163-i was silent for a little . Then [he]1163-i said , slowly and whimsically :

“ [Miss Stirling]175-olive , [you]175-olive ’re a brick ! [You]175-olive ’re a whole cartload of bricks . To come here and look after [Cissy]182-cissy — under the circumstances . ”[1163-i]

“ There ’s nothing so bricky about that , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . “ [I]1163-i ’d nothing else to do . And — [I]1163-i like it here . [I]1163-i do n’t feel as if [I]1163-i ’d done anything specially meritorious . [Mr. Gay]211-mr. gay is paying [me]1163-i fair wages . [I]1163-i never earned any money before — and [I]1163-i like it . ”[1163-i] It seemed so easy to talk to [Barney Snaith]140-barney , someway — this terrible [Barney Snaith]140-barney of the lurid tales and mysterious past — as easy and natural as if talking to [herself]107-valancy .

“ All the money in [the world]321-the world could n’t buy what [you]175-olive ’re doing for [Cissy Gay]182-cissy , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney . “ It ’s splendid and fine of [you]175-olive . And if there ’s anything [I]140-barney can do to help [you]175-olive in any way , [you]175-olive have only to let [me]140-barney know .
