“ [He]141-roaring abel does n’t . [He]141-roaring abel ’s lovely to [me]107-valancy . [I]107-valancy like [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy frankly .

“ So do [I.]107-valancy But there ’s one stage of [his]141-roaring abel drunkenness — perhaps [you]175-olive have n’t encountered it yet — when [he]141-roaring abel sings ribald songs — — ”[140-barney]

“ Oh , yes . [He]141-roaring abel came [home]612-home last night like that . [Cissy]182-cissy and [I]140-barney just went to [[our]2519-our room]2520-our room and shut [ourselves]2519-our in where [we]2519-our could n’t hear [him]141-roaring abel . [He]141-roaring abel apologised this morning . [I]140-barney ’m not afraid of any of [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s stages . ”[140-barney]

“ Well , [I]140-barney ’m sure [he]141-roaring abel ’ll be decent to [you]107-valancy , apart from [his]141-roaring abel inebriated yowls , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney . “ And [I]140-barney ’ve told [him]141-roaring abel [he]141-roaring abel ’s got to stop damning things when [you]107-valancy ’re around . ”[140-barney]

“ Why ? ”[107-valancy] asked [Valancy]107-valancy slily , with one of [her]107-valancy odd , slanted glances and a sudden flake of pink on each cheek , born of the thought that [Barney Snaith]140-barney had actually done so much for [her]107-valancy . “ [I]140-barney often feel like damning things [myself]140-barney . ”[140-barney]

For a moment [Barney]140-barney stared . Was [this elfin girl]1164-this elfin girl the little , old - maidish creature who had stood there two minutes ago ? Surely there was magic and devilry going on in [that shabby , weedy old garden]1165-that shabby , weedy old garden .

Then [he]1166-he laughed .

“ It will be a relief to have some one to do it for [you]107-valancy , then . So [you]107-valancy do n’t want anything but salt codfish ? ”[1166-he]

“ Not tonight . But [I]1166-he dare say [I]1166-he ’ll have some errands for [you]107-valancy very often when [you]107-valancy go to [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence . [I]1166-he ca n’t trust [Mr. Gay]211-mr. gay to remember to bring all the things [I]1166-he want . ”[1166-he]

[Barney]140-barney had gone away , then , in [his]1166-he Lady [Jane]210-lady jane , and [Valancy]107-valancy stood in [the garden]1104-the garden for a long time .

Since then [he]1166-he had called several times , walking down through [the barrens]1124-the barrens , whistling . How that whistle of [his]1166-he echoed through the spruces on those June twilights ! [Valancy]107-valancy caught [herself]107-valancy listening for it every evening — rebuked [herself]107-valancy — then let [herself]107-valancy go . Why should n’t [she]107-valancy listen for it ?

[He]1166-he always brought [Cissy]182-cissy fruit and flowers . Once [he]1166-he brought [Valancy]107-valancy a box of candy — the first box of candy [she]107-valancy had ever been given . It seemed sacrilege to eat it .

[She]107-valancy found [herself]107-valancy thinking of [him]1166-he in season and out of season . [She]107-valancy wanted to know if [he]1166-he ever thought about [her]107-valancy when [she]107-valancy was n’t before [his]1166-he eyes , and , if so , what . [She]107-valancy wanted to see [that mysterious house of [his]1166-he back on [the Mistawis island]1170-the mistawis island]1169-that mysterious house of his back on the mistawis island . [Cissy]182-cissy had never seen it . [Cissy]182-cissy , though [she]182-cissy talked freely of [Barney]140-barney and had known [him]1166-he for five years , really knew little more of [him]1166-he than [Valancy]107-valancy [herself]107-valancy .

“ But [he]1166-he is n’t bad , ”[182-cissy] said [Cissy]182-cissy . “ [Nobody]348-nobody need ever tell [me]182-cissy [he]1166-he is . [He]1166-he ca n’t have done a thing to be ashamed of . ”[182-cissy]

“ Then why does [he]1166-he live as [he]1166-he does ? ”[107-valancy] asked [Valancy]107-valancy — to hear [somebody]623-somebody defend [him]1166-he .

“ [I]182-cissy do n’t know . [He]1166-he ’s a mystery . And of course there ’s something behind it , but [I]182-cissy know it is n’t disgrace . [Barney Snaith]140-barney simply could n’t do anything disgraceful , [Valancy]107-valancy . ”[182-cissy]

[Valancy]107-valancy was not so sure . [Barney]140-barney must have done something — sometime . [He]1166-he was [a man of education and intelligence]1172-a man of education and intelligence . [She]107-valancy had soon discovered that , in listening to [his]1166-he conversations and wrangles with [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel — who was surprisingly well read and could discuss any subject under the sun when sober . [Such a man]1173-such a man would n’t bury [himself]1173-such a man for five years in [Muskoka]16-muskoka and live and look like [a tramp]1174-a tramp if there were not too good — or bad — a reason for it . But it did n’t matter . All that mattered was that [she]107-valancy was sure now that [he]1166-he had never been [[Cissy Gay]182-cissy ’s lover]1175-cissy gay ’s lover . There was nothing like that between [them]1176-them . Though [he]1166-he was very fond of [Cissy]182-cissy and [she]107-valancy of [him]1166-he , as [any one]444-any one could see . But it was a fondness that did n’t worry [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ [You]107-valancy do n’t know what [Barney]140-barney has been to [me]182-cissy , these past two years , ”[182-cissy] [Cissy]182-cissy had said simply . “ Everything would have been unbearable without [him]1166-he . ”[182-cissy]

“ [Cissy Gay]182-cissy is [the sweetest girl [I]140-barney ever knew]2522-the sweetest girl i ever knew — and there ’s [a man somewhere [I]140-barney ’d like to shoot if [I]140-barney could find [him]1166-he]2523-a man somewhere i ’d like to shoot if i could find him , ”[140-barney] [Barney]140-barney had said savagely .

[Barney]140-barney was [an interesting talker]1178-an interesting talker , with a knack of telling a great deal about [his]1166-he adventures and nothing at all about [himself]1166-he . There was one glorious rainy day when [Barney]140-barney and [Abel]141-roaring abel swapped yarns all the afternoon while [Valancy]107-valancy mended tablecloths and listened . [Barney]140-barney told weird tales of [his]1166-he adventures with “ [shacks ”]2524-shacks ”[140-barney] on [trains]1179-trains while hoboing it across [the continent]1180-the continent . [Valancy]107-valancy thought [she]107-valancy ought to think [his]1166-he stealing rides quite dreadful , but did n’t . The story of [his]1166-he working [his]1166-he way to [England]39-england on [a cattle - ship]1181-a cattle - ship sounded more legitimate . And [his]1166-he yarns of [the Yukon]40-the yukon enthralled [her]107-valancy — especially the one of the night [he]1166-he was lost on the divide between [Gold Run]41-gold run and [Sulphur Valley]42-sulphur valley . [He]1166-he had spent two years out [there]448-there . Where in all this was there room for [the penitentiary]2366-the penitentiary and the other things ?

If [he]1166-he were telling the truth . But [Valancy]107-valancy knew [he]1166-he was .

“ Found no gold , ”[1166-he] [he]1166-he said . “ Came away poorer than when [I]1166-he went . But such a place to live ! Those silences at the back of [the north wind]2525-the north wind got [me]1166-he . [I]1166-he ’ve never belonged to [myself]1166-he since . ”[1166-he]

Yet [he]1166-he was not [a great talker]1184-a great talker . [He]1166-he told a great deal in a few well - chosen words — how well - chosen [Valancy]107-valancy did not realise . And [he]1166-he had a knack of saying things without opening [his]1166-he mouth at all .

“ [I]107-valancy like [a man whose eyes say more than [his]1166-he lips]2526-a man whose eyes say more than his lips , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy .

But then [she]107-valancy liked everything about [him]1166-he — [his]1166-he tawny hair — [his]1166-he whimsical smiles — the little glints of fun in [his]1166-he eyes — [his]1166-he loyal affection for that unspeakable [Lady Jane]210-lady jane — [his]1166-he habit of sitting with [his]1166-he hands in [his]1166-he pockets , [his]1166-he chin sunk on [his]1166-he breast , looking up from under [his]1166-he mismated eyebrows . [She]107-valancy liked [his]1166-he nice voice which sounded as if it might become caressing or wooing with very little provocation . [She]107-valancy was at times almost afraid to let [herself]107-valancy think these thoughts . They were so vivid that [she]107-valancy felt as if [the others]724-the others must know what [she]107-valancy was thinking .

“ [I]1166-he ’ve been watching [a woodpecker]2527-a woodpecker all day , ”[1166-he] [he]1166-he said one evening on [the shaky old back verandah]1186-the shaky old back verandah . [His]1166-he account of [the woodpecker]1187-the woodpecker ’s doings was satisfying . [He]1166-he had often some gay or cunning little anecdote of [the wood folk]1188-the wood folk to tell [them]1188-the wood folk . And sometimes [he]1166-he and [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel smoked fiercely the whole evening and never said a word , while [Cissy]182-cissy lay in the hammock swung between the verandah posts and [Valancy]107-valancy sat idly on the steps , [her]107-valancy hands clasped over [her]107-valancy knees , and wondered dreamily if [she]107-valancy were really [Valancy Stirling]107-valancy and if it were only three weeks since [she]107-valancy had left [the ugly old house on [Elm Street]7-elm street]1189-the ugly old house on elm street .

[The barrens]1124-the barrens lay before [her]107-valancy in a white moon splendour , where dozens of little rabbits frisked . [Barney]140-barney , when [he]1166-he liked , could sit down on [the edge of the barrens]1191-the edge of the barrens and lure those rabbits right to [him]1166-he by some mysterious sorcery [he]1166-he possessed . [Valancy]107-valancy had once seen a squirrel leap from a scrub pine to [his]1166-he shoulder and sit there chattering to [him]1166-he . It reminded [her]107-valancy of [John Foster]114-john foster .

It was one of the delights of [Valancy]107-valancy ’s new life that [she]107-valancy could read [John Foster]114-john foster ’s books as often and as long as [she]107-valancy liked . [She]107-valancy could read them in bed if [she]107-valancy wanted to . [She]107-valancy read them all to [Cissy]182-cissy , who loved [them]1192-them . [She]107-valancy also tried to read them to [Abel]141-roaring abel and [Barney]140-barney , who did not love [them]1192-them . [Abel]141-roaring abel was bored and [Barney]140-barney politely refused to listen at all .

“ [Piffle]212-piffle , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney .

CHAPTER XIX

Of course , [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings had not left [the poor maniac]1193-the poor maniac alone all this time or refrained from heroic efforts to rescue [her]1193-the poor maniac perishing soul and reputation . [Uncle James]107-valancy , whose lawyer had helped [him]1194-him as little as [[his]1194-him doctor]1195-his doctor , came one day and , finding [Valancy]107-valancy alone in [the kitchen]2472-the kitchen , as [he]1194-him supposed , gave [her]107-valancy a terrible talking - to — told [her]107-valancy [she]107-valancy was breaking [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother ’s heart and disgracing [[her]107-valancy family]983-her family .

“ But why ? ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , not ceasing to scour [her]107-valancy porridge pot decently . “ [I]107-valancy ’m doing honest work for honest pay . What is there in that that is disgraceful ? ”[107-valancy]

“ Do n’t quibble , [Valancy]107-valancy , ”[107-valancy] said [Uncle James]107-valancy solemnly . “ This is no fit place for [you]107-valancy to be , and [you]107-valancy know it . Why , [I]107-valancy ’m told that jail - bird , [Snaith]140-barney , is hanging around here every evening . ”[107-valancy]

“ Not every evening , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy reflectively . “ No , not quite every evening . ”[107-valancy]

“ It’s — it ’s insufferable ! ”[107-valancy] said [Uncle James]107-valancy violently . “ [Valancy]107-valancy , [you]107-valancy must come [home]612-home . [We]2529-we wo n’t judge [you]107-valancy harshly . [I]107-valancy assure [you]107-valancy [we]2529-we wo n’t . [We]2529-we will overlook all this . ”[107-valancy]

“ Thank [you]107-valancy , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ Have [you]107-valancy no sense of shame ? ”[107-valancy] demanded [Uncle James]107-valancy .

“ Oh , yes . But the things [I]107-valancy am ashamed of are not the things [you]107-valancy are ashamed of . ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy proceeded to rinse [her]107-valancy dishcloth meticulously .

Still was [Uncle James]107-valancy patient . [He]1199-his gripped the sides of [his]1199-his chair and ground [his]1199-his teeth .

“ [We]2529-we know [your]107-valancy mind is n’t just right . [We]2529-we ’ll make allowances . But [you]107-valancy must come [home]612-home . [You]107-valancy shall not stay here with [that drunken , blasphemous old scoundrel]2531-that drunken , blasphemous old scoundrel — — ”[1199-his]

“ Were [you]141-roaring abel by any chance referring to [me]141-roaring abel , [Mister Stirling]213-james stirling ? ”[141-roaring abel] demanded [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel , suddenly appearing in the doorway of [the back verandah]1200-the back verandah where [he]141-roaring abel had been smoking a peaceful pipe and listening to “ [old Jim Stirling]213-james stirling ’s ”[141-roaring abel] tirade with huge enjoyment ! [His]141-roaring abel red beard fairly bristled with indignation and [his]141-roaring abel huge eyebrows quivered . But cowardice was not among [James Stirling]213-james stirling ’s shortcomings .

“ [I]141-roaring abel was . And , furthermore , [I]141-roaring abel want to tell [you]107-valancy that [you]107-valancy have acted an iniquitous part in luring [this weak and unfortunate girl]2532-this weak and unfortunate girl away from [[her]2532-this weak and unfortunate girl home]2533-her home and [friends]2214-friends , and [I]141-roaring abel will have [you]107-valancy punished yet for it — — ”[141-roaring abel]

[James Stirling]213-james stirling got no further . [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel crossed [the kitchen]2472-the kitchen at a bound , caught [him]141-roaring abel by [his]141-roaring abel collar and [his]141-roaring abel trousers , and hurled [him]141-roaring abel through the doorway and over [the garden paling]1202-the garden paling with as little apparent effort as [he]141-roaring abel might have employed in whisking a troublesome kitten out of the way .

“ The next time [you]107-valancy come back [here]2277-here , ”[141-roaring abel] [he]141-roaring abel bellowed , “ [I]141-roaring abel ’ll throw [you]107-valancy through the window — and all the better if the window is shut ! Coming here , thinking [yourself]107-valancy [God]103-god to put [the world]321-the world to rights ! ”[141-roaring abel]

[Valancy]107-valancy candidly and unashamedly owned to [herself]107-valancy that [she]107-valancy had seen few more satisfying sights than [Uncle James]107-valancy ’ coat - tails flying out into the asparagus bed . [She]107-valancy had once been afraid of [this man]1203-this man ’s judgment . Now [she]107-valancy saw clearly that [he]1203-this man was nothing but [a rather stupid little village tin - god]1204-a rather stupid little village tin - god .

[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel turned with [his]141-roaring abel great broad laugh .

“ [He]1203-this man ’ll think of that for years when [he]1203-this man wakes up in the night . [The Almighty]214-the almighty made a mistake in making so many [Stirlings]93-the stirlings . But since they are made , [we]1205-they ’ve got to reckon with [them]1205-they . Too many to kill out . But if [they]1205-they come here bothering [you]2537-you [I]141-roaring abel ’ll shoo ’em off before a cat could lick its ear . ”[141-roaring abel]

The next time [they]1205-they sent [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling . Surely [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel would not throw [him]1203-this man into asparagus beds . [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling was not so sure of this and had no great liking for the task . [He]131-dr. stalling did not believe [Valancy Stirling]107-valancy was out of [her]107-valancy mind . [She]107-valancy had always been queer . [He]131-dr. stalling , [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling , had never been able to understand [her]107-valancy . Therefore , beyond doubt , [she]107-valancy was queer . [She]107-valancy was only just a little queerer than usual now . And [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling had [his]131-dr. stalling own reasons for disliking [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel . When [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling had first come to [Deerwood]5-deerwood [he]131-dr. stalling had had a liking for long hikes around [Mistawis]27-mistawis and [Muskoka]16-muskoka . On one of these occasions [he]131-dr. stalling had got lost and after much wandering had fallen in with [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel with [his]131-dr. stalling gun over [his]131-dr. stalling shoulder .

[Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling had contrived to ask [his]131-dr. stalling question in about the most idiotic manner possible . [He]131-dr. stalling said , “ Can [you]131-dr. stalling tell [me]131-dr. stalling where [I]131-dr. stalling ’m going ? ”[131-dr. stalling]

“ How the devil should [I]141-roaring abel know where [you]131-dr. stalling ’re going , [gosling]215-gosling ? ”[141-roaring abel] retorted [Abel]141-roaring abel contemptuously .

[Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling was so enraged that [he]131-dr. stalling could not speak for a moment or two and in that moment [Abel]141-roaring abel had disappeared in [the woods]2193-the woods . [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling had eventually found [his]131-dr. stalling way [home]612-home , but [he]131-dr. stalling had never hankered to encounter [Abel Gay]141-roaring abel again .

Nevertheless [he]131-dr. stalling came now to do [his]131-dr. stalling duty . [Valancy]107-valancy greeted [him]131-dr. stalling with a sinking heart . [She]107-valancy had to own to [herself]107-valancy that [she]107-valancy was terribly afraid of [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling still . [She]107-valancy had a miserable conviction that if [he]131-dr. stalling shook [his]131-dr. stalling long , bony finger at [her]107-valancy and told [her]107-valancy to go [home]612-home , [she]107-valancy dared not disobey .

“ [Mr. Gay]211-mr. gay , ”[131-dr. stalling] said [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling politely and condescendingly , “ may [I]131-dr. stalling see [Miss Stirling]175-olive alone for a few minutes ? ”[131-dr. stalling]

[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel was a little drunk — just drunk enough to be excessively polite and very cunning . [He]141-roaring abel had been on the point of going away when [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling arrived , but now [he]141-roaring abel sat down in a corner of [the parlour]2406-the parlour and folded [his]141-roaring abel arms .

“ No , no , [mister]2538-mister , ”[141-roaring abel] [he]141-roaring abel said solemnly . “ That would n’t do — wouldn’t do at all . [I]141-roaring abel ’ve got the reputation of [[my]141-roaring abel household]2539-my household to keep up . [I]141-roaring abel ’ve got to chaperone [this young lady]2540-this young lady . Ca n’t have any sparkin ’ going on here behind [my]141-roaring abel back . ”[141-roaring abel]

[Outraged Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling looked so terrible that [Valancy]107-valancy wondered how [Abel]141-roaring abel could endure [his]141-roaring abel aspect . But [Abel]141-roaring abel was not worried at all .

“ D’ye know anything about it , anyway ? ”[141-roaring abel] [he]141-roaring abel asked genially .

“ About what ? ”[131-dr. stalling]

“ [Sparking]216-sparking , ”[141-roaring abel] said [Abel]141-roaring abel coolly .

[Poor Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling , who had never married because [he]131-dr. stalling believed in [a celibate clergy]1210-a celibate clergy , would not notice this ribald remark . [He]131-dr. stalling turned [his]131-dr. stalling back on [Abel]141-roaring abel and addressed [himself]131-dr. stalling to [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ [Miss Stirling]175-olive , [I]131-dr. stalling am here in response to [[your]175-olive mother]2315-your mother ’s wishes . [She]2315-your mother begged [me]131-dr. stalling to come . “ Yes , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy faintly , eyeing the forefinger . It had a hypnotic effect on [her]107-valancy .

“ The first is this . If [you]107-valancy will leave this — this — — ”[107-valancy]

Back of [her]107-valancy terror [Valancy]107-valancy smiled in secret . “ That ’s [my]141-roaring abel business , [Mister]2538-mister , ”[141-roaring abel] said [Abel]141-roaring abel . “ [Miss Stirling]175-olive can go if [she]175-olive pleases , or stay if [she]175-olive pleases . “ [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling , [a nurse]2553-a nurse is not what [Cissy]182-cissy needs , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy earnestly . “ [She]175-olive is n’t so ill as that , yet . “ [I]131-dr. stalling understand that [your]131-dr. stalling motive is quite — ahem — commendable . ”[131-dr. stalling] [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling felt that [he]131-dr. stalling was very broad - minded indeed — especially as in [his]131-dr. stalling secret soul [he]131-dr. stalling did not believe [Valancy]107-valancy ’s motive was commendable . Simplicity itself ! “ But [your]131-dr. stalling first duty is to [[your]131-dr. stalling mother]2315-your mother . [She]2315-your mother needs [you]131-dr. stalling . “ [She]2315-your mother entreats , but [I]131-dr. stalling , [Miss Stirling,”—Dr[131-dr. stalling] . [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling shook [his]131-dr. stalling finger at [Valancy]107-valancy . Before that pitiless finger [she]107-valancy drooped and wilted visibly .

“ [She]107-valancy ’s giving in , ”[141-roaring abel] thought [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel . “ [She]107-valancy ’ll go with [him]141-roaring abel . Beats all , the power [these preacher fellows]2561-these preacher fellows have over [women]2354-women . ”[141-roaring abel]

[Valancy]107-valancy was on the point of obeying [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling . [She]107-valancy must go [home]612-home with [him]141-roaring abel — and give up . [She]107-valancy would lapse back to [Doss Stirling]106-doss again and for [her]107-valancy few remaining days or weeks be [the cowed , futile creature [she]107-valancy had always been]1213-the cowed , futile creature she had always been . It was [her]107-valancy fate — typified by that relentless , uplifted forefinger . [She]107-valancy could no more escape from it than [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel from [his]141-roaring abel predestination . [She]107-valancy eyed it as the fascinated bird eyes the snake . Another moment —

“ Fear is the original sin , ”[107-valancy] suddenly said a still , small voice away back — back — back of [Valancy]107-valancy ’s consciousness . “ Almost all the evil in [the world]321-the world has its origin in the fact that [some one]359-some one is afraid of something . ”[107-valancy]

[Valancy]107-valancy stood up . [She]107-valancy was still in the clutches of fear , but [her]107-valancy soul was [her]107-valancy own again . [She]107-valancy would not be false to that inner voice .

“ [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy said slowly , “ [I]107-valancy do not at present owe any duty to [[my]107-valancy mother]2565-my mother . [She]2565-my mother is quite well ; [she]2565-my mother has all the assistance and companionship [she]2565-my mother requires ; [she]2565-my mother does not need [me]107-valancy at all . [I]107-valancy am needed [here]2277-here . [I]107-valancy am going to stay [here]2277-here . ”[107-valancy]

“ There ’s spunk for [you]131-dr. stalling , ”[141-roaring abel] said [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel admiringly .

[Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling dropped [his]131-dr. stalling forefinger . [One]332-one could not keep on shaking a finger forever .

“ [Miss Stirling]175-olive , is there nothing that can influence [you]131-dr. stalling ? Do [you]131-dr. stalling remember [your]131-dr. stalling childhood days — — ”[131-dr. stalling]

“ Perfectly . And hate [them]2568-them . ”[131-dr. stalling]

“ Do [you]131-dr. stalling realise what [people]2198-people will say ? What [they]2198-people are saying ? ”[131-dr. stalling]

“ [I]107-valancy can imagine it , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , with a shrug of [her]107-valancy shoulders . [She]107-valancy was suddenly free of fear again . “ [I]107-valancy have n’t listened to the gossip of Deerwood teaparties and sewing circles twenty years for nothing . But , [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling , it does n’t matter in the least to [me]107-valancy what [they]2198-people say — not in the least . ”[107-valancy]

[Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling went away then . [A girl who cared nothing for public opinion]1215-a girl who cared nothing for public opinion ! Over whom sacred family ties had no restraining influence ! Who hated [her]1215-a girl who cared nothing for public opinion childhood memories !

Then [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana came — on [her]110-cousin georgiana own initiative , for [nobody]348-nobody would have thought it worth while to send [her]110-cousin georgiana . “ [We]2570-we ’ll just have to wait , ”[108-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin . “ After all , [Cissy Gay]182-cissy ca n’t live long . [Dr. Marsh]117-dr. marsh tells [me]108-uncle benjamin [she]182-cissy may drop off any day . ”[108-uncle benjamin]

[Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick wept . It would really have been so much easier to bear if [Valancy]107-valancy had died . [She]107-valancy could have worn mourning then .

[CHAPTER XX]221-chapter xx

When [Abel Gay]141-roaring abel paid [Valancy]107-valancy [her]107-valancy first month ’s wages — which [he]141-roaring abel did promptly , in bills reeking with the odour of tobacco and whiskey — [Valancy]107-valancy went into [Deerwood]5-deerwood and spent every cent of it . [She]107-valancy got a pretty green crêpe dress with a girdle of crimson beads , at a bargain sale , a pair of silk stockings , to match , and a little crinkled green hat with a crimson rose in it . [She]107-valancy even bought a foolish little beribboned and belaced nightgown .

[She]107-valancy passed [the house on [Elm Street]7-elm street]1219-the house on elm street twice — [Valancy]107-valancy never even thought about it as “ home”—but[107-valancy] saw [no one]515-no one . No doubt [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother was sitting in [the room]472-the room this lovely June evening playing solitaire — and cheating . [Valancy]107-valancy knew that [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick always cheated . [She]99-mrs. frederick never lost a game . [Most of [the people [Valancy]107-valancy met]1224-the people valancy met]1223-most of the people valancy met looked at [her]107-valancy seriously and passed [her]107-valancy with a cool nod . [Nobody]348-nobody stopped to speak to [her]107-valancy .

[Valancy]107-valancy put on [her]107-valancy green dress when [she]107-valancy got [home]612-home . Then [she]107-valancy took it off again . [She]107-valancy felt so miserably undressed in its low neck and short sleeves . And that low , crimson girdle around the hips seemed positively indecent . [She]107-valancy hung it up in [the closet]477-the closet , feeling flatly that [she]107-valancy had wasted [her]107-valancy money . [She]107-valancy would never have the courage to wear that dress . [John Foster]114-john foster ’s arraignment of fear had no power to stiffen [her]107-valancy against this . In this one thing habit and custom were still all - powerful . Yet [she]107-valancy sighed as [she]107-valancy went down to meet [Barney Snaith]140-barney in [her]140-barney old snuff - brown silk . That green thing had been very becoming — [she]107-valancy had seen so much in [her]107-valancy one ashamed glance . Above it [her]107-valancy eyes had looked like odd brown jewels and the girdle had given [her]107-valancy flat figure an entirely different appearance . [She]107-valancy wished [she]107-valancy could have left it on . But there were some things [John Foster]114-john foster did not know .

Every Sunday evening [Valancy]107-valancy went to [the little Free Methodist church]1228-the little free methodist church in [a valley on the edge of “ up [back”—a[1231-the minister who preached there] spireless little grey building among the pines]2571-back”—a spireless little grey building among the pines , with a few sunken graves and mossy gravestones in [the small , paling - encircled , grass - grown square beside [it]1228-the little free methodist church]1230-the small , paling - encircled , grass - grown square beside it]1229-a valley on the edge of “ up back”—a spireless little grey building among the pines , with a few sunken graves and mossy gravestones in the small , paling - encircled , grass - grown square beside it . [She]107-valancy liked [the minister who preached [there]448-there]1231-the minister who preached there . [He]1231-the minister who preached there was so simple and sincere . [An old man , who lived in [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence]1233-an old man , who lived in port lawrence and came out by [the lake]1234-the lake in [a little disappearing propeller boat]1235-a little disappearing propeller boat to give a free service to [the people of [the small , stony farms back of [the hills]1238-the hills]1237-the small , stony farms back of the hills , who would otherwise never have heard any gospel message]1236-the people of the small , stony farms back of the hills , who would otherwise never have heard any gospel message . [She]107-valancy liked the simple service and the fervent singing . [She]107-valancy liked to sit by the open window and look out into [the pine woods]1239-the pine woods . [The congregation]1240-the congregation was always small . [The Free Methodists]1241-the free methodists were few in number , poor and generally illiterate . But [Valancy]107-valancy loved those Sunday evenings . For the first time in [her]107-valancy life [she]107-valancy liked going to [church]501-church . The rumour reached [Deerwood]93-the stirlings that [she]107-valancy had “ turned [Free Methodist]2572-free methodist ”[107-valancy] and sent [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick to bed for a day . But [Valancy]107-valancy had not turned anything . [She]107-valancy went to [the church]588-the church because [she]107-valancy liked it and because in some inexplicable way it did [her]107-valancy good . [Old Mr. Towers]222-mr. towers believed exactly what [he]222-mr. towers preached and somehow it made a tremendous difference .

Oddly enough , [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel disapproved of [her]107-valancy going to [the hill church]1244-the hill church as strongly as [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick [herself]99-mrs. frederick could have done . [He]141-roaring abel had “ no use for [Free Methodists]2573-free methodists . [He]141-roaring abel was [a Presbyterian]466-a presbyterian . ”[141-roaring abel] But [Valancy]107-valancy went in spite of [him]141-roaring abel .

“ [We]1245-we ’ll hear something worse than that about [her]107-valancy soon , ”[108-uncle benjamin] [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin predicted gloomily .

[They]1245-we did .

[Valancy]107-valancy could not quite explain , even to [herself]107-valancy , just why [she]107-valancy wanted to go to that party . It was a dance “ up back ”[107-valancy] at [Chidley Corners]44-chidley corners ; and dances at [Chidley Corners]44-chidley corners were not , as a rule , the sort of assemblies where [well - brought - up young ladies]1246-well - brought - up young ladies were found . [Valancy]107-valancy knew it was coming off , for [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel had been engaged as [one of [the fiddlers]1248-the fiddlers]1247-one of the fiddlers .

But the idea of going had never occurred to [her]107-valancy until [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel [himself]141-roaring abel broached it at supper .

“ [You]107-valancy come with [me]141-roaring abel to the dance , ”[141-roaring abel] [he]141-roaring abel ordered . “ It ’ll do [you]107-valancy good — put some colour in [your]107-valancy face . [You]107-valancy look peaked — [you]107-valancy want something to liven [you]107-valancy up . ”[141-roaring abel]

[Valancy]107-valancy found [herself]107-valancy suddenly wanting to go . [She]107-valancy knew nothing at all of what dances at [Chidley Corners]44-chidley corners were apt to be like . [Her]107-valancy idea of dances had been fashioned on the correct affairs that went by that name in [Deerwood]5-deerwood and [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence . Of course [she]107-valancy knew [the Corners ’ dance]1249-the corners ’ dance would n’t be just like them . Much more informal , of course . But so much the more interesting . Why should n’t [she]107-valancy go ? [Cissy]182-cissy was in a week of apparent health and improvement . [She]182-cissy would n’t mind staying alone in the least . [She]182-cissy entreated [Valancy]107-valancy to go if [she]182-cissy wanted to . And [Valancy]107-valancy did want to go .

[She]107-valancy went to [[her]107-valancy room]372-her room to dress . A rage against the snuff - brown silk seized [her]107-valancy . Wear that to a party ! Never . [She]107-valancy pulled [her]107-valancy green crêpe from its hanger and put it on feverishly . It was nonsense to feel so — so — naked — just because [her]107-valancy neck and arms were bare . That was just [her]107-valancy old maidishness . [She]107-valancy would not be ridden by it . On went the dress — the slippers .

It was the first time [she]107-valancy had worn a pretty dress since the organdies of [her]107-valancy early teens . And [they]1251-they had never made [her]107-valancy look like this .

If [she]107-valancy only had a necklace or something . [She]107-valancy would n’t feel so bare then . [She]107-valancy ran down to [the garden]1104-the garden . There were clovers there — great crimson things growing in the long grass . [Valancy]107-valancy gathered handfuls of them and strung them on a cord . Fastened above [her]107-valancy neck they gave [her]107-valancy the comfortable sensation of a collar and were oddly becoming . Another circlet of them went round [her]107-valancy hair , dressed in the low puffs that became [her]107-valancy . Excitement brought those faint pink stains to [her]107-valancy face . [She]107-valancy flung on [her]107-valancy coat and pulled the little , twisty hat over [her]107-valancy hair .

“ [You]182-cissy look so nice and — and — different , [dear]2211-dear , ”[182-cissy] said [Cissy]182-cissy . “ Like a green moonbeam with a gleam of red in it , if there could be such a thing . ”[182-cissy]

[Valancy]107-valancy stooped to kiss [her]182-cissy .

“ [I]107-valancy do n’t feel right about leaving [you]182-cissy alone , [Cissy]182-cissy . ”[107-valancy]

“ Oh , [I]107-valancy ’ll be all right . [I]107-valancy feel better tonight than [I]107-valancy have for a long while . [I]107-valancy ’ve been feeling badly to see [you]182-cissy sticking here so closely on [my]107-valancy account . [I]107-valancy hope [you]182-cissy ’ll have a nice time . [I]107-valancy never was at a party at [the Corners]45-the corners , but [I]107-valancy used to go sometimes , long ago , to dances up back . [We]2576-we always had good times . And [you]182-cissy need n’t be afraid of [Father]206-father being drunk tonight . [He]206-father never drinks when [he]206-father engages to play for a party . But — there may be — liquor . What will [you]182-cissy do if it gets rough ? ”[107-valancy]

“ [Nobody]348-nobody would molest [me]107-valancy . ”[107-valancy]

“ Not seriously , [I]107-valancy suppose . [Father]206-father would see to that . But it might be noisy and — and unpleasant . ”[107-valancy]

“ [I]107-valancy wo n’t mind . [I]107-valancy ’m only going as [a looker - on]2578-a looker - on . [I]107-valancy do n’t expect to dance . [I]107-valancy just want to see what a party up back is like . [I]107-valancy ’ve never seen anything except decorous Deerwood . ”[107-valancy]

[Cissy]182-cissy smiled rather dubiously . [She]182-cissy knew much better than [Valancy]107-valancy what a party “ up back ”[107-valancy] might be like if there should be liquor . But again there might n’t be .

“ [I]182-cissy hope [you]107-valancy ’ll enjoy it , [dear]2211-dear , ”[182-cissy] [she]182-cissy repeated .

[Valancy]107-valancy enjoyed the drive [there]448-there . [They]1254-they went early , for it was twelve miles to [Chidley Corners]44-chidley corners , and [they]1254-they had to go in [[Abel]141-roaring abel ’s old , ragged top - buggy]1255-abel ’s old , ragged top - buggy . [The road]756-the road was rough and rocky , like [most Muskoka roads]1257-most muskoka roads , but full of the austere charm of [northern woods]1258-northern woods . [It]756-the road wound through beautiful , purring pines that were ranks of enchantment in the June sunset , and over [the curious jade - green rivers of [Muskoka , fringed by aspens that were always quivering with some supernal joy]1260-muskoka , fringed by aspens that were always quivering with some supernal joy]1259-the curious jade - green rivers of muskoka , fringed by aspens that were always quivering with some supernal joy .

[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel was excellent company , too . [He]141-roaring abel knew all the stories and legends of the wild , beautiful “ up back , ”[141-roaring abel] and [he]141-roaring abel told [them]1261-them to [Valancy]107-valancy as [they]1254-they drove along . [Valancy]107-valancy had several fits of inward laughter over what [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin and [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington , et al . , would feel and think and say if [they]1262-they saw [her]107-valancy driving with [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel in [that terrible buggy]1263-that terrible buggy to a dance at [Chidley Corners]44-chidley corners .

At first the dance was quiet enough , and [Valancy]107-valancy was amused and entertained . [She]107-valancy even danced twice [herself]107-valancy , with [a couple of nice “ up back ”[1264-a couple of nice “ up back ” boys who danced beautifully and told her she did , too] boys who danced beautifully and told [her]107-valancy [she]107-valancy did , too]1264-a couple of nice “ up back ” boys who danced beautifully and told her she did , too .

Another compliment came [her]107-valancy way — not a very subtle one , perhaps , but [Valancy]107-valancy had had too few compliments in [her]107-valancy life to be over - nice on that point . [She]107-valancy overheard two of [the “ up back ”[1265-the “ up back ” young men] young men]1265-the “ up back ” young men talking about [her]107-valancy in [the dark “ lean - to ”[1265-the “ up back ” young men] behind [her]107-valancy]1266-the dark “ lean - to ” behind her .

“ Know who [that girl in green]2580-that girl in green is ? ”[1265-the “ up back ” young men]

“ Nope . Guess [she]2580-that girl in green ’s from out front . [The Port]2254-the port , maybe . Got a stylish look to [her]2580-that girl in green . ”[1265-the “ up back ” young men]

“ No beaut but cute - looking , [I]1265-the “ up back ” young men ’ll say . ‘ [Jever]223-jever see such eyes ? ”[1265-the “ up back ” young men]

[The big room]1267-the big room was decorated with pine and fir boughs , and lighted by Chinese lanterns . The floor was waxed , and [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s fiddle , purring under [his]141-roaring abel skilled touch , worked magic . [The “ up back ”[1268-the “ up back ” girls] girls]1268-the “ up back ” girls were pretty and prettily dressed . [Valancy]107-valancy thought it the nicest party [she]107-valancy had ever attended .

By eleven o’clock [she]107-valancy had changed [her]107-valancy mind . [A new crowd]1269-a new crowd had arrived — [a crowd unmistakably drunk]1270-a crowd unmistakably drunk . Whiskey began to circulate freely . Very soon almost [all the men]1271-all the men were partly drunk . [Those in [the porch]1015-the porch and outside around the door]1272-those in the porch and outside around the door began howling “ come - all - [ye]2582-ye ’s ”[1272-those in the porch and outside around the door] and continued to howl [them]1272-those in the porch and outside around the door . [The room]472-the room grew noisy and reeking . Quarrels started up here and there . Bad language and obscene songs were heard . [The girls]762-the girls , swung rudely in the dances , became dishevelled and tawdry . [Valancy]107-valancy , alone in [her]107-valancy corner , was feeling disgusted and repentant . Why had [she]107-valancy ever come to such a place ? Freedom and independence were all very well , but [one]332-one should not be [a little fool]1277-a little fool . [She]107-valancy might have known what it would be like — [she]107-valancy might have taken warning from [Cissy]182-cissy ’s guarded sentences . [Her]107-valancy head was aching — [she]107-valancy was sick of the whole thing . But what could [she]107-valancy do ? [She]107-valancy must stay to the end . [Abel]141-roaring abel could not leave till then . And that would probably be not till three or four in the morning .

The new influx of [boys]2333-boys had left [the girls far in the minority]1279-the girls far in the minority and [partners]1280-partners were scarce . [Valancy]107-valancy was pestered with invitations to dance . [She]107-valancy refused [them]1281-them all shortly , and some of [her]107-valancy refusals were not well taken . There were muttered oaths and sullen looks . Across [the room]472-the room [she]107-valancy saw [a group of [the strangers]1284-the strangers]1283-a group of the strangers talking together and glancing meaningly at [her]107-valancy . What were [they]1283-a group of the strangers plotting ?

It was at this moment that [she]107-valancy saw [Barney Snaith]140-barney looking in over the heads of [the crowd at the doorway]1285-the crowd at the doorway . [Valancy]107-valancy had two distinct convictions — one was that [she]107-valancy was quite safe now ; the other was that this was why [she]107-valancy had wanted to come to the dance . It had been such an absurd hope that [she]107-valancy had not recognised it before , but now [she]107-valancy knew [she]107-valancy had come because of the possibility that [Barney]140-barney might be there , too . [She]107-valancy thought that perhaps [she]107-valancy ought to be ashamed for this , but [she]107-valancy was n’t . After [her]107-valancy feeling of relief [her]107-valancy next feeling was one of annoyance with [Barney]140-barney for coming [there]448-there unshaved . Surely [he]1287-he might have enough self - respect to groom [himself]1287-he up decently when [he]1287-he went to a party . There [he]1287-he was , bareheaded , bristly - chinned , in [his]1287-he old trousers and [his]1287-he blue homespun shirt . Not even a coat . [Valancy]107-valancy could have shaken [him]1287-he in [her]107-valancy anger . No wonder [people]2198-people believed everything bad of [him]1287-he .

But [she]107-valancy was not afraid any longer . One of [the whispering group]1289-the whispering group left [[his]1287-he comrades]1290-his comrades and came across [the room]472-the room to [her]107-valancy , through the whirling couples that now filled [it]472-the room uncomfortably . [He]1287-he was [a tall , broad - shouldered fellow , not ill - dressed or ill - looking but unmistakably half drunk]1292-a tall , broad - shouldered fellow , not ill - dressed or ill - looking but unmistakably half drunk . [He]1287-he asked [Valancy]107-valancy to dance . [Valancy]107-valancy declined civilly . [His]1287-he face turned livid . [He]1287-he threw [his]1287-he arm about [her]107-valancy and pulled [her]107-valancy to [him]1287-he . [His]1287-he hot , whiskied breath burned [her]107-valancy face .

“ [We]2583-us wo n’t have fine - lady airs here , [[my]1287-he girl]2584-my girl . If [you]107-valancy ai n’t too good to come here [you]107-valancy ai n’t too good to dance with [us]2583-us . [Me]1287-he and [[my]1287-he pals]2585-my pals have been watching [you]107-valancy . [You]107-valancy ’ve got to give [us]2583-us each a turn and a kiss to boot . ”[1287-he]

[Valancy]107-valancy tried desperately and vainly to free [herself]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy was being dragged out into [the maze of shouting , stamping , yelling dancers]1293-the maze of shouting , stamping , yelling dancers . The next moment [the man who held [her]107-valancy]1294-the man who held her went staggering across [the room]472-the room from a neatly planted blow on the jaw , knocking down [whirling couples]1296-whirling couples as [he]1294-the man who held her went . [Valancy]107-valancy felt [her]107-valancy arm grasped .

“ This way — quick , ”[1294-the man who held her] said [Barney Snaith]140-barney . [He]1294-the man who held her swung [her]107-valancy out through the open window behind [them]1297-them , vaulted lightly over the sill and caught [her]107-valancy hand .

“ Quick — [we]1297-them must run for it — they’ll be after [us]1297-them . ”[1294-the man who held her]

[Valancy]107-valancy ran as [she]107-valancy had never run before , clinging tight to [Barney]140-barney ’s hand , wondering why [she]107-valancy did not drop dead in such a mad scamper . Suppose [she]107-valancy did ! What a scandal it would make for [[her]107-valancy poor people]1298-her poor people . For the first time [Valancy]107-valancy felt a little sorry for [them]1298-her poor people . Also , [she]107-valancy felt glad that [she]107-valancy had escaped from that horrible row . Also , glad that [she]107-valancy was holding tight to [Barney]140-barney ’s hand . [Her]107-valancy feelings were badly mixed and [she]107-valancy had never had so many in such a brief time in [her]107-valancy life .

[They]1297-them finally reached a quiet corner in [the pine woods]1239-the pine woods . The pursuit had taken a different direction and the whoops and yells behind [them]1297-them were growing faint . [Valancy]107-valancy , out of breath , with a crazily beating heart , collapsed on the trunk of a fallen pine .

“ Thanks , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy gasped .

“ What a goose [you]107-valancy were to come to such a place ! ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney .

“ [I]107-valancy — didn’t — know — it — would — be like this , ”[107-valancy] protested [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ [You]140-barney should have known . [Chidley Corners]44-chidley corners ! ”[107-valancy]

“ It — was — just — a name — to [me]107-valancy . ”[107-valancy]

[Valancy]107-valancy knew [Barney]140-barney could not realise how ignorant [she]140-barney was of the regions “ up back . ”[140-barney] [She]140-barney had lived in [Deerwood]5-deerwood all [her]140-barney life and of course [he]1300-he supposed [she]140-barney knew . [He]1300-he did n’t know how [she]140-barney had been brought up . There was no use trying to explain .

“ When [I]107-valancy drifted in at [Abel ’s]141-roaring abel this evening and [Cissy]182-cissy told [me]107-valancy [you]107-valancy ’d come [here]2277-here [I]107-valancy was amazed . And downright scared . [Cissy]182-cissy told [me]107-valancy [she]182-cissy was worried about [you]107-valancy but had n’t liked to say anything to dissuade [you]107-valancy for fear [you]107-valancy ’d think [she]182-cissy was thinking selfishly about [herself]182-cissy . So [I]107-valancy came on up here instead of going to [Deerwood]5-deerwood . ”[107-valancy]

[Valancy]107-valancy felt a sudden delightful glow irradiating soul and body under the dark pines . So [he]1300-he had actually come up to look after [her]140-barney .

“ As soon as [they]2587-they stop hunting for [us]2588-us [we]2588-us ’ll sneak around to [the Muskoka road]654-the muskoka road . [I]1300-he left [Lady Jane]210-lady jane down there . [I]1300-he ’ll take [you]140-barney [home]612-home . [I]1300-he suppose [you]140-barney ’ve had enough of [[your]140-barney party]2591-your party . ”[1300-he]

“ Quite , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy meekly . The first half of the way [home]612-home neither of [them]1302-them said anything . It would not have been much use . [Lady Jane]210-lady jane made so much noise [they]1302-them could not have heard [each other]1303-each other . Anyway , [Valancy]107-valancy did not feel conversationally inclined . [She]107-valancy was ashamed of the whole affair — ashamed of [her]107-valancy folly in going — ashamed of being found in such a place by [Barney Snaith]140-barney . By [Barney Snaith]140-barney , [reputed jail - breaker]1304-reputed jail - breaker , [infidel]1305-infidel , [forger]1306-forger and [defaulter]1307-defaulter . [Valancy]107-valancy ’s lips twitched in the darkness as [she]107-valancy thought of it . But [she]107-valancy was ashamed .

And yet [she]107-valancy was enjoying [herself]107-valancy — was full of a strange exultation — bumping over [that rough road]1308-that rough road beside [Barney Snaith]140-barney . The big trees shot by [them]1309-them . [The tall mulleins]1310-the tall mulleins stood up along [the road]756-the road in stiff , orderly ranks like [companies of [soldiers]1313-soldiers]1312-companies of soldiers . [The thistles]1314-the thistles looked like drunken fairies or tipsy elves as [their]1314-the thistles car - lights passed over [them]1314-the thistles . This was the first time [she]107-valancy had even been in [a car]1315-a car . After all , [she]107-valancy liked it . [She]107-valancy was not in the least afraid , with [Barney]140-barney at the wheel . [Her]107-valancy spirits rose rapidly as [they]1309-them tore along . [She]107-valancy ceased to feel ashamed . [She]107-valancy ceased to feel anything except that [she]107-valancy was part of a comet rushing gloriously through the night of space .

All at once , just where [the pine woods]1239-the pine woods frayed out to [the scrub barrens]1317-the scrub barrens , [Lady Jane]210-lady jane became quiet — too quiet . [Lady Jane]210-lady jane slowed down quietly — and stopped .

[Barney]140-barney uttered an aghast exclamation . Got out . [Investigated . Came]224-investigated . came apologetically back .

“ [I]210-lady jane ’m [a doddering idiot]2592-a doddering idiot . Out of gas . [I]210-lady jane knew [I]210-lady jane was short when [I]210-lady jane left [home]612-home , but [I]210-lady jane meant to fill up in [Deerwood]5-deerwood . Then [I]210-lady jane forgot all about it in [my]210-lady jane hurry to get to [the Corners]45-the corners . ”[210-lady jane]

“ What can [we]2594-we do ? ”[107-valancy] asked [Valancy]107-valancy coolly .

“ [I]210-lady jane do n’t know . There ’s no gas nearer than [Deerwood]5-deerwood , nine miles away . And [I]210-lady jane do n’t dare leave [you]2595-you here alone . There are always tramps on [this road]2596-this road — and [some of [those crazy fools back at [the Corners]45-the corners]2598-those crazy fools back at the corners]2597-some of those crazy fools back at the corners may come straggling along presently . There were [boys]2333-boys there from [the Port]2254-the port . As far as [I]210-lady jane can see , the best thing to do is for [us]2594-we just to sit patiently here until [some car]2601-some car comes along and lends [us]2594-we enough gas to get to [[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s with]2602-roaring abel ’s with . ”[210-lady jane]

“ Well , what ’s the matter with that ? ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ [We]2594-we may have to sit [here]2277-here all night , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney .

“ [I]107-valancy do n’t mind , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

[Barney]140-barney gave a short laugh . “ If [you]107-valancy do n’t , [I]140-barney need n’t . [I]140-barney have n’t any reputation to lose . ”[140-barney]

“ Nor [I]107-valancy , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy comfortably .

CHAPTER XXI

“ [We]2594-we ’ll just sit here , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney , “ and if [we]2594-we think of anything worth while saying [we]2594-we ’ll say it . Otherwise , not . Do n’t imagine [you]107-valancy ’re bound to talk to [me]140-barney . ”[140-barney]

“ [John Foster]114-john foster says , ”[107-valancy] quoted [Valancy]107-valancy , “ ‘ If [you]107-valancy can sit in silence with [a person]2208-a person for half an hour and yet be entirely comfortable , [you]107-valancy and [that person]2605-that person can be [friends]2214-friends . If [you]107-valancy can not , [friends]2214-friends [you]107-valancy ’ll never be and [you]107-valancy need not waste time in trying . ’ ”[107-valancy]

“ [Evidently John Foster]114-john foster says a sensible thing once in a while , ”[140-barney] conceded [Barney]140-barney .

[They]1318-they sat in silence for a long while . [Little rabbits]225-little rabbits hopped across [the road]756-the road . Once or twice [an owl]1320-an owl laughed out delightfully . [The road]756-the road beyond [them]1318-they was fringed with the woven shadow lace of trees . Away off to the southwest the sky was full of silvery little cirrus clouds above [the spot where [Barney]140-barney ’s island]1322-the spot where barney ’s island must be .

[Valancy]107-valancy was perfectly happy . Some things dawn on [you]1323-you slowly . Some things come by lightning flashes . [Valancy]107-valancy had had a lightning flash .

[She]107-valancy knew quite well now that [she]107-valancy loved [Barney]140-barney . Yesterday [she]107-valancy had been all [her]107-valancy own . Now [she]107-valancy was [this man]1203-this man ’s . Yet [he]1203-this man had done nothing — said nothing . [He]1203-this man had not even looked at [her]107-valancy as [a woman]414-a woman . But that did n’t matter . Nor did it matter what [he]1203-this man was or what [he]1203-this man had done . [She]107-valancy loved [him]1203-this man without any reservations . Everything in [her]107-valancy went out wholly to [him]1203-this man . [She]107-valancy had no wish to stifle or disown [her]107-valancy love . [She]107-valancy seemed to be [his]1203-this man so absolutely that thought apart from [him]1203-this man — thought in which [he]1203-this man did not predominate — was an impossibility .

[She]107-valancy had realised , quite simply and fully , that [she]107-valancy loved [him]1203-this man , in the moment when [he]1203-this man was leaning on the car door , explaining that [Lady Jane]210-lady jane had no gas . [She]107-valancy had looked deep into [his]1203-this man eyes in the moonlight and had known . In just that infinitesimal space of time everything was changed . Old things passed away and all things became new .

[She]107-valancy was no longer unimportant , little , [old maid Valancy Stirling]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy was [a woman , full of love and therefore rich and significant]1326-a woman , full of love and therefore rich and significant — justified to [herself]107-valancy . Life was no longer empty and futile , and death could cheat [her]107-valancy of nothing . [Love]226-love had cast out [her]107-valancy last fear .

Love ! What a searing , torturing , intolerably sweet thing it was — this possession of body , soul and mind ! With something at its core as fine and remote and purely spiritual as the tiny blue spark in the heart of the unbreakable diamond . No dream had ever been like this . [She]107-valancy was no longer solitary . [She]107-valancy was one of a vast sisterhood — [all the women who had ever loved in [the world]321-the world]1327-all the women who had ever loved in the world .

[Barney]140-barney need never know it — though [she]107-valancy would not in the least have minded [his]1203-this man knowing . But [she]107-valancy knew it and it made a tremendous difference to [her]107-valancy . Just to love ! [She]107-valancy did not ask to be loved . It was rapture enough just to sit there beside [him]1203-this man in silence , alone in the summer night in the white splendour of moonshine , with the wind blowing down on them out of [the pine woods]1239-the pine woods . [She]107-valancy had always envied the wind . So free . Blowing where it listed . Through [the hills]1238-the hills . Over [the lakes]1331-the lakes . What a tang , what a zip it had ! What a magic of adventure ! [Valancy]107-valancy felt as if [she]107-valancy had exchanged [her]107-valancy shop - worn soul for a fresh one , fire - new from the workshop of [the gods]1332-the gods . As far back as [she]107-valancy could look , life had been dull — colourless — savourless . Now [she]107-valancy had come to a little patch of violets , purple and fragrant — hers for the plucking . No matter who or what had been in [Barney]140-barney ’s past — no matter who or what might be in [his]1203-this man future — [no one else]453-no one else could ever have this perfect hour . [She]107-valancy surrendered [herself]107-valancy utterly to the charm of the moment .

“ Ever dream of ballooning ? ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney suddenly .

“ No , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ [I]107-valancy do — often . Dream of sailing through the clouds — seeing the glories of sunset — spending hours in the midst of a terrific storm with lightning playing above and below [you]2608-you — skimming above a silver cloud floor under a full moon — wonderful ! ”[107-valancy]

“ It does sound so , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . “ [I]107-valancy ’ve stayed on [earth]2609-earth in [my]107-valancy dreams . ”[107-valancy]

[She]107-valancy told [him]1203-this man about [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle . It was so easy to tell [Barney]140-barney things . [One]332-one felt [he]1203-this man understood everything — even the things [you]1336-you did n’t tell [him]1203-this man . And then [she]107-valancy told [him]1203-this man a little of [her]107-valancy existence before [she]107-valancy came to [[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s]1118-roaring abel ’s . [She]107-valancy wanted [him]1203-this man to see why [she]107-valancy had gone to the dance “ up back . ”[107-valancy]

“ [You]1203-this man see — [I’ve]107-valancy never had any real life , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy said . “ [I]107-valancy ’ve just — breathed . Every door has always been shut to [me]107-valancy . ”[107-valancy]

“ But [you]140-barney ’re still young , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney .

“ Oh , [I]107-valancy know . Yes , [I]107-valancy ’m ‘ still young’—but that ’s so different from young , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy bitterly . For a moment [she]107-valancy was tempted to tell [Barney]140-barney why [her]107-valancy years had nothing to do with [her]107-valancy future ; but [she]107-valancy did not . [She]107-valancy was not going to think of death tonight .

“ Though [I]107-valancy never was really young , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy went on—“until tonight , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy added in [her]107-valancy heart . “ [I]107-valancy never had a life like [other girls]2610-other girls . [You]140-barney could n’t understand . [Why,”—she]227-why,”—she[107-valancy] had a desperate desire that [Barney]140-barney should know the worst about her—“I did n’t even love [[my]107-valancy mother]2565-my mother . Is n’t it awful that [I]107-valancy do n’t love [[my]107-valancy mother]2565-my mother ? ”[107-valancy]

“ Rather awful — for [her]2565-my mother , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney drily .

“ Oh , [she]2565-my mother did n’t know it . [She]2565-my mother took [my]107-valancy love for granted . And [I]107-valancy was n’t any use or comfort to [her]2565-my mother or [anybody]454-anybody . [I]107-valancy was just a — a — vegetable . And [I]107-valancy got tired of it . That ’s why [I]107-valancy came to keep [house]2474-house for [Mr. Gay]211-mr. gay and look after [Cissy]182-cissy . ”[107-valancy]

“ And [I]107-valancy suppose [[your]107-valancy people]2615-your people thought [you]107-valancy ’d gone mad . ”[107-valancy]

“ [They]2615-your people did — and do — literally , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . “ But it ’s a comfort to [them]2615-your people . [They]2615-your people ’d rather believe [me]107-valancy mad than bad . There ’s no other alternative . But [I]107-valancy ’ve been living since [I]107-valancy came to [Mr. Gay]211-mr. gay ’s . It ’s been a delightful experience . [I]107-valancy suppose [I]107-valancy ’ll pay for it when [I]107-valancy have to go back — but [I]107-valancy ’ll have had it . ”[107-valancy]

“ That ’s true , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney . “ If [you]107-valancy buy [your]107-valancy experience it ’s [your]107-valancy own . So it ’s no matter how much [you]107-valancy pay for it . [Somebody else]2616-somebody else ’s experience can never be [yours]107-valancy . Well , it ’s [a funny old world]2617-a funny old world . ”[140-barney]

“ Do [you]140-barney think it really is old ? ”[107-valancy] asked [Valancy]107-valancy dreamily . “ [I]107-valancy never believe that in [June]15-june . It seems so young tonight — somehow . In that quivering moonlight — like [a young , white girl]2618-a young , white girl — waiting . ”[107-valancy]

“ Moonlight here on the verge of up back is different from moonlight anywhere else , ”[140-barney] agreed [Barney]140-barney . “ It always makes [me]140-barney feel so clean , somehow — body and soul . And of course the age of gold always comes back in spring . ”[140-barney]

It was ten o’clock now . [A dragon of black cloud]1338-a dragon of black cloud ate up the moon . The spring air grew chill — [Valancy]107-valancy shivered . [Barney]140-barney reached back into the innards of [Lady Jane]210-lady jane and clawed up an old , tobacco - scented overcoat .

“ Put that on , ”[1339-i] [he]1339-i ordered .

“ Do n’t [you]140-barney want it [yourself]140-barney ? ”[107-valancy] protested [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ No . [I]140-barney ’m not going to have [you]140-barney catching cold on [my]140-barney hands . ”[140-barney]

“ Oh , [I]1339-i wo n’t catch cold . [I]1339-i have n’t had a cold since [I]1339-i came to [Mr. Gay’s]229-mr. gay’s — though [I]1339-i ’ve done the foolishest things . It ’s funny , too — [I]1339-i used to have them all the time . [I]1339-i feel so selfish taking [your]140-barney coat . ”[1339-i]

“ [You]140-barney ’ve sneezed three times . No use winding up [your]140-barney ‘ experience ’ up back with grippe or pneumonia . ”[1339-i]

[He]1339-i pulled it up tight about [her]107-valancy throat and buttoned it on [her]107-valancy . [Valancy]107-valancy submitted with secret delight . How nice it was to have some one look after [you]1340-you so ! [She]107-valancy snuggled down into the tobaccoey folds and wished the night could last forever .

Ten minutes later [a car]1315-a car swooped down on [them]1342-them from “ up back . ”[140-barney] [Barney]140-barney sprang from [Lady Jane]210-lady jane and waved [his]1339-i hand . [The car]1343-the car came to a stop beside [them]1342-them . [Valancy]107-valancy saw [Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington and [Olive]175-olive gazing at [her]107-valancy in horror from [it]1315-a car .

[So Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington had got [a car]1315-a car ! And [he]1339-i must have been spending the evening up at [Mistawis]27-mistawis with [Cousin Herbert]230-cousin herbert . [Valancy]107-valancy almost laughed aloud at the expression on [his]1339-i face as [he]1339-i recognised [her]107-valancy . [The pompous , bewhiskered old humbug]231-the pompous , bewhiskered old humbug !

“ Can [you]95-uncle wellington let [me]140-barney have enough gas to take [me]140-barney to [Deerwood]5-deerwood ? ”[140-barney] [Barney]140-barney was asking politely . But [Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington was not attending to [him]1339-i .

“ [Valancy]107-valancy , how came [you]107-valancy [here]2277-here ! ”[95-uncle wellington] [he]95-uncle wellington said sternly .

“ By chance or [God]103-god ’s grace , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ With this jail - bird — at ten o’clock at night ! ”[95-uncle wellington] said [Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington .

[Valancy]107-valancy turned to [Barney]140-barney . The moon had escaped from its dragon and in its light [her]140-barney eyes were full of deviltry .

“ Are [you]140-barney [a jail - bird]2620-a jail - bird ? ”[107-valancy]

“ Does it matter ? ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney , gleams of fun in [his]1339-i eyes .

“ Not to [me]107-valancy . [I]107-valancy only asked out of curiosity , ”[107-valancy] continued [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ Then [I]95-uncle wellington wo n’t tell [you]140-barney . [I]95-uncle wellington never satisfy curiosity . ”[95-uncle wellington] [He]95-uncle wellington turned to [Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington and [his]95-uncle wellington voice changed subtly .

“ [Mr. Stirling]213-james stirling , [I]95-uncle wellington asked [you]213-james stirling if [you]213-james stirling could let [me]95-uncle wellington have some gas . If [you]213-james stirling can , well and good . If not , [we]2621-we are only delaying [you]213-james stirling unnecessarily . ”[95-uncle wellington]

[Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington was in a horrible dilemma . To give gas to [this shameless pair]1345-this shameless pair ! But not to give it to [them]1345-this shameless pair ! To go away and leave [them]1345-this shameless pair there in [the Mistawis woods]1346-the mistawis woods — until daylight , likely . It was better to give it to [them]1345-this shameless pair and let [them]1345-this shameless pair get out of sight before [any one else]1085-any one else saw [them]1345-this shameless pair .

“ Got anything to get gas in ? ”[95-uncle wellington] [he]95-uncle wellington grunted surlily .

[Barney]140-barney produced a two - gallon measure from [Lady Jane]210-lady jane . [The two men]1348-the two men went to the rear of [the Stirling car]1349-the stirling car and began manipulating the tap . [Valancy]107-valancy stole sly glances at [Olive]175-olive over the collar of [Barney]140-barney ’s coat . [Olive]175-olive was sitting grimly staring straight ahead with an outraged expression . [She]175-olive did not mean to take any notice of [Valancy]107-valancy . [Olive]175-olive had [her]175-olive own secret reasons for feeling outraged . [Cecil]102-cecil had been in [Deerwood]5-deerwood lately and of course had heard all about [Valancy]107-valancy . [He]102-cecil agreed that [her]107-valancy mind was deranged and was exceedingly anxious to find out whence the derangement had been inherited . It was a serious thing to have in [the family]451-the family — a very serious thing . [One]332-one had to think of [one’s]1352-one’s — [descendants]1353-descendants .

“ [She]107-valancy got it from [the Wansbarras]34-the wansbarras , ”[175-olive] said [Olive]175-olive positively . “ There ’s nothing like that in [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings — nothing ! ”[175-olive]

“ [I]102-cecil hope not — [I]102-cecil certainly hope not , ”[102-cecil] [Cecil]102-cecil had responded dubiously . “ But then — to go out as [a servant]2622-a servant — for that is what it practically amounts to . [[Your]102-cecil cousin]2623-your cousin ! ”[102-cecil]

[Poor Olive]101-olive felt the implication . [The Port Lawrence Prices]1354-the port lawrence prices were not accustomed to ally [themselves]1354-the port lawrence prices with [families whose members]1355-families whose members “ worked out . ”[107-valancy]

[Valancy]107-valancy could not resist temptation . [She]107-valancy leaned forward .

“ [Olive]101-olive , does it hurt ? ”[107-valancy]

[Olive]101-olive bit — stiffly .

“ Does what hurt ? ”[107-valancy]

“ Looking like that . ”[107-valancy]

For a moment [Olive]101-olive resolved [she]101-olive would take no further notice of [Valancy]107-valancy . Then duty came uppermost . [She]101-olive must not miss the opportunity .

“ [Doss]106-doss , ”[101-olive] [she]101-olive implored , leaning forward also , “ wo n’t [you]106-doss come [home]612-home — come [home]612-home tonight ? ”[101-olive]

[Valancy]107-valancy yawned .

“ [You]106-doss sound like a revival meeting , ”[101-olive] [she]101-olive said . “ [You]106-doss really do . ”[101-olive]

“ If [you]106-doss will come back — — ”[101-olive]

“ All will be forgiven . ”[101-olive]

“ Yes , ”[101-olive] said [Olive]101-olive eagerly . “ And [me]107-valancy having the time of [my]107-valancy life , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , laughing .

[Valancy]107-valancy was still leaning forward . [Her]107-valancy little hat with its crimson rose was tilted down over one eye . [Olive]101-olive stared . [She]107-valancy looked — not pretty — [Doss]106-doss could n’t be pretty — but provocative , fascinating — yes , abominably so . [Olive]101-olive drew back . It was beneath [her]101-olive dignity to say more . After all , [Valancy]107-valancy must be both mad and bad .

“ Thanks — that ’s enough , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney behind [the car]1343-the car . “ Much obliged , [Mr. Stirling]213-james stirling . Two gallons — seventy cents . Thank [you]213-james stirling . ”[140-barney]

[Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington climbed foolishly and feebly into [[his]95-uncle wellington car]655-his car . No doubt [he]95-uncle wellington carried firearms .

[Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington looked indecisively at [Valancy]107-valancy . But [Valancy]107-valancy had turned [her]107-valancy back on [him]95-uncle wellington and was watching [Barney]140-barney pour the gas into [[Lady Jane]210-lady jane ’s maw]1359-lady jane ’s maw .
