“ [The little hussy]2630-the little hussy ! [The shameless little hussy]2631-the shameless little hussy ! ”[95-uncle wellington] said [Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington .

CHAPTER XXII

The next thing [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings heard was that [Valancy]107-valancy had been seen with [Barney Snaith]140-barney in [a movie theatre in [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence]1360-a movie theatre in port lawrence and after it at supper in [a Chinese restaurant there]1361-a chinese restaurant there . This was quite true — and [no one]515-no one was more surprised at it than [Valancy]107-valancy [herself]107-valancy . [Barney]140-barney had come along in [Lady Jane]210-lady jane one dim twilight and told [Valancy]107-valancy unceremoniously if [she]107-valancy wanted a drive to hop in .

“ [I]140-barney ’m going to [the Port]2254-the port . Will [you]107-valancy go [there]448-there with [me]140-barney ? ”[140-barney]

[His]1363-his eyes were teasing and there was a bit of defiance in [his]1363-his voice . [Valancy]107-valancy , who did not conceal from [herself]107-valancy that [she]107-valancy would have gone anywhere with [him]1363-his to any place , “ hopped in ”[107-valancy] without more ado . [They]1364-they tore into and through [Deerwood]5-deerwood . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles , taking a little air on [the verandah]688-the verandah , saw [them]1364-they whirl by in a cloud of dust and sought comfort in [each other]1303-each other ’s eyes . [Valancy]107-valancy , who in some dim pre - existence had been afraid of [a car]1315-a car , was hatless and [her]107-valancy hair was blowing wildly round [her]107-valancy face . [She]107-valancy would certainly come down with bronchitis — and die at [Roaring Abel ’s]141-roaring abel . [She]107-valancy wore a low - necked dress and [her]107-valancy arms were bare . [That Snaith creature]1368-that snaith creature was in [his]1368-that snaith creature shirt - sleeves , smoking a pipe . [They]1364-they were going at the rate of forty miles an hour — sixty , [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles averred . [Lady Jane]210-lady jane could hit the pike when [she]210-lady jane wanted to . [Valancy]107-valancy waved [her]107-valancy hand gaily to [[her]107-valancy relatives]838-her relatives . As for [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick , [she]99-mrs. frederick was wishing [she]99-mrs. frederick knew how to go into hysterics .

“ Was it for this , ”[99-mrs. frederick] [she]99-mrs. frederick demanded in hollow tones , “ that [I]99-mrs. frederick suffered the pangs of motherhood ? ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ [I]97-cousin stickles will not believe , ”[97-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles solemnly , “ that [our]838-her relatives prayers will not yet be answered . ”[97-cousin stickles]

“ Who — who will protect [that unfortunate girl]2634-that unfortunate girl when [I]99-mrs. frederick am gone ? ”[99-mrs. frederick] moaned [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick .

As for [Valancy]107-valancy , [she]107-valancy was wondering if it could really be only a few weeks since [she]107-valancy had sat there with [them]838-her relatives on [that verandah]1370-that verandah . Hating the rubber - plant . Pestered with teasing questions like black flies . Always thinking of appearances . Cowed because of [Aunt Wellington]91-aunt wellington ’s teaspoons and [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin ’s money . Poverty - stricken . Afraid of [everybody]422-everybody . [Envying Olive]101-olive . [A slave to moth - eaten traditions]1372-a slave to moth - eaten traditions . Nothing to hope for or expect .

And now every day was a gay adventure .

[Lady Jane]210-lady jane flew over the fifteen miles between [Deerwood]5-deerwood and [the Port]2254-the port — through [the Port]2254-the port . The way [Barney]140-barney went past [traffic policemen]1375-traffic policemen was not holy . The lights were beginning to twinkle out like stars in the clear , lemon - hued twilight air . This was the only time [Valancy]107-valancy ever really liked [the town]1376-the town , and [she]107-valancy was crazy with the delight of speeding . Was it possible [she]107-valancy had ever been afraid of [a car]1315-a car ? [She]107-valancy was perfectly happy , riding beside [Barney]140-barney . Not that [she]107-valancy deluded [herself]107-valancy into thinking it had any significance . [She]107-valancy knew quite well that [Barney]140-barney had asked [her]107-valancy to go on the impulse of the moment — an impulse born of a feeling of pity for [her]107-valancy and [her]107-valancy starved little dreams . [She]107-valancy was looking tired after a wakeful night with a heart attack , followed by a busy day . [She]107-valancy had so little fun . [He]1378-he ’d give [her]107-valancy an outing for once . Besides , [Abel]141-roaring abel was in [the kitchen]2472-the kitchen , at the point of drunkenness where [he]141-roaring abel was declaring [he]141-roaring abel did not believe in [God]103-god and beginning to sing ribald songs . It was just as well [she]107-valancy should be out of the way for a while . [Barney]140-barney knew [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s repertoire .

[They]1380-they went to the movie — [Valancy]107-valancy had never been to a movie . And then , finding a nice hunger upon [them]1380-they , [they]1380-they went and had fried chicken — unbelievably delicious — in [the Chinese restaurant]1381-the chinese restaurant . After which [they]1380-they rattled [home]612-home again , leaving a devastating trail of scandal behind [them]1380-they . [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick gave up going to [church]501-church altogether . [She]99-mrs. frederick could not endure [[her]99-mrs. frederick friends]1384-her friends ’ pitying glances and questions . But [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles went every Sunday . [She]99-mrs. frederick said [they]1380-they had been given a cross to bear .

CHAPTER XXIII

On one of [Cissy]182-cissy ’s wakeful nights , [she]182-cissy told [Valancy]107-valancy [her]182-cissy poor little story . [They]1380-they were sitting by the open window . [Cissy]182-cissy could not get [her]182-cissy breath lying down that night . An inglorious gibbous moon was hanging over [the wooded hills]1385-the wooded hills and in its spectral light [Cissy]182-cissy looked frail and lovely and incredibly young . [A child]520-a child . It did not seem possible that [she]182-cissy could have lived through all the passion and pain and shame of [her]182-cissy story .

“ [He]2635-he was stopping at [the hotel across [the lake]1234-the lake]2636-the hotel across the lake . [He]2635-he used to come over in [his]2635-he canoe at night — [we]1380-they met in [the pines down [the shore]2639-the shore]2638-the pines down the shore . [He]2635-he was [a young college student]2640-a young college student — [[his]2635-he father]2641-his father was [a rich man in [Toronto]26-toronto]2642-a rich man in toronto . Oh , [Valancy]107-valancy , [I]107-valancy did n’t mean to be bad — [I]107-valancy did n’t , indeed . But [I]107-valancy loved [him]2635-he so — [I]107-valancy love [him]2635-he yet — [I’ll]107-valancy always love [him]2635-he . And [I]107-valancy — didn’t know — some things . [I]107-valancy didn’t — understand . Then [[his]2635-he father]2641-his father came and took [him]2635-he away . And — after a little — [I]107-valancy found out — oh , [Valancy,—I]233-valancy,—i was so frightened . [I]107-valancy did n’t know what to do . [I]107-valancy wrote [him]2635-he — and [he]2635-he came . [He]2635-he — [he]2635-he said [he]2635-he would marry [me]107-valancy , [Valancy]107-valancy . ”[107-valancy]

“ And why — and why ? — — ”[107-valancy]

“ Oh , [Valancy]107-valancy , [he]2635-he did n’t love [me]107-valancy any more . [I]107-valancy saw that at a glance . [He]2635-he — [he]2635-he was just offering to marry [me]107-valancy because [he]2635-he thought [he]2635-he ought to — because [he]2635-he was sorry for [me]107-valancy . [He]2635-he was n’t bad — but [he]2635-he was so young — and what was [I]107-valancy that [he]2635-he should keep on loving [me]107-valancy ? ”[107-valancy]

“ Never mind making excuses for [him]2635-he , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy a bit shortly . “ So [you]107-valancy would n’t marry [him]2635-he ? ”[107-valancy]

“ [I]107-valancy couldn’t — not when [he]2635-he did n’t love [me]107-valancy any more . Somehow — [I]107-valancy ca n’t explain — it seemed a worse thing to do than — the other . [He]2635-he — [he]2635-he argued a little — but [he]2635-he went away . Do [you]107-valancy think [I]107-valancy did right , [Valancy]107-valancy ? ”[107-valancy]

“ Yes , [I]107-valancy do . [You]107-valancy did right . But [he]2635-he — — ”[107-valancy]

“ Do n’t blame [him]2635-he , [dear]2211-dear . Please do n’t . Let ’s not talk about [him]2635-he at all . There ’s no need . [I]107-valancy wanted to tell [you]107-valancy how it was — [I]107-valancy did n’t want [you]107-valancy to think [me]107-valancy bad — — ”[107-valancy]

“ [I]107-valancy never did think so . ”[107-valancy]

“ Yes , [I]107-valancy felt that — whenever [you]107-valancy came . Oh , [Valancy]107-valancy , what [you]107-valancy ’ve been to [me]107-valancy ! [I]107-valancy can never tell [you]107-valancy — but [God]103-god will bless [you]107-valancy for it . [I]107-valancy know [He]103-god will—‘with what measure [ye]107-valancy mete . ’ ”[107-valancy]

[Cissy]182-cissy sobbed for a few minutes in [Valancy]107-valancy ’s arms . Then [she]182-cissy wiped [her]182-cissy eyes .

“ Well , that ’s almost all . [I]107-valancy came [home]612-home . [I]107-valancy was n’t really so very unhappy . [I]107-valancy suppose [I]107-valancy should have been — but [I]107-valancy was n’t . [Father]2646-father was n’t hard on [me]107-valancy . And [[my]107-valancy baby]2647-my baby was so sweet while [he]103-god lived . [I]107-valancy was even happy — [I]107-valancy loved [him]103-god so much , [the dear little thing]2648-the dear little thing . [He]103-god was so sweet , [Valancy]107-valancy — with such lovely blue eyes — and little rings of pale gold hair like silk floss — and tiny dimpled hands . [I]107-valancy used to bite [his]103-god satin - smooth little face all over — softly , so as not to hurt [him]103-god , [you]107-valancy know — — ”[107-valancy]

“ [I]107-valancy know , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , wincing . “ [I]107-valancy know — [a woman]414-a woman always knows — and dreams — — ”[107-valancy]

“ And [he]103-god was all [mine]107-valancy . [Nobody else]862-nobody else had any claim on [him]103-god . When [he]103-god died , oh , [Valancy]107-valancy , [I]107-valancy thought [I]107-valancy must die too — [I]107-valancy did n’t see how [anybody]454-anybody could endure such anguish and live . To see [his]103-god dear little eyes and know [he]103-god would never open them again — to miss [his]103-god warm little body nestled against [mine]107-valancy at night and think of [him]103-god sleeping alone and cold , [his]103-god wee face under the hard frozen earth . It was so awful for the first year — after that it was a little easier , [one]332-one did n’t keep thinking ‘ this day last year’—but [I]107-valancy was so glad when [I]107-valancy found out [I]107-valancy was dying . ”[107-valancy]

“ ‘ Who could endure life if it were not for the hope of death ? ’ ”[107-valancy] murmured [Valancy]107-valancy softly — it was of course a quotation from some book of [John Foster]114-john foster ’s .

“ [I]182-cissy ’m glad [I]182-cissy ’ve told [you]107-valancy all about it , ”[182-cissy] sighed [Cissy]182-cissy . “ [I]182-cissy wanted [you]107-valancy to know . ”[182-cissy]

[Cissy]182-cissy died a few nights after that . [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel was away . When [Valancy]107-valancy saw the change that had come over [Cissy]182-cissy ’s face [she]107-valancy wanted to telephone for [the doctor]2251-the doctor . But [Cissy]182-cissy would n’t let [her]107-valancy .

“ [Valancy]107-valancy , why should [you]107-valancy ? [He]141-roaring abel can do nothing for [me]107-valancy . [I]107-valancy ’ve known for several days that — this — was near . Let [me]107-valancy die in peace , [dear]2211-dear — just holding [your]2211-dear hand . Oh , [I]107-valancy ’m so glad [you]2211-dear ’re here . Tell [Father]206-father good - bye for [me]107-valancy . [He]206-father ’s always been as good to [me]107-valancy as [he]206-father knew how — and [Barney]140-barney . Somehow , [I]107-valancy think that [Barney]140-barney — — ”[107-valancy]

But a spasm of coughing interrupted and exhausted [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy fell asleep when it was over , still holding to [Valancy]107-valancy ’s hand . [Valancy]107-valancy sat there in the silence . [She]107-valancy was not frightened — or even sorry . At sunrise [Cissy]182-cissy died . [She]182-cissy opened [her]182-cissy eyes and looked past [Valancy]107-valancy at something — something that made [her]182-cissy smile suddenly and happily . And , smiling , [she]182-cissy died .

[Valancy]107-valancy crossed [Cissy]182-cissy ’s hands on [her]107-valancy breast and went to the open window . In the eastern sky , amid the fires of sunrise , an old moon was hanging — as slender and lovely as a new moon . [Valancy]107-valancy had never seen an old , old moon before . [She]107-valancy watched it pale and fade until it paled and faded out of sight in the living rose of day . [A little pool in [the barrens]1124-the barrens]1388-a little pool in the barrens shone in the sunrise like a great golden lily .

But [the world]321-the world suddenly seemed [a colder place to [Valancy]107-valancy]1391-a colder place to valancy . Again [nobody]348-nobody needed [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy was not in the least sorry [Cecilia]182-cissy was dead . [She]107-valancy was only sorry for all [her]107-valancy suffering in life . But [nobody]348-nobody could ever hurt [her]107-valancy again . [Valancy]107-valancy had always thought death dreadful . But [Cissy]182-cissy had died so quietly — so pleasantly . And at the very last — something — had made up to [her]182-cissy for everything . [She]182-cissy was lying there now , in [her]182-cissy white sleep , looking like [a child]520-a child . Beautiful ! All the lines of shame and pain gone .

[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel drove in , justifying [his]141-roaring abel name . [Valancy]107-valancy went down and told [him]141-roaring abel . The shock sobered [him]141-roaring abel at once . [He]141-roaring abel slumped down on the seat of [his]141-roaring abel buggy , [his]141-roaring abel great head hanging .

“ [Cissy]182-cissy dead — [Cissy]182-cissy dead , ”[141-roaring abel] [he]141-roaring abel said vacantly . “ [I]141-roaring abel did n’t think it would ‘ a ’ come so soon . [Dead]234-dead . [She]182-cissy used to run down [the lane]2654-the lane to meet [me]141-roaring abel with a little white rose stuck in [her]182-cissy hair . [Cissy]182-cissy used to be [a pretty little girl]587-a pretty little girl . And [a good little girl]2656-a good little girl . ”[141-roaring abel]

“ [She]182-cissy has always been [a good little girl]2656-a good little girl , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

[CHAPTER XXIV

Valancy]235-valancy [herself]107-valancy made [Cissy]182-cissy ready for burial . No hands but [hers]107-valancy should touch that pitiful , wasted little body . [The old house]1395-the old house was spotless on the day of the funeral . [Barney Snaith]140-barney was not [there]448-there . [He]1397-he had done all [he]1397-he could to help [Valancy]235-valancy before [it]1398-it — [he]1397-he had shrouded the pale [Cecilia]182-cissy in white roses from [the garden]1104-the garden — and then had gone back to [[his]1397-he island]1400-his island . But [everybody else]741-everybody else was [there]448-there . All [Deerwood]5-deerwood and “ up back ”[1403-they] came . [They]1403-they forgave [Cissy]182-cissy splendidly at last . [Mr. Bradly]236-mr. bradly gave a very beautiful funeral address . [Valancy]235-valancy had wanted [[her]107-valancy old Free Methodist man]1404-her old free methodist man , but [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel was obdurate . [He]1404-her old free methodist man was [a Presbyterian]466-a presbyterian and [no one]515-no one but [a Presbyterian minister]1407-a presbyterian minister should bury [[his]1404-her old free methodist man daughter]1408-his daughter . [Mr. Bradly]236-mr. bradly was very tactful . [He]236-mr. bradly avoided all dubious points and it was plain to be seen [he]236-mr. bradly hoped for the best . [Six reputable citizens of [Deerwood]5-deerwood]1409-six reputable citizens of deerwood bore [Cecilia Gay]182-cissy to [her]182-cissy grave in [decorous Deerwood cemetery]1410-decorous deerwood cemetery . Among [them]1409-six reputable citizens of deerwood was [Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington .

[The Stirlings]1411-the stirlings all came to the funeral , [men]2185-men and [women]2354-women . [They]1411-the stirlings had had a family conclave over it . Surely now that [Cissy Gay]182-cissy was dead [Valancy]235-valancy would come [home]612-home . [She]182-cissy simply could not stay [there]448-there with [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel . That being the case , the wisest course — decreed [Uncle James]107-valancy — was to attend the funeral — legitimise the whole thing , so to speak — show [Deerwood]5-deerwood that [Valancy]107-valancy had really done a most creditable deed in going to nurse poor [Cecilia Gay]182-cissy and that [[her]107-valancy family]983-her family backed [her]107-valancy up in it . [Death]237-death , [the miracle worker]1417-the miracle worker , suddenly made the thing quite respectable . If [Valancy]107-valancy would return to [home]612-home and decency while public opinion was under [its]1419-its influence all might yet be well . [Society]1420-society was suddenly forgetting all [Cecilia]182-cissy ’s wicked doings and remembering what a pretty , modest little thing [she]182-cissy had been—“and motherless , [you]2658-you know — motherless ! ”[107-valancy] It was the psychological moment — said [Uncle James]107-valancy .

So [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings went to the funeral . [Even [Cousin Gladys]92-dr. trent ’ neuritis]1421-even cousin gladys ’ neuritis allowed [her]182-cissy to come . [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles was there , [her]97-cousin stickles bonnet dripping all over [her]97-cousin stickles face , crying as woefully as if [Cissy]182-cissy had been [her]97-cousin stickles nearest and dearest . Funerals always brought [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles ’ “ own sad bereavement ”[97-cousin stickles] back .

And [Uncle Wellington]95-uncle wellington was [a pall - bearer]1422-a pall - bearer .

[Valancy]107-valancy , pale , subdued - looking , [her]107-valancy slanted eyes smudged with purple , in [her]107-valancy snuff - brown dress , moving quietly about , finding seats for [people]2198-people , consulting in undertones with [minister]1424-minister and [undertaker]1425-undertaker , marshalling [the “ mourners ”]2659-the “ mourners ”[107-valancy] into [the parlour]2406-the parlour , was so decorous and proper and [Stirlingish]238-stirlingish that [[her]107-valancy family]983-her family took heart of grace . This was not — could not be — [the girl who had sat all night in [the woods]2193-the woods with [Barney Snaith]140-barney — who had gone tearing bareheaded through [Deerwood]5-deerwood and [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence]1428-the girl who had sat all night in the woods with barney snaith — who had gone tearing bareheaded through deerwood and port lawrence . This was the Valancy [they]1430-they knew . [Really]239-really , surprisingly capable and efficient . Perhaps [she]107-valancy had always been kept down a bit too much — [Amelia]164-amelia really was rather strict — hadn’t had a chance to show what was in [her]107-valancy . So thought [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings . And [Edward Beck]135-edward beck , from [the Port road]1431-the port road , [a widower with a large family who was beginning to take notice , took notice of [Valancy]107-valancy]1432-a widower with a large family who was beginning to take notice , took notice of valancy and thought [she]107-valancy might make [a mighty fine second wife]1433-a mighty fine second wife . No beauty — but [a fifty - year - old widower]1434-a fifty - year - old widower , [Mr. Beck]240-mr. beck told [himself]240-mr. beck very reasonably , could n’t expect everything . Altogether , it seemed that [Valancy]107-valancy ’s matrimonial chances were never so bright as [they]1435-they were at [Cecilia Gay]182-cissy ’s funeral .

What [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings and [Edward Beck]135-edward beck would have thought had [they]1430-they known the back of [Valancy]107-valancy ’s mind must be left to the imagination . [Valancy]107-valancy was hating the funeral — hating [the people who came to stare with curiosity at [Cecilia]182-cissy ’s marble - white face]1436-the people who came to stare with curiosity at cecilia ’s marble - white face — hating the smugness — hating the dragging , melancholy singing — hating [Mr. Bradly]236-mr. bradly ’s cautious platitudes . If [she]107-valancy could have had [her]107-valancy absurd way , there would have been no funeral at all . [She]107-valancy would have covered [Cissy]182-cissy over with flowers , shut [her]182-cissy away from prying eyes , and buried [her]182-cissy beside [[her]107-valancy nameless little baby]1437-her nameless little baby in [the grassy burying - ground under the pines of [the “ up back ”[107-valancy] church]1439-the “ up back ” church]1438-the grassy burying - ground under the pines of the “ up back ” church , with a bit of kindly prayer from [the old Free Methodist minister]1440-the old free methodist minister . [She]107-valancy remembered [Cissy]182-cissy saying once , “ [I]182-cissy wish [I]182-cissy could be buried deep in [the heart of [the woods]2193-the woods]2660-the heart of the woods where [nobody]348-nobody would ever come to say , ‘ [Cissy Gay]182-cissy is buried here , ’ and tell over [my]182-cissy miserable story . ”[182-cissy]

But this ! However , it would soon be over . [Valancy]107-valancy knew , if [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings and [Edward Beck]135-edward beck did n’t , exactly what [she]107-valancy intended to do then . [She]107-valancy had lain awake all the preceding night thinking about it and finally deciding on it .

When the funeral procession had left [the house]364-the house , [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick sought out [Valancy]107-valancy in [the kitchen]2472-the kitchen .

“ [[My]99-mrs. frederick child]2663-my child , ”[99-mrs. frederick] [she]99-mrs. frederick said tremulously , “ [you]107-valancy ’ll come [home]612-home now ? ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ [Home]612-home , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy absently . [She]107-valancy was getting on an apron and calculating how much tea [she]107-valancy must put to steep for supper . There would be [several guests from “ up back”—distant[107-valancy] relatives of [the Gays]1444-the gays ’ who had not remembered [them]1445-them for years]1443-several guests from “ up back”—distant relatives of the gays ’ who had not remembered them for years . And [she]107-valancy was so tired [she]107-valancy wished [she]107-valancy could borrow a pair of legs from the cat .

“ Yes , [home]612-home , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick , with a touch of asperity . “ [I]99-mrs. frederick suppose [you]107-valancy wo n’t dream of staying [here]2277-here now — alone with [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel . ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ Oh , no , [I]107-valancy ’m not going to stay [here]2277-here , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . “ Of course , [I]107-valancy ’ll have to stay for a day or two , to put [the house]364-the house in order generally . But that will be all . Excuse [me]107-valancy , [Mother]96-mother , wo n’t [you]96-mother ? [I]107-valancy ’ve a frightful lot to do — [all those “[107-valancy] up back ” people]2670-all those “ up back ” people will be here to supper . ”[99-mrs. frederick]

[Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick retreated in considerable relief , and [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings went [home]612-home with lighter hearts .

“ [We]2671-we will just treat [her]107-valancy as if nothing had happened when [she]107-valancy comes back , ”[108-uncle benjamin] decreed [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin . “ That will be the best plan . Just as if nothing had happened . ”[108-uncle benjamin]

CHAPTER XXV

On the evening of the day after the funeral [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel went off for a spree . [He]141-roaring abel had been sober for four whole days and could endure it no longer . Before [he]141-roaring abel went , [Valancy]107-valancy told [him]141-roaring abel [she]107-valancy would be going away the next day . [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel was sorry , and said so . [A distant cousin from “ up back ”]2672-a distant cousin from “ up back ”[141-roaring abel] was coming to keep [house]2474-house for [him]141-roaring abel — quite willing to do so now since there was [no sick girl to wait on]1448-no sick girl to wait on — but [Abel]141-roaring abel was not under any delusions concerning [her]107-valancy .

“ [She]107-valancy wo n’t be like [you]107-valancy , [[my]141-roaring abel girl]2584-my girl . Well , [I]141-roaring abel ’m obliged to [you]107-valancy . [You]107-valancy helped [me]141-roaring abel out of a bad hole and [I]141-roaring abel wo n’t forget it . And [I]141-roaring abel wo n’t forget what [you]107-valancy did for [Cissy]182-cissy . [I]141-roaring abel ’m [[your]107-valancy friend]2674-your friend , and if [you]107-valancy ever want any of [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings spanked and sot in a corner send for [me]141-roaring abel . [I]141-roaring abel ’m going to wet [my]141-roaring abel whistle . [Lord]2675-lord , but [I]141-roaring abel ’m dry ! Do n’t reckon [I]141-roaring abel ’ll be back afore tomorrow night , so if [you]107-valancy ’re going [home]612-home tomorrow , good - bye now . ”[141-roaring abel]

“ [I]107-valancy may go [home]612-home tomorrow , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , “ but [I]107-valancy ’m not going back to [Deerwood]5-deerwood . ”[107-valancy]

“ Not going — — ”[141-roaring abel]

“ [You]107-valancy ’ll find the key on the woodshed nail , ”[107-valancy] interrupted [Valancy]107-valancy , politely and unmistakably . “ The dog will be in [the barn]687-the barn and the cat in [the cellar]2679-the cellar . Do n’t forget to feed [her]2680-her till [[your]107-valancy cousin]2623-your cousin comes . [The pantry]496-the pantry is full and [I]107-valancy made bread and pies today . Good - bye , [Mr. Gay]211-mr. gay . [You]107-valancy have been very kind to [me]107-valancy and [I]107-valancy appreciate it . ”[107-valancy]

“ [We]2683-we ’ve had a d —— d decent time of it together , and that ’s a fact , ”[141-roaring abel] said [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel . “ [You]107-valancy ’re the best small sport in [the world]321-the world , and [your]107-valancy little finger is worth [the whole Stirling clan]436-the whole stirling clan tied together . Good - bye and good - luck . ”[141-roaring abel]

[Valancy]107-valancy went out to [the garden]1104-the garden . [Her]107-valancy legs trembled a little , but otherwise [she]107-valancy felt and looked composed . [She]107-valancy held something tightly in [her]107-valancy hand . [The garden]1104-the garden was lying in the magic of the warm , odorous July twilight . A few stars were out and the robins were calling through the velvety silences of [the barrens]1124-the barrens . [Valancy]107-valancy stood by the gate expectantly . Would [he]141-roaring abel come ? If [he]141-roaring abel did not — —

[He]141-roaring abel was coming . [Valancy]107-valancy heard [Lady Jane Grey]210-lady jane far back in [the woods]2193-the woods . [Her]107-valancy breath came a little more quickly . Nearer — and nearer — [she]107-valancy could see [Lady Jane]210-lady jane now — bumping down [the lane]2654-the lane — nearer — nearer — [he]141-roaring abel was there — [he]141-roaring abel had sprung from [the car]1343-the car and was leaning over the gate , looking at [her]107-valancy .

“ Going [home]612-home , [Miss Stirling]175-olive ? ”[141-roaring abel]

“ [I]107-valancy do n’t know — yet , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy slowly . [Her]107-valancy mind was made up , with no shadow of turning , but the moment was very tremendous .

“ [I]140-barney thought [I]140-barney ’d run down and ask if there was anything [I]140-barney could do for [you]107-valancy , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney .

[Valancy]107-valancy took it with a canter .

“ Yes , there is something [you]140-barney can do for [me]107-valancy , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy said , evenly and distinctly . “ Will [you]140-barney marry [me]107-valancy ? ”[107-valancy]

For a moment [Barney]140-barney was silent . There was no particular expression on [his]141-roaring abel face . Then [he]141-roaring abel gave an odd laugh .

“ Come , now ! [I]141-roaring abel knew luck was just waiting around the corner for [me]141-roaring abel . All the signs have been pointing that way today . ”[141-roaring abel]

“ Wait . ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy lifted [her]107-valancy hand . “ [I]107-valancy ’m in earnest — but [I]107-valancy want to get [my]107-valancy breath after that question . Of course , with [my]107-valancy bringing up , [I]107-valancy realise perfectly well that this is one of the things ‘ [a lady]2322-a lady should not do . ’ ”[107-valancy]

“ But why — why ? ”[107-valancy]

“ For two reasons . ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy was still a little breathless , but [she]107-valancy looked [Barney]140-barney straight in the eyes , while [all the dead Stirlings]1455-all the dead stirlings revolved rapidly in [their]1455-all the dead stirlings graves and [the living ones]1456-the living ones did nothing because [they]1456-the living ones did not know that [Valancy]107-valancy was at that moment proposing lawful marriage to the notorious [Barney Snaith]140-barney . “ The first reason is , [I]107-valancy — [I”—Valancy]241-i”—valancy[107-valancy] tried to say “ [I]107-valancy love [you]140-barney ”[107-valancy] but could not . [She]107-valancy had to take refuge in a pretended flippancy . “ [I]107-valancy ’m crazy about [you]1457-you . The second is — this . ”[107-valancy]

[She]107-valancy handed [him]1457-you [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s letter .

[Barney]140-barney opened it with the air of [a man thankful to find some safe , sane thing to do]1458-a man thankful to find some safe , sane thing to do . As [he]1457-you read it [his]1457-you face changed . [He]1457-you understood — more perhaps than [Valancy]107-valancy wanted [him]1457-you to .

“ Are [you]1457-you sure nothing can be done for [you]1457-you ? ”[1457-you]

[Valancy]107-valancy did not misunderstand the question .

“ Yes . [You]1457-you know [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s reputation in regard to heart disease . [I]107-valancy have n’t long to live — perhaps only a few months — a few weeks . [I]107-valancy want to live them . [I]107-valancy ca n’t go back to [Deerwood]5-deerwood — [you]1457-you know what [my]107-valancy life was like there . [And”—she]107-valancy[107-valancy] managed it this time—“I love [you]1457-you . [I]107-valancy want to spend the rest of [my]107-valancy life with [you]1457-you . That ’s all . ”[107-valancy]

[Barney]140-barney folded [his]1457-you arms on the gate and looked gravely enough at a white , saucy star that was winking at [him]1457-you just over [Roaring [Abel]141-roaring abel ’s kitchen chimney]1459-roaring abel ’s kitchen chimney .

“ [You]107-valancy do n’t know anything about [me]140-barney . [I]140-barney may be [a — murderer]2688-a — murderer . ”[140-barney]

“ No , [I]107-valancy do n’t . [You]140-barney may be something dreadful . Everything [they]2689-they say of [you]140-barney may be true . But it does n’t matter to [me]107-valancy . ”[107-valancy]

“ [You]107-valancy care that much for [me]140-barney , [Valancy]107-valancy ? ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney incredulously , looking away from the star and into [her]1460-her eyes — [her]1460-her strange , mysterious eyes .

“ [I]107-valancy care — that much , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy in a low voice . [She]1460-her was trembling . [He]1461-he had called [her]1460-her by [her]1460-her name for the first time . It was sweeter than [another man]1462-another man ’s caress could have been just to hear [him]1461-he say [her]1460-her name like that .

“ If [we]2690-we are going to get married , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney , speaking suddenly in a casual , matter - of - fact voice , “ some things must be understood . ”[140-barney]

“ Everything must be understood , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ [I]140-barney have things [I]140-barney want to hide , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney coolly . “ [You]107-valancy are not to ask [me]140-barney about them . ”[140-barney]

“ [I]107-valancy wo n’t , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ [You]107-valancy must never ask to see [my]140-barney mail . ”[140-barney]

“ Never . ”[140-barney]

“ And [we]2690-we are never to pretend anything to each other . ”[140-barney]

“ [We]2690-we wo n’t , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . “ [You]107-valancy wo n’t even have to pretend [you]107-valancy like [me]107-valancy . If [you]107-valancy marry [me]107-valancy [I]107-valancy know [you]107-valancy ’re only doing it out of pity . ”[107-valancy]

“ And [we]2690-we ’ll never tell a lie to [each other]1303-each other about anything — a big lie or a petty lie . ”[140-barney]

“ Especially a petty lie , ”[107-valancy] agreed [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ And [you]107-valancy ’ll have to live back on [[my]140-barney island]2692-my island . [I]140-barney wo n’t live anywhere else . ”[140-barney]

“ That ’s partly why [I]107-valancy want to marry [you]1463-you , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

[Barney]140-barney peered at [her]107-valancy .

“ [I]140-barney believe [you]107-valancy mean it . Well — let ’s get married , then . ”[140-barney]

“ Thank [you]1463-you , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , with a sudden return of primness . [She]107-valancy would have been much less embarrassed if [he]1463-you had refused [her]107-valancy .

“ [I]140-barney suppose [I]140-barney have n’t any right to make conditions . But [I]140-barney ’m going to make one . [You]107-valancy are never to refer to [my]140-barney heart or [my]140-barney liability to sudden death . [You]107-valancy are never to urge [me]140-barney to be careful . [You]107-valancy are to forget — absolutely forget — that [I]140-barney ’m not perfectly healthy . [I]140-barney have written a letter to [[my]140-barney mother]2565-my mother — here it is — [you]107-valancy are to keep it . [I]140-barney have explained everything in it . If [I]140-barney drop dead suddenly — as [I]140-barney likely will do — — ”[140-barney]

“ It will exonerate [me]140-barney in the eyes of [[your]107-valancy kindred]2694-your kindred from the suspicion of having poisoned [you]107-valancy , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney with a grin .

“ Exactly . ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy laughed gaily . “ Dear [me]107-valancy , [I]107-valancy ’m glad this is over . It has been — a bit of an ordeal . [You]107-valancy see , [I]107-valancy ’m not in the habit of going about asking [men]2185-men to marry [me]107-valancy . It is so nice of [you]107-valancy not to refuse [me]107-valancy — or offer to be [a brother]2696-a brother ! ”[107-valancy]

“ [I]107-valancy ’ll go to [the Port]2254-the port tomorrow and get a license . [We]2698-we can be married tomorrow evening . [Dr. Stalling]131-dr. stalling , [I]107-valancy suppose ? ”[107-valancy]

“ Heavens , no . ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy shuddered . “ Besides , [he]131-dr. stalling would n’t do it . [He]131-dr. stalling ’d shake [his]131-dr. stalling forefinger at [me]107-valancy and [I]107-valancy ’d jilt [you]107-valancy at the altar . No , [I]107-valancy want [my]107-valancy old [Mr. Towers]222-mr. towers to marry [me]107-valancy . ”[107-valancy]

“ Will [you]107-valancy marry [me]140-barney as [I]140-barney stand ? ”[140-barney] demanded [Barney]140-barney . [A passing car]1464-a passing car , full of [tourists]1465-tourists , honked loudly — it seemed derisively . [Valancy]107-valancy looked at [him]1466-he . Blue homespun shirt , nondescript hat , muddy overalls . Unshaved !

“ Yes , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy said .

[Barney]140-barney put [his]1466-he hands over the gate and took [her]107-valancy little , cold ones gently in [his]1466-he .

“ [Valancy]107-valancy , ”[1466-he] [he]1466-he said , trying to speak lightly , “ of course [I]1466-he ’m not in love with [you]107-valancy — never thought of such a thing as being in love . But , do [you]107-valancy know , [I]1466-he ’ve always thought [you]107-valancy were a bit of [a dear]2699-a dear . ”[1466-he]

CHAPTER XXVI

The next day passed for [Valancy]107-valancy like a dream . [She]107-valancy could not make [herself]107-valancy or anything [she]107-valancy did seem real . [She]107-valancy saw nothing of [Barney]140-barney , though [she]107-valancy expected [he]1466-he must go rattling past on [his]1466-he way to [the Port]2254-the port for a license .

Perhaps [he]1466-he had changed [his]1466-he mind .

But at dusk the lights of [Lady Jane]210-lady jane suddenly swooped over the crest of [the wooded hill beyond [the lane]2654-the lane]1468-the wooded hill beyond the lane . [Valancy]107-valancy was waiting at the gate for [[her]107-valancy bridegroom]1470-her bridegroom . [She]107-valancy wore [her]107-valancy green dress and [her]107-valancy green hat because [she]107-valancy had nothing else to wear . [She]107-valancy did not look or feel at all bride - like — [she]107-valancy really looked like a wild elf strayed out of the greenwood . But that did not matter . Nothing at all mattered except that [Barney]140-barney was coming for [her]107-valancy .

“ Ready ? ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney , stopping [Lady Jane]210-lady jane with some new , horrible noises .

“ Yes . ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy stepped in and sat down . [Barney]140-barney was in [his]1466-he blue shirt and overalls . But they were clean overalls . “ No . Have [you]140-barney ? ”[140-barney]

Then the lights of [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence were about [them]1471-they . [They]1471-they were standing up together before [Mr. Towers]222-mr. towers . [Valancy]107-valancy heard [Mr. Towers]222-mr. towers and [Barney]140-barney saying things . CHAPTER XXVII

[Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana came down [the lane leading up to [[her]110-cousin georgiana little house]1506-her little house]1505-the lane leading up to her little house . [She]110-cousin georgiana lived half a mile out of [Deerwood]5-deerwood and [she]110-cousin georgiana wanted to go in to [[Amelia]164-amelia ’s]1507-amelia ’s and find out if [Doss]106-doss had come [home]612-home yet . [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana was anxious to see [Doss]106-doss . [She]110-cousin georgiana had something very important to tell [her]110-cousin georgiana . Something , [she]110-cousin georgiana was sure , [Doss]106-doss would be delighted to hear . [Poor Doss]106-doss ! [She]110-cousin georgiana had had rather a dull life of it . [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana owned to [herself]110-cousin georgiana that [she]110-cousin georgiana would not like to live under [Amelia]164-amelia ’s thumb . For the time being , [she]110-cousin georgiana quite forgot to wonder which of [them]1509-them would go next .

And here was [Doss]106-doss [herself]106-doss , coming along [the road]756-the road from [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s in such a queer green dress and hat . Talk about luck . [Valancy]107-valancy , who had been living for four days on [[her]107-valancy [enchanted island]1514-enchanted island]1513-her enchanted island , had decided that [she]107-valancy might as well go in to [Deerwood]5-deerwood and tell [[her]107-valancy relatives]838-her relatives that [she]107-valancy was married . “ Yes , [you]2187-my dear . [He]135-edward beck fell in love with [you]2187-my dear at the funeral . And [he]135-edward beck came to consult [me]107-valancy about it . “ [I]107-valancy ’m sure [you]2187-my dear would . [You]2187-my dear were always so fond of [children]962-children . ”[107-valancy]

“ But nine is such [a family]2764-a family to start with , ”[107-valancy] objected [Valancy]107-valancy gravely .

“ [The two oldest]2765-the two oldest are grown up and [the third almost]2766-the third almost . That leaves only six that really count . And most of [them]962-children are [boys]2333-boys . “ Jump at [him]240-mr. beck , ”[107-valancy] supplied [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ Oh , no , no , [dear]2211-dear . [I]107-valancy would n’t use such an indelicate expression . [I]107-valancy told [him]240-mr. beck [I]107-valancy thought [you]2187-my dear would consider [his]240-mr. beck proposal favourably . “ [He]2816-he has a score of aliases , no doubt , ”[108-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin . “ For [my]108-uncle benjamin part , [I]108-uncle benjamin believe [the man]2229-the man is half [Indian]258-indian .
