“ If [he]2816-he has married [her]140-barney under the name of [Snaith]140-barney and it is n’t [his]2816-he real name would n’t that make the marriage null and void ? ”[97-cousin stickles] asked [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles hopefully .

[Uncle James]107-valancy shook [his]108-uncle benjamin head .

“ No , it is [the man who marries , not the name]2821-the man who marries , not the name . ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ [You]107-valancy know , ”[92-dr. trent] said [Cousin Gladys]92-dr. trent , who had recovered and returned but was still shaky , “ [I]92-dr. trent had a distinct premonition of this at [Herbert]230-cousin herbert ’s silver dinner . [I]92-dr. trent remarked it at the time . When [she]140-barney was defending [Snaith]107-valancy . [You]107-valancy remember , of course . It came over [me]92-dr. trent like a revelation . [I]92-dr. trent spoke to [David]156-uncle david when [I]92-dr. trent went [home]612-home about it . ”[92-dr. trent]

“ What — what , ”[1558-aunt wellington of the universe] demanded [Aunt Wellington of [the universe]1559-the universe]1558-aunt wellington of the universe , “ has come over [Valancy]107-valancy ? [Valancy]107-valancy ! ”[1558-aunt wellington of the universe]

[The universe]1559-the universe did not answer but [Uncle James]107-valancy did .

“ Is n’t there something coming up of late about secondary personalities cropping out ? [I]92-dr. trent do n’t hold with many of those new - fangled notions , but there may be something in this one . It would account for [her]107-valancy incomprehensible conduct . ”[92-dr. trent]

“ [Valancy]107-valancy is so fond of mushrooms , ”[110-cousin georgiana] sighed [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana . “ [I]110-cousin georgiana ’m afraid [she]107-valancy ’ll get poisoned eating toadstools by mistake living up back in [the woods]2193-the woods . ”[110-cousin georgiana]

“ There are worse things than death , ”[107-valancy] said [Uncle James]107-valancy , believing that it was the first time in [the world]321-the world that such a statement had been made .

“ Nothing can ever be the same again ! ”[97-cousin stickles] sobbed [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles .

[Valancy]107-valancy , hurrying along [the dusty road]1562-the dusty road , back to [cool Mistawis]27-mistawis and [[her]107-valancy purple island]1563-her purple island , had forgotten all about [them]1564-them — just as [she]107-valancy had forgotten that [she]107-valancy might drop dead at any moment if [she]107-valancy hurried .

CHAPTER XXVIII

[Summer]259-summer passed by . [The Stirling clan]461-the stirling clan — with the insignificant exception of [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana — had tacitly agreed to follow [Uncle James]107-valancy ’ example and look upon [Valancy]107-valancy as one dead . To be sure , [Valancy]107-valancy had an unquiet , ghostly habit of recurring resurrections when [she]107-valancy and [Barney]140-barney clattered through [Deerwood]5-deerwood and out to [the Port]2254-the port in [that unspeakable car]1567-that unspeakable car . [Valancy]107-valancy , bareheaded , with stars in [her]107-valancy eyes . [Barney]140-barney , bareheaded , smoking [his]1568-his pipe . But shaved . Always shaved now , if any of [them]1569-them had noticed it . [They]1569-them even had the audacity to go in to [[Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin ’s store]575-uncle benjamin ’s store to buy groceries . [Twice Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin ignored [them]1569-them . Was not [Valancy]107-valancy [one of the dead]1571-one of the dead ? While [Snaith]140-barney had never existed . But the third time [he]108-uncle benjamin told [Barney]140-barney [he]108-uncle benjamin was [a scoundrel who should be hung for luring an unfortunate , weak - minded girl away from [[her]107-valancy home and [friends]2214-friends]1573-her home and friends]1572-a scoundrel who should be hung for luring an unfortunate , weak - minded girl away from her home and friends .

[Barney]140-barney ’s one straight eyebrow went up .

“ [I]108-uncle benjamin have made [her]107-valancy happy , ”[108-uncle benjamin] [he]108-uncle benjamin said coolly , “ and [she]107-valancy was miserable with [[her]107-valancy friends]1384-her friends . So that ’s that . ”[108-uncle benjamin]

[Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin stared . It had never occurred to [him]108-uncle benjamin that [women]2354-women had to be , or ought to be , “ made happy . ”[2354-women]

“ [You]140-barney — [you]140-barney pup ! ”[108-uncle benjamin] [he]108-uncle benjamin said .

“ Why be so unoriginal ? ”[140-barney] queried [Barney]140-barney amiably . “ [Anybody]454-anybody could call [me]140-barney a pup . Why not think of something worthy of [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings ? Besides , [I]140-barney ’m not a pup . [I]140-barney ’m really quite a middle - aged dog . Thirty - five , if [you]108-uncle benjamin ’re interested in knowing . ”[140-barney]

[Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin remembered just in time that [Valancy]107-valancy was dead . [He]108-uncle benjamin turned [his]108-uncle benjamin back on [Barney]140-barney .

[Valancy]107-valancy was happy — gloriously and entirely so . [She]107-valancy seemed to be living in [a wonderful house of life]1576-a wonderful house of life and every day opened [a new , mysterious room]1577-a new , mysterious room . It was in [a world which had nothing in common with the one [she]107-valancy had left behind]1578-a world which had nothing in common with the one she had left behind — [a world where time was not]1579-a world where time was not — which was young with [immortal youth]1580-immortal youth — where there was neither past nor future but only the present . [She]107-valancy surrendered [herself]107-valancy utterly to the charm of it .

The absolute freedom of it all was unbelievable . [They]1581-they could do exactly as [they]1581-they liked . [No Mrs. Grundy]260-no mrs. grundy . No traditions . [No relatives]1582-no relatives . [Or in - laws]1583-or in - laws . “ Peace , perfect peace , with [loved ones]2826-loved ones far away , ”[140-barney] as [Barney]140-barney quoted shamelessly .

[Valancy]107-valancy had gone [home]612-home once and got [her]107-valancy cushions . And [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana had given [her]107-valancy one of [her]110-cousin georgiana famous candlewick spreads of most elaborate design . “ For [your]107-valancy spare - room bed , [dear]2211-dear , ”[110-cousin georgiana] [she]110-cousin georgiana said .

“ But [I]107-valancy have n’t got any spare - room , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

[Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana looked horrified . [A house without a spare - room]1585-a house without a spare - room was monstrous to [her]110-cousin georgiana .

“ But it ’s a lovely spread , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , with a kiss , “ and [I]107-valancy ’m so glad to have it . [I]107-valancy ’ll put it on [[my]107-valancy own bed]2828-my own bed . [Barney]140-barney ’s old patch - work quilt is getting ragged . ”[107-valancy]

“ [I]110-cousin georgiana do n’t see how [you]107-valancy can be contented to live up back , ”[110-cousin georgiana] sighed [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana . “ It ’s so out of [the world]321-the world . ”[110-cousin georgiana]

“ Contented ! ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy laughed . What was the use of trying to explain to [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana . “ It is , ”[110-cousin georgiana] [she]110-cousin georgiana agreed , “ most gloriously and entirely out of [the world]321-the world . ”[110-cousin georgiana]

“ And [you]107-valancy are really happy , [dear]2211-dear ? ”[110-cousin georgiana] asked [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana wistfully .

“ [I]107-valancy really am , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy gravely , [her]107-valancy eyes dancing .

“ Marriage is such a serious thing , ”[110-cousin georgiana] sighed [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana .

“ When it ’s going to last long , ”[107-valancy] agreed [Valancy]107-valancy .

[Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana did not understand this at all . But it worried [her]110-cousin georgiana and [she]110-cousin georgiana lay awake at nights wondering what [Valancy]107-valancy meant by it .

[Valancy]107-valancy loved [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle and was completely satisfied with [it]400-her blue castle . [The big living - room]1587-the big living - room had three windows , all commanding exquisite views of [exquisite Mistawis]27-mistawis . [The one in the end of [the room]472-the room]1588-the one in the end of the room was an oriel window — which [Tom MacMurray]243-tom macmurray , [Barney]140-barney explained , had got out of [some little , old “ up back ”[140-barney] church]1590-some little , old “ up back ” church that had been sold . It faced the west and when the sunsets flooded [it]1587-the big living - room [Valancy]107-valancy ’s whole being knelt in prayer as if in [some great cathedral]1591-some great cathedral . The new moons always looked down through it , the lower pine boughs swayed about the top of it , and all through the nights the soft , dim silver of [the lake]1234-the lake dreamed through it .

There was a stone fireplace on the other side . No desecrating gas imitation but a real fireplace where [you]1593-you could burn real logs . With a big grizzly bearskin on the floor before it , and beside it a hideous , red - plush sofa of [Tom MacMurray]243-tom macmurray ’s régime . But its ugliness was hidden by silver - grey timber wolf skins , and [Valancy]107-valancy ’s cushions made [it]1587-the big living - room gay and comfortable . In a corner a nice , tall , lazy old clock ticked — the right kind of a clock . One that did not hurry the hours away but ticked them off deliberately . It was the jolliest looking old clock . A fat , corpulent clock with a great , round , [man]1594-man ’s face painted on it , the hands stretching out of its nose and the hours encircling it like a halo .

There was a big glass case of stuffed owls and several deer heads — likewise of [Tom MacMurray]243-tom macmurray ’s vintage . Some comfortable old chairs that asked to be sat upon . A squat little chair with a cushion was prescriptively [Banjo]246-banjo ’s . If [anybody else]1595-anybody else dared sit on it [Banjo]246-banjo glared [him]1595-anybody else out of it with [his]246-banjo topaz - hued , black - ringed eyes . [Banjo]246-banjo had an adorable habit of hanging over the back of it , trying to catch [his]246-banjo own tail . Losing [his]246-banjo temper because [he]246-banjo could n’t catch it . Giving it a fierce bite for spite when [he]246-banjo did catch it . Yowling malignantly with pain . [Barney]140-barney and [Valancy]107-valancy laughed at [him]246-banjo until [they]1596-they ached . But it was Good Luck [they]1596-they loved . [They]1596-they were both agreed that Good Luck was so lovable that [he]246-banjo practically amounted to an obsession .

One side of the wall was lined with rough , homemade book - shelves filled with books , and between the two side windows hung an old mirror in a faded gilt frame , with fat cupids gamboling in the panel over the glass . A mirror , [Valancy]107-valancy thought , that must be like the fabled mirror into which [Venus]261-venus had once looked and which thereafter reflected as beautiful [every woman who looked into it]1597-every woman who looked into it . [Valancy]107-valancy thought [she]107-valancy was almost pretty in that mirror . But that may have been because [she]107-valancy had shingled [her]107-valancy hair .

This was before the day of bobs and was regarded as a wild , unheard - of proceeding — unless [you]1598-you had typhoid . When [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick heard of it [she]99-mrs. frederick almost decided to erase [Valancy]107-valancy ’s name from the family Bible . [Barney]140-barney cut the hair , square off at the back of [Valancy]107-valancy ’s neck , bringing it down in a short black fringe over [her]107-valancy forehead . It gave a meaning and a purpose to [her]107-valancy little , three - cornered face that it never had possessed before . Even [her]107-valancy nose ceased to irritate [her]107-valancy . [Her]107-valancy eyes were bright , and [her]107-valancy sallow skin had cleared to the hue of creamy ivory . The old family joke had come true — [she]107-valancy was really fat at last — anyway , no longer skinny . [Valancy]107-valancy might never be beautiful , but [she]107-valancy was of the type that looks its best in [the woods]2193-the woods — elfin — mocking — alluring .

[Her]107-valancy heart bothered [her]107-valancy very little . When an attack threatened [she]107-valancy was generally able to head it off with [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s prescription . The only bad one [she]107-valancy had was one night when [she]107-valancy was temporarily out of medicine . And it was a bad one . For the time being , [Valancy]107-valancy realised keenly that death was actually waiting to pounce on [her]107-valancy any moment . But the rest of the time [she]107-valancy would not — did not — let [herself]107-valancy remember it at all .

CHAPTER XXIX

[Valancy]107-valancy toiled not , neither did [she]107-valancy spin . There was really very little work to do . [She]107-valancy cooked [their]1600-them meals on a coal - oil stove , performing all [her]107-valancy little domestic rites carefully and exultingly , and [they]1600-them ate out on the verandah that almost overhung [the lake]1234-the lake . Before [them]1600-them lay [Mistawis]27-mistawis , like a scene out of some fairy tale of old time . And [Barney]140-barney smiling [his]1602-his twisted , enigmatical smile at [her]107-valancy across the table .

“ What a view [old Tom]243-tom macmurray picked out when [he]243-tom macmurray built [this shack]2832-this shack ! ”[140-barney] [Barney]140-barney would say exultantly .

Supper was the meal [Valancy]107-valancy liked best . The faint laughter of winds was always about [them]1600-them and the colours of [Mistawis]27-mistawis , imperial and spiritual , under the changing clouds were something that can not be expressed in mere words . Shadows , too . Clustering in the pines until a wind shook [them]1600-them out and pursued [them]1600-them over [Mistawis]27-mistawis . [They]1600-them lay all day along [the shores]1603-the shores , threaded by ferns and wild blossoms . [They]1600-them stole around [the headlands]1604-the headlands in the glow of the sunset , until twilight wove them all into one great web of dusk .

The cats , with [their]1605-their wise , innocent little faces , would sit on the verandah railing and eat the tidbits [Barney]140-barney flung [them]1600-them . And how good everything tasted ! [Valancy]107-valancy , amid all the romance of [Mistawis]27-mistawis , never forgot that [men]2185-men had stomachs . [Barney]140-barney paid [her]107-valancy no end of compliments on [her]107-valancy cooking .

“ After all , ”[1607-i] [he]1607-i admitted , “ there ’s something to be said for square meals . [I]1607-i ’ve mostly got along by boiling two or three dozen eggs hard at once and eating a few when [I]1607-i got hungry , with a slice of bacon once in a while and a jorum of tea . ”[1607-i]

[Valancy]107-valancy poured tea out of [Barney]140-barney ’s little battered old pewter teapot of incredible age . [She]107-valancy had not even a set of dishes — only [Barney]140-barney ’s mismatched chipped bits — and a dear , big , pobby old jug of robin’s - egg blue .

After the meal was over [they]1608-they would sit there and talk for hours — or sit and say nothing , in all the languages of [the world]321-the world , [Barney]140-barney pulling away at [his]1607-i pipe , [Valancy]107-valancy dreaming idly and deliciously , gazing at [the far - off hills beyond [Mistawis]27-mistawis where the spires of firs]1610-the far - off hills beyond mistawis where the spires of firs came out against the sunset . The moonlight would begin to silver [the Mistawis]27-mistawis dusk . [Bats]263-bats would begin to swoop darkly against the pale , western gold . [The little waterfall that came down on [the high bank not far away]1612-the high bank not far away]1611-the little waterfall that came down on the high bank not far away would , by some whim of [the wildwood gods]1613-the wildwood gods , begin to look like [a wonderful white woman beckoning through the spicy , fragrant evergreens]1614-a wonderful white woman beckoning through the spicy , fragrant evergreens . And [Leander]249-leander would begin to chuckle diabolically on [the mainland shore]1615-the mainland shore . How sweet it was to sit there and do nothing in the beautiful silence , with [Barney]140-barney at the other side of the table , smoking !

There were [plenty of other islands in sight]1616-plenty of other islands in sight , though none were near enough to be troublesome as [neighbours]1617-neighbours . There was [one little group of [islets far off to the west]1619-islets far off to the west which [they]1608-they called [the Fortunate Isles]55-the fortunate isles]1618-one little group of islets far off to the west which they called the fortunate isles . At sunrise [they]1618-one little group of islets far off to the west which they called the fortunate isles looked like a cluster of emeralds , at sunset like a cluster of amethysts . [They]1618-one little group of islets far off to the west which they called the fortunate isles were too small for [houses]1620-houses ; but the lights on [the larger islands]1621-the larger islands would bloom out all over [the lake]1234-the lake , and bonfires would be lighted on [[their]1618-one little group of islets far off to the west which they called the fortunate isles shores]1623-their shores , streaming up into the wood shadows and throwing great , blood - red ribbons over [the waters]1624-the waters . Music would drift to [them]1608-they alluringly from boats here and there , or from the verandahs on [the big house of the millionaire on [the biggest island]1626-the biggest island]1625-the big house of the millionaire on the biggest island .

“ Would [you]107-valancy like [a house like that]2321-a house like that , [Moonlight]264-moonlight ? ”[140-barney] [Barney]140-barney asked once , waving [his]1627-his hand at it . [He]1627-his had taken to calling [her]1628-her [Moonlight]264-moonlight , and [Valancy]107-valancy loved it .

“ No , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , who had once dreamed of [a mountain castle ten times the size of [the rich man]1629-the rich man ’s “ cottage]2834-a mountain castle ten times the size of the rich man ’s “ cottage ”[1627-his] and now pitied [the poor inhabitants of [palaces]1631-palaces]1630-the poor inhabitants of palaces . “ No . [It]2834-a mountain castle ten times the size of the rich man ’s “ cottage ’s too elegant . [I]107-valancy would have to carry it with [me]107-valancy everywhere [I]107-valancy went . On [my]107-valancy back like a snail . [It]2834-a mountain castle ten times the size of the rich man ’s “ cottage would own [me]107-valancy — possess [me]107-valancy , body and soul . [I]107-valancy like [a house [I]107-valancy can love and cuddle and boss . Just like [ours]2836-ours here]2835-a house i can love and cuddle and boss . just like ours here . [I]107-valancy do n’t envy [Hamilton Gossard]56-hamilton gossard ‘ [the finest summer residence in [Canada]10-canada]2837-the finest summer residence in canada . ’ [It]56-hamilton gossard is magnificent , but [it]56-hamilton gossard is n’t [[my]107-valancy Blue Castle]2473-my blue castle . ”[107-valancy]

Away down at [the far end of [the lake]1234-the lake]1632-the far end of the lake [they]1634-they got every night a glimpse of [a big , continental train]1635-a big , continental train rushing through [a clearing]1636-a clearing . [Valancy]107-valancy liked to watch [its]1635-a big , continental train lighted windows flash by and wonder who was on [it]1635-a big , continental train and what hopes and fears it carried . [She]107-valancy also amused [herself]107-valancy by picturing [Barney]140-barney and [herself]107-valancy going to the dances and dinners in [[the houses]1637-the houses on [the islands]1639-the islands]1638-the houses on the islands , but [she]107-valancy did not want to go in reality . Once [they]1634-they did go to a masquerade dance in [the pavilion at one of [the hotels up [the lake]1234-the lake]1641-the hotels up the lake]1640-the pavilion at one of the hotels up the lake , and had a glorious evening , but slipped away in [[their]1634-they canoe]1643-their canoe , before unmasking time , back to [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle .

“ It was lovely — but [I]107-valancy do n’t want to go again , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

So many hours a day [Barney]140-barney shut [himself]140-barney up in [[Bluebeard]245-bluebeard ’s Chamber]2721-bluebeard ’s chamber . [Valancy]107-valancy never saw the inside of it . From the smells that filtered through at times [she]107-valancy concluded [he]1646-you must be conducting chemical experiments — or counterfeiting money . [Valancy]107-valancy supposed there must be smelly processes in making counterfeit money . But [she]107-valancy did not trouble [herself]107-valancy about it . [She]107-valancy had no desire to peer into [the locked chambers of [Barney]140-barney ’s house of life]1647-the locked chambers of barney ’s house of life . [His]1646-you past and [his]1646-you future concerned [her]107-valancy not . Only this rapturous present . Nothing else mattered .

Once [he]1646-you went away and stayed away two days and nights . [He]1646-you had asked [Valancy]107-valancy if [she]107-valancy would be afraid to stay alone and [she]107-valancy had said [she]107-valancy would not . [He]1646-you never told [her]107-valancy where [he]1646-you had been . [She]107-valancy was not afraid to be alone , but [she]107-valancy was horribly lonely . The sweetest sound [she]107-valancy had ever heard was [Lady Jane]210-lady jane ’s clatter through [the woods]2193-the woods when [Barney]140-barney returned . And then [his]1646-you signal whistle from [the shore]2639-the shore . [She]107-valancy ran down to the landing rock to greet [him]1646-you — to nestle [herself]107-valancy into [his]1646-you eager arms — [they]1650-they did seem eager .

“ Have [you]107-valancy missed [me]140-barney , [Moonlight]264-moonlight ? ”[140-barney] [Barney]140-barney was whispering .

“ It seems a hundred years since [you]1646-you went away , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ [I]140-barney wo n’t leave [you]1646-you again . ”[140-barney]

“ [You]1646-you must , ”[107-valancy] protested [Valancy]107-valancy , “ if [you]1646-you want to . [I]107-valancy ’d be miserable if [I]107-valancy thought [you]1646-you wanted to go and did n’t , because of [me]107-valancy . [I]107-valancy want [you]1646-you to feel perfectly free . ”[107-valancy]

[Barney]140-barney laughed — a little cynically .

“ There is no such thing as freedom on [earth]2609-earth , ”[1651-he] [he]1651-he said . “ Only different kinds of bondages . And comparative bondages . [You]1646-you think [you]1646-you are free now because [you]1646-you ’ve escaped from a peculiarly unbearable kind of bondage . But are [you]1646-you ? [You]1646-you love [me]1651-he — that ’s a bondage . ”[1651-he]

“ Who said or wrote that ‘ [the prison unto which [we]1652-we doom [ourselves]1652-we no prison]2840-the prison unto which we doom ourselves no prison is ’ ? ”[107-valancy] asked [Valancy]107-valancy dreamily , clinging to [his]1651-he arm as [they]1652-we climbed up the rock steps .

“ Ah , now [you]1646-you have it , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney . “ That ’s all the freedom [we]1652-we can hope for — the freedom to choose [[our]1652-we prison]2841-our prison . But , [Moonlight,”—he]265-moonlight,”—he[140-barney] stopped at the door of [the Blue Castle]2-the blue castle and looked about [him]1651-he — at [the glorious lake]1653-the glorious lake , [the great , shadowy woods]1654-the great , shadowy woods , the bonfires , the twinkling lights—“Moonlight , [I]140-barney ’m glad to be [home]612-home again . When [I]140-barney came down through [the woods]2193-the woods and saw [[my]140-barney home]2844-my home lights — mine — gleaming out under the old pines — something [I]140-barney ’d never seen before — oh , [girl]2845-girl , [I]140-barney was glad — glad ! ”[140-barney]

But in spite of [Barney]140-barney ’s doctrine of bondage , [Valancy]107-valancy thought [they]1655-they were splendidly free . It was amazing to be able to sit up half the night and look at the moon if [you]1656-you wanted to . To be late for meals if [you]1656-you wanted to — [she]1657-she who had always been rebuked so sharply by [[her]1657-she mother]343-her mother and so reproachfully by [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles if [she]1657-she were one minute late . Dawdle over meals as long as [you]1656-you wanted to . Leave [your]1656-you crusts if [you]1656-you wanted to . Not come [home]612-home at all for meals if [you]1656-you wanted to . Sit on a sun - warm rock and paddle [your]1656-you bare feet in the hot sand if [you]1656-you wanted to . Just sit and do nothing in the beautiful silence if [you]1656-you wanted to . In short , do any fool thing [you]1656-you wanted to whenever the notion took [you]1656-you . If that was n’t freedom , what was ?

CHAPTER XXX

[They]1655-they did n’t spend all [their]1655-they days on [the island]1497-the island . [They]1655-they spent more than half of [them]1655-they wandering at will through [the enchanted Muskoka country]1661-the enchanted muskoka country . [Barney]140-barney knew [the woods]2193-the woods as a book and [he]1663-he taught [their]1655-they lore and craft to [Valancy]107-valancy . [He]1663-he could always find trail and haunt of [the shy wood people]1664-the shy wood people . [Valancy]107-valancy learned the different fairy - likenesses of the mosses — the charm and exquisiteness of woodland blossoms . [She]107-valancy learned to know every bird at sight and mimic its call — though never so perfectly as [Barney]140-barney . [She]107-valancy made [friends]2214-friends with every kind of tree . [She]107-valancy learned to paddle [a canoe]2736-a canoe as well as [Barney]140-barney [himself]140-barney . [She]107-valancy liked to be out in the rain and [she]107-valancy never caught cold .

Sometimes [they]1667-they took a lunch with [them]1667-they and went berrying — strawberries and blueberries . How pretty blueberries were — the dainty green of the unripe berries , the glossy pinks and scarlets of the half ripes , the misty blue of the fully matured ! And [Valancy]107-valancy learned the real flavour of the strawberry in its highest perfection . There was a certain sunlit dell on [the banks of [Mistawis]27-mistawis]1668-the banks of mistawis along which white birches grew on one side and on the other still , changeless ranks of young spruces . There were long grasses at the roots of the birches , combed down by the winds and wet with morning dew late into the afternoons . Here [they]1667-they found berries that might have graced the banquets of [Lucullus]57-lucullus , great ambrosial sweetnesses hanging like rubies to long , rosy stalks . [They]1667-they lifted them by the stalk and ate them from it , uncrushed and virgin , tasting each berry by itself with all its wild fragrance ensphered therein . When [Valancy]107-valancy carried any of these berries [home]612-home that elusive essence escaped and they became nothing more than the common berries of [the market - place]1670-the market - place — very kitchenly good indeed , but not as they would have been , eaten in [[their]1667-they birch dell]1671-their birch dell until [her]107-valancy fingers were stained as pink as [Aurora]266-aurora ’s eyelids .

Or [they]1667-they went after water - lilies . [Barney]140-barney knew where to find them in [the creeks and bays of [Mistawis]27-mistawis]1672-the creeks and bays of mistawis . Then [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle was glorious with [them]1674-them , every receptacle that [Valancy]107-valancy could contrive filled with the exquisite things . If not water lilies then cardinal flowers , fresh and vivid from [the swamps of [Mistawis]27-mistawis]1675-the swamps of mistawis , where they burned like ribbons of flame .

Sometimes [they]1667-they went trouting on [little nameless rivers]1676-little nameless rivers or hidden [brooks on whose banks]1677-brooks on whose banks [Naiads]267-naiads might have sunned [their]267-naiads white , wet limbs . Then all [they]1667-they took with [them]1667-they were some raw potatoes and salt . [They]1667-they roasted the potatoes over a fire and [Barney]140-barney showed [Valancy]107-valancy how to cook the trout by wrapping them in leaves , coating them with mud and baking them in a bed of hot coals . Never were such delicious meals . [Valancy]107-valancy had such an appetite it was no wonder [she]107-valancy put flesh on [her]107-valancy bones .

Or [they]1667-they just prowled and explored through woods that always seemed to be expecting something wonderful to happen . At least , that was the way [Valancy]107-valancy felt about [them]1667-they . Down [the next hollow]1678-the next hollow — over [the next hill]1679-the next hill — [you]1680-you would find it .

“ [We]1667-they do n’t know where [we]1667-they ’re going , but is n’t it fun to go ? ”[140-barney] [Barney]140-barney used to say .

Once or twice night overtook [them]1667-they , too far from [[their]1667-they Blue Castle]1681-their blue castle to get back . But [Barney]140-barney made [a fragrant bed of bracken and fir boughs]1682-a fragrant bed of bracken and fir boughs and [they]1667-they slept on it dreamlessly , under a ceiling of old spruces with moss hanging from them , while beyond [them]1667-they moonlight and the murmur of pines blended together so that [one]332-one could hardly tell which was light and which was sound .

There were rainy days , of course , when [Muskoka]16-muskoka was [a wet green land]1684-a wet green land . Days when showers drifted across [Mistawis]27-mistawis like pale ghosts of rain and [they]1667-they never thought of staying in because of it . Days when it rained in right good earnest and [they]1667-they had to stay in . Then [Barney]140-barney shut [himself]140-barney up in [[Bluebeard]245-bluebeard ’s Chamber]2721-bluebeard ’s chamber and [Valancy]107-valancy read , or dreamed on the wolfskins with Good Luck purring beside [her]107-valancy and [Banjo]246-banjo watching [them]1667-they suspiciously from [his]246-banjo own peculiar chair . On Sunday evenings [they]1667-they paddled across to [a point of land]1686-a point of land and walked from there through [the woods]2193-the woods to [the little Free Methodist church]1228-the little free methodist church . [One]332-one felt really too happy for Sunday . [Valancy]107-valancy had never really liked Sundays before .

And always , Sundays and weekdays , [she]107-valancy was with [Barney]140-barney . Nothing else really mattered . And what [a companion]1690-a companion [he]1690-a companion was ! How understanding ! How jolly ! How — how [Barney]140-barney - like ! That summed it all up .

[Valancy]107-valancy had taken some of [her]107-valancy two hundred dollars out of the bank and spent it in pretty clothes . [She]107-valancy had a little smoke - blue chiffon which [she]107-valancy always put on when [they]1667-they spent the evening at [home]612-home — smoke - blue with touches of silver about it . It was after [she]107-valancy began wearing it that [Barney]140-barney began calling [her]107-valancy Moonlight .

“ Moonlight and blue twilight — that is what [you]107-valancy look like in that dress . [I]140-barney like it . It belongs to [you]107-valancy . [You]107-valancy are n’t exactly pretty , but [you]107-valancy have some adorable beauty - spots . [Your]107-valancy eyes . And that little kissable dent just between [your]107-valancy collar bones . [You]107-valancy have the wrist and ankle of [an aristocrat]2846-an aristocrat . That little head of yours is beautifully shaped . And when [you]107-valancy look backward over [your]107-valancy shoulder [you]107-valancy ’re maddening — especially in twilight or moonlight . [An elf maiden]2847-an elf maiden . [A wood sprite]2848-a wood sprite . [You]107-valancy belong to [the woods]2193-the woods , Moonlight — [you]107-valancy should never be out of them . In spite of [your]107-valancy ancestry , there is something wild and remote and untamed about [you]107-valancy . And [you]107-valancy have such a nice , sweet , throaty , summery voice . Such a nice voice for love - making . ”[140-barney]

“ Shure an ’ ye’ve kissed [the Blarney Stone]268-the blarney stone , ”[107-valancy] scoffed [Valancy]107-valancy . But [she]107-valancy tasted these compliments for weeks .

[She]107-valancy got a pale green bathing - suit , too — a garment which would have given [her]107-valancy clan [their]1692-their deaths if [they]1692-their had ever seen [her]107-valancy in it . [Barney]140-barney taught [her]107-valancy how to swim . Sometimes [she]107-valancy put [her]107-valancy bathing - dress on when [she]107-valancy got up and did n’t take it off until [she]107-valancy went to bed — running down to [the water]1693-the water for a plunge whenever [she]107-valancy felt like it and sprawling on the sun - warm rocks to dry .

[She]107-valancy had forgotten all the old humiliating things that used to come up against [her]107-valancy in the night — the injustices and the disappointments . It was as if they had all happened to [some other person]1477-some other person — not to [her]107-valancy , [Valancy Snaith]107-valancy , who had always been happy .

“ [I]107-valancy understand now what it means to be born again , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy told [Barney]140-barney .

[Holmes]269-holmes speaks of grief “ staining backward ”[269-holmes] through the pages of life ; but [Valancy]107-valancy found [her]107-valancy happiness had stained backward likewise and flooded with rose - colour [her]107-valancy whole previous drab existence . [She]107-valancy found it hard to believe that [she]107-valancy had ever been lonely and unhappy and afraid .

“ When death comes , [I]107-valancy shall have lived , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy . “ [I]107-valancy shall have had [my]107-valancy hour . ”[107-valancy]

And [her]107-valancy dust - pile !

One day [Valancy]107-valancy had heaped up the sand in [the little island cove]1695-the little island cove in a tremendous cone and stuck a gay little Union Jack on top of it .

“ What are [you]107-valancy celebrating ? ”[140-barney] [Barney]140-barney wanted to know .

“ [I]107-valancy ’m just exorcising [an old demon]2850-an old demon , ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy told [him]1696-him .

CHAPTER XXXI

Autumn came . Late September with cool nights . [They]1697-they had to forsake [the verandah]688-the verandah ; but [they]1697-they kindled a fire in the big fireplace and sat before it with jest and laughter . [They]1697-they left the doors open , and [Banjo]246-banjo and Good Luck came and went at pleasure . Sometimes [they]1697-they sat gravely on the bearskin rug between [Barney]140-barney and [Valancy]107-valancy ; sometimes [they]1697-they slunk off into the mystery of the chill night outside . The stars smouldered in the horizon mists through [the old oriel]1699-the old oriel . The haunting , persistent croon of the pine - trees filled the air . The little waves began to make soft , sobbing splashes on the rocks below [them]1697-they in the rising winds . [They]1697-they needed no light but the firelight that sometimes leaped up and revealed [them]1697-they — sometimes shrouded [them]1697-they in shadow . When the night wind rose higher [Barney]140-barney would shut the door and light a lamp and read to [her]107-valancy — poetry and essays and gorgeous , dim chronicles of ancient wars . [Barney]140-barney never would read novels : [he]1696-him vowed they bored [him]1696-him . But sometimes [she]107-valancy read them [herself]107-valancy , curled up on the wolf skins , laughing aloud in peace . For [Barney]140-barney was not one of [those aggravating people who can never hear [you]1701-you smiling audibly over something [you]1701-you ’ve read without inquiring placidly , “ What is the joke ? ”[1700-those aggravating people who can never hear you smiling audibly over something you ’ve read without inquiring placidly , “ what is the joke ? ” october — with a gorgeous pageant of color around mistawis , into which valancy plunged her soul]

October — with a gorgeous pageant of color around [Mistawis]27-mistawis , into which [Valancy]107-valancy plunged [her]107-valancy soul]1700-those aggravating people who can never hear you smiling audibly over something you ’ve read without inquiring placidly , “ what is the joke ? ” october — with a gorgeous pageant of color around mistawis , into which valancy plunged her soul . Never had [she]107-valancy imagined anything so splendid . A great , tinted peace . Blue , wind - winnowed skies . Sunlight sleeping in [the glades of [that fairyland]1703-that fairyland]1702-the glades of that fairyland . Long dreamy purple days paddling idly in [their]1697-they canoe along [shores]1704-shores and up [the rivers of crimson and gold]1705-the rivers of crimson and gold . [A sleepy , red hunter]1706-a sleepy , red hunter ’s moon . Enchanted tempests that stripped the leaves from the trees and heaped them along [the shores]1603-the shores . Flying shadows of clouds . What had [all the smug , opulent lands out front]1708-all the smug , opulent lands out front to compare with this ?

November — with uncanny witchery in [its]1709-its changed trees . With murky red sunsets flaming in smoky crimson behind [the westering hills]1710-the westering hills . With dear days when [the austere woods]1711-the austere woods were beautiful and gracious in a dignified serenity of folded hands and closed eyes — days full of a fine , pale sunshine that sifted through the late , leafless gold of the juniper - trees and glimmered among the grey beeches , lighting up evergreen banks of moss and washing the colonnades of the pines . Days with a high - sprung sky of flawless turquoise . Days when an exquisite melancholy seemed to hang over [the landscape]1126-the landscape and dream about [the lake]1234-the lake . But days , too , of the wild blackness of great autumn storms , followed by dank , wet , streaming nights when there was witch - laughter in the pines and fitful moans among [the mainland trees]1714-the mainland trees . What cared [they]1697-they ? [Old Tom]243-tom macmurray had built [[his]243-tom macmurray roof]1715-his roof well , and [his]243-tom macmurray chimney drew .

“ Warm fire — books — comfort — safety from storm — [our]2851-our cats on the rug . Moonlight , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney , “ would [you]1716-you be any happier now if [you]1716-you had a million dollars ? ”[140-barney]

“ No — nor half so happy . [I]1697-they ’d be bored by conventions and obligations then . ”[1697-they]

December . Early snows and Orion . The pale fires of the Milky Way . It was really winter now — wonderful , cold , starry winter . How [Valancy]107-valancy had always hated winter ! Dull , brief , uneventful days . Long , cold , companionless nights . [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles with [her]97-cousin stickles back that had to be rubbed continually . [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles making weird noises gargling [her]97-cousin stickles throat in the mornings . [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles whining over the price of coal . [[Her]1716-you mother]343-her mother , probing , questioning , ignoring . Endless colds and bronchitis — or the dread of it . Redfern ’s Liniment and Purple Pills .

But now [she]1716-you loved winter . Winter was beautiful “ up back”—almost[343-her mother] intolerably beautiful . Days of clear brilliance . Evenings that were like cups of glamour — the purest vintage of winter ’s wine . Nights with their fire of stars . Cold , exquisite winter sunrises . Lovely ferns of ice all over the windows of [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle . Moonlight on birches in a silver thaw . Ragged shadows on windy evenings — torn , twisted , fantastic shadows . Great silences , austere and searching . [Jewelled , barbaric hills]1719-jewelled , barbaric hills . The sun suddenly breaking through grey clouds over long , white [Mistawis]27-mistawis . Icy - grey twilights , broken by snow - squalls , when [[their]1720-their cosy living - room]1721-their cosy living - room , with [its]1721-their cosy living - room goblins of firelight and inscrutable cats seemed cosier than ever . Every hour brought a new revelation and wonder .

[Barney]140-barney ran [Lady Jane]210-lady jane into [[Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel ’s barn]1722-roaring abel ’s barn and taught [Valancy]107-valancy how to snowshoe — [Valancy , who ought to be laid up with bronchitis]1723-valancy , who ought to be laid up with bronchitis . But [Valancy]107-valancy had not even a cold . Later on in the winter [Barney]140-barney had a terrible one and [Valancy]107-valancy nursed [him]1724-he through it with a dread of pneumonia in [her]107-valancy heart . But [Valancy]107-valancy ’s colds seemed to have gone where old moons go . Which was luck — for [she]107-valancy had n’t even [Redfern]140-barney ’s Liniment . [She]107-valancy had thoughtfully bought a bottle at [the Port]2254-the port and [Barney]140-barney had hurled it into [frozen Mistawis]27-mistawis with a scowl .

“ Bring no more of that devilish stuff here , ”[1724-he] [he]1724-he had ordered briefly . It was the first and last time [he]1724-he had spoken harshly to [her]107-valancy .

[They]1726-they went for long tramps through the exquisite reticence of [winter woods]1727-winter woods and the silver jungles of frosted trees , and found loveliness everywhere .

At times [they]1726-they seemed to be walking through a spellbound world of crystal and pearl , so white and radiant were clearings and [lakes and sky]1728-lakes and sky . The air was so crisp and clear that it was half intoxicating .

Once [they]1726-they stood in a hesitation of ecstasy at the entrance of a narrow path between ranks of birches . Every twig and spray was outlined in snow . The undergrowth along [its]1729-its sides was [a little fairy forest cut out of marble]1730-a little fairy forest cut out of marble . The shadows cast by the pale sunshine were fine and spiritual .

“ Come away , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney , turning . “ [We]1726-they must not commit the desecration of tramping through there . ”[140-barney]

One evening [they]1726-they came upon a snowdrift far back in an old clearing which was in the exact likeness of [a beautiful woman]1731-a beautiful woman ’s profile . Seen too close by , the resemblance was lost , as in the fairy - tale of [the Castle of [St. John]270-st. john]1732-the castle of st. john . Seen from behind , it was a shapeless oddity . But at just the right distance and angle the outline was so perfect that when [they]1726-they came suddenly upon [it]1729-its , gleaming out against the dark background of spruce in the glow of that winter sunset [they]1726-they both exclaimed in amazement . There was a low , noble brow , a straight , classic nose , lips and chin and cheek - curve modelled as if [some goddess of old time]1733-some goddess of old time had sat to the sculptor , and a breast of such cold , swelling purity as the very spirit of [the winter woods]1734-the winter woods might display .

“ ‘ All the beauty that old [Greece]59-greece and [Rome]60-rome , sung painted , taught , ’ ”[140-barney] quoted [Barney]140-barney .

“ And to think no human eyes save [ours]1726-they have seen or will see it , ”[107-valancy] breathed [Valancy]107-valancy , who felt at times as if [she]107-valancy were living in a book by [John Foster]114-john foster . As [she]107-valancy looked around [her]107-valancy [she]107-valancy recalled some passages [she]107-valancy had marked in the new Foster book [Barney]140-barney had brought [her]107-valancy from [the Port]2254-the port — with an adjuration not to expect [him]114-john foster to read or listen to it .

“ ‘ All the tintings of winter woods are extremely delicate and elusive , ’ ”[107-valancy] recalled [Valancy]107-valancy . “ ‘ When the brief afternoon wanes and the sun just touches the tops of [the hills]1238-the hills , there seems to be all over [the woods]2193-the woods an abundance , not of colour , but of the spirit of colour . There is really nothing but pure white after all , but one has the impression of fairy - like blendings of rose and violet , opal and heliotrope on [the slopes]2854-the slopes — in the dingles and along the curves of [the forest - land]2855-the forest - land . [You]2856-you feel sure the tint is there , but when [you]2856-you look at it directly it is gone . From the corner of [your]2856-you eye [you]2856-you are aware that it is lurking over yonder in a spot where there was nothing but pale purity a moment ago . Only just when the sun is setting is there a fleeting moment of real colour . Then the redness streams out over the snow and incarnadines [the hills]1238-the hills and [rivers]2858-rivers and smites the crest of the pines with flame . Just a few minutes of transfiguration and revelation — and it is gone . ’[107-valancy]

“ [I]107-valancy wonder if [John Foster]114-john foster ever spent a winter in [Mistawis]27-mistawis , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ Not likely , ”[140-barney] scoffed [Barney]140-barney . “ [People who write tosh like that]2859-people who write tosh like that generally write it in [a warm house on [some smug city street]2861-some smug city street]2860-a warm house on some smug city street . ”[140-barney]

“ [You]140-barney are too hard on [John Foster]114-john foster , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy severely . “ [No one]515-no one could have written that little paragraph [I]107-valancy read [you]140-barney last night without having seen it first — [you]140-barney know [he]114-john foster could n’t . ”[107-valancy]

“ [I]140-barney did n’t listen to it , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney morosely . “ [You]140-barney know [I]140-barney told [you]140-barney [I]140-barney would n’t . ”[140-barney]

“ Then [you]1736-you ’ve got to listen to it now , ”[107-valancy] persisted [Valancy]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy made [him]1736-you stand still on [his]1736-you snowshoes while [she]107-valancy repeated it .

“ ‘ [She]107-valancy is [a rare artist]2863-a rare artist , [this old Mother Nature , who works “[107-valancy] for the joy of working ” and not in any spirit of vain show]2864-this old mother nature , who works “ for the joy of working ” and not in any spirit of vain show . Today [the fir woods]2865-the fir woods are a symphony of greens and greys , so subtle that [you]1736-you can not tell where one shade begins to be the other . Grey trunk , green bough , grey - green moss above the white , grey - shadowed floor . Yet [the old gypsy]2866-the old gypsy does n’t like unrelieved monotones . [She]2866-the old gypsy must have a dash of colour . See it . A broken dead fir bough , of a beautiful red - brown , swinging among the beards of moss . ’ ”[107-valancy]

“ [Good Lord]271-good lord , do [you]1736-you learn all [that fellow]2867-that fellow ’s books by heart ? ”[1736-you] was [Barney]140-barney ’s disgusted reaction as [he]1736-you strode off .
