When [they]1737-they came out to [the lake]1234-the lake [they]1737-they changed from snowshoes to skates and skated [home]612-home . For a wonder [Valancy]107-valancy had learned , when [she]107-valancy was [a little schoolgirl]1740-a little schoolgirl , to skate on [the pond behind [the Deerwood school]1742-the deerwood school]1741-the pond behind the deerwood school . [She]107-valancy never had any skates of [her]107-valancy own , but [some of [the other girls]2508-the other girls]1743-some of the other girls had lent [her]107-valancy theirs and [she]107-valancy seemed to have a natural knack of it . [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin had once promised [her]107-valancy a pair of skates for Christmas , but when Christmas came [he]108-uncle benjamin had given [her]107-valancy rubbers instead . [She]107-valancy had never skated since [she]107-valancy grew up , but the old trick came back quickly , and glorious were the hours [she]107-valancy and [Barney]140-barney spent skimming over [the white lakes]1745-the white lakes and past [the dark islands]1746-the dark islands where [the summer cottages]1747-the summer cottages were closed and silent . Tonight [they]1748-they flew down [Mistawis]27-mistawis before the wind , in an exhilaration that crimsoned [Valancy]107-valancy ’s cheeks under [her]107-valancy white tam . And at the end was [[her]107-valancy dear little house]1749-her dear little house , on [the island of pines]1750-the island of pines , with a coating of snow on [its]1749-her dear little house roof , sparkling in the moonlight . [Its]1749-her dear little house windows glinted impishly at [her]107-valancy in the stay gleams .

“ Looks exactly like a picture - book , does n’t it ? ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney .

[They]1748-they had a lovely Christmas . No rush . No scramble . No niggling attempts to make ends meet . No wild effort to remember whether [she]107-valancy had n’t given the same kind of present to [the same person]1751-the same person two Christmases before — [no mob of last - minute shoppers]1752-no mob of last - minute shoppers — no dreary family “ reunions ”[1748-they] where [she]107-valancy sat mute and unimportant — no attacks of “ nerves . ”[1748-they] [They]1748-they decorated [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle with pine boughs , and [Valancy]107-valancy made delightful little tinsel stars and hung them up amid the greenery . [She]107-valancy cooked a dinner to which [Barney]140-barney did full justice , while [Good Luck]247-good luck and [Banjo]246-banjo picked the bones .

“ [A land]2868-a land that can produce a goose like that is [an admirable land]2869-an admirable land , ”[140-barney] vowed [Barney]140-barney . “ [Canada]10-canada forever ! ”[140-barney] And [they]1748-they drank to the Union Jack a bottle of dandelion wine that [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana had given [Valancy]107-valancy along with the bedspread .

“ [One]332-one never knows , ”[110-cousin georgiana] [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana had said solemnly , “ when [one]332-one may need a little stimulant . ”[110-cousin georgiana]

[Barney]140-barney had asked [Valancy]107-valancy what [she]107-valancy wanted for a Christmas present .

“ Something frivolous and unnecessary , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , who had got a pair of goloshes last Christmas and two long - sleeved , woolen undervests the year before . And so on back .

To [her]107-valancy delight , [Barney]140-barney gave [her]107-valancy a necklace of pearl beads . [Valancy]107-valancy had wanted a string of milky pearl beads — like congealed moonshine — all [her]107-valancy life . And these were so pretty . All that worried [her]107-valancy was that they were really too good . They must have cost a great deal — fifteen dollars , at least . Could [Barney]140-barney afford that ? [She]107-valancy did n’t know a thing about [his]1754-him finances . [She]107-valancy had refused to let [him]1754-him buy any of [her]107-valancy clothes — [she]107-valancy had enough for that , [she]107-valancy told [him]1754-him , as long as [she]107-valancy would need clothes . In a round , black jar on the chimney - piece [Barney]140-barney put money for [their]1755-they household expenses — always enough . The jar was never empty , though [Valancy]107-valancy never caught [him]1754-him replenishing it . [He]1754-him could n’t have much , of course , and that necklace — but [Valancy]107-valancy tossed care aside . [She]107-valancy would wear it and enjoy it . It was the first pretty thing [she]107-valancy had ever had .

CHAPTER XXXII

New Year . The old , shabby , inglorious outlived calendar came down . [The new one]1756-the new one went up . January was a month of storms . It snowed for three weeks on end . The thermometer went miles below zero and stayed there . But , as [Barney]140-barney and [Valancy]107-valancy pointed out to each other , there were no mosquitoes . And the roar and crackle of [their]1755-they big fire drowned the howls of the north wind . Good Luck and [Banjo]246-banjo waxed fat and developed resplendent coats of thick , silky fur . [Nip]272-nip and [Tuck]248-tuck had gone .

“ But [they]1755-they ’ll come back in spring , ”[140-barney] promised [Barney]140-barney .

There was no monotony . Sometimes [they]1755-they had dramatic little private spats that never even thought of becoming quarrels . Sometimes [Roaring Abel]141-roaring abel dropped in — for an evening or a whole day — with [his]141-roaring abel old tartan cap and [his]141-roaring abel long red beard coated with snow . [He]1754-him generally brought [his]1754-him fiddle and played for [them]1755-they , to the delight of [all except [Banjo]246-banjo , who would go temporarily insane and retreat under [Valancy]107-valancy ’s bed]1757-all except banjo , who would go temporarily insane and retreat under valancy ’s bed . Sometimes [Abel]141-roaring abel and [Barney]140-barney talked while [Valancy]107-valancy made candy for [them]1755-they ; sometimes [they]1755-they sat and smoked in silence à [la Tennyson]273-la tennyson and [Carlyle]274-carlyle , until [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle reeked and [Valancy]107-valancy fled to the open . Sometimes [they]1755-they played checkers fiercely and silently the whole night through . Sometimes [they]1755-they all ate the russet apples [Abel]141-roaring abel had brought , while the jolly old clock ticked the delightful minutes away .

“ A plate of apples , an open fire , and ‘ a jolly goode booke whereon to looke ’ are a fair substitute for heaven , ”[140-barney] vowed [Barney]140-barney . “ [Any one]444-any one can have the streets of gold . Let ’s have another whack at [Carman]275-carman . ”[140-barney]

It was easier now for [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings to believe [Valancy]107-valancy of the dead . Not even dim rumours of [her]107-valancy having been over at [the Port]2254-the port came to trouble [them]1755-they , though [she]107-valancy and [Barney]140-barney used to skate [there]448-there occasionally to see a movie and eat hot dogs shamelessly at [the corner stand]1761-the corner stand afterwards . Presumably [none of [the Stirlings]93-the stirlings]445-none of the stirlings ever thought about [her]107-valancy — except [Cousin Georgiana]110-cousin georgiana , who used to lie awake worrying about poor [Doss]106-doss . Did [she]110-cousin georgiana have enough to eat ? Was that dreadful creature good to [her]110-cousin georgiana ? Was [she]110-cousin georgiana warm enough at nights ?

[Valancy]107-valancy was quite warm at nights . [She]107-valancy used to wake up and revel silently in the cosiness of those winter nights on [that little island in [the frozen lake]1764-the frozen lake]1763-that little island in the frozen lake . The nights of other winters had been so cold and long . [Valancy]107-valancy hated to wake up in them and think about the bleakness and emptiness of the day that had passed and the bleakness and emptiness of the day that would come . Now , [she]107-valancy almost counted that night lost on which [she]107-valancy did n’t wake up and lie awake for half an hour just being happy , while [Barney]140-barney ’s regular breathing went on beside [her]107-valancy , and through the open door the smouldering brands in the fireplace winked at [her]107-valancy in the gloom . It was very nice to feel a little Lucky cat jump up on [your]1765-your bed in the darkness and snuggle down at [your]1765-your feet , purring ; but [Banjo]246-banjo would be sitting dourly by [himself]246-banjo out in front of the fire like a brooding demon . At such moments [Banjo]246-banjo was anything but canny , but [Valancy]107-valancy loved [his]246-banjo uncanniness .

The side of the bed had to be right against the window . There was no other place for it in [the tiny room]1766-the tiny room . [Valancy]107-valancy , lying there , could look out of the window , through the big pine boughs that actually touched it , away up [Mistawis]27-mistawis , white and lustrous as a pavement of pearl , or dark and terrible in the storm . Sometimes the pine boughs tapped against the panes with friendly signals . Sometimes [she]107-valancy heard the little hissing whisper of snow against them right at [her]107-valancy side . Some nights [the whole outer world]1767-the whole outer world seemed given over to the empery of silence ; then came nights when there would be a majestic sweep of wind in [the pines]1768-the pines ; nights of dear starlight when it whistled freakishly and joyously around [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle ; brooding nights before storm when it crept along the floor of [the lake]1234-the lake with a low , wailing cry of boding and mystery . [Valancy]107-valancy wasted many perfectly good sleeping hours in these delightful communings . But [she]107-valancy could sleep as long in the morning as [she]107-valancy wanted to . [Nobody]348-nobody cared . [Barney]140-barney cooked [his]1772-his own breakfast of bacon and eggs and then shut [himself]1772-his up in [[Bluebeard]245-bluebeard ’s Chamber]2721-bluebeard ’s chamber till supper time . Then [they]1774-they had an evening of reading and talk . [They]1774-they talked about everything in [this world]2203-this world and a good many things in [other worlds]1776-other worlds . [They]1774-they laughed over [their]1774-they own jokes until [the Blue Castles]9-blue castles re - echoed .

“ [You]107-valancy do laugh beautifully , ”[140-barney] [Barney]140-barney told [her]107-valancy once . “ It makes [me]140-barney want to laugh just to hear [you]107-valancy laugh . There ’s a trick about [your]107-valancy laugh — as if there were so much more fun back of it that [you]107-valancy would n’t let out . Did [you]107-valancy laugh like that before [you]107-valancy came to [Mistawis]27-mistawis , Moonlight ? ”[140-barney]

“ [I]335-a man never laughed at all — really . [I]335-a man used to giggle foolishly when [I]335-a man felt [I]335-a man was expected to . But now — the laugh just comes . ”[335-a man]

It struck [Valancy]107-valancy more than once that [Barney]140-barney [himself]140-barney laughed a great deal oftener than [he]1777-he used to and that [his]1777-he laugh had changed . It had become wholesome . [She]107-valancy rarely heard the little cynical note in it now . Could [a man]335-a man laugh like that who had crimes on [his]335-a man conscience ? Yet [Barney]140-barney must have done something . [Valancy]107-valancy had indifferently made up [her]107-valancy mind as to what [he]1777-he had done . [She]107-valancy concluded [he]1777-he was [a defaulting bank cashier]1779-a defaulting bank cashier . [She]107-valancy had found in one of [Barney]140-barney ’s books an old clipping cut from a [Montreal]4-montreal paper in which [a vanished , defaulting cashier]1780-a vanished , defaulting cashier was described . The description applied to [Barney]140-barney — as well as to [half a dozen other men [Valancy]107-valancy knew]1781-half a dozen other men valancy knew — and from some casual remarks [he]1777-he had dropped from time to time [she]107-valancy concluded [he]1777-he knew [Montreal]4-montreal rather well . [Valancy]107-valancy had it all figured out in the back of [her]107-valancy mind . [Barney]140-barney had been in [a bank]1782-a bank . [He]1777-he was tempted to take some money to speculate — meaning , of course , to put it back . [He]1777-he had got in deeper and deeper , until [he]1777-he found there was nothing for it but flight . It had happened so to [scores of [men]2185-men]1783-scores of men . [He]1777-he had , [Valancy]107-valancy was absolutely certain , never meant to do wrong . Of course , the name of [the man in the clipping]1785-the man in the clipping was [Bernard Craig]140-barney . But [Valancy]107-valancy had always thought [Snaith]107-valancy was an alias . Not that it mattered .

[Valancy]107-valancy had only one unhappy night that winter . It came in late March when most of the snow had gone and [Nip]272-nip and [Tuck]248-tuck had returned . [Barney]140-barney had gone off in the afternoon for a long , woodland tramp , saying [he]1777-he would be back by dark if all went well . Soon after [he]1777-he had gone it had begun to snow . The wind rose and presently [Mistawis]27-mistawis was in the grip of one of the worst storms of the winter . It tore up [the lake]1234-the lake and struck at [the little house]547-the little house . [The dark angry woods on [the mainland]2734-the mainland]1788-the dark angry woods on the mainland scowled at [Valancy]107-valancy , menace in the toss of [their]1788-the dark angry woods on the mainland boughs , threats in [their]1788-the dark angry woods on the mainland windy gloom , terror in the roar of [their]1788-the dark angry woods on the mainland hearts . The trees on [the island]1497-the island crouched in fear . [Valancy]107-valancy spent the night huddled on the rug before the fire , [her]107-valancy face buried in [her]107-valancy hands , when [she]107-valancy was not vainly peering from the oriel in a futile effort to see through the furious smoke of wind and snow that had once been blue - dimpled [Mistawis]27-mistawis . Where was [Barney]140-barney ? Lost on [the merciless lakes]1791-the merciless lakes ? Sinking exhausted in [the drifts of [the pathless woods]1793-the pathless woods]1792-the drifts of the pathless woods ? [Valancy]107-valancy died a hundred deaths that night and paid in full for all the happiness of [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle . When morning came the storm broke and cleared ; the sun shone gloriously over [Mistawis]27-mistawis ; and at noon [Barney]140-barney came [home]612-home . [Valancy]107-valancy saw [him]1796-him from [the oriel]1797-the oriel as [he]1796-him came around [a wooded point]1798-a wooded point , slender and black against [the glistening white world]1799-the glistening white world . [She]107-valancy did not run to meet [him]1796-him . Something happened to [her]107-valancy knees and [she]107-valancy dropped down on [Banjo]246-banjo ’s chair . Luckily [Banjo]246-banjo got out from under in time , [his]246-banjo whiskers bristling with indignation . [Barney]140-barney found [her]107-valancy there , [her]107-valancy head buried in [her]107-valancy hands .

“ [Barney]140-barney , [I]107-valancy thought [you]140-barney were dead , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy whispered .

[Barney]140-barney hooted .

“ After two years of [the Klondike]61-the klondike did [you]107-valancy think a baby storm like this could get [me]140-barney ? [I]140-barney spent the night in [that old lumber shanty]2873-that old lumber shanty over by [Muskoka]16-muskoka . A bit cold but snug enough . Little goose ! [Your]107-valancy eyes look like burnt holes in a blanket . Did [you]107-valancy sit up here all night worrying over [an old woodsman like [me]140-barney]2874-an old woodsman like me ? ”[140-barney]

“ Yes , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . “ [I]107-valancy — couldn’t help it . The storm seemed so wild . [Anybody]454-anybody might have been lost in it . When — [I]107-valancy saw [you]107-valancy — come round the point — there — something happened to [me]107-valancy . [I]107-valancy do n’t know what . It was as if [I]107-valancy had died and come back to life . [I]107-valancy ca n’t describe it any other way . ”[107-valancy]

CHAPTER XXXIII

Spring . [Mistawis]27-mistawis black and sullen for a week or two , then flaming in sapphire and turquoise , lilac and rose again , laughing through the oriel , caressing its amethyst islands , rippling under winds soft as silk . Frogs , little green wizards of [swamp and pool]1800-swamp and pool , singing everywhere in the long twilights and long into the nights ; islands fairy - like in a green haze ; the evanescent beauty of wild young trees in early leaf ; frost - like loveliness of the new foliage of juniper - trees ; [the woods]2193-the woods putting on a fashion of spring flowers , dainty , spiritual things akin to the soul of [the wilderness]1802-the wilderness ; red mist on the maples ; willows decked out with glossy silver pussies ; all the forgotten violets of [Mistawis]27-mistawis blooming again ; lure of April moons .

“ Think how many thousands of springs have been here on [Mistawis]27-mistawis — and all of them beautiful , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . “ Oh , [Barney]140-barney , look at that wild plum ! [I]107-valancy will — [I]107-valancy must quote from [John Foster]114-john foster . There ’s a passage in one of [his]114-john foster books — [I’ve]107-valancy re - read it a hundred times . [He]114-john foster must have written it before a tree just like that :[107-valancy]

“ ‘ Behold the young wild plum - tree which has adorned [herself]2876-herself after immemorial fashion in a wedding - veil of fine lace . The fingers of [wood pixies]2877-wood pixies must have woven it , for nothing like it ever came from an earthly loom . [I]107-valancy vow the tree is conscious of [its]27-mistawis loveliness . It is bridling before [our]2878-our very eyes — as if its beauty were not the most ephemeral thing in [the woods]2193-the woods , as it is the rarest and most exceeding , for today it is and tomorrow it is not . Every south wind purring through the boughs will winnow away a shower of slender petals . But what matter ? Today it is queen of [the wild places]2220-the wild places and it is always today in [the woods]2193-the woods . ’ ”[107-valancy]

“ [I]140-barney ’m sure [you]140-barney feel much better since [you]140-barney ’ve got that out of [your]140-barney system , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney heartlessly .

“ Here ’s a patch of dandelions , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , unsubdued . “ Dandelions should n’t grow in [the woods]2193-the woods , though . [They]2883-they have n’t any sense of the fitness of things at all . [They]2883-they are too cheerful and self - satisfied . [They]2883-they have n’t any of the mystery and reserve of the real wood - flowers . ”[107-valancy]

“ In short , [they]2883-they ’ve no secrets , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney . “ But wait a bit . [The woods]2193-the woods will have their own way even with those obvious dandelions . In a little while all that obtrusive yellowness and complacency will be gone and [we]1804-they ’ll find here misty , phantom - like globes hovering over those long grasses in full harmony with the traditions of [the forest]2223-the forest . ”[140-barney]

“ That sounds [John Fosterish]278-john fosterish , ”[107-valancy] teased [Valancy]107-valancy .

“ What have [I]140-barney done that deserved a slam like that ? ”[140-barney] complained [Barney]140-barney .

One of the earliest signs of spring was the renaissance of [Lady Jane]210-lady jane . [Barney]140-barney put [her]210-lady jane on roads that [no other car]1803-no other car would look at , and [they]1804-they went through [Deerwood]5-deerwood in mud to the axles . [They]1804-they passed [several Stirlings , who groaned and reflected that now spring]1805-several stirlings , who groaned and reflected that now spring was come [they]1804-they would encounter that shameless pair everywhere . [Valancy]107-valancy , prowling about [Deerwood shops]1806-deerwood shops , met [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin on [the street]537-the street ; but [he]108-uncle benjamin did not realise until [he]108-uncle benjamin had gone two blocks further on that [the girl in the scarlet - collared blanket coat , with cheeks reddened in the sharp April air and the fringe of black hair over laughing , slanted eyes]1808-the girl in the scarlet - collared blanket coat , with cheeks reddened in the sharp april air and the fringe of black hair over laughing , slanted eyes , was [Valancy]107-valancy . When [he]108-uncle benjamin did realise it , [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin was indignant . What business had [Valancy]107-valancy to look like — like — like [a young girl]2342-a young girl ? The way of [the transgressor]1810-the transgressor was hard . Had to be . Scriptural and proper . Yet [Valancy]107-valancy ’s path could n’t be hard . [She]107-valancy would n’t look like that if it were . There was something wrong . It was almost enough to make [a man]335-a man turn modernist .

[Barney]140-barney and [Valancy]107-valancy clanged on to [the Port]2254-the port , so that it was dark when [they]1813-they went through [Deerwood]5-deerwood again . At [[her]107-valancy old home [Valancy]107-valancy]1814-her old home valancy , seized with a sudden impulse , got out , opened the little gate and tiptoed around to the sitting - room window . There sat [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles drearily , grimly knitting . Baffling and inhuman as ever . If [they]1816-they had looked the least bit [lonesome Valancy]107-valancy would have gone in . But [they]1816-they did not . [Valancy]107-valancy would not disturb [them]1816-they for worlds .

CHAPTER XXXIV

[Valancy]107-valancy had two wonderful moments that spring .

One day , coming [home]612-home through [the woods]2193-the woods , with [her]107-valancy arms full of trailing arbutus and creeping spruce , [she]107-valancy met [a man who [she]107-valancy knew must be [Allan Tierney]279-allan tierney]1819-a man who she knew must be allan tierney . [Allan Tierney]279-allan tierney , [the celebrated painter of beautiful women]1820-the celebrated painter of beautiful women . [He]279-allan tierney lived in [New York]62-new york in winter , but [he]279-allan tierney owned [an island cottage at [the northern end of [Mistawis]27-mistawis to which [he]279-allan tierney always came the minute the ice was out of [the lake]1234-the lake]1822-the northern end of mistawis to which he always came the minute the ice was out of the lake]1821-an island cottage at the northern end of mistawis to which he always came the minute the ice was out of the lake . [He]279-allan tierney was reputed to be [a lonely , eccentric man]1824-a lonely , eccentric man . [He]279-allan tierney never flattered [[his]279-allan tierney sitters]1825-his sitters . There was no need to , for [he]279-allan tierney would not paint [any one who required flattery]1826-any one who required flattery . To be painted by [Allan Tierney]279-allan tierney was all the cachet of beauty [a woman]414-a woman could desire . [Valancy]107-valancy had heard so much about [him]279-allan tierney that [she]107-valancy could n’t help turning [her]107-valancy head back over [her]107-valancy shoulder for another shy , curious look at [him]279-allan tierney . A shaft of pale spring sunlight fell through a great pine athwart [her]107-valancy bare black head and [her]107-valancy slanted eyes . [She]107-valancy wore a pale green sweater and had bound a fillet of linnæa vine about [her]107-valancy hair . The feathery fountain of trailing spruce overflowed [her]107-valancy arms and fell around [her]107-valancy . [Allan Tierney]279-allan tierney ’s eyes lighted up .

“ [I]140-barney ’ve had [a caller]2886-a caller , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney the next afternoon , when [Valancy]107-valancy had returned from another flower quest .

“ Who ? ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy was surprised but indifferent . [She]107-valancy began filling a basket with arbutus .

“ [Allan Tierney]279-allan tierney . [He]279-allan tierney wants to paint [you]107-valancy , [Moonlight]264-moonlight . ”[107-valancy]

“ [Me]107-valancy ! ”[107-valancy] [Valancy]107-valancy dropped [her]107-valancy basket and [her]107-valancy arbutus . “ [You]140-barney ’re laughing at [me]107-valancy , [Barney]140-barney . ”[107-valancy]

“ [I]107-valancy ’m not . That ’s what [Tierney]279-allan tierney came for . To ask [my]107-valancy permission to paint [[my]107-valancy wife]2887-my wife — as [the Spirit of [Muskoka]16-muskoka]2888-the spirit of muskoka , or something like that . ”[107-valancy]

“ But — but — ”[107-valancy] stammered [Valancy]107-valancy , “ [Allan Tierney]279-allan tierney never paints any but — any but — — ”[107-valancy]

“ [Beautiful women]2889-beautiful women , ”[140-barney] finished [Barney]140-barney . “ Conceded . Q. E. D. , [Mistress Barney Snaith]140-barney is [a beautiful woman]1731-a beautiful woman . ”[140-barney]

“ Nonsense , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy , stooping to retrieve [her]107-valancy arbutus . “ [You]140-barney know that ’s nonsense , [Barney]140-barney . [I]107-valancy know [I]107-valancy ’m a heap better - looking than [I]107-valancy was a year ago , but [I]107-valancy ’m not beautiful . ”[107-valancy]

“ [Allan Tierney]279-allan tierney never makes a mistake , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney . “ [You]140-barney forget , [Moonlight]264-moonlight , that there are different kinds of beauty . [Your]140-barney imagination is obsessed by the very obvious type of [[your]140-barney cousin]2623-your cousin [Olive]175-olive . Oh , [I]140-barney ’ve seen [her]175-olive — [she]175-olive ’s [a stunner]2892-a stunner — but [you]140-barney ’d never catch [Allan Tierney]279-allan tierney wanting to paint [her]175-olive . In the horrible but expressive slang phrase , [she]175-olive keeps all [her]175-olive goods in the shop - window . But in [your]140-barney subconscious mind [you]140-barney have a conviction that [nobody]348-nobody can be beautiful who does n’t look like [Olive]175-olive . Also , [you]140-barney remember [your]140-barney face as it was in the days when [your]140-barney soul was not allowed to shine through it . [Tierney]279-allan tierney said something about the curve of [your]140-barney cheek as [you]140-barney looked back over [your]140-barney shoulder . [You]140-barney know [I]140-barney ’ve often told [you]140-barney it was distracting . And [he]279-allan tierney ’s quite batty about [your]140-barney eyes . If [I]140-barney was n’t absolutely sure it was solely professional — [he]279-allan tierney ’s really [a crabbed old bachelor]2894-a crabbed old bachelor , [you]140-barney know — [I’d]140-barney be jealous . ”[140-barney]

“ Well , [I]107-valancy do n’t want to be painted , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . “ [I]107-valancy hope [you]140-barney told [him]279-allan tierney that . ”[107-valancy]

“ [I]140-barney could n’t tell [him]279-allan tierney that . [I]140-barney did n’t know what [you]140-barney wanted . But [I]140-barney told [him]279-allan tierney [I]140-barney did n’t want [[my]140-barney wife]2887-my wife painted — hung up in a salon for [the mob]2896-the mob to stare at . Belonging to [another man]1462-another man . For of course [I]140-barney could n’t buy the picture . So even if [you]140-barney had wanted to be painted , [Moonlight]264-moonlight , [[your]140-barney tyrannous husband]2898-your tyrannous husband would not have permitted it . [Tierney]279-allan tierney was a bit squiffy . [He]279-allan tierney is n’t used to being turned down like that . [His]279-allan tierney requests are almost like [royalty]2899-royalty ’s . ”[140-barney]

“ But [we]2900-we are [outlaws]2901-outlaws , ”[107-valancy] laughed [Valancy]107-valancy . “ [We]2900-we bow to [no decrees]2902-no decrees — [we]2900-we acknowledge no sovereignty . ”[107-valancy]

In [her]1828-she heart [she]1828-she thought unashamedly :

“ [I]107-valancy wish [Olive]175-olive could know that [Allan Tierney]279-allan tierney wanted to paint [me]107-valancy . [Me]107-valancy ! Little - old - maid - [Valancy - Stirling]107-valancy - that - was . ”[107-valancy]

[Her]1828-she second wonder - moment came one evening in May . [She]1828-she realised that [Barney]140-barney actually liked [her]1828-she . [She]1828-she had always hoped [he]1829-he did , but sometimes [she]1828-she had a little , disagreeable , haunting dread that [he]1829-he was just kind and nice and chummy out of pity ; knowing that [she]1828-she had n’t long to live and determined [she]1828-she should have a good time as long as [she]1828-she did live ; but away back in [his]1829-he mind rather looking forward to freedom again , with no intrusive woman creature in [his]1829-he island fastness and no chattering thing beside [him]1829-he in [his]1829-he woodland prowls . [She]1828-she knew [he]1829-he could never love [her]1828-she . [She]1828-she did not even want [him]1829-he to . If [he]1829-he loved [her]1828-she [he]1829-he would be unhappy when [she]1828-she died — [Valancy]107-valancy never flinched from the plain word . No “ passing away ”[1828-she] for [her]1828-she . And [she]1828-she did not want [him]1829-he to be the least unhappy . But neither did [she]1828-she want [him]1829-he to be glad — or relieved . [She]1828-she wanted [him]1829-he to like [her]1828-she and miss [her]1828-she as [a good chum]1830-a good chum . But [she]1828-she had never been sure until this night that [he]1829-he did .

[They]1831-they had walked over [the hills]1238-the hills in the sunset . [They]1831-they had the delight of discovering a virgin spring in [a ferny hollow]1833-a ferny hollow and had drunk together from it out of a birch - bark cup ; [they]1831-they had come to an old tumble - down rail fence and sat on it for a long time . [They]1831-they did n’t talk much , but [Valancy]107-valancy had a curious sense of oneness . [She]1828-she knew that [she]1828-she could n’t have felt that if [he]1829-he had n’t liked [her]1828-she .

“ [You]1828-she nice little thing , ”[140-barney] said [Barney]140-barney suddenly . “ Oh , [you]1828-she nice little thing ! Sometimes [I]140-barney feel [you]1828-she ’re too nice to be real — that [I]140-barney ’m just dreaming [you]1828-she . ”[140-barney]

“ Why ca n’t [I]107-valancy die now — this very minute — when [I]107-valancy am so happy ! ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy .

Well , it could n’t be so very long now . Somehow , [Valancy]107-valancy had always felt [she]107-valancy would live out the year [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent had allotted . [She]107-valancy had not been careful — [she]107-valancy had never tried to be . But , somehow , [she]107-valancy had always counted on living out [her]107-valancy year . [She]107-valancy had not let [herself]107-valancy think about it at all . But now , sitting here beside [Barney]140-barney , with [her]107-valancy hand in [his]1834-his , a sudden realisation came to [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy had not had a heart attack for a long while — two months at least . The last one [she]107-valancy had had was two or three nights before [Barney]140-barney was out in the storm . Since then [she]107-valancy had not remembered [she]107-valancy had a heart . Well , no doubt , it betokened the nearness of the end . [Nature]281-nature had given up the struggle . There would be no more pain .

“ [I]107-valancy ’m afraid [heaven]2448-heaven will be very dull after this past year , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy . “ But perhaps [one]332-one will not remember . Would that be — nice ? No , no . [I]107-valancy do n’t want to forget [Barney]140-barney . [I]107-valancy ’d rather be miserable in [heaven]2448-heaven remembering [him]2906-him than happy forgetting [him]2906-him . And [I]107-valancy ’ll always remember through all eternity — that [he]2906-him really , really liked [me]107-valancy . ”[107-valancy]

CHAPTER XXXV

Thirty seconds can be very long sometimes . Long enough to work a miracle or a revolution . In thirty seconds life changed wholly for [Barney]140-barney and [Valancy Snaith]107-valancy .

[They]1835-their had gone around [the lake]1234-the lake one June evening in [their]1835-their disappearing propeller , fished for an hour in [a little creek]1837-a little creek , left [[their]1835-their boat]1838-their boat there , and walked up through the woods to [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence two miles away . [Valancy]107-valancy prowled a bit in [the shops]1839-the shops and got [herself]107-valancy a new pair of sensible shoes . [Her]107-valancy old pair had suddenly and completely given out , and this evening [she]107-valancy had been compelled to put on the little fancy pair of patent - leather with rather high , slender heels , which [she]107-valancy had bought in a fit of folly one day in the winter because of their beauty and because [she]107-valancy wanted to make one foolish , extravagant purchase in [her]107-valancy life . [She]107-valancy sometimes put them on of an evening in [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle , but this was the first time [she]107-valancy had worn them outside . [She]107-valancy had not found it any too easy walking up through [the woods]2193-the woods in [them]2193-the woods , and [Barney]140-barney guyed [her]107-valancy unmercifully about them . But in spite of the inconvenience , [Valancy]107-valancy secretly rather liked the look of [her]107-valancy trim ankles and high instep above those pretty , foolish shoes and did not change them in [the shop]1842-the shop as [she]107-valancy might have done .

The sun was hanging low above the pines when [they]1843-they left [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence . To the north of [it]1844-it [the woods]2193-the woods closed around [the town]1376-the town quite suddenly . [Valancy]107-valancy always had a sense of stepping from [one world]1847-one world to another — from reality to [fairyland]1848-fairyland — when [she]107-valancy went out of [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence and in a twinkling found [it]1849-it shut off behind [her]107-valancy by [the armies of the pines]1850-the armies of the pines .

A mile and a half from [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence there was [a small railroad station]1851-a small railroad station with [a little station - house which at this hour of the day]1852-a little station - house which at this hour of the day was deserted , since [no local train]1853-no local train was due . [Not a soul]1854-not a soul was in sight when [Barney]140-barney and [Valancy]107-valancy emerged from [the woods]2193-the woods . Off to the left a sudden curve in [the track]1856-the track hid [it]1849-it from view , but over the tree - tops beyond , the long plume of smoke betokened the approach of [a through train]1857-a through train . The rails were vibrating to its thunder as [Barney]140-barney stepped across the switch . [Valancy]107-valancy was a few steps behind [him]1858-his , loitering to gather June - bells along [the little , winding path]1859-the little , winding path . But there was plenty of time to get across before [the train]2257-the train came . [She]107-valancy stepped unconcernedly over the first rail .

[She]107-valancy could never tell how it happened . The ensuing thirty seconds always seemed in [her]107-valancy recollection like a chaotic nightmare in which [she]107-valancy endured the agony of a thousand lifetimes .

The heel of [her]107-valancy pretty , foolish shoe caught in a crevice of the switch . [She]107-valancy could not pull it loose .

“ [Barney]140-barney — [Barney]140-barney ! ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy called in alarm .

[Barney]140-barney turned — saw [her]107-valancy predicament — saw [her]107-valancy ashen face — dashed back . [He]1858-his tried to pull [her]107-valancy clear — [he]1858-his tried to wrench [her]107-valancy foot from the prisoning hold . In vain . In a moment [the train]2257-the train would sweep around the curve — would be on [them]1862-them .

“ Go — go — quick — [you’ll]140-barney be killed , [Barney]140-barney ! ”[107-valancy] shrieked [Valancy]107-valancy , trying to push [him]1858-his away .

[Barney]140-barney dropped on [his]1858-his knees , ghost - white , frantically tearing at [her]107-valancy shoe - lace . The knot defied [his]1858-his trembling fingers . [He]1858-his snatched a knife from [his]1858-his pocket and slashed at it . [Valancy]107-valancy still strove blindly to push [him]1858-his away . [Her]107-valancy mind was full of the hideous thought that [Barney]140-barney was going to be killed . [She]107-valancy had no thought for [her]107-valancy own danger .

“ [Barney]140-barney — go — go — for [God]103-god ’s sake — go ! ”[107-valancy]

“ Never ! ”[140-barney] muttered [Barney]140-barney between [his]1858-his set teeth . [He]1858-his gave one mad wrench at the lace . As [the train]2257-the train thundered around [the curve]1864-the curve [he]1858-his sprang up and caught [Valancy]107-valancy — dragging [her]107-valancy clear , leaving the shoe behind [her]107-valancy . The wind from [the train]2257-the train as it swept by turned to icy cold the streaming perspiration on [his]1858-his face .

“ Thank [God]103-god ! ”[1858-his] [he]1858-his breathed .

For a moment [they]1866-they stood stupidly staring at [each other]1303-each other , two white , shaken , wild - eyed creatures . Then [they]1866-they stumbled over to the little seat at [the end of [the station - house]1869-the station - house]1868-the end of the station - house and dropped on [it]1870-it . [Barney]140-barney buried [his]1858-his face in [his]1858-his hands and said not a word . [Valancy]107-valancy sat , staring straight ahead of [her]107-valancy with unseeing eyes at [the great pine woods]1871-the great pine woods , [the stumps of [the clearing]1873-the clearing]1872-the stumps of the clearing , the long , gleaming rails . There was only one thought in [her]107-valancy dazed mind — a thought that seemed to burn it as a shaving of fire might burn [her]107-valancy body .

[Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent had told [her]107-valancy over a year ago that [she]107-valancy had a serious form of heart - disease — that any excitement might be fatal .

If that were so , why was [she]107-valancy not dead now ? This very minute ? [She]107-valancy had just experienced as much and as terrible excitement as [most people]1874-most people experience in a lifetime , crowded into that endless thirty seconds . Yet [she]107-valancy had not died of it . [She]107-valancy was not an iota the worse for it . A little wobbly at the knees , as [any one]444-any one would have been ; a quicker heart - beat , as [any one]444-any one would have ; nothing more .

Why !

Was it possible [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent had made a mistake ?

[Valancy]107-valancy shivered as if a cold wind had suddenly chilled [her]107-valancy to the soul . [She]107-valancy looked at [Barney]140-barney , hunched up beside [her]107-valancy . [His]1877-he silence was very eloquent . Had the same thought occurred to [him]1877-he ? Did [he]1877-he suddenly find [himself]1877-he confronted by the appalling suspicion that [he]1877-he was married , not for a few months or a year , but for good and all to [a woman [he]1877-he did not love and who had foisted [herself]1878-a woman he did not love and who had foisted herself upon him by some trick or lie upon [him]1877-he by some trick or lie]1878-a woman he did not love and who had foisted herself upon him by some trick or lie ? [Valancy]107-valancy turned sick before the horror of it . It could not be . It would be too cruel — too devilish . [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent could n’t have made a mistake . Impossible . [He]92-dr. trent was one of [the best heart specialists in [Ontario]63-ontario]1879-the best heart specialists in ontario . [She]107-valancy was foolish — unnerved by the recent horror . [She]107-valancy remembered some of the hideous spasms of pain [she]107-valancy had had . There must be something serious the matter with [her]107-valancy heart to account for them .

But [she]107-valancy had not had any for nearly three months .

Why ?

Presently [Barney]140-barney bestirred [himself]140-barney . [He]1877-he stood up , without looking at [Valancy]107-valancy , and said casually :

“ [I]1877-he suppose [we]2907-we ’d better be hiking back . Sun ’s getting low . Are [you]107-valancy good for the rest of [the road]756-the road ? ”[1877-he]

“ [I]107-valancy think so , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy miserably .

[Barney]140-barney went across [the clearing]1873-the clearing and picked up the parcel [he]1877-he had dropped — the parcel containing [her]107-valancy new shoes . [He]1877-he brought it to [her]107-valancy and let [her]107-valancy take out the shoes and put them on without any assistance , while [he]1877-he stood with [his]1877-he back to [her]107-valancy and looked out over [the pines]1768-the pines .

[They]1882-they walked in silence down [the shadowy trail]1883-the shadowy trail to [the lake]1234-the lake . In silence [Barney]140-barney steered [[his]1877-he boat]1885-his boat into [the sunset miracle that was [Mistawis]27-mistawis]1886-the sunset miracle that was mistawis . In silence [they]1882-they went around [feathery headlands]1887-feathery headlands and across [coral bays]1888-coral bays and [silver rivers]1889-silver rivers where canoes were slipping up and down in the afterglow . In silence [they]1882-they went past [cottages echoing with music and laughter]1890-cottages echoing with music and laughter . In silence drew up at [the landing - place below [the Blue Castle]2-the blue castle]1891-the landing - place below the blue castle .

[Valancy]107-valancy went up the rock steps and into [the house]364-the house . [She]107-valancy dropped miserably on the first chair [she]107-valancy came to and sat there staring through the oriel , oblivious of [Good Luck]247-good luck ’s frantic purrs of joy and [Banjo]246-banjo ’s savage glares of protest at [her]107-valancy occupancy of [his]1877-he chair .

[Barney]140-barney came in a few minutes later . [He]1877-he did not come near [her]107-valancy , but [he]1877-he stood behind [her]107-valancy and asked gently if [she]107-valancy felt any the worse for [her]107-valancy experience . [Valancy]107-valancy would have given [her]107-valancy year of happiness to have been able honestly to answer “ Yes . ”[1877-he]

“ No , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy said flatly .

[Barney]140-barney went into [[Bluebeard]245-bluebeard ’s Chamber]2721-bluebeard ’s chamber and shut the door . [She]107-valancy heard [him]1877-he pacing up and down — up and down . [He]1877-he had never paced like that before .

And an hour ago — only an hour ago — [she]107-valancy had been so happy !

CHAPTER XXXVI

Finally [Valancy]107-valancy went to bed . Before [she]107-valancy went [she]107-valancy re - read [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s letter . It comforted [her]107-valancy a little . So positive . So assured . The writing so black and steady . Not the writing of [a man who did n’t know what [he]1894-a man who did n’t know what he was writing about was writing about]1894-a man who did n’t know what he was writing about . But [she]107-valancy could not sleep . [She]107-valancy pretended to be asleep when [Barney]140-barney came in . [Barney]140-barney pretended to go to sleep . But [Valancy]107-valancy knew perfectly well [he]1877-he was n’t sleeping any more than [she]107-valancy was . [She]107-valancy knew [he]1877-he was lying there , staring through the darkness . Thinking of what ? Trying to face — what ?

[Valancy]107-valancy , who had spent so many happy wakeful hours of night lying by that window , now paid the price of [them]1895-them all in this one night of misery . A horrible , portentous fact was slowly looming out before [her]107-valancy from the nebula of surmise and fear . [She]107-valancy could not shut [her]107-valancy eyes to it — push it away — ignore it .

There could be nothing seriously wrong with [her]107-valancy heart , no matter what [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent had said . If there had been , those thirty seconds would have killed [her]107-valancy . It was no use to recall [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s letter and reputation . [The greatest specialists]1896-the greatest specialists made mistakes sometimes . [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent had made one .

Towards morning [Valancy]107-valancy fell into a fitful dose with ridiculous dreams . One of them was of [Barney]140-barney taunting [her]107-valancy with having tricked [him]1877-he . In [her]107-valancy dream [she]107-valancy lost [her]107-valancy temper and struck [him]1877-he violently on the head with [her]107-valancy rolling - pin . [He]1877-he proved to be made of glass and shivered into splinters all over the floor . [She]107-valancy woke with a cry of horror — a gasp of relief — a short laugh over the absurdity of [her]107-valancy dream — a miserable sickening recollection of what had happened .

[Barney]140-barney was gone . [Valancy]107-valancy knew , as [people]2198-people sometimes know things — inescapably , without being told — that [he]1877-he was not in [the house]364-the house or in [[Bluebeard]245-bluebeard ’s Chamber]2721-bluebeard ’s chamber either . There was a curious silence in [the living - room]1900-the living - room . A silence with something uncanny about it . The old clock had stopped . [Barney]140-barney must have forgotten to wind it up , something [he]1877-he had never done before . [The room without]1901-the room without [it]1902-it was dead , though the sunshine streamed in through [the oriel]1797-the oriel and dimples of light from the dancing waves beyond quivered over the walls .

[The canoe]1500-the canoe was gone but [Lady Jane]210-lady jane was under [the mainland trees]1714-the mainland trees . So [Barney]140-barney had betaken [himself]140-barney to [the wilds]1906-the wilds . [He]1877-he would not return till night — perhaps not even then . [He]1877-he must be angry with [her]210-lady jane . That furious silence of [his]1877-he must mean anger — cold , deep , justifiable resentment . Well , [Valancy]107-valancy knew what [she]107-valancy must do first . [She]107-valancy was not suffering very keenly now . Yet the curious numbness that pervaded [her]107-valancy being was in a way worse than pain . It was as if something in [her]107-valancy had died . [She]107-valancy forced [herself]107-valancy to cook and eat a little breakfast . Mechanically [she]107-valancy put [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle in perfect order . Then [she]107-valancy put on [her]107-valancy hat and coat , locked the door and hid the key in the hollow of the old pine and crossed to [the mainland]2734-the mainland in [the motor boat]1909-the motor boat . [She]107-valancy was going into [Deerwood]5-deerwood to see [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent . [She]107-valancy must know .

CHAPTER XXXVII

[Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent looked at [her]107-valancy blankly and fumbled among [his]92-dr. trent recollections .

“ Er — [Miss — Miss]2909-miss — miss — ”[92-dr. trent]

“ [Mrs. Snaith]140-barney , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy quietly . “ [I]107-valancy was [Miss Valancy Stirling]107-valancy when [I]107-valancy came to [you]107-valancy last May — over a year ago . [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s face cleared .

Well , well , it has agreed with [you]107-valancy . [You]107-valancy do n’t look much like [an invalid]2910-an invalid now , [hey]2911-hey ? [I]92-dr. trent remember that day . [I]92-dr. trent was badly upset . Hearing about poor [Ned]135-edward beck bowled [me]92-dr. trent over . But [Ned]135-edward beck ’s as good as new and [you]107-valancy , too , evidently . “ [You]92-dr. trent told [me]107-valancy , in [your]92-dr. trent letter , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy said slowly , with a curious feeling that [some one else]1910-some one else was talking through [her]107-valancy lips , “ that [I]1910-some one else had angina pectoris — in the last stages — complicated with an aneurism . “ Then likely [you]107-valancy ’re all right . [I]92-dr. trent told [you]107-valancy what to do in the letter [you]107-valancy should have got . “ [I]92-dr. trent did n’t want [anybody]454-anybody to know . ”[92-dr. trent]

“ [Idiot]2919-idiot , ”[92-dr. trent] said [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent bluntly . “ [I]92-dr. trent ca n’t understand such folly . And poor old [Miss Sterling]282-old miss jane sterling . [She]282-old miss jane sterling was here that day — not long before [you]107-valancy . [I]92-dr. trent hated to tell [her]282-old miss jane sterling the truth . “ Yes . [I]92-dr. trent noticed that . But [I]92-dr. trent thought it a mistake . [I]92-dr. trent did n’t know there were any [Sterlings]284-sterlings in [Port Lawrence]14-port lawrence . ”[92-dr. trent]

“ [She]282-old miss jane sterling was [the only one]2421-the only one . [A lonely old soul]2925-a lonely old soul . [She]282-old miss jane sterling died two months after [she]282-old miss jane sterling was [here]2277-here — died in [her]282-old miss jane sterling sleep . [My]92-dr. trent mistake could n’t have made any difference to [her]282-old miss jane sterling . But [you]107-valancy ! [I]92-dr. trent ca n’t forgive [myself]92-dr. trent for inflicting a year ’s misery on [you]107-valancy . It ’s time [I]92-dr. trent retired , all right , when [I]92-dr. trent do things like that — even if [[my]92-dr. trent son]2928-my son was supposed to be fatally injured . Can [you]107-valancy ever forgive [me]92-dr. trent ? ”[92-dr. trent]

A year of misery ! [Valancy]107-valancy smiled a tortured smile as [she]107-valancy thought of all the happiness [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent ’s mistake had bought [her]107-valancy . But [she]107-valancy was paying for it now — oh , [she]107-valancy was paying . If to feel was to live [she]107-valancy was living with a vengeance .

[She]107-valancy let [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent examine [her]107-valancy and answered all [his]92-dr. trent questions . When [he]92-dr. trent told [her]107-valancy [she]107-valancy was fit as a fiddle and would probably live to be a hundred , [she]107-valancy got up and went away silently . [She]107-valancy knew that there were a great many horrible things outside waiting to be thought over . [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent thought [she]107-valancy was odd . [Anybody]454-anybody would have thought , from [her]107-valancy hopeless eyes and woebegone face , that [he]92-dr. trent had given [her]107-valancy a sentence of death instead of life . [Snaith]140-barney ? [Snaith]140-barney ? Who [the devil]469-the devil had [she]107-valancy married ? [He]92-dr. trent had never heard of [Snaiths]285-snaiths in [Deerwood]5-deerwood . And [she]107-valancy had been such [a sallow , faded , little old maid]1915-a sallow , faded , little old maid . [Gad]286-gad , but marriage had made a difference in [her]107-valancy , anyhow , whoever [Snaith]140-barney was . [Snaith]140-barney ? [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent remembered . That rapscallion “ up back ! ”[140-barney] Had [Valancy Stirling]107-valancy married [him]92-dr. trent ? And [[her]107-valancy clan]331-her clan had let [her]107-valancy ! Well , probably that solved the mystery . [She]107-valancy had married in haste and repented at leisure , and that was why [she]107-valancy was n’t overjoyed at learning [she]107-valancy was [a good insurance prospect]1917-a good insurance prospect , after all . Married ! To [God]103-god knew whom ! Or what ! Jail - bird ? [Defaulter]1307-defaulter ? [Fugitive from justice]1919-fugitive from justice ? It must be pretty bad if [she]107-valancy had looked to death as a release , [poor girl]1920-poor girl . But why were [women]2354-women [such fools]1922-such fools ? [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent dismissed [Valancy]107-valancy from [his]92-dr. trent mind , though to the day of [his]92-dr. trent death [he]92-dr. trent was ashamed of putting those letters into the wrong envelopes .

CHAPTER XXXVIII

[Valancy]107-valancy walked quickly through [the back streets]1923-the back streets and through [[Lover]287-lover ’s Lane]1924-lover ’s lane . [She]107-valancy did not want to meet [any one [she]107-valancy knew]1925-any one she knew . [She]107-valancy did n’t want to meet [even people [she]107-valancy did n’t know]1926-even people she did n’t know . [She]107-valancy hated to be seen . [Her]107-valancy mind was so confused , so torn , so messy . [She]107-valancy felt that [her]107-valancy appearance must be the same . [She]107-valancy drew a sobbing breath of relief as [she]107-valancy left [the village]638-the village behind and found [herself]107-valancy on [the “ up back ”[1933-one of them] road]1928-the “ up back ” road . There was little fear of meeting [any one [she]107-valancy knew [here]2277-here]1929-any one she knew here . [The cars that fled by [her]107-valancy with raucous shrieks]1931-the cars that fled by her with raucous shrieks were filled with [strangers]1932-strangers . [One of [them]1931-the cars that fled by her with raucous shrieks]1933-one of them was packed with [young people who whirled past [her]107-valancy singing uproariously :

“ [[My]2929-young people who whirled past her singing uproariously : “ my wife has the fever , o then , my wife wife]2887-my wife has the fever , O then , [[My]2929-young people who whirled past her singing uproariously : “ my wife has the fever , o then , my wife wife]2887-my wife]2929-young people who whirled past her singing uproariously : “ my wife has the fever , o then , my wife has the fever , O then , [[My]2929-young people who whirled past her singing uproariously : “ my wife has the fever , o then , my wife wife]2887-my wife has the fever , Oh , [I]2929-young people who whirled past her singing uproariously : “ my wife has the fever , o then , my wife hope it wo n’t leave [her]2887-my wife , For [I]2929-young people who whirled past her singing uproariously : “ my wife has the fever , o then , my wife want to be single again . ”[2929-young people who whirled past her singing uproariously : “ my wife has the fever , o then , my wife]

[Valancy]107-valancy flinched as if one of [them]1931-the cars that fled by her with raucous shrieks had leaned from [the car]1343-the car and cut [her]107-valancy across the face with a whip .

[She]107-valancy had made a covenant with death and death had cheated [her]107-valancy . Now life stood mocking [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy had trapped [Barney]140-barney . Trapped [him]1935-him into marrying [her]107-valancy . And divorce was so hard to get in [Ontario]63-ontario . So expensive . And [Barney]140-barney was poor .

With life , fear had come back into [her]107-valancy heart . Sickening fear . Fear of what [Barney]140-barney would think . Would say . Fear of the future that must be lived without [him]1935-him . Fear of [[her]107-valancy insulted , repudiated clan]1936-her insulted , repudiated clan .

[She]107-valancy had had one draught from a divine cup and now it was dashed from [her]107-valancy lips . With no kind , friendly death to rescue [her]107-valancy . [She]107-valancy must go on living and longing for it . Everything was spoiled , smirched , defaced . Even that year in [the Blue Castle]2-the blue castle . Even [her]107-valancy unashamed love for [Barney]140-barney . It had been beautiful because death waited . Now it was only sordid because death was gone . How could [any one]444-any one bear an unbearable thing ?

[She]107-valancy must go back and tell [him]1935-him . Make [him]1935-him believe [she]107-valancy had not meant to trick [him]1935-him — [she]107-valancy must make [him]1935-him believe that . [She]107-valancy must say good - bye to [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle and return to [the brick house on [Elm Street]7-elm street]1939-the brick house on elm street . Back to everything [she]107-valancy had thought left behind forever . The old bondage — the old fears . But that did not matter . All that mattered now was that [Barney]140-barney must somehow be made to believe [she]107-valancy had not consciously tricked [him]1935-him .

When [Valancy]107-valancy reached [the pines]1768-the pines by [the lake]1234-the lake [she]107-valancy was brought out of [her]107-valancy daze of pain by a startling sight . There , parked by the side of old , battered ragged [Lady Jane]210-lady jane , was [another car]1942-another car . [A wonderful car]1943-a wonderful car . [A purple car]1944-a purple car . Not a dark , royal purple but a blatant , screaming purple . [It]1944-a purple car shone like a mirror and [its]1944-a purple car interior plainly indicated [the car caste of [Vere de Vere]64-vere de vere]1945-the car caste of vere de vere . On [the driver]1946-the driver ’s seat sat a haughty chauffeur in livery . And in [the tonneau]1947-the tonneau sat [a man who opened the door and bounced out nimbly as [Valancy]107-valancy came down the path to [the landing - place]1949-the landing - place]1948-a man who opened the door and bounced out nimbly as valancy came down the path to the landing - place . [He]1948-a man who opened the door and bounced out nimbly as valancy came down the path to the landing - place stood under the pines waiting for [her]107-valancy and [Valancy]107-valancy took in every detail of [him]1948-a man who opened the door and bounced out nimbly as valancy came down the path to the landing - place .

[A stout , short , pudgy man , with a broad , rubicund , good - humoured face]1950-a stout , short , pudgy man , with a broad , rubicund , good - humoured face — a clean - shaven face , though an unparalysed little imp at the back of [Valancy]107-valancy ’s paralysed mind suggested the thought , “ Such a face should have a fringe of white whisker around it . ”[107-valancy] Old - fashioned , steel - rimmed spectacles on prominent blue eyes . A pursey mouth ; a little round , knobby nose . Where — where — where , groped [Valancy]107-valancy , had [she]107-valancy seen that face before ? It seemed as familiar to [her]107-valancy as [her]107-valancy own .

[The stranger]1951-the stranger wore a green hat and a light fawn overcoat over a suit of a loud check pattern . [His]1951-the stranger tie was a brilliant green of lighter shade ; on the plump hand [he]1951-the stranger outstretched to intercept [Valancy]107-valancy an enormous diamond winked at [her]107-valancy . But [he]1951-the stranger had a pleasant , fatherly smile , and in [his]1951-the stranger hearty , unmodulated voice was a ring of something that attracted [her]107-valancy .

“ Can [you]107-valancy tell [me]1951-the stranger , [Miss]2933-miss , if [that house yonder]2934-that house yonder belongs to [a Mr. Redfern]2935-a mr. redfern ? And if so , how can [I]1951-the stranger get to it ? ”[1951-the stranger]

[Redfern]140-barney ! A vision of bottles seemed to dance before [Valancy]107-valancy ’s eyes — long bottles of bitters — round bottles of hair tonic — square bottles of liniment — short , corpulent little bottles of purple pills — and all of them bearing that very prosperous , beaming moon - face and steel - rimmed spectacles on the label .

[Dr. Redfern]119-dr. redfern !

“ [He]290-old doc redfern was away when [I]107-valancy left this morning , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy . “ [I]107-valancy suppose [he]290-old doc redfern has n’t come [home]612-home yet . ”[107-valancy]

[She]107-valancy spoke flatly and tonelessly . What was the use ?

[Dr. Redfern]119-dr. redfern was gazing at [her]107-valancy in perplexity .

[Valancy]107-valancy had been thinking idly that [Barney]140-barney must resemble [[his]1966-he mother]1967-his mother . [She]107-valancy had remained standing by the steps , but [Dr. Redfern]119-dr. redfern waved [her]107-valancy to the swing seat .

[Valancy]107-valancy sat down . To be obliged to sit still when mental agony urges [us]1968-us to stride up and down is the refinement of torture . “ No . [I]107-valancy know nothing of [his]2975-he past life , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy with sudden eagerness . [She]107-valancy wanted to know — [she]107-valancy must know now . “ What happened ? Why did [he]2975-he leave [[his]2975-he home]2982-his home ? Tell [me]27-mistawis . Tell [me]27-mistawis . ”[27-mistawis]

“ Well , it ai n’t much of a story . Just [a young fool]2983-a young fool gone mad because of a quarrel with [[his]2975-he girl]2984-his girl . [Only Bernie]140-barney was [a stubborn fool]2985-a stubborn fool . Always stubborn . [You]2986-you never could make [that boy]2987-that boy do anything [he]2987-that boy did n’t want to do . From the day [he]2987-that boy was born . Yet [he]2987-that boy was always [a quiet , gentle little chap]2988-a quiet , gentle little chap , too . Good as gold . [[His]2987-that boy poor mother]2937-his poor mother died when [he]2987-that boy was only two years old . [I]107-valancy ’d just begun to make money with [my]107-valancy Hair Vigor . [I]107-valancy ’d dreamed the formula for it , [you]2986-you see . Some dream that . The cash rolled in . [Bernie]140-barney had everything [he]2987-that boy wanted . [I]107-valancy sent [him]2987-that boy to [the best schools]2990-the best schools — [private schools]2991-private schools . [I]107-valancy meant to make [a gentleman of [him]2987-that boy]2992-a gentleman of him . Never had any chance [myself]107-valancy . Meant [he]2987-that boy should have every chance . [He]2987-that boy went through [McGill]297-mcgill . Got honours and all that . [I]107-valancy wanted [him]2987-that boy to go in for law . [He]2987-that boy hankered after journalism and stuff like that . Wanted [me]107-valancy to buy a paper for [him]2987-that boy — or back [him]2987-that boy in publishing what [he]2987-that boy called a ‘ real , worthwhile , honest - to - goodness Canadian Magazine . ’ [I]107-valancy s’pose [I]107-valancy ’d have done it — [I]107-valancy always did what [he]2987-that boy wanted [me]107-valancy to do . Was n’t [he]2987-that boy all [I]107-valancy had to live for ? [I]107-valancy wanted [him]2987-that boy to be happy . And [he]2987-that boy never was happy . Can [you]2993-you believe it ? Not that [he]2987-that boy said so . But [I]107-valancy ’d always a feeling that [he]2987-that boy was n’t happy . Everything [he]2987-that boy wanted — all the money [he]2987-that boy could spend — [his]2987-that boy own bank account — travel — seeing [the world]321-the world — but [he]2987-that boy was n’t happy . Not till [he]2987-that boy fell in love with [Ethel Traverse]296-ethel traverse . Then [he]2987-that boy was happy for a little while . ”[107-valancy]

The cloud had reached the sun and a great , chill , purple shadow came swiftly over [Mistawis]27-mistawis . It touched [the Blue Castle]2-the blue castle — rolled over [it]2-the blue castle . [Valancy]107-valancy shivered .

“ Yes , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy said , with painful eagerness , though every word was cutting [her]107-valancy to the heart . “ What — was — [she]296-ethel traverse — like ? ”[107-valancy]

[“ Prettiest girl in [Montreal]4-montreal]2995-“ prettiest girl in montreal , ”[119-dr. redfern] said [Dr. Redfern]119-dr. redfern . “ Oh , [she]296-ethel traverse was [a looker]2996-a looker , all right . [Valancy]107-valancy was fingering [her]107-valancy necklace . [She]107-valancy was wearing fifteen thousand dollars around [her]107-valancy neck . [He]1973-the imp in the back of valancy shook [her]107-valancy hand and patted [her]107-valancy kindly on the shoulder . [He]1973-the imp in the back of valancy looked as if [he]1973-the imp in the back of valancy would have kissed [her]107-valancy , with a little encouragement , but [Valancy]107-valancy did not give it . Not that [she]107-valancy would have minded . [He]1973-the imp in the back of valancy was rather dreadful and loud — and — and — dreadful . But there was something about [him]1973-the imp in the back of valancy [she]107-valancy liked . [She]107-valancy thought dully that [she]107-valancy might have liked being [[his]1973-the imp in the back of valancy daughter - in - law]1974-his daughter - in - law if [he]1973-the imp in the back of valancy had not been [a millionaire]1975-a millionaire . A score of times over . And [Barney]140-barney was [[his]1973-the imp in the back of valancy son]2255-his son — and [heir]1977-heir .

[She]107-valancy took [him]1973-the imp in the back of valancy over in [the motor boat]1909-the motor boat and watched [the lordly purple car]1979-the lordly purple car roll away through [the woods]2193-the woods with [Henry]289-henry at the wheel looking things not lawful to be uttered . Then [she]107-valancy went back to [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle . What [she]107-valancy had to do must be done quickly . [Barney]140-barney might return at any moment . And it was certainly going to rain . [She]107-valancy was thankful [she]107-valancy no longer felt very bad . When [you]1982-you are bludgeoned on the head repeatedly , [you]1982-you naturally and mercifully become more or less insensible and stupid .

[She]107-valancy stood briefly like a faded flower bitten by frost , by the hearth , looking down on the white ashes of the last fire that had blazed in [the Blue Castle]2-the blue castle .

“ At any rate , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy thought wearily , “ [Barney]140-barney is n’t poor . [He]3033-he will be able to afford a divorce . Quite nicely . ”[107-valancy]

CHAPTER XXXIX

[She]107-valancy must write a note . The imp in the back of [her]107-valancy mind laughed . In every story [she]107-valancy had ever read when [a runaway wife]1983-a runaway wife decamped from [home]612-home [she]107-valancy left a note , generally on the pin - cushion . It was not a very original idea . But [one]332-one had to leave something intelligible . What was there to do but write a note ? [She]107-valancy looked vaguely about [her]107-valancy for something to write with . Ink ? There was none . [Valancy]107-valancy had never written anything since [she]107-valancy had come to [the Blue Castle]319-the blue castle , save memoranda of household necessaries for [Barney]140-barney . A pencil sufficed for [them]1987-them , but now the pencil was not to be found . [Valancy]107-valancy absently crossed to the door of [[Bluebeard]245-bluebeard ’s Chamber]2721-bluebeard ’s chamber and tried it . [She]107-valancy vaguely expected to find it locked , but [it]1989-it opened unresistingly . [She]107-valancy had never tried it before , and did not know whether [Barney]140-barney habitually kept it locked or not . If [he]1990-he did , [he]1990-he must have been badly upset to leave it unlocked . [She]107-valancy did not realise that [she]107-valancy was doing something [he]1990-he had told [her]107-valancy not to do . [She]107-valancy was only looking for something to write with . All [her]107-valancy faculties were concentrated on deciding just what [she]107-valancy would say and how [she]107-valancy would say it . There was not the slightest curiosity in [her]107-valancy as [she]107-valancy went into [the lean - to]2720-the lean - to .

There were [no beautiful women]1992-no beautiful women hanging by [their]1992-no beautiful women hair on the walls . [It]1993-it seemed [a very harmless apartment]1994-a very harmless apartment , with a commonplace little sheet - iron stove in the middle of [it]1993-it , [its]1993-it pipe sticking out through the roof . At one end was a table or counter crowded with odd - looking utensils . Used no doubt by [Barney]140-barney in [his]1990-he smelly operations . Chemical experiments , probably , [she]107-valancy reflected dully . At the other end was a big writing desk and swivel - chair . The side walls were lined with books .

[Valancy]107-valancy went blindly to the desk . There [she]107-valancy stood motionless for a few minutes , looking down at something that lay on it . A bundle of galley - proofs . The page on top bore the title [Wild Honey]73-wild honey , and under the title were the words “ by [John Foster]114-john foster . ”[140-barney]

The opening sentence—“Pines are the trees of myth and legend . They strike their roots deep into the traditions of [an older world]3034-an older world , but wind and star love [their]1996-their lofty tops . What music when [old Æolus]300-old æolus draws [his]300-old æolus bow across the branches of the pines — ”[140-barney] [She]107-valancy had heard [Barney]140-barney say that one day when [they]1995-they walked under [them]1996-their .

So [Barney]140-barney was [John Foster]114-john foster !

[Valancy]107-valancy was not excited . [She]107-valancy had absorbed all the shocks and sensations that [she]107-valancy could compass for one day . This affected [her]107-valancy neither one way nor the other . [She]107-valancy only thought :

“ So this explains it . ”[107-valancy]

“ It ”[140-barney] was a small matter that had , somehow , stuck in [her]107-valancy mind more persistently than its importance seemed to justify . Soon after [Barney]140-barney had brought [her]107-valancy [John Foster]114-john foster ’s latest book [she]107-valancy had been in [a Port Lawrence bookshop]1997-a port lawrence bookshop and heard [a customer]1998-a customer ask [the proprietor]1999-the proprietor for [John Foster]114-john foster ’s new book . [The proprietor]1999-the proprietor had said curtly , “ Not out yet . Wo n’t be out till next week . ”[1999-the proprietor]

[Valancy]107-valancy had opened [her]107-valancy lips to say , “ Oh , yes , it is out , ”[107-valancy] but closed them again . After all , it was none of [her]107-valancy business . [She]107-valancy supposed [the proprietor]1999-the proprietor wanted to cover up [his]1999-the proprietor negligence in not getting the book in promptly . Now [she]107-valancy knew . The book [Barney]140-barney had given [her]107-valancy had been one of [the author]2002-the author ’s complimentary copies , sent in advance .

Well ! [Valancy]107-valancy pushed the proofs indifferently aside and sat down in the swivel - chair . [She]107-valancy took up [Barney]140-barney ’s pen — and a vile one it was — pulled a sheet of paper to [her]107-valancy and began to write . [She]107-valancy could not think of anything to say except bald facts .

“ [Dear Barney]301-barney : —[107-valancy]

[I]0-i went to [Dr. Trent]92-dr. trent this morning and found out [he]92-dr. trent had sent [me]0-i the wrong letter by mistake . There never was anything serious the matter with [my]0-i heart and [I]0-i am quite well now .

[I]0-i did not mean to trick [you]140-barney . Please believe that . [I]0-i could not bear it if [you]140-barney did not believe that . [I]0-i am very sorry for the mistake . But surely [you]140-barney can get a divorce if [I]0-i leave [you]140-barney . Is desertion a ground for divorce in [Canada]10-canada ? Of course if there is anything [I]0-i can do to help or hasten it [I]0-i will do it gladly , if [[your]140-barney lawyer]2003-your lawyer will let [me]0-i know .

[I]0-i thank [you]140-barney for all [your]140-barney kindness to [me]0-i . [I]0-i shall never forget it . Think as kindly of [me]0-i as [you]140-barney can , because [I]0-i did not mean to trap [you]140-barney . Good - bye .

[Yours]140-barney gratefully ,

[VALANCY]107-valancy . ”[107-valancy]

It was very cold and stiff , [she]107-valancy knew . But to try to say anything else would be dangerous — like tearing away a dam . [She]107-valancy did n’t know what torrent of wild incoherences and passionate anguish might pour out . In a postscript [she]107-valancy added :

“ [[Your]140-barney father]2396-your father was here today . [He]2396-your father is coming back tomorrow . [He]2396-your father told [me]107-valancy everything . [I]107-valancy think [you]140-barney should go back to [him]2396-your father . [He]2396-your father is very lonely for [you]140-barney . ”[107-valancy]

[She]107-valancy put the letter in an envelope , wrote “ [Barney]301-barney ”[107-valancy] across it , and left it on the desk . On it [she]107-valancy laid the string of pearls . If they had been the beads [she]107-valancy believed [them]2004-them [she]107-valancy would have kept them in memory of that wonderful year . But [she]107-valancy could not keep the fifteen thousand dollar gift of [a man who had married [her]107-valancy out of pity and whom [she]107-valancy was now leaving]2005-a man who had married her out of pity and whom she was now leaving . It hurt [her]107-valancy to give up [her]107-valancy pretty bauble . That was an odd thing , [she]107-valancy reflected . The fact that [she]107-valancy was leaving [Barney]301-barney did not hurt [her]107-valancy — yet . It lay at [her]107-valancy heart like a cold , insensible thing . If it came to life — [Valancy]107-valancy shuddered and went out — —

[She]107-valancy put on [her]107-valancy hat and mechanically fed Good Luck and Banjo . [She]107-valancy locked the door and carefully hid the key in the old pine . Then [she]107-valancy crossed to [the mainland]2734-the mainland in the disappearing propeller . [She]107-valancy stood for a moment on [the bank]2007-the bank , looking at [[her]107-valancy Blue Castle]400-her blue castle . The rain had not yet come , but the sky was dark , and [Mistawis]27-mistawis grey and sullen . [The little house under the pines]2009-the little house under the pines looked very pathetic — a casket rifled of [its]2009-the little house under the pines jewels — a lamp with its flame blown out .

“ [I]107-valancy shall never again hear the wind crying over [Mistawis]27-mistawis at night , ”[107-valancy] thought [Valancy]107-valancy . This hurt [her]107-valancy , too . [She]107-valancy could have laughed to think that such a trifle could hurt [her]107-valancy at such a time .

[CHAPTER XL

Valancy]107-valancy paused a moment on [the porch of [the brick house in [Elm Street]7-elm street]2011-the brick house in elm street]2010-the porch of the brick house in elm street . [She]107-valancy felt that [she]107-valancy ought to knock like [a stranger]893-a stranger . [Her]107-valancy rosebush , [she]107-valancy idly noticed , was loaded with buds . The rubber - plant stood beside the prim door . A momentary horror overcame [her]107-valancy — a horror of the existence to which [she]107-valancy was returning . Then [she]107-valancy opened the door and walked in .

“ [I]107-valancy wonder if [the Prodigal Son]3036-the prodigal son ever felt really at [home]612-home again , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy thought .

[Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles were in [the sitting - room]2013-the sitting - room . [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin was [there]448-there , too . [They]2015-they looked blankly at [Valancy]107-valancy , realising at once that something was wrong . This was not [the saucy , impudent thing who had laughed at [them]2015-they in [this very room]2017-this very room last summer]2016-the saucy , impudent thing who had laughed at them in this very room last summer . This was [a grey - faced woman with the eyes of a creature who had been stricken by a mortal blow]2018-a grey - faced woman with the eyes of a creature who had been stricken by a mortal blow .

[Valancy]107-valancy looked indifferently around [the room]472-the room . [She]107-valancy had changed so much — and it had changed so little . The same pictures hung on the walls . [The little orphan who knelt at [her]2020-the little orphan who knelt at her never - finished prayer by the bed whereon reposed the black kitten that never grew up into a cat never - finished prayer by the bed whereon reposed the black kitten that never grew up into a cat]2020-the little orphan who knelt at her never - finished prayer by the bed whereon reposed the black kitten that never grew up into a cat . The grey “ steel engraving ”[107-valancy] of [Quatre Bras]74-quatre bras , where [the British regiment]2021-the british regiment forever stood at bay . The crayon enlargement of [the boyish father]2022-the boyish father [she]107-valancy had never known . There they all hung in the same places . The green cascade of “ [Wandering Jew ”]3038-wandering jew ”[107-valancy] still tumbled out of the old granite saucepan on the window - stand . The same elaborate , never - used pitcher stood at the same angle on the sideboard shelf . The blue and gilt vases that had been among [[her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother ’s wedding - presents still primly adorned the mantelpiece , flanking the china clock of berosed and besprayed ware that never went . The chairs in exactly the same places . [[Her]107-valancy mother]343-her mother and [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles , likewise unchanged , regarding [her]107-valancy with stony unwelcome .

[Valancy]107-valancy had to speak first .

“ [I]107-valancy ’ve come [home]612-home , [Mother]362-mother , ”[107-valancy] [she]107-valancy said tiredly .

“ So [I]99-mrs. frederick see . ”[99-mrs. frederick] [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick ’s voice was very icy . [She]99-mrs. frederick had resigned [herself]99-mrs. frederick to [Valancy]107-valancy ’s desertion . [She]99-mrs. frederick had almost succeeded in forgetting there was [a Valancy]107-valancy . [She]99-mrs. frederick had rearranged and organised [her]99-mrs. frederick systematic life without any reference to [an ungrateful , rebellious child]2025-an ungrateful , rebellious child . [She]99-mrs. frederick had taken [her]99-mrs. frederick place again in a society which ignored the fact that [she]99-mrs. frederick had ever had [a daughter]2026-a daughter and pitied [her]2026-a daughter , if it pitied [her]99-mrs. frederick at all , only in discreet whispers and asides . The plain truth was that , by this time , [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick did not want [Valancy]107-valancy to come back — did not want ever to see or hear of [her]107-valancy again .

And now , of course , [Valancy]107-valancy was [here]2277-here . With tragedy and disgrace and scandal trailing after [her]107-valancy visibly . “ So [I]99-mrs. frederick see , ”[99-mrs. frederick] said [Mrs. Frederick]99-mrs. frederick . “ May [I]99-mrs. frederick ask why ? ”[99-mrs. frederick]

“ Because — [I’m]107-valancy — not — going to die , ”[107-valancy] said [Valancy]107-valancy huskily .

“ God bless [my]108-uncle benjamin soul ! ”[108-uncle benjamin] said [Uncle Benjamin]108-uncle benjamin . “ Who said [you]107-valancy were going to die ? ”[108-uncle benjamin]

“ [I]97-cousin stickles suppose , ”[97-cousin stickles] said [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles shrewishly — [Cousin Stickles]97-cousin stickles did not want [Valancy]107-valancy back either—“I suppose [you]107-valancy ’ve found out [he]108-uncle benjamin has [another wife]3041-another wife — as [we]3042-we ’ve been sure all along . ”[97-cousin stickles]

[CHAPTER XLI

Valancy]306-valancy looked dully about [[her]107-valancy old room]2040-her old room . [It]2040-her old room , too , was so exactly the same that it seemed almost impossible to believe in the changes that had come to [her]107-valancy since [she]107-valancy had last slept in [it]2040-her old room . It seemed — somehow — indecent that it should be so much the same . There was [Queen Louise]98-queen louise everlastingly coming down [the stairway]2041-the stairway , and [nobody]348-nobody had let [the forlorn puppy]2043-the forlorn puppy in out of the rain . Here was the purple paper blind and the greenish mirror .
